Active glucocorticoids (GCS), such as cortisol or corticosterone, are a prerequisite for the induction of surfactant synthesis in the fetal lung.	2.3393578426898536
In fetal serum, biologically inactive metabolites (cortisone or 11-dehydrocorticosterone) outweigh the active forms.	1.822090799137969
In this study we demonstrate with organoid cultures of fetal rat lungs that the reductive side of 11-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase (11-HSD) regulates the intracellular activation of GCS.	1.756774010453951

In a community sample of 394 eldery aged 61 years and older from East and West Germany, diseases, contacts with general practitioners and specialists, the use of medicine, attitudes regarding health and illness, the subjective health, psychic problems, social support, social integration, social burden, and socio-demographic variables were assessed.	1.8765649045044108
Based on these data the determinants for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine were analyzed.	2.211123228967673
The results confirmed the frequency of multimorbidity in the elderly; on average we found three different diseases at the same time for each person.	2.3800001584006627
In nearly 10% of the sample we found seven diagnoses existing at the same time.	2.1920555369883123
88% had contact with a general practitioner at least once a year, 97% had contact either with a general practitioner or with a specialist once a year.	2.148572540704995
The number of diseases existing at the same time was the most determining variable for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine.	2.3057810439845627
Furthermore, the elderly had more contact with physicians and took more medicine if they thought they were susceptible to diseases in a high degree, and if they rated their own health as poor.	1.9485208963048006
Fewer contacts with physicians and a lower use of medicine were found in those elderly that rated health behavior as little useful, that had low control beliefs regarding their own health, and that experienced only a low degree of health-related limitations in their everyday life.	2.0239442505766583
Furthermore, we found a higher use of medicine if there was little social support.	2.3296880831586573
There were no significant age-related or sex-related differences regarding the contact of practitioners or the use of medicine.	2.315601428702779
Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD: Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) are chronic inflammatory and frequently relapsing diseases of the gut that ultimately lead to destruction of the intestinal tissue.	2.0612538623255756
Recent evidence suggests that a pathologic activation of the mucosal immune system in response to antigens is a key factor in the pathogenesis of IBD.	2.3668442593937717
Furthermore, changes in cell migration and cytokine production appear to contribute to the perpetuation of IBD and the postoperative recurrence of Crohn's disease.	2.110771881479621
Based on recent advances in our understanding of the pathogenesis of IBD, several new therapeutic strategies are currently being tested in clinical practice, including recombinant anti-inflammatory cytokines (IFN-, IL-10, IL-11) and inhibitors of cell adhesion molecules (ICAM), proinflammatory cytokines (TNF, IL-12) and their receptors (TNF, IL-6R).	2.248851014039432
Dysregulation of apoptosis may play a major role in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).	2.420052961508447
A defective clearance of apoptotic cells or inappropriately high rates of apoptosis may lead to a pathologic accumulation of abnormal cell material with a secondary autoimmune response.	2.0574419628582152
Experimental findings in apoptotic keratinocytes and C1q knock-out mice suggest an important role of C1q in the clearance of apoptotic cell material.	2.091385281441327
In addition, there are several links between C1q and SLE: Most the patients with C1q deficiency develop a SLE-like syndrome.	2.08287262494366
SLE itself often causes secondary C1q deficiency and autoantibodies to C1q are detected in almost all patients with active lupus nephritis.	2.2074032275614957
These observations suggest a central role of C1q in apoptosis and in the pathogenesis of SLE.	2.693469017770717

The aim of this study was to demonstrate that fixation with Biofix rods and screws is as good as the standard A. O. fixation.	1.8770666288698827
Patients aged between 16 and 75 years old with closed, non-comminuted fractures of the lateral and/or medial malleolus and dislocation of the fracture fragments greater thean 2 mm were included in the study.	2.5115579598257516

After 3, 6 and 12 months, rontgenograms were taken.	2.661991376362808
At the same time functional results were evaluated following the criteria of Olerud and Molander.	2.338059346809598
Two patients were withdrawn from the trial for non-medical reasons.	2.4185295603325248

In 4 cases a Biofix screw broke down just beneath the head during insertion.	1.9284062291213555
This did not result in an insufficient fixation of the fracture.	2.884016381448559
There were no early post-operative complications.	2.4993165305484
The functional and rontgenological results in both groups were equal.	2.5873790503668648

The use of resorbable fracture fixation material has the advantage that a second operation to remove osteosynthesis material is not necessary.	2.0114989431031707
The long term results are good.	2.8427086714919345

In current textbooks of dermatology, lichen amyloidosus is said to be a papular, intensely pruritic type of amyloidosis of unknown aetiology.	2.106089822087932
When this concept was developed, there was no way of discriminating between the different types of amyloid.	2.5339985793628013
It is now known that amyloid in lichen amyloidosus is not derived from immunoglobulins or serum proteins, as it is in systemic amyloidoses, but from keratin peptides of necrotic keratinocytes.	1.86890713750424
Even several years ago, chronic scratching was invoked as a possible cause of damage to keratinocytes in lichen amyloidosus.	2.1457189401505703
In support of this hypothesis, four cases are presented.	2.4555500300363806
Apart from amyloid in the papillary layer, all biopsy specimens revealed histopathological signs of chronic scratching (epithelial hyperplasia with hypergranulosis and compact orthokeratosis, coarse collagen in vertical streaks in the stratum papillare), such as are also found in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus.	1.7377482054190758
Lichen amyloidosus is considered to be a variant of these conditions.	2.8970905324181704
Just as in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus, pruritus seems to be the cause and not a symptom of the papular skin lesions.	2.086356029623337
Consequently, treatment of lichen amyloidosus should not be directed at removing amyloid, but at improving the pruritus.	2.1757318368765306

To answer this question we compared mean slow-phase velocity (SPV) using three different recording techniques: electro-oculography (EOG), video-oculography (VOG) and infra-red oculography (IROG) during four different types of examinations.	1.7392724472883336
The examinations were the eye target tracking test (ETT), horizontal and vertical optokinetic nystagmus (OKN) tests and the rotating chair test of the horizontal vestibulo-ocular reflex (HVOR).	1.7018151716341916
For the ETT tests the VOG provided consistently higher mean SPV values with low variance, presumably because of the accuracy and stability of the calibration.	2.1266258198935395
For the horizontal OKN and VOR rotating chair tests no significant differences were found between the mean SPV obtained with the different recording techniques, although the IROG recordings were associated with a larger variance.	2.3262508934113417
Vertical OKN mean SPV was consistently lower with IROG and VOG techniques presumably because of non-linearities and resolution limitations inherent in these techniques.	1.965976574566491
These results indicate that the EOG technique despite its disadvantages of noise, time to apply and variability of calibration still provides an inexpensive, reliable and accurate means of measuring slow-phase eye movements.	1.9101768907339403

The blood supply of the quadriceps tendon arises from descending branches of the lateral circumflex femoral artery, by branches of the descending geniculate artery and by branches of the medial and lateral superior geniculate arteries.	2.176372603525125
Blood vessels penetrate the tendon from the surrounding connective tissue and anastomose with a longitudinally orientated intraligamentous network.	1.9088058726914363
Compared to the surrounding synovial layer, the amount of vessels in the tendon substance is greatly reduced.	2.1873818275423154
The distribution of blood vessels within the quadriceps tendon is not homogenous.	2.3389724505389986
The anterior or superficial part of the tendon has a complete vascular network that extends from the musculo-tendinous junction to the patella.	2.104954968480035

Lesions of the acetabular labrum should be treated by correcting the causes.	2.5999898022229493
In a steep acetabulum where the femoral head brings the acetabular labrum under tension and traction, the acetabulum should be rotated by triple pelvic osteotomy to slightly overcorrected acetabular measurements.	1.8404420579636476
Severely diminished acetabular and femoral anteversion can also lead to tears and impingement of the labrum.	2.056184619603332
Then rotation of the femoral neck and/or rotations of the acetabulum by triple osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion are indicated.	2.501009275759131
Our triple osteotomy technique differs from that of others mainly in the ischial osteotomy.	2.1769519311941825
It is performed from the posterior approach between the sciatic notch next to the ischial spine and the obturator foramen and is directed 20-30  ° anteriorly from the frontal (coronal) plane.	1.8998191042360582
Our normal values of the acetabular position were tested by correlating the measurements with the absence of pain.	2.3987715193748076
The optimum is reached with a CE angle and a VCA angle of 30-35  °, an angle of the weight-bearing zone of +5 to -5  ° and a migration index of 10-15 %.	1.9929047587264128
Overcorrections again caused pain and should be avoided.	2.7106587819332044
Diminished anteversion of femur and acetabulum towards 0  ° also caused pain and should be corrected by triple and femoral osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion.	1.9686146224029581

With an incidence of 1-3 %, mortality of 20 % it and permanent disability for another 20 % is a clinically relevant disorder.	2.2647726519810685

Differences from the previous method are (1) removal of stabilizer from the MMA monomer before its application, (2) the use of a different starter, (3) avoidance of O2 influence during polymerization by means of vacuum exchange with N2, and (4) polymerisation in a water bath to draw off residual heat.	2.196452455804828

Of these patients, 138 received this initial operative treatment at an outside institution.	2.1907480129588364
The primary reconstructions for the fractures utilized plates in 112 cases, reamed nails in 24 cases and external fixators in 9 cases.	1.9043512173807957
The average age of the patients was 35 years and the mean time from the initial operative treatment was 2 years.	2.61632846767726
Twenty-seven patients (19 %) presented with a hypertrophic nonunion and 118 (81 %) with an atrophic nonunion.	2.2413034466305954
There was a significant correlation between primary "classic" plating and development of an atrophic nonunion (2-test: P < 0.01).	2.324177656218996
We observed 34 wound infections (23 %) with no significant correlation to the type of primary osteosynthesis.	2.51261925115812
We determined that 73 of the pseudarthroses were due to improper osteosynthesis techniques.	2.096139464053028
Of these cases, 41 % involved the use of plates, 83 % involved the use of reamed nails, and 78 % involved the use of external fixators.	2.541502887890564
Fracture location near the diaphyseal-metaphyseal junctions was common in this problematic group.	1.9683755006139805
Ninety-two percent of all plates led to atrophic nonunions.	2.1495465927081545

Fifty-seven (39 %) of all patients had additional injuries, but we found that did not increase the risk of disturbed bone healing.	2.446305651124867
Our revision operations focused on the elimination of wound infections, refreshment of bone healing, and improvement in fragment stability.	2.1582242300545142
Only 28 % of all "classic" plates and 11 % of all external fixators were changed to an intramedullary implant at the time of the first revision surgery.	2.1698230240711327

Methods: Patients with a local recurrence after curative resection of ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreas were treated with 100 µg of octreotide three times a day and tamoxifen 20 mg once daily.	2.233614798400493

Results: Recurrences were diagnosed after R0 resection in a mean time of 13  +/-  6.8 months.	2.2877541444545213

Conclusion: Since combined therapy with octreotide and tamoxifen can be administered comfortably for outpatient treatment, this seems to represent progress in the palliative therapy of pancreatic cancer.	2.0540177449346517

Design: Prospective, randomised, placebo-controlled study.	2.4284325095811807
Patients: Twenty adult patients undergoing elective pulmonary resection.	2.366475441016677
Anaesthesia: General anaesthesia was performed using propofol, fentanyl, N2O and vecuronium.Volume-controlled ventilation was performed to maintain normocapnia over the whole investigation period.	2.1557354769378048
During OLV, the tidal volume was reduced and the respiratory rate was increased to avoid a peak airway pressure exceeding 40 cm H2O.	2.009052614389849
Furthermore the FiO2 was increased to 1,0 and the external PEEP was removed during OLV.	2.2521676154035632
Interventions: The patients received either dopexamine at 2 µg/kg/min (group A, n=10) or 0,9% saline as control (group B, n=10) after assessing the baseline values.	2.3029282428686764

Data were recorded at the following times: After induction of anaesthesia in stable haemodynamics during two-lung ventilation (baseline values, T0), intraoperatively during one-lung ventilation (T1) and postoperatively after re-establishing two-lung ventilation (T2).	1.846803737667161
Patients characteristics, data from the preoperative lung function testing and surgical procedures did not differ significantly between the groups.	2.42095121794578
CI increased in the dopexamine group from 2,5 +/- 1,2 l - min-1 - m-2 (T0) to 3,6 +/- 0,9 l - min-1 - m-2 (T1) and 4,0 +/- 1,3 l - min-1 -  m-2 (T2).	2.2452206619008046
The course of the intrapulmonary right-to-left shunting did not differ between the groups.	2.5224326948666844
Regarding the pressure-flow-curves there was no difference during OLV between the two groups indicating no major blocking effect of dopexamine on hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction.	2.131232463458933
Conclusion: It is concluded that dopexamine can be used to improve haemodynamics and oxygen delivery during thoracic surgery without increasing venous admixture during one-lung ventilation.	2.1075705581072435

The deformity in severe spondylolisthesis consists of two components: the parallel anterocaudad slip of the spondylolisthetic vertebra, and its tilt into kyphotic malposition.	1.8077979729841014
The influence of the two components is very different: the anterocaudad slippage has not much impact on the sagittal profile of the spine and is easily compensated for by a slight increase in lumbar lordosis.	2.2513696605365148
The kyphotic deformity has a high impact on trunk imbalance and the sagittal profile.	2.1760528246447537
There are two compensation mechanisms: hyperlordosis of the lumbar spine to its anatomical extremes and - if that is not sufficient - verticalisation of the sacral bone, performed by contracture of the hamstrings and uprighting of the pelvis around the hip joints.	1.8332624629750718
The latter mechanism is followed by functional disadvantages.	2.4972653806021667
Therefore, correction of the kyphosis of L5 may be considered during operative treatment if the lumbosacral kyphosis (angle delta) is less than 85  ° and the sacral inclination less than 35  °.	1.8750580841444482

Evidence of reproducibility and accuracy is a prerequisite for useful interpretation of the results.	2.3690328604162096

Materials and methods: We reviewed a total of 50 [18F]-2-fluordeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (18FDG-PET) investigations performed in 44 patients who had undergone surgical resection of oral cancer.	2.266546077144065
In 23 cases, re-staging (group A) was indicated due to suspicion of recurrent or secondary tumor manifestation.	2.038215141074042
In 27 cases, PET served as a screening procedure (group B).	2.1459651573258562
Statistic evaluation included sensitivity, specifity, positive/negative predictive value and accuracy of 18FDG-PET for the detection of tumor manifestation.	2.225571353541988
Results: 18FDG-PET correctly identified 23 of 26 tumor sites (88%) in the re-staging group and 9 of 10 tumor sites (90%) in the screening group.	2.4168651660614455

Specificity was 63% for local recurrence, 97% for secondary lymph node involvement and 90% for distant metastasis.	2.022495024415009

There were not any complaints, or the complaints were so much diminished that complete division of the carpal ligament could be viewed as accomplished in 51 of 55 cases.	1.9914863885533265
There were continuing complaints in four cases, and after an additional check two patients were operated on again.	2.6612196419534886
The advantage of the endoscopic method is the inconspicuous scar and the reduced postoperative disablement.	2.0985732000189414
For surgical removal of a malignant choroid melanoma, it is necessary to reduce systolic blood pressure to around 50-60 mmHg in order to prevent choroidal haemorrhages.	2.683333846208311
However, blood pressure reduction is associated with the risk of cerebral ischaemia.	3.3056367254228496
We report a patient with a malignant choroid melanoma in whom waves I and II of the brainstem auditory evoked potentials (BAEP) disappeared during surgery under controlled arterial hypotension and hypothermia (31.1 ° C).	1.9235082947295878
The waves could be recorded again immediately after the mean arterial pressure was increased from 48 to 77 mmHg.	2.187465726603391
The oesophageal temperature had dropped by 0.3 ° C at this time.	2.0954670221375458
A bilateral, reversible, apparently blood-pressure-dependent loss of waves I and II during arterial hypotension despite a normal EEG has to our knowledge not been previously described in the literature.	1.9808089639925186
The isolated loss of waves I and II with maintenance of waves III, IV, and V is unusual.	2.0703124969567135
The literature contains reports of acoustic neurinoma patients in whom only wave V could be recorded.	2.1329020812819732
This is regarded as an indication of continued impulse conduction despite the loss of waves I to IV.	2.348690139963419
Others have observed a patient with temporary and reversible loss of BAEP wave I due to vasospasm of the internal auditory artery that apparently occurred during or shortly after manipulation of the internal auditory meatus.	2.0166869160403653
Assuming anatomic peculiarities in the blood supply to the generators of the BAEP waves, a stenosis of the basilar artery could be considered as the cause of the bilateral reversible loss of waves I and II.	2.1473568946917134
Another potential source could be the induced hypothermia, but this does not seem very likely because the patient's temperature was 0.3 ° C lower at the return of the waves than at their loss.	2.0365000439941308
In the syndrome arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy, little is known to date about the mechanism for the development of arrhythmias.	2.3258666117171782
In a group of 54 patients with documented ventricular tachycardia during longterm ECG recordings, the determinants for the development of VT and the relationship between signal-averaged ECG and the morphological characteristics of the disease are investigated.	2.413616839925965
The analysis of the long-term electrocardiographic data includes the measurement of RR-intervals 30, 15, 5, 1min and immediately before onset of the VT, the determination of the morphology of the previous ventricular premature beats, and the frequency of the atrial arrhythmias.	2.595190366889233
Normal values for the analysis of late potentials in the ECG signal accquisition with bidirectional filters between 40 and 300Hz were defined a maximum of 113ms for a QRS width, LAS of 38ms, and RMS40 of 16uV.	1.9834833377521996
The analysis of the long-term ECG produced monomorphic VT in all cases without previous atrial arrhythmia and in only 4 cases with previous polymorphic ventricular premature beats.	2.3050505132153725
A long-short phenomenon could only be proven in 4VT episodes.	2.278496370147505
In 84% of all tachycardias, no arrhythmia were found immediately before onset of the arrhythmic event.	2.080155668840459
According to the circadian clock, two peaks, mornings between 6 and 9h and evenings between 6 and 9h, could be determined.	1.8727545957854477
In patients, who were recently diagnosed with ARVD, a significant shortening of the RR intervals before the onset of VT as an indication of an acceleration of the sinus rhythm was observed.	2.2666738214431814
This effect could not be observed in patients with a past medical history of AVRD.	3.397720327728329
Late potentials were determined with a prevalence of 74% overall.	2.464822794589231
Increasingly, late potentials were observed with morphologically diffuse forms of the ARVD.	2.3686230680780342
A correlation to the severity of spontaneous arrhythmias (ventricular, sustained or not sustained VT) could not be established.	2.337900429272535
In comparison to the origin of VT in coronary heart disease, previous arrhythmias play a less important role in arrhymogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy.	2.2907824936644032
Most importantly, an intensified sympathetic tone before onset of VT and an increased prevalence of positive late potentials are observed.	2.133037278762362

If physiotherapy and neurosurgical procedures such as nerve repair do not have the desired outcome, muscle transfer operations are possible.	2.1224549028507482
The results of our favored transfer of the trapezius muscle to compensate paralysis of the deltoid muscle will be presented.	2.0784641078972084
Preoperatively radiological, clinical and electromyographic examinations are necessary.	2.4773883944700406
Our results are based upon the clinical and radiological check ups and the subjective assessment of the patients.	2.9576919867460623
Thirty-one patients (7 female, 24 male) underwent a trapezius transfer between March 1994 and December 1996.	2.0213698276907763
With the patient in lateral decubitus position and protection of the opposite plexus, a sagital skin incision is the first step, followed by the preparation of trapezius and deltoid muscle as well as the bony parts of the shoulder (acromion, clavicle, scapular spine).	2.3265898129459175
The deltoid origin is cut from the lateral third of the clavicle, the acromion and the lateral half of the scapular spine.	2.272763501428258
The next step is transection of the root of the acromion and the lateral clavicle.	2.1224364649980254
After elevation of the remaining trapezius insertions from the clavicle and scapular spine, the proximal humerus is exposured by splitting the partly detached deltoid muscle longitudinally.	1.8754360506200483
Then the acromion fragment and humerus are prepared for the bone-to-bone contact.	2.4055135543419977
In 90  ° of abduction the acromion fragment with its trapezius insertion is transferred and fixed to the humerus with two 4.5-mm screws.	1.857401788829987
Finally the deltoid is sutured on the top of the trapezius and the skin is closed over two suction drains.	2.0328316352615814
Postoperatively we immobilize the operated arm in an abduction support for 6 weeks.	2.1457008805498248
The physiotherapy program starts on the first postoperative day with active training of elbow, hand and fingers and electrostimulation of the transferred trapezius muscle.	1.969078927780067
Six weeks after the procedure we take an X-ray and start with progressive adduction of the arm.	2.282862652713718
The preoperative subluxation of the humeral head was abolished in all cases.	2.3513739835231
We achieved an average increase of active abduction from 7.3  ° (range 0-45  °) preoperatively to 39.2  ° (range 25  °-80  °) 1 year after the operation; the increase of forward flexion was from 20  ° (range 0  °-85  °) to 43  ° (range 20  °-90  °).	1.9359476089198864
Finally we can conclude that the trapezius transfer for flail shoulder gives a satisfactory outcome regarding shoulder function and stability as well as the subjective situation of the patients.	2.2520852765044017
We analyzed psychiatric and criminological data from 103 arsonists.	2.137818311083859
The following criticisms of the definition of pyromania according to DSM-III-R and IDC-10 seem appropriate.	2.029979879901464
First, the categoric exclusion of aggressive motives does not seem very promising, since approximately one fourth of arsonists whose firesetting is based on motives quoted in DSM-III-R may also have an aggressive motive.	1.8951430102489069
Second, ICD-10 gives being drunk and alcoholism as a criterion for the exclusion of pyromania.	2.1137281660923835
This seems untenable, since the behavior classed as pyromania is largely a product of alcohol misuse.	2.00665877506295
Repeated firesetting, resulting from being fascinated by fire etc., may be less a disturbance of impulse control but rather the manifestation of a psychoinfantilism, which, supported by alcohol abuse, extends into older age.	1.945801284264552
The tendency for relapses after imprisonment seems to be low; this tendency probably decreases spontaneously in older age.	2.086287955454185
The mean age of arsonists with aggressive motives is a little below 30 years, those setting fire with suicidal motives have a mean age of 35, deluded arsonists have a mean age of 40 years.	1.995410579598195
Concrete sexual motives are relatively rare.	2.5536713612654456
Retaliation is a rare cause, however, since most of them do not even know the victims.	2.81303631360367
One third of these persons set the fire in their own homes.	2.1104429809627248
Most arsonists show a personality disorder, with insecurity and narcissism predominating.	2.1014483126713634
Data on firesetting are to be treated with caution, since two thirds of all cases are newer resolved; one fourth of cases concern minors, and in Central Europe arsonists with rational motives are hardly ever referred to psychiatrists.	2.1468928848825604
A normal ciliary beat frequency of ciliated cells is necessary for the mucociliary clearance of the nose and paranasal sinuses.	2.058031962851501
An in vitro investigation was performed to eval-uate the influence of topical corticosteroids and antihistamines on the ciliary beat frequency of human nasal mucosa.	2.1999888011229194
The nasal sprays examined contained the corticosteroids budesonide or fluticasone propionate and the topical antihistamines azelastine or levocabastine.	1.7921586087930346
All tests were performed on cell cultures of human nasal mucosa during constant conditions.	2.251730643901995
Three of the four nasal sprays tested contained benzalkonium chloride as preservative.	2.0397055732775553
An irreversible cessation of ciliary movement was observed in all cells exposed to nasal sprays containing benzalkonium chloride in a 50 per cent solution.	2.044704047991637
The nasal spray containing budesonide was benzalkonium chloride-free and caused minor but fully reversible decreases in ciliary beat frequency after 20 min.	1.8680845606651315
As benzalkonium chloride can cause complete standstill of ciliary beat frequency in vitro in human nasal mucosa, we recommend that this preservative should not be used anymore in topical nasal medications.	2.0064392605366157

The usual method of surgery for this is to lift the bladder neck towards cranial and ventral.	2.1374647321108293

The disappointing results with the Stamey technique did not correlate with the degree of initial continence.	2.362693153680886

It is well known that alterations to the oral cavity caused by dental prostheses may affect speech articulation, although influences on the voice are not assumed.	2.0093452030028613
In addition to the vocal fundamental frequency, vibrations of the vocal chords generate overtones.	2.066551420658547
Through the shape of the larynx and the upper airway, resonances and antiresonances are formed, and in this way overtones are amplified to a variable extent.	2.271651228236032
Nozzle changes caused by a dental prosthesis in the oral cavity may possibly influence overtones but influences on the vocal fundamental frequency seem unlikely.	2.2271594854745285
The influence of dental prostheses on the voice is demonstrated in a patient who owned two different dental prostheses.	2.349637022975592
The fundamental frequency rose by up to five semitones during speech and his vocal range increased by up to four semitones when a thin denture was used instead of a normal denture.	1.8482593908758778
When the position of the mandible was checked by intraoral needle point placement, a more rostral position of the mandible was recorded with the thin denture than with the normal denture.	2.2192113995381573
Sagittal magnetic resonance tomography imaging also showed that the larynx was in a more cranial position.	2.4574498703076433
This change was presumed to be due to an upward movement of the larynx induced by the tongue, which itself was found to be in a more cranial position with the thin denture.	2.4216518314777553
In this situation, increased tension of the laryngeal muscles were believed to induce a rise in fundamental frequency, shifting the voice range toward higher frequencies.	1.975089347906367
These findings show that dental prostheses can cause vocal changes in individual cases.	2.1150095606386756
The etiology of this occurrence is still not clear.	2.3620965736933406
Its consequences, however, should be known to the dentist, ENT surgeon and phoniatrist if patients notice changes in their voice after having altered or replaced their dentures.	2.0139061401582543

The basic idea of the Collaborative Family Health Care is nothing new.	2.032694111176593
It has its roots in the bio-psycho-social model of medicine developed by George Engel in the U.S.A. and it has a long tradition in the German psychosomatic medicine.	1.934992492081751

The basic is a systemic view of illness and health.	2.301923876718404

In the ancient times, Aristotle, Herophilos, and Galen discovered basic anatomical structures.	1.8860502083687338
Paul von Aegina, in the seventh century a. c., had the idea of a nerve suture, which was first performed in an animal 1000 years later by the Italian surgeon Gabriele Ferrara.	2.145899554595103
Systematic investigations on nerve crossing date to the beginning of the nineteenth century and were conducted by Jean Pierre Flourens.	2.0043881695224854
Within 1 week in summer 1864, two French surgeons (Laugier and Nélaton) independently carried out the first nerve sutures in humans.	1.7511194109319441
Their observations of an immediate functional recovery of the appropriate muscles after suturing were discussed controversially in scientific circles.	1.9804161781049718

The entity was first described in 1983.	2.592815222543766
The tumor is regarded as low-grade sarcoma by some authors; its cause and pathogenesis are presently unknown.	2.197826076288804

The single radiation doses were 200 cGy 5 times a week.	2.1037990108911218

A follow-up 2 years after the radiation treatment revealed no recurrence.	2.8824833580356195

The CMV settings were a tidal volume of 10 ml/kg body weight, a respiratory rate of 10 breaths/min, an I:E ratio of 1:1.5, and an end-inspiratory pause of 30% of inspiratory time.	2.0846827683471774
With both ventilation modes FiO2 was set to 0.5 and PEEP to 3 cm H2O.	2.026229026655117
During ALV a desired alveolar ventilation of 70 ml/kg KG - min was preset.	2.116245724603191
All other ventilatory parameters were determined by the ALV controller according to the instantaneously measured respiratory parameters.	2.574706266506903
Positioning induced a reduction of compliance from 61.6 to 47.9 ml/cm H2O; the respiratory time constant shortened from 1.2 to 1.08 s, whereas physiological dead space increased from 158.9 to 207.5 ml.	1.7673645420981585
On average, the ventilatory parameters selected by the ALV controller resembled very closely those used with CMV.	1.926688441462519
However, an adaptation to individual respiratory mechanics was clearly evident with ALV.	1.9861037914228095
In conclusion, we found that the effects of positioning for nephrectomy are minor and may give rise to problems only in patients with restrictive lung disease.	2.487962708143279
The novel ALV controller automatically selects ventilatory parameters that are clinically sound and are better adapted to the respiratory mechanics of ventilated patients than the standardized settings of CMV are.	1.9045127649507985

The role of hip sonography in neonatal hip screening is still a controversial matter.	2.2103483516645666
This paper reports the results of the Austrian ultrasound hip screening program, in which all Austrian babies undergo hip sonography twice: at the birth clinic during the 1st week of life and at an age of 12-16 weeks.	2.144962001420546
Data from all public health insurance companies since 1985 and all ICD data about children hospitalized because of CDH in Austria were collected and analyzed.	1.9031996873898858
The rate of sonographically pathological hips was 6.57 % (1994).	1.9703986051639497
The treatment rate before introduction of hip sonography was 13.16 % (1985).	2.057596016150208
Hip sonography screening proved to be effective in detecting true instability of the hip joint as well as dysplasia.	3.039544425208947
The optimal time for sonographic screening does not seem to be immediately after birth when only "high risk" hips (clinical instability, positive family history, breech delivery) should undergo hip sonography, but at an age between 4 and 6 weeks when the hip has already shown its true nature.	1.8543585003155485
Since one sonographic scan appears to be sufficient for screening, a further reduction of costs could be accomplished.	2.3250145212900133

Transactional analysis (Berne 1958) in its original concepts was intended to help even lay people to understand personal structures and psychodynamic processes.	1.8419571260214485
This intention lead some of the following authors to superficiality and a "happy-go-lucky" perspective.	2.173414605260122
Others, most of all European transactional analysts went back to the roots of the original contents and aims and showed that they offer great clinical relevance for the understanding and treatment of a variety of disturbances.	2.280452359875068
This article will illustrate these aspects, using the borderline syndrome as an example.	2.2699234272280524

Introduction: Postoperative delirium is a common psychic disturbance occurring acutely after various surgical procedures and typically presenting with a fluctuating course.	2.1239727844473695
These patients' recovery takes longer.	2.3943483509992762
In this study we analyze the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients undergoing vascular surgery and try to identify risk factors for its development.	2.3723977398763507
Methods: Patients undergoing elective arterial operations were included.	2.291700193639828
Their medical history, the specific vascular diagnosis and operation performed, the medication and laboratory data were monitored.	2.2147108896410774
Additionally the patients were preoperatively interviewed by a psychiatrist.	2.592425970012839
Intraoperatively the drugs, infusions, possible transfusions, blood gases and pressures were monitored, as were the times of surgery and anesthesia.	2.075779862562478
Postoperatively patients were seen daily by the psychiatrist and the surgeon for at least 7 days.	2.1537232792665617
Postoperative delirium was diagnosed according to DSM IV criteria, and mild, moderate and severe delirium were distinguished.	2.0864207020784873
Results: Fifty-four patients entered the study.	2.4208980869035783
Twenty-one (38.9 %) developed postoperative delirium (11 mild, 2 moderate, 8 severe).	1.9289607435975757
Some preexisting diseases (hearing disturbance) increased the probability of postoperative delirium, while age was not identified as a risk factor.	2.2088224310130626
General psychopathological and depressive disturbances increased the likelihood of postoperative delirium.	2.2737615760265366
Patients who had a severe intraoperative course developed postoperative delirium more frequently.	2.253227035367475
More reliable parameters were an increased intraoperative need for crystalloid volume, intra - or postoperatively decreased hemoglobin values (Hb < 10 g/dl) and the development of acidosis that had to be treated.	2.44303100098421
Patients with delirium had serious complications more often (8/21 = 38.1 % vs 6/33 = 18.2 %) and needed Intensive Care treatment longer (2.7 vs 2.1 days, only aortic surgery 3.2 vs 2.4 days).	1.6901419129296797
Conclusions: Postoperative delirium after vascular surgery is frequent.	2.355394739187254

The number of deaths due to acute hemorrhage was considerably smaller among those patients with prophylactic ligature of the ECA performed during operative procedure of tumor resection and neck dissection.	1.9809420002240692
In addition there were much less unfavourable courses in the sequence of prophylactic closure of the ECA than observed after ligating the CCA or ECA and STA in an emergency situation.	1.8565207321537762

Typical, however, is its neuroendocrine and mucinous differentiation so that an unequivocal diagnosis is possible by means of immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.	2.455890229404175

During the past decade, the molecular mechanisms in the process of tumor progression, including metastasis and angiogenesis, have become better understood.	2.043295813124541
Each of these steps is crucial and limiting, since a failure to complete any one prevents the tumor cell from producing a metastasis.	1.8654471048768997
Detachment from the solid tumor by loosening the intercellular junctions and proteolysis of the extracellular matrix enables tumor cells to enter blood- and lymph vessels.	1.9079152133170851
The intravasation into the circulation is supported by the secretion of angiogenic factors, which induce degradation of the basal membran in blood vessels.	2.097065870724396
Adhesion to endothelial cells, extravasation from the circulation, and induction of angiogenesis are further essential steps for completing the metastatic process.	1.96739875761279
Furthermore, it is well known that once a tumor cell has entered circulation, it will survive only by evasion of the immune system.	2.1504542844833705
The systematic identification of tumor antigens opens up new possibilities for immunotherapeutic approaches.	2.0199151773583206

Both CT and MR imaging are highly sensitive for the detection of neoplastic invasion of the pre-epiglottic space, paraglottic space, subglottic region and cartilage.	2.2440777579692592

The specificity of both CT and MRI is, however, limited and both methods may therefore overestimate the extent of tumor spread.	2.4984510103212476

a QA-Inventory for routine monitoring; (2.)	2.268338955078272
rules for evaluating the outcome of every patient and (3.)	2.9884066107048612
a feedback model for communicating the results to the therapists (quality circles).	2.142742153908624
The focus of this model is the recognition of problematic results.	2.392547714623762

We report a truck driver with severe soft tissue contusion of both legs who developed atypical heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) after a thrombosis prophylaxis with unfractionated heparin; despite a thrombosis the patient showed a systemic allergic reaction to heparin in combination with elevation of thrombocytes and positive heparin-dependent antibodies.	1.8842023164680255
Six days after the initial trauma deep vein thrombosis of the left lower leg was diagnosed and fasciotomy was performed, preventing an imminent compartment syndrome.	2.534205762281677
Another 5 days later the patient developed exanthema of the trunk and upper extremities and urticaria on his face, as well as severe headache.	2.4746707407626
His platelet count increased from 134 000/µl to 258 000/µl.	2.010775177586042
After exclusion of other causes for these symptoms, a reaction to heparin-dependent antibodies (heparin-platelet-factor 4 complex) was demonstrated 2 days later.	2.0662648261122234
Shortly after rinsing of an intravenous line with less than 50 IE unfractionated heparin at day 36 after trauma the patient developed an anaphylactic shock, which could be managed with cortisone.	1.999756477423829
We suggest that in HIT the thrombocytopenia may represent only one form of an allergic reaction to heparin.	2.0876526449201314
The cause of the thrombembolic event is an antigen-antibody reaction to heparin taking place on the surface of the thrombocyte.	2.1314519775566376
This is similar in all forms of systemic reaction to heparin application, even though the symptoms may vary.	2.241348421889816
As thrombocytopenia may not be the main symptom of a heparin-induced antibody reaction - in our hospital only 5 of 10 patients with HIT - the disease should rather be named "heparin allergy".	2.1464928715158904
We suggest a new classification of different pattern of heparin allergy types I-IV.	2.202787623669647
The new types I and II are similar to HIT types I and II.	2.23093586519745
Type III is the reaction of antibodies without decrease of thrombocytes, and type IV the reaction of antibodies associated with systemic allergic symptoms.	1.9190491843313082

The weaning period is complicated by the withdrawal syndrome, showing tachycardia, hypertonia, tachypnea and restlessness.	2.0096048826678836
Adding sufentanil, an opioid with greater effects on analgesia than on respiratory depression compared with fentanyl, tachypnea can be reduced to normal frequency.	2.0546688279721597
In this way weaning management can be managed more easily for the benefit of both, the patient and physician.	2.656796329705666

Given the high mortality of severe sepsis and septic shock, immunomodulation has been considered as an attractive adjunct therapy.	2.1737046832015077
Many agents have been studied that have the therapeutic potential to interfere with cytokines and other pathways which are activated during sepsis.	2.010370870665997
Drugs having the properties to neutralize lipopolysaccharides have also been considered.	2.2218092400756784
So far all the large clinical trials with immunomodulating agents (HA1A, E5, anti TNF antibodies, ILra) have been shown to be of marginal or of no benefit.	2.078516290430688

Recently, two new halogenated volatile anaesthetics, sevoflurane and desflurane, have been approved for clinical use in Germany.	2.254541424225693
Their low solubility in blood is the most important common property, and this represents the most obvious difference from the inhalational anaesthetics currently used.	2.2941813518882763
Extensive clinical and experimental evaluations have confirmed the superior pharmacokinetic properties predicted.	2.1950714154878637
Both sevoflurane and desflurane provide more rapid emergence from anaesthesia, permit easier titration of the anaesthetic dose during maintenance and offer more rapid recovery from anaesthesia.	1.8163199826849727
For sevoflurane, there are additional advantages: a pleasant odor, negligible airway irritation, and excellent pharmacodynamic characteristics that even provide cardiovascular stability comparable to isoflurane.	1.9056684292795392
A certain disadvantage and source of potential nephrotoxicity result from the metabolism of sevoflurane (2-5%) to anorganic fluoride and degradation to compound A in carbon dioxide absorbents.	1.9620026159747108
The extensive clinical data reported to date have revealed no evidence that sevoflurane has adverse renal effects.	2.2127695856696934
New insight into the pathomechanism of nephrotoxicity associated with either production of fluoride or compound A may well support clinical experience.	1.8851910450804392
Desflurane strongly resists in vivo metabolism and because of this it appears to be devoid of toxicity.	2.273687071295918
Nevertheless, potential side-effects may result from degradation in dry absorbents and subsequent release of CO, from its extreme pungency and irritating airway effects.	1.9156193552347316
Thus, desflurane is not recommended for induction of anaesthesia, especially in children.	2.829621238995487
The tendency for desflurane transiently to stimulate sympathetic activity, especially at concentrations above 1.0 MAC, limits its application in patients with cardiac disease.	2.1795731446485873
The doctor in charge, who is generally the medical director, is liable if patients suffer harm through organizational faults within his or her department.	1.9027994461107505
Even the suspicion that an error has arisen as the result of defective organization is enough for the person responsible - that is to say the medical director - to be liable.	1.9458464100586297
For this reason, the doctor in charge must be in a position to recognize structural defects in organization and to correct these by means of staff training.	2.0904371758588223
Every training measure must guarantee specialist standards; this means that the work of doctors with no specialist training and those still in training and working under supervision is guaranteed to be of the same standard and performed with the same degree of meticulous care as that of a qualified specialist.	2.0253687699785585
A legally valid consent from the patient and documentation of the patient information must be accessible at all times.	2.5869614513169745
Operations carried out by doctors in training must be supervised by a qualified specialist; otherwise the doctor in charge is guilty of a defect in organization.	1.9999595581640737
Because of staff shortages it often happens that inexperienced beginners - often doctors doing their practical training - are on call very early on.	1.733655395502296
In the high-risk specialty of obstetrics it is particularly important that doctors still undergoing practical training can call on an experienced colleague for help at all times.	1.9639619046467398
The changeover from day duty to emergency duty must be organized by the doctor in charge in such a way that the medical staff are rested and that adequate free time is guaranteed.	1.8530706150606804
There must be no friction when cooperation with other disciplines concerned is needed.	2.0728066282203668
Each sector must know its own area of responsibility.	2.190289720758302
The doctor in charge is resonsible for seeing that his or her staff members are familiar with the use of the medical equipment.	2.243946251815103
Uniform guidelines will make it possible for the medical director to train his/her staff and prevent systematic organizational defects.	2.0292757499459113

The rate of local or regional metastasis was also very high (22.7%).	2.115434071986006

Extracorporeal photophoresis (ECP), a therapeutic modality that has been under investigation for some years, is based on separation of a leucocyte/lymphocyte-enriched cell fraction from the peripheral blood, extracorporeal treatment of the cells with 8-MOP/UVA and subsequent reinfusion of the cells in the patient.	2.1979615799029815
Its main effects seem to consist in changes to the immunologic behaviour of the photoinactivated/modulated cells.	1.9665681183511692
The immune response of the host is obviously stimulated by this treatment.	2.208530162230766
ECP is normally performed for 4 h per day on 2 consecutive days every 4 weeks.	2.1170240681577503
The treatment is well tolerated and causes few side effects.	2.2852064958900913

Progressive systemic scleroderma responded in more than 50% of our cases.	2.4039987858772136

The effectiveness of ECP seems to be quite well established in CTCL, but remains to be examined in autoimmune dermatoses.	2.319856966781078
ECP is an attractive addition to the dermatological therapies available but our experience is still preliminary.	2.2354231340251762

Of the 48 patients 36 were followed up over an average of 2 1/2 years using the Lysholm scores and the OAK scores.	2.2270337532949984
The total score of the 36 patients was 81 points and can be valued as good using the evaluation scale of Lysholm and Gillquist.	1.9834038414686201

Myocardial ischemia results in myocardial dysfunction.	2.5306938485836055
Recovery may be delayed ("stunning"), or persistent if perfusion remains reduced ("hibernation") and ischemia may go on to necrosis, thus, contributing to chronic heart failure.	1.8886032974021236
In addition, myocardium not directly affected by ischemia may undergo adaptive processes like hypertrophy and dilatation, which may result in chronic left heart failure.	2.023536831829287
This process is characterized by hemodynamic, neurohumoral, and progressive morphologic changes of the heart which are closely interrelated.	2.4430555146334716
Hemodynamic changes basically consist of an increase in left ventricular filling pressure and a decrease in global ejection fraction, and, in most cases years after myocardial infarction, in an increase in systemic vascular resistance and right atrial pressure.	2.6720500169878667
Neurohumoral changes consist of an increase in plasma catecholamines, atrial natriuretic factor and vasopressin, and in an activation of the renin-angiotensin-system.	2.337148634166712
Plasma endothelin-1 was recently reported to be increased in patients with heart failure, and prognosis was related to endothelin levels.	2.647744803561676
Diminished response of vessels to endothelium (EDRF/NO) dependent vasodilatation suggests impairment of vascular endothelium in heart failure.	1.9048600678622247
Local changes of cardiac neurohumoral systems could contribute to structural changes of the heart, e.g., systemic activation to hemodynamic changes.	2.332006818695907
Structural changes of the heart are characterized by an increase in volume and thickness of surviving myocardium and an expansion of ischemic and necrotic myocardium.	2.4807662913612543

In 33.3 %, combined types of negligence were found.	2.2536084014758577
Most frequently, negligence was suspected after infection following hand surgery and internal fixation of long bones.	2.2368478717445766
The highest success rate of claims was seen after puncture of joints (69.2 %).	2.1338326210925564
Insufficient documentation was confirmed in 15.3 %.	2.4598268137849564

Abstract   Patient satisfaction plays an increasing part in the analysis of the outcome of medical treatment.	3.1014439313876094
The aim of the study was to compare health-related quality of life in patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm after endovascular or conventional surgery.	2.5390376982247047
A total of 40 patients were included (20 treated by endovascular and 20 by conventional surgery).	2.061639477804151
A questionnaire with 28 items similar to the SF-36 was answered during scheduled appointments.	2.042315375262818
On the third postoperative day, the conventionally treated patients were more frequently confined to bed (80% vs. 32%) and complained of intervention-related pain (90% vs. 42%) and incisional pain (26% vs. 15%); 55% of the patients suffered from obstipation (vs. 5% of the endovascular group).	1.972433815414486
Furthermore, the preoperative psychological stress seemed to be intensified.	2.2412155488587224
In comparable percentage, both the endovascular and conventionally treated patients were limited in social activities perioperatively.	2.0411085329959366
Sexual dysfunction was more frequent in the conventional group (33% vs. 13% three months postoperative).	2.2112718859540306
In addition, the conventionally treated patients were more limited in their physical activities (25% vs. 40%) and had more fear of ambulation (35% vs. 6%).	1.8505461024460013
The patients treated by an endovascular approach complained about frequent examinations (39% vs. 5%) that were often related to X-ray exposure (67% vs. 20%).	2.062298890203048
All of the conventionally operated patients had a sense of improvement (vs. 89% of the endovascular group); nevertheless only 28% felt completely healthy, compared to 11% of the endovascular treated patients.	2.0406868947712904
Advantages of the endovascular treated patients were "short hospital stay", "decreased pain", "smaller scars", and a "shorter confinement to bed".	2.2729704727559983
After intervention the conventionally treated patients were more limited in almost all quality-of-life aspects.	2.2235103426360623
After 3 months, differences between the groups decreased except for sexual dysfunction and limited physical activities.	2.2526997074070167
The patients treated by endovascular surgery complained more about frequent X-ray examinations than the conventionally treated group.	2.2757751107235693

Originally described by the Finish physician Erik von Willebrand in 1926 this disorder is associated with mucous membran bleeding including epistaxis, hypermenorhoea and excessive bleeding from surgery and dental procedures.	1.8597426483997466
In von Willebrands disease the patients have a quantitative or qualitative abnormality in the von Willebrand Factor (vWF) which has two major functions: it serves by bridging between platelets and injury site in the blood vessel wall, and it circulates as a complex with factor VIII, protecting it from rapid degradation.	1.8064108855936976
More than 20 different types and subtypes of vWD have been described but almost all patients can be classified as having 1 of the 2 most common types of vWD.	2.29545869773032
About 70 % of patients have type 1 and about 10-20 % present themself with type 2A and 2B vWD type 3 in about 10 %.	2.0118096554554534
By taking a clinical history of bleeding it is important to think about vWD and to make the appropriate diagnosis.	2.2845360777452837
If the vWD is suspected diagnostic tests should include an activated partial thromboplastin time, bleeding time, factor VIII:C, Ristocetin cofactor, and vWF antigen.	1.776685873739225
Additional testing of ristocetin induced plattlet adhesion (RIPA), the multimeric structure and collagen binding test and gen-analysis allow diagnosing the different types of v. Willebrand Disease.	1.9290894532229972
In patients with severe type 1, type 2B, 2N and type 3 or in people who do not response to desmopressin, the appropriate treatment is a factor VIII concentrate that is rich of vWF.	1.9370127137031272
Until now no recommendations in the orthopaedic literature have been found regarding diagnosis and treatment of vWS patients.	2.2734162977904573
Based on the experience with 43 orthopaedic patients presenting vWD over the last 15 years a contemporary guideline for the successful perioperative management of vWD in orthopaedic surgery is presented.	1.9350423904859
In a close collaboration between the orthopaedic surgeon and the specialized haemostaseologist every invasive procedure in patients with vWD can be undertaken without the risk of excessive bleeding.	2.3093115524752967

In most institutions it is not feasible to treat patients as Rao recommended: this would overstrain both hospital structure and financial resources.	2.075068734935797

Cicatrical pemphigoid (CP) comprises a groupf of patients with a chronic subepidermal blistering disease which primarily involves mucous membranes; lesions characteristically heal with scarring.	2.1083217165048964
Immunofluorescence investigations typically demonstrate deposits of tissue bound and circulating immunoreactants of the IgG and less frequently of the IgA class in a linear pattern along the basement membrane zone.	1.737212137447735
These autoantibodies are thought to play an important role in the blister formation of CP.	2.3393572350225926
Most patients show binding to the bullous pemphigoid antigen 2 (BPag2), collagen type XVII, with a molecularweight of 180 kD.	2.003462608973529
A smaller group of patients with CP have autoantibodies to laminin 5.	2.6499233085633094
Animal models confirm that autoantibodies binding to these two adhesion molecules (BPag2 and laminin 5) are important in blister formation.	1.9634672673405418
There are other autoantigens described in CP; however, they are only found in small groups of CP patients and most of them are not further characterised.	2.1154575784854472
The described molecules are part of the hemidesmosomal adhesion complex.	2.5649668661480396
Impaired function of any component of this complex may lead to a separation of the epidermis from the dermis; better knowledge about the single molecules and the exact localisation of epitopes within these molecules may lead to further understanding of the clinical picture.	2.3915367558693217

3 of these NSAIDs were also studied in terms of their effect on cartilage collagen synthesis.	2.2714004086000785

Those such as Aceclofenac, Tenidap and Tolmetin which can stimulate matrix synthesis 2.	1.977365557317894
Those such as Piroxicam, Tiaprofenic Acid and Aspirin which appear to be without significant effect on matrix synthesis and, 3.	1.9975802466936405
Those like Naproxen, Ibuprofen, Indomethacin, Nimezulide which significantly inhibit matrix synthesis.	1.8754163420325938

Pathological angiogenesis is observed in tumor formation and represents a multifactorial process, in which specific angiogenic factors, as well as growth factors, extracellular matrix proteins and cell adhesion molecules are involved.	2.2922022037520304
Tumor growth is characterized by an imbalance in favor of angiogenic over angiogenesis-inhibiting factors.	2.3538787355430757
Some of the most frequently examined angiogenic factors are vascular endothelial growth factor, acidic/basic fibroblast growth factors and the platelet-derived endothelial cell growth factor.	2.1221630675423433
The most important angiogenesis inhibitors are angiostatin and thrombospondin.	2.053894571812549
To date, the clinical relevance of tumor angiogenesis has been shown for several human tumors.	2.5974317932656126
For most urological tumors, the grade of tumor vessel formation, measured as microvessel density, has been associated with metastases, tumor growth and clinical course.	2.1112852940714273
The prognostic value of this feature of malignant growth seems to be higher than that of most of the classical and newer prognostic factors.	2.600793006563026

During the last few decades, traumatic injuries of the hip joint have significantly increased in number, and traffic accidents have also increased.	2.226800024206304
Depending on the speed, direction of the forces and the position of the femur at the moment of impact, different patterns of injury occur.	2.1385903553694554
Basically, they are classified as hip dislocations, dislocation fractures and acetabular fractures.	2.225729753910117
These injuries have in common a high rate of concomitant lesions.	2.5016225465084037
Several classification systems have been developed for these injuries.	2.9125884195713767
Commonly, Stewart and Milford's or Levin's classification is used for dislocations and dislocation fractures.	2.058499178333362
For acetabular fractures, Judet and Letournel's classification and its newer version developed by Helfet (AO classification) are generally accepted.	2.002695673074351
Fractures of the femoral head, though included in these classifications, are typically described by separate classifications like the one presented in 1957 by Pipkin.	1.9867047637844315
The multitude of injuries occuring in the hip joint requires vast knowledge of various operative approaches.	2.2017847228961003
No single approach exists that would permit the treatment of all injuries in an ideal fashion.	2.4581392440266674
Approaches are either considered limited (Kocher-Langenbeck, ilioinguinal iliofemoral) when they permit access only to a restricted segment of the joint, or extended (extended iliofemoral, Maryland, Ruedi) when they allow all-around visualization of the hip joint.	1.862692232605155
The choice of the best approach for an individual patient depends on the type of injury and also on patient variables like age, preexisting disease, and concomitant injuries.	2.374601009620825
The decision is further influenced by the timing of surgery, the kind of fracture stabilization intended and by complications typically seen with certain approaches.	2.1583244660201073
The indication for extended procedures is only seen in patients with complex injury patterns involving both the anterior and the posterior column or in delayed cases undergoing surgery more than 3 weeks after trauma.	2.1819464986523696
Extended approaches permit excellent visualization of the fracture, but the extent of the soft tissue trauma is reflected in a high rate of postoperative complications.	3.0816174490729074
After a phase in which extended procedures were favored, recently a trend towards more limited approaches can be recognized because of their lower complication rate.	1.905783561848158
This is facilitated by modern fracture-reduction methods using indirect techniques.	2.015686632250679

While age and sex were not associated with coping, external locus of control correlated positively to "depressive coping" and duration of illness correlated negatively to "distraction and self-affirmation."	2.0641444976971615
Coping strategies regarded as maladaptive and a small degree of internal locus of control correlated to unfavourable results for depression and satisfaction.	1.944462565572311

In its background, the data base contains a list of over 4700 ICD-encoded diagnoses to which the picture-documented findings are linked.	2.0212004293671053
Comments on pictures can be added by the author or by users.	2.1360857392547192
The data base contains several lists, such as a list of ICD codes and diagnoses, a list of all pictures with corresponding diagnoses, a list of all diagnoses and number of picture, a list of those diagnoses for which the corresponding picture is available, as well as a list of comments on each picture.	2.0998624976030835
Special program scripts handle the user's search key words for diagnoses and extract the required information out of the data base, using Windows NT.	1.9776987051116137
Search results are presented on an automatically built-up webpage.	2.3040964077287427
To provide fast speed of search all pictures initially are shown in a small format (thumbnails) with little amount of data.	1.9824814302001137
The related full-size picture is retrieved by a single mouse click.	2.09479221303739
Moreover, the name and institution of the author, diagnostical hints and comments on pictures by the author or by users are offered for each diagnosis available.	1.7591892786350811
The Giessen Ophthalmological Picture Atlas can be reached in the Internet.	2.2226741249245507
It allows a fast search free of charge from all over the world and, therefore, offers an additional option to obtain specific ophthalmological information for various purposes.	1.9752199272912405

The goal of this prospective, randomised and double-blind pilot-study was to investigate the analgesic potency and the side-effects of tramadol enantiomers in clinical practice.	2.352821925294529
One hundred patients recovering from orthopaedic surgery with a postoperative pain intensity of more than 50 on a visual analogue scale 0-100 mm (Table 1) were recruited for the study.	2.258214721188066
They were treated in a randomised, double-blind way with a maximal dose of 150 mg i.v.	2.1621390737996755
(+)-, (-)-tramadol, racemate, or 15 mg i.v.	2.088674457785872
morphine or saline in the placebo group (5 groups, 20 patients each).	2.3237189973333994
The primary criterium of efficacy was the number of responders defined as patients with a pain reduction of at least 20 on VAS after 40 min.	2.4491443921056653
In case of pain, responders were allowed to continue with the double-blind drug up to six hours.	2.209884869376442
The non-responders were treated with morphine as the rescue analgesic.	2.498003121598368
The secondary criterium was the incidence and severity of side-effects.	2.6414754715792634
Six patients terminated the study prematurely.	2.384757772635456
One patient was excluded because of an allergic reaction to morphine, one patient could not be treated sufficiently with morphine, four were excluded because of protocol violations.	2.1625672896463075
There were 8 responders in the (+)-tramadol-, 6 in the (-)-tramadol- and 6 in the racemate group, 16* (P<0,05) in the morphine group, and 5 in the placebo group.	2.231929838553565
Pain intensity after 40 min was reduced by 20 (p<0,05), 17 (p<0,05), 17 (p<0,05), 36 (p<0,01 vs placebo, p<0,05 vs (+)-, (-)-tramadol, and racemate group) and 5 mm on the VAS in the (+)-, (-)-, (+/-)-tramadol-, morphine- and placebo-group, respectively.	1.9147116897332193
Thirty eight adverse events like nausea, vomiting, PCO2-increase, and urinary retention occurred in 20 patients, most frequently in the (+)-tramadol- and morphine group.	2.1359897928937883
Sedation was significantly less profound in the (-)-tramadol group 1-4 h postoperatively.	2.2726541908040723
There were no side-effect in the tramadol racemate group.	2.3125849394233815
The enantiomers were equal to the racemate in analgesic potency, but inferior by far to morphine.	2.071805647647316
They showed more adverse events and, hence, can not be preferred to the racemate in postoperative pain therapy.	2.2806426352880274
A 36-year-old man known as chronic alcohol abuser presently suffered from arthralgia and showed bilateral petriefied kidneys by sonography and computed tomography.	1.9452379340389194

Since the man had never shown signs of hyperoxaluria in his life before, a secondary oxalosis was supposed.	1.9312550081713666

At autopsy, progressed chronic renal oxalosis could be confirmed.	2.28328538004951

Insulinomas are rare tumors and account for 90 % of all endocrine pancreatic tumors.	2.3859898338347683
They typically present as a solitary tumor, but may occur in multiple sites (e.g.	2.2899706216122584
multiple endocrine neoplasia type I) or as a malignant disease in 10 % of cases and rarely as nesidioblastosis or islet cell adenomatosis.	2.270581525397262
Neuroglucopenic symptoms lead to the diagnosis; inadequate high insulin and C-peptide secretion with hypoglycemia in the fasting test confirm the diagnosis.	2.1401585763946227
Preoperative localization is not necessary prior to the first operation.	2.9073641978878038
The treatment of multiple tumors and islet cell hyperplasia with a high risk of recurrence is problematic.	2.4041963017341113
Subtotal resection plus enucleation seems to be better than selective tumor resection.	2.567920245772239
In malignant insulinomas, mostly presenting with liver metastases, aggressive surgical therapy with hepatectomy and debulking, chemoembolization and systemic chemotherapy are the modalities of choice.	1.9216093718585938
MR spectroscopy is the only method for non-invasive detection of various aspects of cardiac metabolism in humans.	2.5536604833072363
While the 1H nucleus of water and fat molecules is the signal source for MR imaging, the MR spectroscopic technique allows for the study of a number of other nuclei, such as 13C, 19F, 23Na, 31P, 39K and 87Rb.	1.9691085517157503
Clinical applications presently are confined to the 31P nucleus.	2.2328609254256846
31P-MR spectroscopy allows the non-invasive study of cardiac high-energy phosphate metabolites ATP and phosphocreatine.	2.2830217809904028
The phosphocreatine/ATP ratio is considered an index of the energetic state of the heart.	2.338370750618115
Possible clinical indications include heart failure, valve disease and coronary artery disease.	2.4533700119695694
In heart failure, the phosphocreatine/ATP ratio is reduced and correlates with clinical severity, ejection fraction and prognosis.	2.1459352595593604
In mitral and aortic valve disease, a reduced phosphocreatine/ATP ratio may indicate the optimum timing for valve replacement.	2.0880489394403865
In coronary artery disease, a regional decrease of phosphocreatine during stress ("biochemical ergometry") may indicate local ischemia.	2.136069289963092
Furthermore, absolute quantification of high-energy phosphates may allow diagnosis of myocardial viability.	2.255762757506923
Major technical developments, leading to improved spatial and temporal resolution will be necessary to establish MR spectroscopy as a routine clinical tool.	2.26620380358848

In addition, lateral teleradiographies of 117 patients from this group were cephalometrically analysed.	1.9527752834510257
Moreover, late results of 36 children and  8 adults with midface-advancement with an average follow-up period of 4.5 years were assessed.	2.122657311018289
In contrast to linear craniectomy and so-called lateral canthal advancement, in only 8.2% of cases (24 out of 293 patients) were relapses requiring reoperation found in this study after fronto-orbital advancement.	1.9989788785053373
The evaluations indicate that with simple forms of craniosynostosis such as trigonocephaly and plagiocephaly predominantly very good or good growth can be observed.	1.8885387492065366
Cephalometric evaluation confirmed the limited potential of growth in the area of the anterior skull base and in the midface in the presence of syndrome-related faciocraniosynostoses.	2.64032257418338
In such cases the cephalometrically confirmed maxillary hypoplasia, which increases in severity in the following order of syndromes `Saethre-Chotzen-Crouzon-Apert-Pfeiffer', could be influenced only to a limited degree by fronto-orbital advancement.	1.751905026002118
For this reason midface advancement is of secondary importance in children with very severe anomalies.	2.1902971765558736
In the present evaluation, a high rate of relapse of midfacial hypoplasia was to be found in children and adolescents after this operation in accordance with other references.	2.440848489372308
Therefore, the indication for Le Fort III osteotomy in the growth period should be limited.	2.1074337731745367
The introduction of Perfluorochemicals into medicine and especially into the treatment of severe lung injury is a fascinating scientific task.	2.242755369973854
Many recall the famous experiments from Clark et al.	2.076426245966739
in 1966 when he demonstrated "liquidventilation with perfluorocarbons" in the mammal species for the first time.	1.94739209951094
After this hallmark, perfluorocarbons were subsequently introduced in research of acute lung injury by the techniques of Total- and Partial-Liquid-Ventilation (TLV; PLV).	1.77352066411206
Perfluorocarbons (saturated organofluorids) have unique chemical and physical properties which made them attractive substances for intraalveolar application.	1.8184860801439586
The strong C-F bindings in the perfluorocarbon molecules are responsible for their chemical stability, biochemical inertness, high capacity to dissolve respiratory gases, low surface tension and high vapor pressures.	1.7839865598819353
Furthermore, the high density of the PFC lead to radio-opacity and their distribution to dependent lung areas.	1.9428521459776842
The efficacy of PFC liquid, applied by TLV/PLV has been demonstrated in numerous animal studies using different models of acute lung injury.	1.997298449216704
Currently, several mechanisms of action of perfluorocarbon fluids in acute lung injury are discussed: recruitment of atelectatic alveoli, prevention of endexpiratory collapse of alveoli ("liquid PEEP"), redistribution of perfusion, oxygen transport, surfactant like effects and decrease of inflammation.	1.8205084548841848
Since total liquid ventilation has been used only in experimental models of lung injury, partial liquid ventilation has been introduced successfully into clinical trials (phase I-II).	2.141081050788084
However, the results of the first randomised, controlled study of PLV in 90 adult patients suffering from severe respiratory failure (ALI/ARDS) showed no differences between PLV and conventional treatment.	2.290920021144677
Furthermore, the instillation of relatively large amounts of liquid into the lungs poses several technical challenges and may be associated with complications such as liquithoraces, pneumothoraces and hypoxia.	1.9359655967258502
Since mammal lungs are evolutionary specialised to gas exchange using atmospheric oxygen, the application of liquids, even if they transport respiratory gases very well is not physiologic.	1.9758652000352384
To overcome these unwanted side effects, we developed a technique of perfluorocarbon vaporisation in analogy to the application of inhalation anaesthetic agents.	2.2366895219309693
After resolving some technical issues, this application technique was used successfully in an animal model of acute lung injury.	2.143130888889444
Vaporisation of perfluorohexane in a concentration of 18 Vol.% of inspired gas improved significantly oxygenation and lung compliance.	1.928951063761568
Though these results are promising, mechanisms of action, dose-efficacy relation, surfactant-perfluorocarbon interaction or anti-inflammatory effects of vaporised perfluorohexane are still unclear.	1.949040643883105
These questions need to be clarified before this technique can be applied clinically.	2.5105799835338587
However, the inhalation of vapor, a technique already familiar to anaesthesiologists should avoid risks of large amounts of fluids in the bronchoalveolar space.	1.7678035553064146
Furthermore, this technique can be administered by established anaesthetic equipment with the advantage of exact dosing, continuous monitoring, and demand application in a way near to clinical routine.	2.030789465017243
VDD pacing using a single pass lead for complete heart block is well described in adults but there are few reports of its use in children.	2.10341613165925
We have used 6 different standard adult size single pass leads and 5 different pacemaker generators in 21 children and adolescents aged 3.7-17.2 years (mean 9.9 years) and weighing 13.5 to 76 kg (mean 34.3 kg).	1.7939349136716973
Congenital complete heart block was present in 14 patients (with associated heart disease in 2 of them), surgical complete heart block in 6 patients and 2:1 AV block of uncertain cause in 1 patient.	2.154064766711875
In 10 patients, the VDD system was their first pacing system.	2.3488709326943797
In 11 of the patients, 1-6 previous systems had been used and simultaneous extraction of ventricular leads (10) and/or atrial leads (5) was performed.	2.662176670694843
All leads were introduced via a subclavian vein puncture (using the extraction sheath when present) and the atrial dipole was placed low in the right atrium to provide slack for further growth while maintaining atrial sensing.	1.964983568188884
Ventricular thresholds ranged from 0.2 to 0.8 V. The minimal atrial amplitude was 0.7 to 4 mV and the maximum amplitude was 2.5 to 8 mV.	1.803756687553421
There was one early micro-displacement and the lead was repositioned.	2.0128822993748328
Over a follow-up period of 2-64 months (mean 32 months), all but 1 of the patients have maintained low ventricular pacing thresholds and adequate atrial signals for reliable pacing at rest and with exercise.	2.3399437521671373
During this time some have undergone considerable growth.	2.2592717271109626
In 1 patient, atrial sensing was lost after cardiopulmonary bypass for additional cardiac surgery at 24 months and the pacemaker was programmed into VVIR mode.	1.929981716037244
One patient with coexisting congenital heart disease died suddenly at 3 years but the pacing system had no fault at autopsy.	1.918759417775336
The standard adult size single pass lead provides a simple means to enable reliable atrial synchronous ventricular pacing in growing children with complete heart block.	1.8956705472429443

This review presents data supporting the involvement of the dopaminergic system in depressive illness.	2.2924605645968095
Neuroanatomical research, animal research and clinical studies have shown that a dysfunction of the mesolimbic dopaminergic system could be associated with depressive symptoms.	2.3269763658810683
Furthermore, the chronic administration of antidepressants in animals provokes a sensitisation and enhanced expression of dopaminergic receptors.	1.8800043098497374
Although the dopaminergic system has received little attention in biological research on depression in the last decades, current research on the dopaminergic system is about to change this situation.	2.1085446361024647
Athletes who need high endurance capacity often use training at moderately high altitude (1500-3000 m) to improve oxygen delivery and utilization because of a hypoxia-induced increase of the red blood cell volume and adaptations at the muscular level.	1.9020212962560363
As maximal heart rates decrease at high altitude and plasma lactate levels for a given workload change during prolonged exposure to high altitude, it can be difficult to control and adapt the intensity and duration of the work-outs.	2.1131155842292872
Furthermore, maximal performance capacity decreases and therefore training intensity at high altitude is usually reduced compared to training at sea level.	1.8784311886136753
To avoid these disadvantages at high altitude a concept of living at moderately high altitude and training at lower elevations, termed "live high - train low" evolved, opposing the conventional concept of "live high - train high".	1.772295082730115
A third option using a hypobaric chamber ("live low - train low") is hardly used anymore for training athletes.	1.8705600655185928
Studies on the effects of conventional high-altitude training for the improvement of athletic performance often lack a rigorous controlled design and yield controversial results.	1.9848118937240413
Regarding the new concept of "live high - train low" there is only one controlled study on college athletes and it shows a minor advantage of this new approach compared to conventional high-altitude training.	1.9548009207850747
However, training concepts are especially important for elite competitive athletes, and controlled studies with such individuals are very difficult to perform.	2.0678130637456635
Therefore, it appears that today we cannot answer the question of whether altitude-specific physiologic factors or non-altitude-related benefits of training camps account for the success of individual athletes.	2.1028484634705222

HIV infectivity is easily destroyed by disinfectants.	2.2926300756348486

After inoculation new HIV is produced after 24 hours, and HIV has spread over the whole organism by the end of one or two weeks.	2.316677132044549

Integrated models of inpatient detoxification and motivation therapy focus on improvement of the motivation of patients towards further treatment of their alcoholism and towards abstinence.	2.041882378376411
In our study 529 alcoholics underwent such treatment lasting between 2 to 3 weeks.	1.9849110931872687
