Fifty-four of these patients relapsed before they started further alcoholism treatment, but achieved abstinence afterwards; 60 (25%) of these 242 patients relapsed after the specific alcoholism therapy; 227 alcoholics did not start further treatment after the initial detoxification and motivation therapy.	1.8790937872527311
In this subpopulation, 113 (50%) relapsed during the follow-up period.	2.224136684072416

They occur sporadically or in association with the MEN I syndrome.	2.3562666274675834
We present five patients (four male, one female; age of first manifestation 19-53 years) who were operated on at our hospital between 1984 and 1995 for neuroendocrine thymic tumors.	2.060306502043362
A hormone-producing tumor presented with Cushing's syndrome in two patients.	2.1954435646212263
Two patients had MEN I syndrome.	2.2621642390459797
Only in the female patient the primary tumor was confined to the thymus.	2.463504627165841
We found lymph node metastases in three patients and a distant metastasis in one.	2.42186992237168
The neuroendocrine tumors have a high rate of local recurrences and thus we performed 11 operations using a transthoracic or transsternal approach.	2.0872182148930434
Since there was no operative mortality and adjuvant therapies are of limited value, we recommend surgery even in case of recurrence.	2.442654911569551

The dopamine hypothesis of schizophrenia was based on the neuroleptical blockade of central dopamine D2 receptors.	2.372463034513714
Brain imaging studies, however, generally failed to demonstrate a significant increase in central D2 receptors among schizophrenic patients.	2.5671788278651912
Using a novel approach, the group of Laruelle and Abi-Dargham was now able to demonstrate that schizophrenic patients have increased synaptic dopamine concentrations in the striatum.	2.1120587766542656
Endogenous dopamine competes with a radioligand for binding at dopamine D2 receptors; compared to healthy control subjects, blockade of dopamine production in neuroleptic-naive schizophrenic patients induced a significantly higher increase in D2 binding of the infused radioligand, indicating higher endogenous synaptic dopamine.	1.7286908708519606
A similar increase in D2 binding was also observed in drug-free schizophrenics who had previously been treated with neuroleptics; these patients also showed an increased density of striatal D2 receptors, most likely due to counteradaptive upregulation of D2 receptors during neuroleptic medication.	1.8606297276436286
The Columbia study provides an important indication of hyperdopaminergic function in schizophrenia.	2.1936916229110017
Multiple and bilateral oncocytomas are rare.	2.5108919987834124
There are only ten cases that have been previously described.	2.2952851839043804
Three of these displayed multiple and bilateral oncocytomas and microoncocytomas, a so-called oncocytomatosis.	2.16778378858595
This report describes a case of renal oncocytomatosis found at autopsy.	2.482775571328518

As a net effect of ACE-inhibitors and AT1-receptor antagonists on the renin-angiotensin system (RAS) cardioprotection due to vasodilative (reduction of blood pressure, afterload reduction), antiproliferative (reduced cell growth, reduction of "vascular" andor "ventricular remodeling", reduced formation of extracellular matrix), as well as antiadrenergic actions and due to the stimulating effect on natriuresis, reduction of blood pressure, preload reduction can be expected.	2.0251668469333644

This respective side-effect can be prevented by the use of AT1-receptor antagonists.	2.7135298642527883

Eleven patients with suspected acute cerebral ischemia were investigated.	2.4296901972037195
The EBT was performed with an acquisition time of 50 ms per slice at eight parallel levels.	2.09828762563371
To compare signal/noise and contrast/ noise ratios the data from the EBT investigation were compared to a similar examination on a spiral CT.	2.161533690861748
The signal/noise ratio with EBT was about 30%, the contrast/noise ratio 25% of that with spiral CT.	2.0773599523589574
The absolute values of CBV were 4.9 +/- 1.2 ml/100 g (EBT); CBF was 50.5 +/- 7.0 ml/100 g/min in normal contralateral brain tissue.	1.9341982678030325

Using a bolus injection of contrast material, calculation of absolute CBV and CBF is feasible using EBT.	2.004513829972241
Advantages of EBT are the absolute measurements possible and it's multislice capability.	2.056256652200037
Disadvantages, however, are caused by the high image noise, limiting the demarcation of ischemic tissue.	2.6217650610067196

She was found unconscious, without measurable blood pressure; the electrocardiogram (ECG) showed bradycardia of 30/min and the rectal temperature was 23.7  °C.	1.8956846570171664
The patient received mechanical ventilation, fluid therapy, warmed gastric lavage, and, unfortunately, inotropic medication.	2.009514342944395

Vascular access was achieved by percutaneous femoral vein cannulation with a Shaldon catheter.	2.1912562833362843
The hemofiltration system (Gambro AK-10, Gambro AB, Sweden) was instituted with a blood flow rate of 200 ml/min.	2.0073679482240614
The hemofiltration monitor controls the pumps for filtering and substituting fluid volumes and allows the infusion solutions to be heated up to 40  °C.	1.7864235368918728
Sinus rhythm resumed without antiarrhythmic medications at a temperature of 29.5  °C, and within 8 h the patient was rewarmed to 35.5  °C.	2.0484091981534296

We conclude that hemofiltration may be the method of choice for rewarming deeply hypothermic patients when their circulation is preserved.	2.1440174331626536
Under these circumstances, it is preferable to external rewarming techniques, as it avoids the disadvantages of temperature afterdrop and rewarming shock.	2.299033952556296
Rewarming rates of 1.5  °C/h seem to be adequate.	2.465965747726016

These processes of activation include very reactive intermediates.	2.219711118016297
Therefore, aerobic cells must cope with - and to some extent also adapt to - oxidative stress provoked for example by infection or intoxication, where reactive intermediates of oxygen activation accumulate.	1.7947772384682645
Depending on the strength of these impacts, several symptoms indicate the deviation from normal, steady-state metabolism.	1.8794669606582366
Most of these visible or measurable symptoms are connected with oxygen activation where principally a transition from heterolytic reactions (two-electron transitions) to increased homolytic reactions (one-electron transitions) is observed.	1.6975442148907562
Homolytic reactions produce free radicals, which are generally counteracted by a parallel increase of intrinsic radical scavenging processes or by compounds administered with food, thus warranting metabolic control within certain limits.	1.8567524665064699
At advanced states of stress, control may be gradually lost and chaotic radical processes dominate.	1.9154310328277244
Every episode during this cascade is characterizable by the balance between pro- and antioxidative capacities.	1.970221973406283
Antioxidants, which in many cases are free radical scavengers or quenchers of activated states, comprise a wealth of classes of organic molecules including phenolics, probably as the most prominent ones.	1.9576911269200898
In this article, mechanisms of oxygen activation and protection from oxidative damage are discussed.	2.0075384801052496
Furthermore, examples of antioxidative functions of a few important natural products are reported.	2.0806757792239283
In a monocenter prospective randomized double-blind clinical trial the efficacy of homeopathic treatment was investigated on children with adenoid vegetations justifying an operation.	2.0584771686141097
Patients were treated with either homeopathic remedies such as Nux vomica D200, Okoubaka D3, Tuberculinum D200, Barium jodatum D4 and Barium jodatum D6 or with placebo.	1.7275784951061384
The duration of the study for each patient was 3 months.	3.0845951194864534
Examination of the ears using a microscope, rhinoscopy, stomatoscopy and pharyngoscopy, as well as tympanometry and audiometry were performed after 4, 8 and 12 weeks.	2.130510873346926
Out of a total of 97 children studied between the ages of 4 to 10 years 82 could be analyzed.	2.2225986764846883
At the end of the study no operation was required in 70.7% of the placebo-treated children and in 78.1% of the children treated with homeopathic preparations.	2.1722163771522554
These results show no statistical significance.	2.5103297797271806

The dose-volume histograms for target, bladder, intestine and soft tissue were exported.	2.055272658091988
Normal tissue complication probability and tumor control probability, respectively, were calculated for all techniques.	2.2307761283850853
For fields enclosing the whole target volume the dose maxima in the region of the matching line decreased to 2.0% (caudal) and 1.8% (cranial), respectively.	1.8372529573830247
For the dose profiles calculated with Helax TMS© no overdose was found.	2.0061105443268237

14 human femurs were scanned by CAT and 3D reconstructed.	2.125254709534668

Shock secondary to sepsis is a serious common disease with a substantial mortality.	2.307629549064214
Coagulation abnormalities, ranging from a rapid fulminant state of disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) to a slight elevation in the level of fibrin(ogen) degradation products, are well recognized in patients with bacterial septicemia.	2.06540029197766
Therefore, the inhibition of the activated coagulation is one of the first therapeutic steps.	2.6623023004268083

The diagnosis of tracheal rupture was confirmed by fiberoptic bronchoscopy.	2.3590920420478976

The liver is the major site for biotransformation of most opioids.	2.22829404045392
The major metabolic pathway is oxidation.	2.334080607659569
Exceptions to this are morphine and buprenorphine, which undergo primarily glucuronidation, and remifentanil which is cleared by esther hydrolysis.	1.8630199880088296

Even if Ignaz Philipp Semmelweis has not found the true aetiology of puerperal fever - bacteria were identified as pathogens only after his observations - he was the first to consequently use epidemiological methods in order to elucidate connections and influencing factors in the spread of nosocomial infections, to draw the right conclusions from his observations on the transmission of childbed fever and to draw the right consequences by implementing preventive measures, especially the hand disinfection.	1.902035989092034
He has correctly realized that human beings suffering from purulent or putride lesions or having even died from them can act as infectious sources as can hands of health-care personnel act as vehicles.	1.6946132586123543
As a characteristic feature of nosocomial infection, he noticed that generally only the weakend organism of the patient is involved as an infection target.	2.22360469584691

Molecular methods may support the specific diagnosis of leptomeningeal infiltration of CLL.	2.2379000278501366
We present an 54 old patient who was diagnosed with CLL five years ago.	2.2877088888922965

Using PCR we selectively amplified the highly variable and clone-specific CDR3 region of the locus encoding the immunoglobulin heavy chain (IgH) in DNA obtained from both CSF and peripheral blood cells.	1.7971614100211528
Analysis of PCR products by high resolution gel electrophoresis revealed a single DNA fragment respectively indicating the presence of a  monoclonal cell population in both  compartments.	1.9964723888534772
DNA sequence analysis of the amplified CDR3 segments confirmed the clonal identity of cells and the leptomeningeal dissemination of CLL.	2.1676039648374363

In one third of the little girls coming to the outpatient clinic for pediatric gynecology, a vulvovaginitis can be diagnosed.	2.1146841287602194
Etiologic factors are poor perineal hygiene, foreign bodies in the vagina and respiratory or skin infections.	2.0185940741498984
The microbiologic investigation often reveals staphylococci, streptococci, E. coli, and in case of chronical-recurrent discharge also B. fragilis and peptostreptococci.	2.076100100122437
The symptoms are itching, burning, dysuria, discharge and rubor of the vulva.	1.9296161093057216
A systemic application of antibiotics is not necessary, a local treatment with antibiotic solutions is contraindicated and the usual vaginal suppositories are unsuitable for girls.	2.0447225358645427
A desinfection often irritates the vulvovaginal region of little girls so that for years we use estriol ointment only which is tolerated.	1.810366241648665
Excellently, a single-dose application being sufficient; burning, itching and discharge disappear and the vaginal epithelium gets more resistant because of the estrogen influence, so that the healing process is accelerated.	2.1103454255299874

Results of a longitudinal study about the transition to retirement are presented.	2.1568940193577224

In adults, infectious spondylitis is a rare but severe disease, caused by a bacterial thrombus in tissue of reduced resistance.	2.322310490613264
In conventional radiographs initial findings are a narrowing of the intervertebral space, local osteoporosis and poorly defined erosive borders of the vertebral endplates.	2.1484122528682734
These changings can be found at least three to six weeks after the onset of disease.	2.7884483623738263
However, in Szintigraphy and MRT pathologic alterations are evident after ten to twelve days.	1.8490897189091595
Thus, early diagnosis and treatment becomes possible.	2.8210017070479565
In early stages of the disease a localized lysis surrounded by a reactive sclerosis appears in predisposed areas of the vertebral body (subchondral, anterobasal, ventral, central).	2.005906961594258
Apparently, a soft tissue tumor is associated.	2.6112923124707224
Sclerosis and reduction of the soft tissue tumor are the first signs of repair processes.	2.6430298253011184
After at least 12 weeks, computed tomography can reveal typical sintering of the vertebral body and occasionally the development of a bony sequester.	2.4383585196767563
In addition, MRT as well as CT can be helpful in the detection and localization of complications as abscesses or affection of the vertebral canal.	2.575294368834742
The tuberculous spondylitis can sometimes cause difficulties in differential diagnosis.	2.069624703450099
Clinical findings, affection of several vertebral bodies, large soft tissue tumors with appearance of calcification as well as not typical locations are strongly suggestive of tuberculous spondylitis, but these findings are not specific of the disease.	2.0919016655230935

As the available vocabulary for verbal characterisation is small and the description depends on the subjective opinion of the viewer, it was the purpose of this study to investigate if colorimetric measurements allow objectivation of hair colour.	2.1962036264934404

When the colour measurements were repeated at intervals of several days the results were found to be reproducible.	2.6442145197187172
We measured the ventilatory pattern and additional work of breathing (WOBadd) at three different levels of inspiratory pressure support [IPS 5, 10, 15 mbar above positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)] and in a new ventilatory mode, automatic tube compensation (ATC), in nine operative patients without lung injury nine patients ventilated for several following acute respiratory insufficiency (ARI).	1.8306014348320887
Pressure support in this mode, i. e. airway pressure above PEEP, is equal to the actual flow-dependent pressure drop across the endotracheal tube (ETT).	2.066314706521968
Airway pressure rises at the beginning of inspiration and falls towards the end.	2.359821720187494
As the tube resistance of ETT seriously hinders expiration and can cause desynchronization between ventilator and patient, airway pressure is reduced below PEEP during expiration in the same way as it is increased during inspiration.	1.866528086553354
This mode could be best termed as "electronic extubation".	2.1310304851998483
The most striking difference between the postoperative patients and the ARI patients was their minute ventilation (17.8+/-1.85 l/min in ARI patients vs 7.3+/-3.1 l/min in the postoperative patients).	2.255284558098407
In the postoperative patients augmentation of IPS from 5 to 15 mbar induced a steady increase in tidal volume (VT) and a consecutive decrease in respiratory rate (rr) compared with ATC (VTATC,postop= 463+/-78 ml; rrATC,postop =16+/-4 min-1; VTIPS5,postop = 505+/-79 ml; rrIPS5,postop = 15+/-4 min-1; VTIPS10,postop = 562+/-86 ml; rrIPS15,postop =14+/-4 min-1; VTIPS15,postop=660+/- 151 ml; rrTPS15, postop = 12+/-4 min-1), whereas the augmentation of IPS of 5 and 10 mbar in the ARI patients could not compensate for the increase in rr and the decrease in VT, after switching from ATC to IPS (VTATC,ARI 724+/-308 ml, rrATC,ARI = 24+/-6 min-1; VTIPS5,ARI = 649+/-315 ml; rrIPS 5,ARI = 27+/-8 min-1; VTIPS10,ARI=653+/-353 ml; rrIPS10,ARI = 25+/-8 min-1: Even IPS 15 was not able to reestablish VT at the values observed during ATC (VTIPS15,ARI =680+/-312 ml).	1.783036828010953
During ATC WOBadd was small in both postoperative and ARI patients (WOBadd,ATC,postop = 93+/-36 mJ/l, WOBadd,ATC,ARI =116 +/-72 mJ/l).	1.9246553496057177
In the postoperative patients, an inspiratory pressure support of 5 mbar was not sufficient to compensate WOBadd compared with ATC.	2.125429301304049
However, IPS 10 and 15 mbar were able to compensate for WOBadd (WOBadd.ATC5,postop WOBadd,IPS5,postop =189+/-77 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS10,postop = 55+/-30 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS15,postop = 21+/-11 mJ/l).	1.8605397618848054
In the ARI patients an IPS 5, 10 or 15 mbar was not sufficient to compensate for WOBadd (WOBadd,IPS 5,ARI = 1126+/-262 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS 10,ARI 863+/-253 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS 15,ARI 763+/-298 mJ/l).	1.804452574533263
Under ATC, WOBadd was only 15% of WOBadd under IPS of 15 mbar.	2.0517295888865994
All but two patients were successfully extubated after the investigation.	2.508892439054768
These two patients were not extubated because they were dependent on an FIO2 >0.5.	2.2536573137117686
Our results strongly indicate that ventilatory dependence in ARI patients may be caused by the ETT rather than by mechanical dysfunction of the lung.	2.489125909155318
ATC is a very helpful mode to use in distinguishing between ventilatory failure caused by ETT and real ventilatory dependence.	2.1242432677678895

In 55 consecutive patients with the same dual chamber pacemaker (Relay, Intermedics) and different pacing leads, the influence of different safety margins for pacing on battery current was investigated.	2.1665018661071542
2.8 +/- 0.9 years after implantation, atrial and ventricular pulse-width thresholds (tRS) (ms) were determined at 0.5, 1.0, and 2.0 V, and the charge delivered at threshold was telemetered.	2.0938751259863704
If tRS was <1.50 ms at 0.5 V, an amplitude of 1.0 V was programmed in the atrium and the ventricule; if tRS was <1.50 ms at 1.0 V, then an amplitude of 2.0 V was chosen.	1.7583570081821125
Two times the charge threshold (2x QRS), two times the voltage threshold (2x URS), and three times the pulse-width threshold (3x tRS) were programmed as the safety margins for pacing.	2.0665669410206466
With every safety margin, battery current (IRS) (µA) was averaged from 5 telemetric readings in D00 mode with 70 bpm.	1.8313564295507994
IBat was significantly lower with 2x QRS as compared with 2x URS (13.43 +/- 1.0 vs. 14.20 +/- 1.2 µA, p<0.01) and as compared with 3x tRS (13.99 +/- 1.2 µA, p<0.05).	1.9129408517842053
Pacemaker longevity derived from these current data was significantly longer with 2x QRS (112 +/- 8 months) as compared with 2x URS (106 +/- 9, p<0.01) and as compared with 3x tRS (108 +/- 8, p<0.05).	2.1122024841459255
If current consumption is compared intraindividually in dependance on the programmed amplitude, battery current is significantly lower at 1.0 V as compared with 2.0 V resulting in a mean reduction of 0.63 µA (-4.9%, p<0.05) and an average gain in longevity of 5 months.	1.955606793920337
This applies to every safety margin tested.	2.3751896671898005
Differences in battery current caused by the safety margins will translate into a greater gain in longevity in future pacemaker models with reduced internal current consumption.	1.9854552222956554

This prerequisite is based on the right to self determination.	3.2798841586845677
Otherwise a medical procedure is considered as physical injury.	2.486526434125805

In patients with an abdominal implantation site, lead-related complications occurred in 20%, in contrast to 6% in patients with a pectoral implantation site.	2.863146894686114
Regarding patients with pectoral implantation site, lead-related complications were observed in 12% of patients with a dual-chamber ICD vs 4% with a single-chamber ICD (p = 0.05), due to dislocation of atrial electrodes with dual-chamber ICD.	2.5480444371464617
There were no differences in clinical parameters between patients with pectoral vs abdominal and between single vs dual-chamber ICD.	1.982254965113498
Several new approaches are available for early defibrillation.	2.6594638485926643
One example is semiautomatic defibrillators used by the first arriving emergency staff.	2.1828102561072615
The recommendations for introducing emergency medical technician (EMT) defibrillation in Germany are based either on the results in cities with so called doctor-manned-ambulances or the experiences of the German multi-center-study.	1.9519807001881144
This analysis intends to contribute data to an EMT defibrillation program in cities with a so called rendezvous-system.	1.9781414773378245
Methods: In a prospective study a EMT-defibrillation group (= DG) was compared with a standard group (basic life support by EMTs and defibrillation by emergency physicians) (= SG) and a control group (emergency physicians starting resuscitation alone or together with EMTs) (= CG).	2.058069361246611
In the DG semiautomatic defibrillators from Laerdal (Heartstart 3000) were used.	2.033449523866178
Results: Over 13 months 43 patients were included, primarily presenting with ventricular fibrillation (VF).	2.0922218839642044
Depending on the first arriving emergency staff the patients were allocated to the DG (n = 12), to the SG (n = 18) or to the CG (n = 13).	2.2063121055168846
DG and SG did not differ significantly concerning the primary survival rate or the long-term prognosis (primary successful 8.3% vs. 38.9%, definite successful 0% vs. 27.8%).	2.0294503927980836
The primary survival rate in the DG was significantly lower than in the CG (8.3% vs. 61.5%).	2.396051308154109
In the long term survival rate there were no significant differences.	2.6358731562066953
In the DG significantly less patients received bystander CPR (8.3%) than in the other groups (55.6% and 69.2%).	2.1191535523205176
Neither the variable "witnessed collapes" nor "bystander CPR" had a significant influence for the outcome of the patients in this study.	2.4519300711777396
Conclusions: A comparison of this study with American, European and German recommendations for EMT defibrillation programms revealed some deviations.	2.211438604337864
Bystander CPR seems to be of special importance as well as the time interval between defibrillation and the arrival of the emergency physician.	2.8489579055884096

Since the result is in accordance with the German multi-center-study, a critical consideration of a EMT defibrillation program seems to be necessary in "Rendezvous-systems".	2.259637675068266

They inhibit the image of the deviated eye by binocular rilvary and particularly by the physiological ability to disregard visually disturbing stimuli.	1.9331052720414983
Red cells, platelet concentrates and fresh frozen plasma of a single donation contain leucocytes, causing a lot of side effects.	2.0510258895598694
Modern filtration- and apheresis-techniques lead to a reduction of residual leucocyte counts of <1x106 per unit.	2.285959178694165
The best method to achieve controlled and validated conditions is the blood bank performed standardised prestorage-filtration.	1.9336456706800054
This is an effective method, to prevent cytokine-mediated and leucocyte-mediated febrile nonhaemolytic transfusion reactions (FNHTR), to prevent a primary immunisation to leucocyte- and histocompatibility-antigens, to avoid transmission of viral infections by blood transfusion, e.g.	1.894629281998003

The authors recommend the general leucocyte-depletion of blood components considering the German medical law (AMG) and cost/benefit ratio.	1.8594146063575205
This study demonstrates on 309 psychotherapy patients treated with inpatient client-centered therapy and followed-up 1 year after treatment that defensiveness, measured with validity scales of personality inventories MMPI-K, FPI-R and Gießen-Test, influences ratings (scales CGI, HAMA, HAMD, BRMES) before and after therapy.	1.714460668295523
Patients who deny psychopathology on admission do so at discharge and to some extent at follow-up.	1.9009852631153363

This paper concerns advances in the integration of psychotherapy in psychiatric education and clinical practice and whether they go along with increasing research activities.	2.090893370407108
To find answers, a survey on psychotherapy research was carried out in all German psychiatric hospitals and departments by means of a questionnaire.	2.2477986186337224
The results indicate that psychotherapy research is done nearly exclusively in university hospitals.	2.1401714434855914
About half of them had already published psychotherapy studies and two thirds of them are presently carrying out studies, mostly including prospective, randomized clinical trials.	2.1216561571535406
These studies cover the whole spectrum of psychiatric disorders: substance abuse, schizophrenic and affective disorders, anxiety, and obsessive compulsive and personality disorders.	1.9553922401078567
To improve psychotherapy research conditions further, efforts are necessary to increase scientific exchange, financial support, and the integration of institutions outside the universities.	2.2438522589418386
There is little to suggest that the course of preeclamsia can be substantially affected by drug treatment.	2.4326493636747624
The vast majority of randomized studies do not indicate beneficial effects of antihypertensive treatment on proteinuria, fetal heart rate abnormalities, abruptio placentae and the incidence of preterm birth.	2.0828476135433065
There is also no definite effect on the development of superimposed preeclampsia, HELLP syndrome, renal failure or eclampsia.	2.3755386163601235
Moreover, blood pressure lowering agents fail to improve uteroplacental perfusion but may have adverse effects on fetal growth.	2.0962111887984087
Antihypertensive treatment is only indicated in severe hypertension ( > 170/110 mm Hg) to reduce the risk of cerebral hemorrhage.	2.3527438173275868
Dihydralazine injections may result in reduced placental blood flow and fetal distress.	2.436957362566456
Oral nifedipine offers some advantages in view of more potent vasodilator actions on uterine and fetoplacental vessels and a lower incidence of fetal distress.	2.030776205460329
Increasing evidence suggests that the mechanism of eclamptic seizure is cerebral vasoconstriction with resultant ischemia.	2.1738769149073143
Cerebral vessels are particularly sensitive to magnesium, which works by reversing cerebral vasoconstriction with resultant improvement in blood flow.	1.9410456768070765
Controlled trials have shown magnesium to be superior to both placebo and phenytoin for the prevention of eclampsia.	2.2520097012834395
Furthermore, magnesium has been found to be more effective than diazepam and phenytoin in preventing recurrence of seizures in women with eclampsia.	2.1406594273076127
Also the neonatal outcome favors magnesium, which is now generally accepted as the drug of choice for the prevention and treatment of eclampsia.	2.585105435204974
Baker's cysts were treated operatively in 19 patients in the Department of Traumatology of the University of Cologne from 1988 to 1997.	2.6118876516768714
The subjective and objective results were evaluated with a questionnaire and a clinical examination and sonography (follow-up: 95 %).	2.648093518622887
All patients were examinated before surgery, sonography and X-ray of the knee were performed.	2.517978096498061

Arthroscopy was performed in all secondary forms of Baker's cyst.	2.673850684187153
Postoperative complications were two reinterventions due to one hematoma and one effusion.	2.096943586282927
Patient's evaluation of operation result was "excellent" in 61 % and "good" in 39 % of cases.	2.1485305741107967
All knee joints had a full range of motion.	2.6211483327478686
There was only one case of a recurrent cyst.	3.046743654326841
The primary form of Baker's cyst has always to be extirpated, according to our clinical experience.	2.1973813548424705

Classic and HIV-associated Kaposi's sarcoma (KS) are predominantly found in male Caucasians.	2.115854503670012
It is unclear why KS is so rare in women.	2.1687059272044755
At the Department of Dermatology, University of Frankfurt, epidemic KS was diagnosed in 299/751 (40%) male and 5/72 (18%) female HIV-infected patients.	2.047945700392659
To detect common parameters regarding immunodeficiency, hormonal disturbances, abnormalities in clinical course, or sexual practices, data of eight women with KS (five HIV+, three HIV-) were compared.	1.954794580951703
In HIV+ women KS is more aggressive than in HIV- women and more aggressive than in HIV+ men.	2.0981224887242695
Early and frequent visceral involvement and no preference for the lower extremities are found.	2.2852448041799054
Compared to HIV- women with KS, HIV+ women are generally younger (mean age 38 vs 71 years) and significantly immunodeficient (reduced absolute CD4 cell count and CD4/CD8 ratio).	1.9135685829734854
All women with KS investigated for sexual hormones (7/8) showed abnormalities: 7/7 had low oestrogens, 4/6 low LH and 3/5 low progesterone.	1.8550844340615797
Controls (n=11, HIV+ without KS) showed a clear trend for higher serum levels of sexual hormones, but the difference was not significant.	2.156511422266119

The aim of the study was the assessment of left ventricular (LV) systolic function and left ventricular mass following aortic valve replacement (AVR) due to aortic valve stenosis as well as the influence of regression of LV hypertrophy in patients with normal and impaired LV systolic function prior to surgery.	2.3566918749161654
74 patients with severe aortic valve stenosis (29 female, 45 male, mean age 66  +/-  18 years) were divided into 2 groups according to LV ejection fraction (EF): Group 1 with EF > 50% (n = 40); Group 2 with EF <= 50% (n = 34).	2.0838722460028594
Furthermore, patients were differentiated into a group A without (n = 53) and a group B with aortic regurgitation (<= II °, n = 21).	2.233830357196092
All patients were examined by transthoracic echocardiography before and 1 month after surgery.	2.4600200218249837
There was a significant decrease of LV enddiastolic and endsystolic valume indices following AVR in group 2 and group B.	2.0018656361971496
Patients with preoperatively lower EF (group 2) showed an increase in LV ejection fraction from 39  +/-  10% before AVR to 47  +/-  11% after AVR (p < 0.001), whereas patients with preoperative normal EF (group 1) showed a significant decrease in EF (from 62  +/-  8% to 57  +/-  10%, p < 0.05).	2.296821501880729
Also patients with combined aortic valve disease before AVR had an increase of EF after surgery (from 45 %plusmn; 14% to 56  +/-  14%, p < 0.03).	2.066844935779416
There were significant decreases of interventricular septum thickness and LV posterior wall thickness in group 1 and group A, whereas a significant decrease of LV anddiastolic diameter index was noted only in group B.	1.9601466513812502
In conclusion, patients with impaired LV function or combined aortic valve disease showed a significant improvement of left ventricular systolic function after AVR, while patients with normal LV function presented a slight decrease of EF.	2.1683834718478048
There was a significant regression of left ventricular muscle mass in all groups independent of the left ventricular functional status.	2.427225746180634
Cardiomyocytes lose the ability to proliferate after birth.	2.5809403377673656
Subsequently, irreversible cellular damage, e.g., during myocardial infarction, causes loss of functional properties and cell replacement by fibrotic tissue.	2.137050450751834
It is, therefore, not surprising that cell replacement strategies such as cardiomyocyte transplantation in damaged myocardium or scar tissue has gained widespread interest.	1.943573174173059
In other species such as mice, rats, and dogs, the technical feasibility of skeletal myoblast-, satellite cell-, and fetal cardiomyocyte engraftment into normal and diseased myocardium has been demonstrated by simple injection methods.	1.852060062650982
Repeatedly, it has been shown that transplanted cells may survive for weeks within host myocardium and build intercellular connections such as grap junctions and desmosomes.	2.050316272453853
In contrast, grafthost connections have not, as yet, been convincingly demonstrated.	2.0115839369364554
Hypothetically, cell transplants might exhibit the following functional properties: stabilization of diseased tissue to prevent structural remodeling; carrier for recombinant proteins, growth factors or drugs to induce molecular alterations of host myocardium; and improvement of regional and global myocardial function due to active contractility.	1.7335034941557121
However, clear evidence of coordinated contractility of transplanted cells, and, thus, of a clinically relevant therapeutical use of cardiomyocyte transplantation as a replacement strategy for damaged host cardiac cells, remains to be demonstrated.	1.9827396003289073

Dopaminergic reinnervation and increased dopaminergic output of the striatum has only been seen after transplantation of fetal cells; this method however carries immunological and ethical problems.	1.9223364516054398
The continuous high frequency stimulation of basal ganglia is the newest technic; it is highly adaptable to the patient's need and carries a low morbidity profile.	1.9169443067862806

The Medtronic Thera/Thera-i (and Kappa 400) pacemakers utilize a mode switching algorithm that switches from the DDD/R mode to the DDIR mode in the presence on an atrial tachyarrhythmia.	1.7806322932532876
To accomplish this, the pacemaker keeps track of a mean atrial rate (MAR) which is a weighted index of the atrial rate.	2.1924938126443947
Once the MAR is greater than the programmed mode switch rate the pacemaker mode switches to the nontracking mode.	1.9251487776875458
Additionally, the algorithm provides a long PVARP and a rate adaptive (RA) AV interval.	1.9972919968556064
These not only help ensure that a wide range of atrial rates will be detected, but may also limit the time the patient tracks at the upper rate before mode switching.	2.0491139152976534
In order to assess the effectiveness of the algorithm, the Thera-i provides detailed diagnostics which provide information on the date, time, duration, and rate of the mode switch episodes.	2.2790459823155023
Additionally, more detailed beat-to-beat information is provided for each episode which can help determine its appropriateness and can assist in making programming changes.	1.9757980097346821

Large B-cell neoplasms represent one of the most frequent groups of non-Hodgkin-lymphomas (30-40%).	2.60947043300378
They are characterised by an aggressive clinical course.	2.427388823941874
These lymphomas may evolve either de novo or secondary during the course of a less aggressive lymphoma.	2.23110141819841
In addition to primary nodal, a primary extranodal manifestation is rather common.	2.0953253911043572
The neoplastic cells, even within one given case, show a broad morphological spectrum.	2.117439027785759
Several findings of the last two decades have revealed that the large B-cell lymphomas represent an inhomogeneous group.	2.382982008207527
This fact has been taken into account by the new WHO classification of malignant lymphomas.	2.3786576448721624
There are two groups identified, that of the variants and that of the subtypes.	2.509036241416873
The various variants (centroblastic, immunoblastic, anaplastic, T-cell/histiocyte-rich) correspond to lymphomas without reproducible discriminating criteria lacking characteristic clinical, immunophenotypical and genetic findings.	1.73835102116393
In contrast, the primary mediastinal, the intravascular, the primary effusion and primary central nervous system lymphomas represent distinct disease entities.	2.014425129709705
A number of recently described large cell lymphoma types, i. e. plasmablastic, ALK-positive and primary gastric, are included in the classification, their designation as distinct entities is still under discussion.	2.0080176493063218

We tested the proprioceptive capability of the subjects with a passive angle reproduction test.	2.073938195510494
Additionally, all knee joints were measured with and without an elastic knee bandage.	2.379229274407651

Atrial fibrillation is the most commonly encountered sustained arrhythmia in men.	2.7064324121034553
It is associated with a two-fold mortality risk and an increased cost for health care providers.	2.557191293418156
The relative inefficacy and the risks of pharmacologic approaches to atrial fibrillation therapy have contributed to increasing efforts to address atrial fibrillation with curative ablative strategies.	1.8694628244036455
Ablation approaches for atrial fibrillation focus on two alternate strategies: ablation of the substrate for initiation and ablation of the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation.	1.9706202827583261
It has been demonstrated that atrial fibrillation may be initiated by repetitive atrial premature beats originating from a single focus.	2.156548212006985
These ectopic foci can be mapped and ablated, thereby removing the substrate for initiation of atrial fibrillation.	1.964153637781768
Most often, these atrial premature beats arise from the pulmonary veins.	2.44031409910857
A challenge in trying to ablate the trigger is actually having enough spontaneous activity from the said focus throughout the electrophysiologic study.	1.8295518049421646
To sidestep the need of mapping, pure anatomic approaches are currently under investigation to electrically isolate the pulmonary veins from the atrial myocardium by circumferential lesions.	2.0036772238104663
In patients without a defined trigger for atrial fibrillation, efforts were made to ablate the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation.	2.025952383637222
Strong evidence exists that atrial fibrillation is the result of multiple coexisting reentrant wavelets requiring a critical myocardial mass to perpetuate.	2.1446284500075365
Several working groups demonstrated that intraoperative compartmentalization of the myocardial tissue by surgical incisions or radiofrequency pulses is highly effective in preventing atrial fibrillation.	1.8460483336131503
Currently, attempts were made to reproduce the surgical technique using transveneous, catheter-based approaches.	2.096464075544335
Though our knowledge of ablation techniques and technical prerequisites is continuously increasing, the difficulty to produce complete linear lesions in the left atrium and local thrombus formation at the ablation line are problems that are still not solved.	2.0051031502201706
Using a time-budget method in a 3 year longitudinal study with a control group design, substantial reductions in the engagement of non-obligatory instrumental, social, and leisure activities could be found in a group of mildly to moderately demented patients.	2.061956503408698
Controlling these changes for differences in baseline paramters, the dementia-specific reduction was about 1,5 hours compared to a non-psychiatric control group.	2.24071964962788
These clinically relevant changes in activity levels underscore the importance of these activity domains with regard to the development of diagnostically useful indicators at the early stages of dementia.	2.478425244742939
Time-budget methods seem to be particularly useful to close the diagnostic gap with regard to the assessment of everyday competence indicators especially at early stages of the dementia illness.	2.348250774412687
Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is a disease with different etiological, morphological, functional, clinical and therapeutic aspects.	2.377210371010091
Recent investigations indicate that HCM is considerably widespread in the population (1:500).	2.016696700785322
The causes seem to generate from familial or sporadic abnormalities (mutations).	1.9526576743085322
Depending on the clinical aspect, the complaints, and on the basis of morphologic and hemodynamic investigational results, we mainly have to consider two types of medical and surgical management.	2.3851644924586215
Atrial fibrillation is in 20-50% the most frequent dysrhythmia after coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) and a possible cause for hemodynamical complications and prolongation off the medical treatment in patients.	2.3719155404734953
Therefore, the effect of -blocking with metoprolol for prevention of supraventricular arrhythmias (SVA) was investigated in a prospective and randomized trial.	2.350588517741648
200 patients after CABG were randomized in a drug and control group (average age 63.2 years, 154 male, 46 female).	2.1053259517801464
Patients of the drug group (n=100) were treated with metoprolol (1mg/kg/BW) beginning on day one after operation, whereas patients of the control group (n=100) received therapy only in case of occurrence of atrial fibrillaton.	2.4419421801529193
ECG, blood pressure, and electrolyte concentrations were measured regulary until the tenth day after surgery.	2.3198918289230908
Reasons for exclusion were an ejection fraction (< 30%, SA- and AV-block or simultaneous application of epinephrine and metoprolol.	1.9743762518980699
There were no significant differences between the patients of drug and control group with respect to age, sex ejection fraction, previous medication, number and type of bypass grafts, cardiopulmonary bypass time, and perioperative ischemic events.	2.1986236581150047
However, a statistically significant difference was seen in the occurrence of supraventricular arrhythmias in both groups, 4 patients of the therapy group (4%) in contrast to 37 patients of the control (37%) developed supraventricular arrhythmias during the postoperative observation period (p<0.0001).	2.600133830650473
Both groups differed in total time of hospital stay by 1.5 days (control group: 9.83 +/- 2.88 days; drug group: 8.42 +/- 2.81 days), which was statistically significant (p<0.05).	2.0769732770944676
All patients of the drug group could be discharged with a stable sinusrhythm, whereas 7 patients of the control group were discharged with persistent atrial fibrillation.	2.348253657169468
The difference was statistically significant as well (p<0.01).	2.199154788570346
Neither typical side effects of metoprolol, nor AV-blocks, bradycardia (f<60/min) or symptoms of low blood pressure could be observed.	2.067784991546363
The conclusion of this trial is a recommendation for a preventive application of 50mg metoprolol/day after coronary artery bypass surgery, which can reduce the incidence of SVA as well as the hospital stay statistically significant.	2.425240155271183
Especially by using the "Functional Muscular Diagnostics" described by Janda specific muscular imbalances can be found.	2.1008366840907944
The method is easy to apply and should be used during and before the championship season.	2.520482310369996
Background: Angiotensin converting  enzyme-inhibitors (ACE-inhibitors) alter the function of the renin-angiotensin-aldesterone-system, which regulates the angiotensin II synthesis.	2.065327059428685
Angiotensine II is known to be a potent vasoconstrictor.	3.1633957974280706

Paclitaxel, a potent anti-tumor agent, shifts the cytoskeleton equilibrium towards assembly of altered and extraordinarily stable microtubules.	1.8335734373676522
These cellular modifications lead to reduced proliferation, migration, and signal transduction.	2.2026311134050043
It is highly lipophilic, which promotes a rapid cellular uptake, and has a long-lasting effect in the cell due to the structural alteration of the cytoskeleton.	2.476535636503779
This makes paclitaxel a promising candidate for local drug delivery intended to address the proliferative and migratory processes involved in restenosis.	1.8581741152048736
In this article, results of our in vitro and in vivo studies with paclitaxel are presented.	2.2024992488946284
Cell culture experiments with monocultures of human arterial smooth muscle cells as well as cocultures with human endothelial cells showed that paclitaxel leads to an almost complete growth inhibition within a dose range of 1.0-10.0µmol/l, even after a short (20 min) single dose application.	2.056259164592673
Tubulin staining and electron microscopy enabled visualization of paclitaxel-induced vessel wall alterations.	2.104758134529619
In the rabbit model, locally delivered paclitaxel resulted in reduced neointima formation and enlargement in vessel size; in the pig model, however, after stenting, this inhibition was not significant.	1.9312502447204396
Both reduced proliferation and enlargement in vessel size contribute to a preservation of vessel shape and are likely to be caused by a structural alteration of the cytoskeleton, which is also supported by vascular contraction force experiments.	2.2042068049475843
Atopic eczema is one of the most frequent dermatological diseases, with a still increasing incidence.	2.6820566418795755
Although its etiopathogenesis is still not completely understood, a variety of triggering factors are known.	2.4559605686344486

This demonstrates how important both dermatological therapy and close cooperation with the field of psychosomatic medicine can be.	2.2725363451923926

The "imaginary self" stabilizes irritating self deficiencies, thus leading to a vulnerability for depersonalisation and identity diffusion during actual turmoils of adaptation.	1.8536455964664815
Biomaterials are defined as non-living materials which are used in interaction with biological systems.	2.279570415534578
Especially in the field of urology, biomaterials are applied in urinary diversion, urinary incontinence, erectile dysfunction, and as cosmetic prostheses.	2.08951326302771
Biomaterial-tissue interaction is caused by the physical and chemical characteristics of the biomaterial, its degradation, and the resulting protein denaturation.	2.7044907978695747
General requirements include biocompatibility and functionality and the avoidance of carcinogenic, mutagenic, toxic, and allergic reactions.	1.9492453268095395
This ist most important when there is permanent contact between urine and epithelial tissue, which may lead to biofilminfection and incrustation.	2.3014733860529977
Continuous modification of known materials, inauguration of new materials, as well as the possibilities of tissue engineering will determine their development in the years to come.	2.300082908972616
Hitherto the question of an indication for psychoanalytic group psychotherapy has not been clarified sufficiently.	2.7647037898773035
In this paper, under the premise, that psychoanalytic group psychotherapy is a treatment mode in its own right, the issue is investigated which patients might best profit from the group treatment method.	1.8343398262641837
It is pointed out that the group process itself contains a variety of therapeutic treatment factors which cannot be facilitated through psychoanalytic treatment of just one patient.	1.9766867068658913
First, a series of diagnostic, structural, motivational and cognitive indication criteria are discussed.	2.116078246711975
Second, the moments of a capacity for cohesion and aspects of social relatedness are considered as helpful tools for a formulation of an indication.	1.9221275836038882
As cohesion - according to group treatment outcome research results - has to be viewed as correspondent to the helpful therapeutic alliance, in the context of group psychotherapy, the quest for indication is inextricably linked to patient selection and setting conditions.	2.135058203124317
The conclusion is that psychoanalytic group psychotherapy, would preferably be indicated for those patients who suffer from constraints of emotional competence as stemming from developmental deficits.	1.9464508442468318

The diagnosis of urinary tract infection in renal transplant patients is important because unrecognized bacterial infection may lead - in the worst case - to graft loss.	1.99936571667479
Between January 1995 and January 1997, we therefore obtained bladder catheter urine samples in 31 female allograft recipients when voided urine samples repeatedly showed pyuria (>=10 WC per microscope field (x40)) and significant bacteriuria (>=;105/ml) combined with vaginal contamination (plenty of squamous epithelial cells, mixed bacterial growth).	1.6699232668889372
Results: In 55 % (17/31), diagnosis of urinary tract infection was confirmed by single bladder catheterization; in 26 % (8/31), urinary tract infection could be excluded, and in 19 % (6/31), bladder colonization without pyuria was found.	2.1716560444105686
Thus, 45 % of the patients with abnormal voided urine samples did not need antimicrobials.	2.6333168571129324
After single dose antibiotic therapy with 500 mg Ciprofloxacin, given immediately after catheterization, no infectious complications occurred.	1.9709819628021366
Diagnostic single bladder catheterization is a simple, safe and - compared to suprapubic aspiration - barely invasive method for the diagnosis or exclusion of urinary tract infection in female renal transplant patients with higher risk for complications due to an acute bladder infection and non-conclusive voided urine samples.	2.1718195095210118
Most people with the Metabolic Syndrome die from thrombotic complications superimposed to degenerative arterial vascular lesions, mostly myocardial infarction.	1.933078572097175
Type-2-Diabetes is a risk factor per se for such complications, but often clusters with dyslipoproteinemia, hypertension and obesity.	2.1364580317563733
This is referred to as "Metabolic Syndrome" and often operates on a genetically programmed susceptibility which accelerates the pathogenesis of coronary artery disease in front of a much wider diabetes specific cardiopathy.	2.0772404918352656
From a pathophysiological point of view none of these associated risk factors explains the pathogenetic series of events leading to the precipitation of an occlusive thrombus at sites of complicated coronary plaques.	1.9359547453209505
In patients with the Metabolic Syndrome the coagulation system is switched towards a prethrombotic state, involving increased plasmatic coagulation, diminished fibrinolysis, decreased endothelial thromboresistance and predominantly platelet hyperreactivity ("diabetic thrombocytopathy").	1.7093659371035705
Some of these factors are associated with an increased coronary risk (e.g.	2.3023303487874025
fibrinogen, PAI-1, platelets), but are also directly linked to the pathogenesis of "atherothrombosis".	2.866274679169368
Altered cardiac remodelling together with adhesion and coagulation mechanisms appears suitable to explain decreased functional performance of infarcted organs, decreased success of acute (reduced fibrinolytic response, no reflow phenomenon) and longterm intervention strategies for vessel patency (PTCA, CABG) in Diabetes.	1.6892995912917963
Glucose adjustment alone will not adequately neutralize these complex mechanisms, but in the situation of myocardial infarction eumetabolization with parenteral glucose-insulin-potassium infusion appears mandatory similar to non-diabetics.	2.0040661409320464
On the longterm a multidimensional interventional repertoire is required particularly in patients with the Metabolic Syndrome including antihypertensive, antidyslipoproteinemic and antithrombotic drugs, customized according to the individual patients needs as assessed by early diagnostic measures ("early secondary prevention").	2.034546982493963
The indication for operative treatment in spondylolisthesis results from pain, progressive sliding and, in up to 60 % of the patients with progressive dislocation, from radicular malfunction.	2.371056167879267
The posterolateral fusion in situ is a safe procedure, but the deformation remains and in spondyloptosis plastic deformation of the fusion mass can lead to further dislocation.	2.281756544125127
With the external fixator as an instrument for reduction and the internal fixator for stabilization the reduction of even serious spondyloptosis and the recovery of a normal spine alignement and posture is possible, with an acceptable neurological risk.	2.129083134230554
Therefore a concept of treatment is suggested, which as a rule is aiming at the anatomical reduction of the dislocated vertrebra beside stabilization and nerveroot decompression.	2.070798031064824
Depending on the extent of the slip, reduction and stabilization is to be performed in one, two or three stages.	2.6585211061262557
An anterior or posterior fusion is sufficient in grade I dislocation.	2.3041793725451094
In grade II-V a combined posterior and anterior surgical proceedure is recommended.	2.101099073268661
Objectives: This study was conducted to evaluate a modified technique of interskalene brachial plexus anaesthesia (ISB) and postoperative catheter analgesia for shoulder surgery.	1.9774735830595278
The original method described by Winnie bears some rare but life-threatening complications (inadvertent subarachnoid or intra-arterial injection, pneumothorax).	1.9217657659331897
Objectives: Due to its low solubility and negligible metabolism, desflurane is assumed to be especially suitable for application by low-flow anaesthetic techniques.	2.1672897056112688
The aim of this clinical investigation was the development of a standardised dosing scheme for low-flow and minimal-flow desflurane anaesthesia.	2.4323093268225104
Methods: One hundred six ASA status I-II patients were assigned to six groups according to the duration of the initial high-flow phase, fresh gas flow, and fresh-gas desflurane concentration.	2.266188609133382
The median age, height, body weight, and constitution of the groups was comparable.	2.2263465745472844
After an initial high-flow phase using 4.4 l/min, the fresh gas flow was reduced to 0.5 l/min (minimal-flow anaesthesia) or 1.0 l/min (low-flow anaesthesia).	2.29064343260463
Inspired nitrous oxide concentrations were maintained at 60% to 70%.	2.1937349767350947
Using different standardised schemes of vaporizer settings, inspired desflurane concentrations were applied in the range from 3.4% to 8.7%, i.e., between 1 and 1.5 MAC.	2.0850761498372017
Inspired and expired desflurane concentrations were measured continuously by the side-stream technique and recorded on-line.	2.1370355697530474
Venous blood samples were taken immediately prior to induction and 45 min after flow reduction for measurement of carboxyhaemoglobin (COHb) concentration).	1.9272707060238055
Results: In the 10- to 15-min initial phase during which a high fresh gas flow of 4.4 l/min was used, the inspired desflurane concentration reached values in the range of 90%-95% of the fresh gas concentration.	2.160695941829749
In low-flow anaesthesia this concentration could be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting, whereas in minimal-flow anaesthesia with flow reduction the fresh gas concentration had to be increased by 1% to 2%: The quotient calculated by division of the inspired desflurane concentration by its fresh gas concentration (Q=CI/CF) ranges between 0.65 and 0.75 in minimal-flow and between 0.80 and 0.85 in low-flow anaesthesia.	2.0122764339453423
If use was made of the wide output range of the desflurane vaporizer, the inspired concentration could be increased rapidly by about 5% in 8 min, although the flow was kept constant at 0.5 l/min.	1.9685197285664657
Compared with its value prior to induction (2.13 +/- 1.05%), the COHb concentration decreased statistically significantly by about 0.7% during the 1st hour of minimal-flow anaesthesia (1.42 +/- 1.01%).	1.9010720400468013
In no case was a COHb concentration observed that exceeded threatening or even toxic values, although the soda lime was changed routinely only once a week.	1.9576424439573925
Conclusions: The pharmacokinetic properties of desflurane, resulting in especially low individual uptake, and the wide output range of the vaporizer facilitate the use of low-flow anaesthetic techniques in routine clinical practice.	2.4455900332864946
Even in minimal-flow anaesthesia, the duration of the initial high-flow phase can be shortened to min.	2.227748579507488
If the flow is reduced to 1 l/min, the inspired desflurane concentration achieved in the initial high-flow phase can be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting.	2.119176087101842
In minimal-flow anaesthesia, however, with flow reduction to 0.5 l/min, the fresh gas concentration has to be increased to a value 1%-2% higher than the inspired nominal value.	2.552521621529817
Due to the wide dialling range of the desflurane vaporizer, the amount of vapour delivered into the breathing system can be increased to about 110 ml/min even at a flow of 0.5 l/min.	2.1071847149810936
The large amount of agent that can be delivered into the system even under low-flow conditions, together with the very low individual uptake, results in a time-constant that is sufficiently short for the clinically required rapid increase in inspired desflurane concentrations.	2.126373303306525
The short time-constant of low-flow desflurane anaesthesia improves the control of the anaesthetic concentration.	2.618390620607468
If all measures are taken to safely avoid inadvertent drying out of the soda lime, there is no evidence that low-flow anaesthesia with desflurane is liable to increase the risk of accidental ca	2.4812055168080662

This review focusses on viral hepatitis-related surgical problems, including liver transplantation.	2.0078939266786393
Hypertensive diseases in pregnancy (HDP) are one of the most frequent causes of maternal death and perinatal mortality.	2.221236792621358
However, chronic hypertension without complications has a more favorable prognosis than preeclampsia.	2.1314132978357145
Apart from a familial predisposition, mutations of various genes may also be responsible; among these, APC resistance is of particular clinical significance.	2.126892558145045

The results of studies on the relevance of NO synthase are controversial.	2.3136423655265475
Currently, neither reliable methods for the early detection nor certain preventative measures to avoid the disease are available.	2.2523930488106125

When the pregnancy is continued defined guidelines for its termination for maternal or fetal indications must be taken into consideration.	1.8435534755056588

Acanthosis nigricans is a hyperkeratotic mucocutaneous eruption of heterogenous etiology which is characterized by hyperpigmentation, velvety cutaneous thickening, intensified skin markings and development of verrucous excrescences typically involving the intertriginous areas.	1.8409960474901974
Malignant acanthosis nigricans is most often associated with an abdominal adenocarcinoma frequently unresectable at the time of diagnosis.	2.493605536449608
We report on the rare association of acanthosis nigricans with a transitional cell carcinoma of the urinary bladder.	2.033440822013586

The goal of this evaluation study is to analyze the effects of a new gerontopsychiatric institution, the gerontopsychiatric center (GC: a combination of a home-based outpatient service, a day-hospital and a consulting office for elderly with mental disorders) on the reorganization process of the treatment system from intramural toward extramural structures, as experts of the government of the FRG have been demanding for a long time.	2.0513379114697283
Based on data of cross-sectional and longitudinal studies two regional catchment areas - the city of Bielefeld (without GC, control region) and the district of Gütersloh (with GC) - are compared and analyzed, whether changes within the gerontopsychiatric system (subsystem A), the system of general medical treatment (subsystem B), or within the elderly care system (subsystem C) occurred.	1.9949463967291623
Concerning subsystem A the results are that the GC has a strong impact on the intended shift from intra- to extramural structures, without selecting patients by diagnosis nor by severity degrees of their mental disorders in extramural treatment facilities.	1.847585003557246
The home-based outpatient treatment is especially successful for elderly with a functional psychic disorder.	2.2010376810653853
These patients had the highest scores in improvement of psychiatric symptoms as well as in reduction of their self-care deficits within one year Effects of the GC on subsystem B were evident soon after its establishment, for example, by the increasing cooperation between the gerontopsychiatric health services and general hospitals in the region with GC, in which (hospitals) two fifths of all clinical gerontopsychiatric patients with a mental disorder as the main diagnosis (ICD-9) are treated.	2.136873505365601

One approach to verify these interactions can be seen in stress research.	2.360073424508335
While the phenomenon of stress-induced changes in immunological processes is widely accepted, more recent studies focus on possible moderators and mechanisms of these responses.	2.0283605006294563
Within this research strategy it became evident that catecholamine increases upon stress are of a major importance for the frequently observed mild leukocytosis.	1.9927461912336222
The present study was conducted to investigate whether the often observed stress-induced increases in the number of peripheral lymphocyte subsets depends on the amount of epinephrine or norepinephrine release.	2.4698543678843783
Moreover, the question was addressed whether high or low catecholamine release is related to subjective ratings on discomfort.	1.9900417059181394
Using a "public speaking paradigm" we were able to replicate previous findings of high increases in the absolute number of CD8+ and CD56+ cells in peripheral blood.	1.9772106483886358
Moreover, when dividing subjects into high and low catecholamine responders, the amount of change was significantly larger in catecholamine responders irrespective of whether norepinephrine or epinephrine was used for grouping the subjects.	1.8805552881618395
However, high and low catecholamine responders did not differ with respect to subjective ratings on discomfort.	2.3915314117760698
The data are discussed with respect to underlying mechanisms in catecholamine-induced lymphocyte migration and possible reasons for the mismatch between objective and subjective indicators of stressor efficacy.	2.0395865583750723

A 34-year-old male (190 cm/100 kg) was scheduled for surgery of the nasal septum.	2.3284012711665794
He had had uneventful anaesthesia for appendicectomy 14 years earlier: following 600 mg thiopentone, 180 mg suxamethonium and up to 2 vol.% halothane for 20 min had been used and no symptoms of malignant hyperthermia (MH) were recorded.	1.8106750092775066
Following oral premedication with 2 mg flunitrazepam at 7.00 a.m. anaesthesia was induced with a priming dose of atracurium at 8.45 a.m. followed by 0.2 mg fentanyl, 500 mg thiopentone, and 100 mg suxamethonium.	1.884148517228765
Endotracheal intubation was accomplished easily [9], and the patient was ventilated manually in a semi-closed circle system until spontaneous ventilation resumed.	2.291525920043202
Enflurane (1.5% for 5 min, 1.0% for 10 min, and 0.8% until the diagnosis of MH was suspected) was given in 33% O2/66% N2O.	2.1751492065035287
Seventy minutes after induction it was noted that the spontaneous respiratory rate and minute volume had risen continuously from 10/min and 6 l/min, respectively, to 20/min and 12 l/min.	2.1699006995799257
Attempts at deepening anaesthesia with repeated doses of fentanyl up to a total dose of 0.95 mg failed to reduce the hyperventilation.	2.2064166723615197
In spite of a high fresh gas flow of 6 l/min and assisted manual ventilation, the FIO2 started to fall from 0.34 to 0.28 at 10:20 a.m.	1.9638088745893176
The O2/N2O ratio was changed to 1 : 1, but the FIO2 remained at 0.3.	2.3430558458662225
MH was suspected, enflurane was discontinued, and an arterial blood gas analysis was done (Table 2).	2.31665527539476
When marked acidosis and hypercarbia were found, dantrolene 2.5 mg/kg was given, the operation was terminated, and the patient's trachea was extubated and he was monitored closely in the intensive care unit for 24 h. Vital signs were stable (Table 3) and no further complications were observed.	2.182982252201049
The patient did not mention pain or uneasiness postoperatively.	2.1176096618557696
About 6 months later, a muscle biopsy was done according to the European MH Protocol [5] and the patient was found to be MHEh.	2.6814694387953786
In this case five main reasons for the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis must be considered (Table 1).	2.1393898143526906
Firstly, hypoventilation does not seem to be reasonable as the patient was ventilated with 8 to 12 l/min, which is within the range of 80 - 120 mg/kg - min.	2.639794003679892
Secondly, we can exclude shock and hypoperfusion because the patient had a normal blood pressure and heart rate (within 65 - 90 beats/min), his fingertips and skin were well perfused, his body temperature was 37  °C, and there was no sign of muscle rigidity.	2.064306335269093
Thirdly, a defect of the CO2 adsorber as well as CO2 admixture to the N2O and O2 ventilation gases can cause hypercarbia.	2.2312767859162275
We use two absorbers in sequence of which one is changed every day, and found neither a change in colour of the indicator nor an abnormally raised temperature of the absorbers [11].	1.9152326232459782
A postoperative check of the ventilator showed no defect in the O2/N2O supply and a correctly functioning anaesthesia apparatus.	1.9367039775276427
A malfunction of both CO2 absorbers resulting in intraoperative hypercarbia could not explain a postoperative mixed acidosis lasting for more than 6 h. Anaesthesias performed at the same time using soda lime from the same canisters were totally uneventful.	2.0543036467615083
It is concluded that the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis were caused by hypermetabolism.	2.1063806920922747
A thorough postoperative examination by an internist did not reveal any thyroid, pulmonary, endocrine, or circulatory reason for our intra- and postoperative findings.	2.0462618248168147
Iatrogenic factors like superficial anaesthesia or systemic side effects of adrenaline admixture to local anaesthetics can cause hypermetabolism without striking clinical signs, but they do not cause mixed acidosis lasting longer than 6 h (Table 2).	1.990966382329287
The most suitable explanation in this case is an abortive form of MH.	2.323723857866323

Definition of the problem: Is it the brain that makes a human being a person?	2.1070617663067943
This anthropological question has been raised because of the findings of modern human brain research, and there are severe ethical consequences anew: If the appropriate anthropological answer is yes, then all invasive research would be problematic, because one would touch the basis of human essence.	2.0038478048444333
The problem is that the two major philosophical paradigms that offer an answer to the anthropological question, dualism and monism, have opposing concepts.	1.844556421511244
Arguments: This paper argues that the error of these two paradigms is that they understand the human body and the human mind as 'res' - as things.	2.052403555168982
The explanation of the human being as an interactive unit of body and mind is impossible in both paradigms.	2.19586993460201
A third anthropological view that tries to make that understandable is the anthropology of the Hebrew Bible.	1.8514386015773907
It does assume the category 'thing' while speaking about humans, it presumes the category 'aspect'.	1.793781130341376
There is no Hebrew word for 'mind' in contrast to 'body' or vice versa.	1.9183860923379745
The biblical language only knows terms for the unity of human beings seen under a certain aspect.	1.9526456146085838
Conclusion: Here, the body and thus the brain are important and necessary condition for human essence, but this is not a sufficient explanation for the human personality.	2.3264501222768494
Invasive research on the human brain is here neither generally forbidden nor tolerated - one has to demonstrate in every single case whether the planned operation touches regions that are crucial for the personality of the human subject.	1.9774537083976558

Furthermore, often preoperative antegrade or retrograde ureteropyelography is performed.	2.119236322595522
However, the significance of retrograde ureteropyelography in the world literature remains controversial.	2.178830325598226
Therefore, we reviewed the records of 41 children who underwent a pyeloplasty in our department.	2.0926892581382974
In 9 children the ureter was visualized by IV pyelogram, voiding cystogram or antegrade ureteropyelography; a retrograde examination of the ureter was performed in 21 children before pyeloplasty in the OR.	2.0759960791970866
In 11 children the ureter was not visualized preoperatively.	2.2107700399722
Retrograde ureterography neither gave additional information in any patient nor did it change the operative technique.	2.138591958240338
In the children where the ureter was not visualized preoperatively, no ureteric abnormality was found in association with ureteropelvic junction obstruction.	2.17114877760713
Hence, we conclude that retrograde ureteropyelography before pyeloplasty in children is not necessary, provided that sonography does not show ureteral dilatation.	2.14990911370715

The aim of our study was to evaluate the use of finite-element models (FEM) for the assessment of mandibular deformation under mechanical loading.	2.2055972826682035
Explanted human mandibles (n = 5) were investigated by strain gauges to determine the individual strain distribution under mechanical loading.	2.3332589905832513
FEM analysis based on a computed tomograph (CT) was performed and the results were matched with the test data.	2.7316553474985263
Our study demonstrates only minor interindividual differences in the strain distribution for each load studied.	2.1408527377243356
The mechanical response in terms of deformation was found to depend mainly on gross geometrical properties and to a minor extent on the various other variables.	2.233436636419199
At all positions the maximum principal strain was tensile, the minimum principal strain was compressive, and the absolute strain values were correlated with the magnitude of the applied force.	2.1879402609595635
CT-based FEM analysis revealed the utility of mathematical models to approximate simulated data our experimental results.	1.895758138515033

Registration of fetal heart beats was generally successful from the 20/21th week of gestation onwards.	2.141005179724004
In a few cases, fetal heart beats could be registered as early as in the 16th week.	2.2789676888927306
Cardiac time intervals and amplitudes of fMCG increased concordantly with fetal growth.	2.044538583285458
Mean P wave duration increased from 31 to 49 ms (p < 0.05), PQ interval from 95 to 107 ms (n. s.) and QRS duration from 36 to 52 ms (p < 0.01).	1.8554830480808744

Acute gastrointestinal bleeding is a life threatening disease with a mortality rate of 10%.	2.710564964105793
Upper gastrointestinal bleeding occurs more frequent (85%) and more severe compared to lower gastrointestinal bleeding.	2.11391606653869

Joints are innervated by nociceptive nerve fibres (nociceptors), which are only activated by tissue-damaging stimuli.	2.1836796783113277
This activation causes pain in conscious humans.	2.3006707803743387
The sensory terminals of many nociceptors in the tissue are sensitized by inflammatory processes.	2.088121758926787
Under these conditions, normally innocuous and non-painful stimuli are sufficient to activate nociceptors and to elicit pain.	1.9858635385661818
The effect of inflammatory mediators such as bradykinin and prostaglandins is important for the process of sensitization.	2.246544719113751
In addition to their sensory function, many nociceptors have an efferent function.	2.0805546680077454
They evoke a neurogenic inflammation by the release of neuropeptides such as substance P and calcitonin gene-related peptide into the tissue.	1.9033887392329072
The efferent function of nociceptors contributes to the generation of inflammatory lesions of the tissue.	2.4562941024322287

Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors are established drugs for the treatment of patients with heart failure and hypertension.	2.509629842112464
There is mounting evidence to suggest that ACE inhibitors may be used for different indications as well.	2.304574803011866
The rational for the use of ACE inhibitors is to block the vasoconstrictive effects mediated by angiotensin II.	2.268897434852413
The hemodynamic profile of ACE inhibitors is modified by additional effects such as interference with the degredation of bradykinin and accumulation of prostaglandin and nitric oxide (NO).	1.8384864194098374
Thus ACE inhibitors may be successful in preventing the negative effects of vasoconstriction on regional circulation.	2.1130069552201354
Since vasoconstriction, particularly of the mesenteric vasculature appears to be largely mediated by the renin-angiotensin-axis, ACE inhibitors are assumed to be effective in treating or avoiding gut mucosal hypoperfusion.	1.9819361994942344

Intravenous preparations of ACE inhibitors may broaden our therapeutic armamentarium for these patients.	2.2595142206847902
However, several questions about the exact mechanisms of ACE inhibitors, such as the ideal substance and the optimal dose, are still open.	2.407701647865683
Moreover, further work needs to be done to definitely determine whether ACE inhibitors may be helpful to prevent or treat (micro-) circulatory catastrophe in these patients.	2.0126774688098066
The pharmacologic properties of ACE inhibitors provide an exciting stepping stone for future research in this field.	2.175770249809254

Between May 1996 and 1999, a total of 186 endoscopic spinal operations were performed to treat unstable injuries and pathologic fractures.	2.2345299561496375
The operative spinal interventions followed the classic sequence of excision of part of a vertebral body, partial replacement of the vertebral body with bone harvested from the iliac crest, and implantation of a titanium plate to stabilize the part to be fused.	2.052420195885214

Various risk scores have been developed for the assessment of operative risk in cardiac surgery.	2.7597724985384864
Although risk stratification has been acknowledged as a useful tool to analyze trends in therapy and changes in patient populations, its relevance in assessing the indication for surgery has been questioned.	2.2279975830652745
It was the goal of this prospective study to compare 6 common risk scores with regard to the predictive value for mortality in individual patients.	2.35207633098
Between September 1998 and February 1999 all adult patients undergoing heart surgery were prospectively scored according to the following scores: initial Parsonnet, Cleveland Clinic, French, Euro, Pons, and the Ontario Province Risk score.	2.0204332885549143
Early lethality was assessed within 30 days postoperatively.	2.314340975444999
Follow-up was completed in 504 patients.	2.3120717267214013
With the exception of the Ontario Province Risk score, lethality in the high risk group was overestimated by all scores, whereas lethality in low to moderate risk groups was underestimated by several scores.	1.8540727945581728
Mean scores of surviving and deceased patients showed a broad overlap with high standard deviations.	2.2045797117429653
Preoperative risk scores are effective tools for stratification of patient populations and the analysis of surgical outcome.	2.2617345368994166
With the aid of risk scores, operative risk can be sufficiently predicted for patient populations or subpopulations.	2.1716776008064413
The Euro score best predicted the outcome of our patients.	2.7017646805874462
However, when the indication for surgery is to be determined in an individual patient, risk scores should be only considered as an orientation in the decision process.	2.4582328504243613
