Patients/Methods: In a retrospective case-control study clinical data sheets of 766 in- patients treated at the department were evaluated with respect to the course of the erysipelas and with respect to potential risk factors.	2.508230308789242
Results: General risk factors for local complications were location at the lower extremities, pre-existing hepatic or renal disease, hyperuricaemia, and diabetes mellitus.	2.2782385998436077
Hepatic and renal disease and - to a lesser extent - diabetes particularly predisposed for bullous and haemorrhagic lesions, while vascular occlusive disease enhanced the risk for ne- crotic lesions.	1.861546078675245
Conclusions: Location and hepatic and renal disease are the most important risk factors, while diabetes is probably of less significance than previously suggested.	2.447140814391376
Patients with end-stage liver disease frequently develop combined coagulopathies due to increased procoagulant and fibrinolytic turnover as well as thrombocytopenia.	2.2358831121705895
This substitution commonly follows standard rules based on the assumption that 0.5 - 1 IU of a coagulation factor or inhibitor concentrate given per kg body weight will increase its endogenous activity by 1%.	1.982563410426111
We set out to investigate the validity of this standard regime in patients with end-stage liver disease scheduled for orthotopic liver transplantation.	2.563721255424997
Fifty-one adult patients were prospectively studied.	2.458469131642088
In 37 patients with antithrombin III (AT III) activity <70%, an AT III preparation (Kybernin, Behring, Marburg, Germany) was given preoperatively (mean dose 2616 +/- 207 IU) following standard calculations in order to increase endogenous activity to 80%.	1.8488149746367106
Twenty-seven of the patients had chronic hepatic failure (CHF group) with histologically proven cirrhosis and 10 had acute hepatic failure (AHF group).	2.1627980945416416
Blood samples were drawn prior to a 15-min infusion of AT III concentrate and 30 min thereafter.	2.0993875829126156
In 14 patients with prothrombin time (PT) <40%, AT III levels had been corrected earlier during the clinical course to achieve activities >70%.	1.9402159547639994
Prothrombin complex (PPSB, Beriplex, Behring, Marburg, Germany) was substituted (mean dose 2304 +/- 289 IU) to increase procoagulant activity to PT >60%.	1.7378020820678612
Blood samples were drawn in the same fashion as in the AT III group.	2.447249999240895
The amounts of AT III and PPSB concentrates ( AT III, [IU/kg];  PPSB [IU/kg]) required to increase AT III activity and PT, respectively, by 1% were calculated.	2.1251811784579657
Standard calculations for AT III substitution indicated AT III recovery in all 37 patients who received AT III concentrate.	2.023200427606693
However, there was a statistically significant difference between patients with CLF and ALF.	2.593620850086667
In patients treated with PPSB concentrate,  PPSB was 1.6 U/kg ( +/- 0.2 SEM) for both CLF and ALF groups.	2.07177645374828
In patients with end stage liver disease standard rules for substitution with AT III-concentrate are adequate only for patients with CLF.	2.1148150015273353
In patients with ALF higher AT III doses are required to achieve the expected effect on endogenous AT III activity.	2.0025977277405898
Procoagulant activity, as reflected by PT, can be increased by 1% when 1.6 IU/kg PPSB concentrate is given.	2.152232284860163
An increased volume of distribution and increased turnover may explain the poor recovery of AT III activity in the ALF group, indicating that the dose of coagulation concentrate should be estimated against the background of the patient's clinical symptoms and diagnosis.	2.0698367492568837

Rapid exhaustion and reduced exercise tolerance leads to difficulties in maintaining a normal daily life for many patients.	1.89613527164818

The common clinical feature is a erythematous plaque surrounded by a hyperkeratotic border.	2.045471525759177
The histopathologic hallmark is a parakeratotic cornoid lamella.	2.1739658713156302

With the introduction of the non-benzodiazepine hypnotics zopiclone and zolpidem it was expected to have hypnotics without side effects and risks characteristically seen with benzodiazepines.	2.266151144177408
We report two cases with high-dose usage and dependency of non-benzodiazepine hypnotics.	2.301918969835024
Both patients were prescribed the drugs to treat sleep disturbances occuring during a depressive episode.	1.9694518231136222
While one patient had a polysubstance abuse there was no evidence for an abuse history in the other patient.	2.4968944497488
Thus, it seems that not only patients with a history of substance abuse but also patients with a psychiatric disorder are at risk for abuse of non-benzodiazepine hypnotics.	2.6631452952383468
Considering the increasing number of case reports with abuse and dependence of zopiclone and zolpidem it seems necessary to reevaluate the dependency risk of the currently available non-benzodiazepine hypnotics.	1.9403678510613247
Fractures of the proximal radius in children may lead to deformities of the radial head and functional disturbance of pro- and supination.	2.500255208558833
However, traumatization is not only caused by the injury itself, but may also occur secondary to surgical reduction, manipulation of fracture fragments and excessive physiotherapy.	2.2072273339755166
In a prospective long-term follow-study (2-20 years after trauma) of 38 children with displaced proximal radius fractures we found functional disturbances in 11 % of children only.	2.129360755739542
These were not caused by radial head deformities, which were present on 83 % of follow-up radiographs.	2.5157059752055897
Functional impairment was mainly seen after open reduction or secondary growth disturbances.	2.218250666432279
On follow-up radiographs all conservatively treated fracture angulations up to 60  ° had corrected themselves spontaneously.	2.242594472916881
In view of the high complication rates after open reduction and the poor functional results, as well as the inconvenience for the pediatric patient and the economic aspects, we recommend a primary conservative treatment concept of proximal radius fractures in children.	2.434062419224723
Patients who have undergone cardiac surgery with use of extracorporeal circulation frequently reveal marked hypovolaemia in spite of a highly positive fluid balance.	2.076637799675504
This is thought to be due to transient microvascular damage and extravascular fluid shift.	2.3785296024755493

Purpose: The temporomandibular joint is a place of motion where release of proinflammatory cytokines like interleukin-1 (IL-1) induces cartilage destruction via production of nitric oxide (NO).	1.9979795321566858
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the effects of continuous passive motion in the form of cyclic stretch on the synthesis of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS).	2.0382518439153743
Methods: Articular chondrocytes were harvested from rabbit cartilage slices and cultured in F12 medium supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum.	1.81398641162294
Subsequently, cells (105/ml per well) were transferred to Flexercell plates, grown to 90% confluency, and subjected to one of the following regimens: (1) no mechanical strain (10 Hz, 20% elongation rate); (2) rhIL-1 (1 ng/ml); (3) mechanical strain; (4) mechanical strain and rhIL-1.	2.225569745991477
The cells were exposed to cyclic stretch for 24 h. Thereafter, cells were trypsinized and centrifuged on microscope slides in a cytospin centrifuge.	1.831316545557094
The presence of iNOS was determined by indirect immunoperoxidase staining using polyclonal rabbit anti-iNOS as primary antibodies, and goat anti-rabbit IgG conjugated with horseradish peroxidase (HRP) as secondary antibodies.	1.7065180588497877
Diaminobenzidine was used as substrate for HRP.	2.5130943285506175
Total NO production was spectrophotometrically measured in the supernatants of cultures using Greiss reaction.	1.951759702166561
All experiments were done in triplicates and the statistical significance was analyzed by Student's t-test.	2.1471067547640676
Results: Cells with treatment 1 and 3 did not exhibit presence of iNOS.	2.3120389331424716
IL-1-treated cells in group 2 exhibited intense peroxidase staining.	2.7040864518109555
Cells in group 4 exposed to IL-1 and mechanical stress showed staining with considerably less intensity.	2.1053988232725755
Control cells treated with normal rabbit IgG as a primary antibody did not exhibit peroxidase staining.	2.1695518622414998
The data were further confirmed by measurement of statistically significant differences of NO levels in supernatants assessed in the four different treatment groups.	2.0312237054113313
Conclusion: Our findings suggest that continuous passive motion exerts anti-inflammatory effects on chondrocytes, downregulating the quantity of iNOS -positive cells.	1.965045440368153
Since NO acts as an intracellular, transcellular, and cytotoxic molecule, it has a basic importance for proper post-traumatic and postoperative TMJ function as well as the course and therapy of inflammatory TMJ diseases.	2.272761875409422
Recently, we presented an implantable piezoelectrical hearing aid transducer.	2.1278178915224384
Its characteristics make it suitable for implantation in patients with sensorineural hearing loss.	2.68360389191998
The transducer transmits micromechanical vibrations instead of sound into the hearing organ.	2.0331212823694766
Efficiency of the transducer implant was investigated in ten cat ears.	2.4512590511162364
BERA responses were recorded following stimulation of umbo, long incus process, stapes head, stapes foot plate, and vestibulum.	1.8590371160428276
By comparing the acoustical and mechanical threshold, a correlation was found between the stimulus level of acoustical and mechanical stimulation.	2.074573823714306
An electrical transducer voltage of 1 Vrms* was equivalent to sound-pressure levels between 100 and 128 dB SPL at the tympanic membrane.	1.8723614103822201
To judge hearing impression, stimulus-dependent latencies of the early acoustically and mechanically evoked potentials (waves P1 to P5) and their thresholds were analyzed.	1.9242143318477414
After coupling the piezoelectrical transducer to the long incus process, latencies corresponded well to stimulation.	2.061355003284498

Devergie interpreted those enlarging ulcers as a side effect of mercury therapy.	2.2378242957825876

In MSA patients laryngoscopy often reveals unilateral or bilateral abductor vocal fold palsies.	1.9906524899627638

Endoscopy while awake demonstrated an incomplete abductor vocal fold palsy.	2.1644039390121734

Sleep efficiency was low (51.9%) due to long intermittent awake periods.	2.1257682916549023
Sleep videoendoscopy of the upper airway proved the entire pharynx to be open during REM and non-REM sleep.	2.2670732338876416
During inspiration fluttering movements of the vocal cords caused the snoring.	2.2683155849599617
This was regularly terminated by arousals.	2.331310521886811
The further treatment is discussed.	2.6584720363259993
In general, glottic snoring without daytime stridor is rare and has only been described in MSA patients.	2.1126944456467314

Generalized granuloma annulare is a rare variant of granuloma annulare affecting the trunk and extremities with a multitude of lesions.	2.3075947103965873
In contrast to localized granuloma annulare, generalized granuloma annulare occurs in older patients, shows a stronger association with diabetes, and is characteristically chronic.	2.1058987360638204
Like our 55-year-old patient, most patients present with papules and annular plaques; less often, macular or non-annular lesions may be encountered.	2.1229538820664744
Instead, there are diffuse dermal, band-like or nodular aggregations of histiocytes intermingled with some multinucleated giant cells and a predominantly lymphocytic infiltrate in the periphery.	1.8912931382587994
Because of its special characteristics, it has been suggested that generalized granuloma annulare might constitute a separate disease entity and that it should be classed among the primary cutaneous histiocytoses as a diffuse dermal histiocytosis.	2.0089297673812525
Using immunohistochemistry to determine the macrophage phenotype of the lesional histiocytes, we have shown that generalized granuloma annulare is not a cutaneous histiocytosis.	2.5977814223422686
Neither MS-1 high-molecular-weight protein, a new specific marker for cutaneous non-Langerhans cell histiocytoses, nor CD1a, the well-known marker for Langerhans cells and Langerhans cell histiocytoses, is expressed by the lesional histiocytes of our patient.	1.877659879316849
In contrast, the antigen expression pattern was diagnostic for non-infectious granulomas and was highly similar to that in localized granuloma annulare.	2.0602724181991166
The aims of the study were: (1) to predict reversal time from intensive atracurium blockade; and (2) to determine the optimal time of neostigmine administration during recovery from atracurium blockade, i.e., the time at which the administration of neostigmine results in the shortest total recovery time (time from administration of last supplemental dose of atracurium to train-of-four [TOF] ratio 0.70), and at the same time results in the shortest time from administration of neostigmine to TOF ratio 0.70.	2.306291003784967
The spontaneous and neostigmine-facilitated recovery in 52 healthy women anaesthetised with thiopentone, fentanyl, droperidol, and nitrous oxide was followed.	1.870586013966212
Post-tetanic count (PTC) of TOF stimulation of the ulnar nerve and mechanomyography were used for monitoring neuromuscular transmission.	1.9759310217163846
The neuromuscular blockade was induced with atracurium 0.6 mg/kg and supplemental doses of 0.15 mg/kg were given when the first twitch response in the TOF (TH1) had recovered to 20%.	2.0943173579889827
Neostigmine 0.036 mg/kg body weight was given at different levels of neuromuscular blockade to 37 of the patients.	2.565293940267475
Multiple regression analyses including pre-reversal time (time from administration of the last atracurium dose to neostigmine administration), PTC, weight, and age of the patients suggest that pre-reversal time is the best predictor of reversal time: reversal time=27.3 min-(0.89xpre-reversal time [min]; (SEE=6.0 min).	1.9564433167583113
If pre-reversal time is unknown, PTC can be used: reversal time=24 min-(4.5xln PTC) at time of reversal); (SEE=6.8 min).	2.059594312365475
Total recovery time was 47 min (SEM=2.0 min, n=15) in the patients allowed to recover spontaneously, and 29 min (SEM=1.2 min, n=29) in the patients reversed by neostigmine; the difference of 18 min (SE diff 2.0 min) was significant (P<0.0005).	2.139378901328791
The level of blockade indicated by PTC (1 - 24) at the time of reversal had no influence on the total recovery time.	2.503782403008655
The spontaneous recovery times from reappearance of TH1 and TH1=10% to TOF ratio 0.70 were 29.2 min (SEM=1.7 min) and 24.4 min (SEM=2.6 min), respectively.	1.8816363387749364
The results suggest that pre-reversal time is the strongest predictor of reversal time when neostigmine is administered during intense atracurium blockade.	1.8648261288490395
To achieve the optimal time-saving effect, neostigmine must be given 18 min (the time saved by giving neostigmine) plus 7 to 11 min (needed for neostigmine to reach its peak effect), giving a total of 25 to 29 min before TOF ratio 0.70.	1.8866683308391636
As TH1 is between 1% and 10% 25 to 29 min before TOF ratio 0.70 is reached during spontaneous recovery, the optimal level of neuromuscular blockade for neostigmine administration in atracurium blockade is when TH1 is between 1% and 10%.	1.789712900271197
Reversal time can be predicted as 27.3 min-(0.89xpre-reversal time (min), and the optimal time of neostigmine administration in atracurium blockade appears to be when TH1 is 1% - 10%.	2.2515229994777397

However, these findings did not correlate with the functional outcome.	2.201747213310836

Again these findings did not correlate with the functional outcome.	2.3230296249345948
More degenerative radiological changes were observed in patients who had undergone surgery (P<0.003).	2.5848561335978046

9 of them showed marked clinical improvement at the end of 6-20 weeks of treatment.	2.4676039449814167

As early as 1974, Brian advocated the prone position for ventilated patients [5].	2.0607968382429003
He suggested that this position might enhance ventilation of the dorsal parts of the lungs, thereby improving oxygenation.	2.381822292474644
These considerations have been confirmed by several experimental and clinical studies [1, 6, 13, 17].	2.40816731384428
Better secretion removal, decreased intrapulmonary shunting, and an increased FRC are thought to be responsible for the observed improvement of oxygenation.	2.3607291953902005
However, the prone position never became very popular in the clinical treatment of the adult respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).	2.1844668214210463
Routine performance of thoracic CT scans in ARDS patients demonstrated preferential distribution of pathological densities in the dependent lung areas.	1.96075632525506
The prone position therefore could possibly benefit these patients, as shown by two recent studies [8, 11].	2.3527312663528335
The aim of our study was to evaluate the influence of repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position on gas exchange and thoracic CT findings in multiple-trauma patients.	2.107261490255669
Seven ventilated intensive care patients with severe ARDS (Murray Score >2.5 [9], Quotient >0.7 [4], mean airway pressure >18 cm H2O, thoracic CT scan showing dorsal atelectases) were included in the study.	2.059854091715101
Patients were turned from the supine to the prone position at 12-h intervals using an air-cushion bed (Mediscus, Austria).	1.8518153008335525
Redistribution of dystelectatic or atelectatic dependent lung areas was verified by means of repeated thoracic CT scans (Figs.	2.217707190697783
The patients were intermittently turned for 6.5  +/-  1.1 days.	2.0769487412533674
The course of gas exchange is shown in Figs.	2.3158170696140985
Initially, improvement of the respiratory quotient could only be achieved during prone positioning, from the 2nd day in the supine position as well.	2.434570933115929
No significant changes in cardiovascular parameters could be observed.	2.354820348502399
Control thoracic CT scans showed uniform reduction of atelectases in dependent lung areas (Figs.	2.126622142805373
The inspiratory fraction of oxygen could be reduced significantly as of the 2nd day (Fig.	2.2210893778539864
Constant levels of positive end-expiratory pressure and tidal volume were associated with decreasing mean and plateau airway pressures (Fig.	2.012867572048403
Repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position produced long-lasting improvement of arterial oxygenation, which persists up to the end of the weaning process.	2.355927626215285
This is in good accordance with other studies [1, 2, 6, 8, 11, 13, 17], however, this is the first study to report an observation period of more than 6 days of repeatedly turning the patient.	2.4032851903984223
These positive effects on gas exchange can be attributed to sudden improvement of the ventilation-perfusion ratio within the lung areas that become dependent after turning to the prone position.	2.0428326232621696
Due to reduced hydrostatic pressure [11] and relative hyperventilation [7, 16], previously collapsed alveoli are recruited in the lung areas that become non-dependent after turning to the prone position.	1.7849765833754967

Heparin-associated thrombocytopenia (HAT) type II was diagnosed.	2.154024758029437

Due to ubiquitous coumarin-necrosis, rapid progressive toxic circulatory failure with disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) developed two days after terminating hirudin therapy necessitating high dose catecholamine therapy.	1.7503848073048982
A second course of hirudin resulted in complete restitution of the coumarin-necrosis without the need for re-operation.	2.044216498525409
Subsequent coumarin-therapy, which was gradually increased over two weeks, was without further complications.	2.3795975772221647

The gaseous radical nitric oxide (NO) is catalyzed by conversion of L-arginine to L-citrulline by one cytokine inducible form (iNOS), which becomes active only within hours after the inducing event, and by two constitutively expressed forms, endothelial (eNOS) and neuronal (nNOS), which are regulated by the cytosolic concentration of free Ca2+.	1.8397902045556684
Brain nNOS is physiologically present in discrete populations of neurons, which are all excited by glutamate via the ionotropic N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor, which controls a Ca2+ channel.	1.8028153195698886
After its diffusion into the extraneuronal space, NO may activate in neurons, which as a rule do not stain for NOS, soluble guanylyl cyclase and formation of cGMP as an intracellular messenger.	1.733959923961327
Beyond that, NO is important as a feedback regulator of glutamatergic excitation.	2.134186587639803
NO as a nitrosylating agent enhances disulfide bonding of vicinal sulfhydryl (thiol) groups of the redox modulatory site of the NMDA receptor complex and thereby down-regulates its Ca2+ channel activity.	1.7062197560647427
Histochemically studies have revealed the presence of large number of NOS containing neurons in the magnocellular and parvocellular subdivisions of hypothalamic nuclei.	2.1916388395445954
Numerous studies conform to the view that NO participates in the control of many different neurosecretory processes, especially of the corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) neurosecretory system.	1.9954181687043957
The redox-modulatory site of the NMDA receptor appears, therefore, as a critical structure in the control of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical (HPA) axis.	2.1077663970718588
Moreover, glucocorticoids augment neuronal excitotoxicity by increasing the expression of glutamate receptors and inhibition of glutamate reuptake.	1.9750303333778043
In attempting to explain the many conflicting results obtained in studies with NO, it may be worthwhile to consider that the actual redox-environment of distinct loci of the brain may determine the final function of NO, acting either as a transmitter or neuromodulator or, in the worst case, causing neurodestruction.	1.9378040700025743
It seems likely that any kind of stress by altering the ratio of reduced vs oxidized thiols within the central nervous system influences neuronal excitability, with NO working either as an amplifier or as a feedback regulator of neuronal excitation or inhibition, which may alter acutely or chronically, among others, the homeostasis of a given neurosecretory system.	1.7940588383844642

Plating of the humerus is the established operative method, but recently interest has also been focussed on intramedullary nailing.	2.1967051121738894
Fifty-nine cases of humeral fractures treated with intramedullary nailing (Seidel/Marchetti-Vicenzi/Prévot) from January 1991 to December 1995 (44 fractures after trauma, 11 pathological fractures, 3 pseudarthroses, 1 re-fracture).	1.7419525261976725
Closed reduction in 55/59 cases.	2.3825719006951473
One infection (soft tissue); 2/48 pseudarthrosis (indication for nailing: pseudarthrosis!).	1.9702057119550047
No iatrogenic palsy of the radial nerve.	2.7411512364034576
Functional postoperative treatment in all 44 cases of humeral fractures after adequate trauma.	2.147772718821786
One poor functional result: periarticular ossification after retrograde nailing, possibly connected with long-term respiratory treatment after trauma.	2.1727982431799964
Treatment of humeral shaft fractures by intramedullary nailing is favoured in our clinic (low complication rates, excellent or good functional results, limited approaches, small scars).	2.0435372905645397
All other fractures of the humeral shaft can be treated by each of the implants used in our clinic.	2.901935371420239

These patients benefit from stable fixation without intense surgical trauma.	2.1573957233544645

Plating is also recommended if revision of the radial nerve becomes necessary.	2.3366615240852573
2-4 % of vascular injuries need operative reconstruktion.	2.692214479109908
In polytraumatized patients the rate is even 10 %.	2.4244298799666084
Arterial vascular repair should precede venous reconstruction and orthopaedic stabilization due to limb threatening ischemia.	1.9321694452337028
Penetration or blunt vascular trauma result either in acute blood loss, ischemia or compartmental compression.	2.0673682885370614
Reperfusion syndrom leads to vital threat of patient.	2.293520182337908
Clinical assessment, measurement of limb pressures using a Doppler device and use of duplex ultrasonography are reliable adjuncts in the rapid evaluation.	1.9985386617233791
Arteriography is rarely indicated and should be spared for patients with abnormal physical examination.	2.683191440677211
Vascular repair include direct anastomosis or lateral suture repair mostly combined with primary shortening of the extremity.	2.134950205968115
In most cases autogenous vein graft is required.	2.1927269169033363
Rethrombosis, arteriovenous fistula and pseudoaneurysms are possible complications.	2.232543080134531
Stabilisation of the fracture has priority over vascular reconstruction.	2.581249109591458
The initial steps to success are surgical debridement, adequate bony stabilization mostly by external fixation, revascularisation of vascular injury, immediate fascial decompression and early soft-tissue reconstruction.	1.8921077113810394
The best results are obtained when a multidiciplinary approach is used combining expertise in orthopedic surgery, vascular surgery and plastic surgery.	2.024932627080343
In secondary prevention, statins are cost-effective and even more cost-effective than other lipid lowering drugs.	2.1712696527953295
Statins are especially favorable in patients with previous myocardial infarction compared to those with angina pectoris.	2.681962362772855
For secondary prevention of coronary heart disease, statins should be administered generously.	2.38789323074183
In primary prevention, statins are effective but not cost-efficient.	2.1992778500025323
Unfavorable results have to be expected especially in premenopausal women, younger patients, and in those with a low risk factor profile.	3.0187013059691443
For population based primary prevention, only dietary measures can be advocated; however, apart from a serious lack of compliance their efficiency has not yet been proven.	1.9889569722836034
Preventive measures have their own prize; in general they are considered not to prevent coronary heart disease but retard it.	2.0773436918945944
Therefore, such therapeutic interventions can be assumed not to reduce but rather to increase the "direct" medical costs.	2.2617895512978192
Furthermore, successful prevention of coronary heart disease leads, due to life-prolongation, to an increase in people out of work and in disabled patients due to age and/or disease.	2.442766541241275
Therefore, an increase especially of the "indirect" costs for unemployment, pension, nursing homes, etc.	2.161738340277788

A microphone constructed for implantation in the posterior wall of the auditory canal and a piezoelectric transducer serving as the main components of an implantable hearing aid were temporally implanted in five patients during middle ear surgery under local anesthesia.	2.0784841478801597
The microphone was positioned beneath the skin of the auditory canal such that it completely covered the microphone membrane.	2.005357600372376
The vibratory element of the transducer was coupled to the malleus in four patients with normal ossicular chains and directly to the stapes in one patient with missing incus.	2.2065115690720223
The microphone and transducer were electrically connected with an external battery-driven signal amplifier.	2.0099022541603344
Speech material and music were presented in the operation room at a sound level of 65 dB SPL under free-field conditions.	1.952988997837895
The patients had to estimate the quality of speech, music, and their own voice as well as the effects of bone-conducting noises.	2.7622426534235665
All patients were able to hear with the system.	2.3473823514266483
An intraoperative talk without vision contact was possible without any problems, as was understanding of numerals ("Freiburger Zahlentest").	1.8885919353867087
Perception of music was judged as "clear and undistorted with all broadband component."	2.003333557580594
The estimation was also valid for one patient with a sensorineural hearing loss.	2.454017052748032
One patient declared the music to be "a little of unnatural."	2.504670298347181

An amplification factor that can be technically realized in an implantable hearing aid was necessary for one of the patients with sensorineural hearing loss to perceive music at a pleasant volume.	2.47577527445586
On the basis of this study, essential requirements for the construction of a fully implantable hearing aid are fulfilled.	2.6985501590860808

Subject: In a 7;11 year old boy with trichotillomania (ICD-10 F63.3), attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) (ICD-10 F90.1), and subclinical minimal cerebral dysfunction, Methylphenidate (Ritalin) medication resulted in a remarkable improvement: unexspected interruption of trichotillomania with regrowth of hair.	2.0379393958280585
An essential feature of the known procedures for the analysis of the ECG signal is the splitting of the ECG into individual parameters which are subsequently processed in defined decision trees, neuronal networks or statistical procedures to diagnostic information.	2.0577145818557003
The correctness of the diagnostic statements thus substantially depends on the suitable selection and the exact determination of the individual criteria.	2.5124494919591993
The analysis algorithm and the expert knowledge are closely linked due to the procedure.	2.4402318449219473
This paper presents a new procedure or the evaluation of signals of medical sensor systems by the example of the ECG.	2.2494776288978735
Unlike the methods used up to now, this procedure is not based on an ever more profound splitting of the ECG signal into individual features.	2.384998688363986
Furthermore, analysis algorithm and knowledge base are separated from each other.	2.1419182683041766
The consideration underlying the procedure is that two ECGs whose leads show identical or very similar signal patterns indicate identical or at least very similar cardiological diagnoses.	1.8990740958739545
As this assumption is the basis of medical experience, it should be possible to compare the signal patterns of the leads of an unknown ECG with those of the leads of the reference ECGs from a database and to draw conclusions for the diagnosis of the unknown ECG.	2.324910017712442
For this purpose, those ECGs are searched in an ECG database whose leads show greatest agreement with the signal pattern of the unknown ECG.	1.8207424496101576
The function of the method was established with the aid of the ECG signal database CARDIODAT with 249 ECGs for the diagnostic groups: infarcts and healthy reference persons from a data inventory of 550 ECGs.	2.0286898726359737
It can be seen from the results that the presented procedure which is based on signal pattern recognition is a new approach to deriving diagnostic information from the ECG signal at least for the diagnostic group of myocardial infarcts.	2.269246662994586
Purpose: The technical conditions, the optimized scanning protocols and the facilities of virtual endoscopy (VE) are presented in an overview.	1.9563619350430894
During a 4-week ambulatory cardiacc rehabilitation program, 262 patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), 235 men and 27 women, 53.6+/-10.2 years, performed 30.5+/-2,9 exercise units.	1.9404570088695685
There was a significant (p<0.001) increase in the maximum exercise capacity at the end of the program (105.3+/-32.3 vs. 121.9+/-37.3 W).	2.1857147728232365
Physical work capacity on the 2.0 mmol lactate level improved (p<0.001) from 72.2+/-23.5 to 86.4+/-25.8 W, on the 2.5 mmol/l level (p<0.001) from 83.5+/-23.2 to 97.4+/-26.4 W, and on the 3.0 mmol/l level (p<0.001) from 93.1+/-23.0 to 106.6+/-26.1 W. Despite enhanced performance, heart rate remained unaltered on the 2.0, 2.5, and 3.0 mmol/l lactate level.	1.7680505017709087
Furthermore, ergometric performance on predefined heart rate levels was significantly (p<0.001) increased: 85/min: from 56.0+/-24.1 to 65.8+/-24.5 W; 90/min: from 62.0+/-27.3 to 71.2+/-26 W; 95/min: from 67.2+/-26.4 to 77.5+/-27.6 W; 100/min: from 71.1+/-29.6 to 80.6+/-28.1 W; 105/min: from 69.8+/-26.2 to 81.9+/-28.2 W and 110/min: from 73.6+/-28.9 to 90.4+/-29.4 W. The results demonstrate that physical performance in patients with CAD was improved by our novel ambulatory cardiac rehabilitation program.	1.7381788506951574
This improvement included an increase in maximum as well as endurance work capacity; furthermore, this increase was accompanied by a decrease in resting and exercise heart rates.	2.4387331140949846
The results demonstrate an absolute increase of physical performance, more importantly an increase of physical performance at defined lactate levels in the presence of unchanged heart rates mediated by the rehabilitation program.	2.1885340782449525
Thus, this increase was independent of motivational factors in the patients and/or the investigators during the re-exercise test.	2.488100040163881
On the contrary, our data demonstrate that it is based on an improvement of aerobic endurance capacity associated with a therapeutically beneficial significant decrease of heart rate for a defined workload.	2.460770667062304
The effects were independent of pharmacological influences (e.g., -receptor antagonists).	2.435632534973977
These findings are of clinical importance with respect to reduction of myocardial oxygen consumption in patients with CAD.	3.010855023388029
Newborn screening programs for inborn errors of metabolism are well established in industrialized countries.	2.196037744690884

The separation of whole blood into components is the state-of-the-art in transfusion of allogeneic blood.	2.187391956986456
The main reasons are the negative effects of the buffy coat and the need for FFP.	2.3274082115731742
Nevertheless, especially in Germany whole blood is being rejected more and more even as autologous blood.	2.4212348692609895
However, most of the negative effects of the buffy coat do not apply to autologous blood.	2.1789543791294723
Additionally, these patients usually do not develop coagulation disorders and therefore do not need plasma as a hemostatic component.	2.0028799980701883
On the other hand, separation into components of autologous blood leads to an increase of costs and to logistic problems that restrict autologous blood predeposit to a few institutions.	2.009101576005724
Therefore, we have reviewed the literature in order to find a scientific basis for this.	2.731878983886989
We analysed all articles listed by MEDLINE during the last 12 years that dealt with the quality of whole blood or red cell concentrates.	2.3528801920259133
In addition, all references were included that contributed relevant information to the topic.	2.0205390270380104
A total of 135 original articles, abstracts, reviews, letters or editorials were analysed that referred to standard preparations and storage media.	1.7108980192943315
In 48 papers the in vivo red cell survival was studied.	2.3556218457307483
28 of which fulfilled the prerequisites to be included into a meta-analysis.	2.379297617066322
The following in vitro parameters were also evaluated: pH, potassium load of the units, ATP and DPG concentration of the red cells.	2.056794860730524
Whole blood (resuspended in CPDA-1) and red cell units (stabilized in CPDA-1 or additive solutions) with a different buffy coat or leucocyte content have comparable pH values and red cell 2,3-DPG and ATP concentrations at the end of the approved storage time.	1.964219895173931
The potassium load of a whole blood unit appears to be higher than red cell concentrates, but this is to some extent caused by the higher plasma content of whole blood and is not thought to be a clinically relevant problem for patients receiving only a few units.	2.4667437203471123
A number of studies demonstrate that dependent upon the leucocyte content of a red cell unit, leucocyte metabolites and enzymes are released and accumulate during storage.	1.7965277317371113
A detrimental influence on the integrity of the red cell membrane was found in several in vitro studies.	2.6935122663893454
Nevertheless, a significant improvement in red cell survival by leucocyte reduction was detected by only one group.	2.32031693627961
Undoubtedly, non-hemolytic febrile transfusion reactions (NHFTR) are generally caused by an antibody-antigen interaction due to the transfusion of allogeneic buffy coat.	2.2154816893935334
On the other hand, there is some evidence that non-specific immunological mechanisms such as the release of histamine or cytokines are also capable of causing NHFTR.	2.2961819367824283
Thus, these reactions are expected to occur in autologous blood transfusion.	2.3109479418380388
However, so far, there are no data about the frequency and severity of these reactions and whether they are more likely to emerge after transfusion of blood units with a particular preparation.	2.4094014821089496
Blood transfusions can cause septic complications due to bacterial contamination of the transfused units.	2.0742806291546616
These fatal but rare complications may be reduced by pre-storage filtration of blood, but there is no indication that buffy coat reduction is effective.	2.2242358626746195
Three cases with septic complications have been reported after autologous transfusion, in two of which red cell concentrates (at least one was free of buffy coat) had been used.	2.295158608603824
Thus, there is no justification for the conclusion that the risk of septic complications is increased by transfusion of whole blood.	2.570902241347613
After all, whole blood and red cell concentrates exhibit only minor differences in relevant in vitro parameters.	2.1800175071345156
Therefore, the 24 h in vivo recovery is considered to be the most valid criterion to assess the quality of red cell preparations.	2.4217189915368

The indications for magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) on prosthetic heart valve recipients remain critical.	2.0592440129936502
Some diagnostic questions such as interests in pathologies of the posterior cranial fossa, spinal abscesses, and internal derangements for the knee, strongly recommend the advantages of MRI versus all other radiological diagnostic techniques.	2.014723208579318

Present literature that concerns the safety considerations of current values appears to be incomplete.	2.261969413728425
Therefore, a survey of twenty-five valve manufacturers with regard to compatibility, safety or contraindication for MRI on their respective prosthetic heart valves was performed in 1998.	2.1918666279776797
Those manufacturers who distribute most of the valves in Europe confirmed the safety of MRI.	2.3917996937186508
However, some gave their assurances based on inadequate data, or assigned all responsibility to the physician.	1.9093115144695483
Some companies did not give any assurance for MRI safety or failed to respond to our enquiry.	1.9859731176082094
Two valve manufacturers warned against performing MRI on certain prostheses.	2.0904351007790742
Based on our 1998 questionnaire, the technical issues, the clinical circumstances, the prerequisites and criteria for and the definition of safety standards for MRI on prosthetic heart valve recipients are presented in this paper.	2.1123178989522366

An epidural infusion of local anaesthetic combined with an opioid and adrenaline was given for a period of 5-7 days.	2.5808547735745697
There was no difference between the groups with respect to the effectiveness of the analgesia and patients' perception of the treatment.	2.7176716986489837
Mobilization differed, as expected, between the groups, however even after the most major surgery (e. g. cystectomy with bladder substitution), mobilization was impressively unproblematic.	2.0932838522005035

The side effects such as sedation, nausea and pruritis were conditional partly on the opiate and partly on the intervention.	2.0116781234152894

There was no clinical evidence of hematoma, abscess or permanent neurological damage.	2.0454864593228597

High-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) provides excellent contrast between osseous structures, air and soft tissue in conjunction with high spatial resolution.	2.1712823327073107
Therefore, thin-section HRCT with bone window setting is the method of choice for the examination of the middle ear structures.	2.3584744203867927
The indications are acute and chronic inflammatory changes, cholesteatoma and tumor, the "postoperative middle ear", and malformations.	2.1303574680424378
In most cases, HRCT enables differentiation between inflammatory changes, cholesteatoma, and tumor.	1.9941748331754805
The excellent depiction of subtle osseous details enables the identification of erosions of the ossicles or of the bony walls of the mastoid cells, of osseous defects of the tegmen, of the bony labyrinth, and of the tympanic course of the facial canal.	2.2755348027213675
In addition, HRCT enables excellent depiction of reconstructions of the ossicles or prosthesis of the ossicles.	2.146969744914062
Although HRCT is the first method of choice, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) may provide additional information and lead to a more accurate diagnosis in some cases.	2.6477129922916554
This is explained by the excellent soft tissue contrast provided by MRI.	2.3351418567584354
In addition, MRI offers the possibility of using various pulse sequences and the administration of IV contrast material.	2.2364006026141094
Therefore, MRI may allow the differentiation between inflammatory changes, cholesteatoma, and tumor in those cases in which accurate diagnosis cannot be made by HRCT.	2.0970810516192926
The differentiation between a meningocele or meningoencephalocele and other entities such as tumors or cholesteatoma can be established by MRI.	1.9992273242525196
Furthermore, MRI can accurately depict cases of labyrinthitis or of neuritis of the facial nerve or of intracranial disease caused by middle ear processes, while this is not always possible by HRCT.	1.9725521477849475

In a prospective study we compared the conventional with the laparoscopic technique.	2.2930514107227515
The results indicated that in 19 patients (15.3 %) treated initially with the laparoscopic technique, a switch to laparotomy was required.	2.1103142517385822
The operating duration was lower for conventional cholecystectomy (75 min versus 95 min).	2.013629134816462
However, surgical and nonsurgical complication rates were similar in both groups.	2.260263215358667
The period of hospitalization was shorter in laparoscopic operations.	2.39091162952326

The patients will benefit from the advantages of laparoscopic surgery without increased morbidity.	2.466492448146619

Since the first report by Morton et al.	2.3757867912500483
in 1992, the method has been refined, and its use has increased.	2.399439420687921

Surgery of the great veins inevitably began with the surgical treatment of injuries, often involving the femoral vein.	2.4118908237260417
Because of the famous case presented by Roux in 1813, the prevailing opinion until almost the end of the nineteenth century was that ligation of the vein made death inevitable, but that the only way to control severe hemorrhaging from a vein was to ligate the femoral artery.	1.7813715606090843
Zaufal's principle (1880) consisted in the ligation and resection of great veins of the body and limbs in order to prevent sepsis in suppurative processes.	2.2345592942997397

Paraneoplastic neurologic syndromes (PNS) are rare disorders of the nervous system that cannot be ascribed to metatastases or to destruction of vital systemic organs by the tumor or its treatment.	2.0153044529678508
Most frequently, PNS occur in association with small-cell lung, breast or ovarian carcinomas.	2.136939233316537
The most frequent PNS is Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome, which at the same time has the highest predictive value concerning an underlying carcinoma.	1.9435385262377651
PNS have been classified mostly under anatomical aspects but now are increasingly categorized according to specific antibodies.	2.0182237982635343
In certain neurologic syndromes (sensible and autonomic neuropathy, cerebellitis, limbic encephalitis, Opsoclonus-Myoclonus syndrome, Stiff-man syndrome, neuromyotonia, subacute amaurosis) specific autoantibodies are highly predictive for a neoplasm.	1.696856203854253
Pathogenic relevance of these autoantibodies has been demonstrated only for antibodies against (1) voltage gated calcium channels (VGCC) in Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome, (2) voltage gated potassium channels (VGKC) in neuromyotonia, and (3) recoverin in cancer associated retinopathy.	2.0167888910836616

Ewing's sarcoma is a very rare tumor which has, however, attracted much oncological interest since the dramatic improvement of its prognosis under chemotherapy.	2.2243167357953313
Its histogenesis has been discussed controversially for a long time, including a possible origin in immature reticulum, myogenous, endothelial and undifferentiated mesenchymal cells.	2.0935095667467642
Repeated reports have also suggested a possible neuroectodermal genesis.	2.3045907950487385
Convincing arguments, however, have only been brought forward during recent years, since it was found that Ewing's sarcoma and malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumor share a common chromosome translocation 11;22.	2.1948804067912326
In the meantime this hypothesis has been strengthened by numerous cell biological analyses.	1.9864577961553893
There seems to be no clear border between Ewing's sarcoma and malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumors with definite neural differentiation.	2.1704735181337957
Histological differential diagnosis of Ewing's sarcoma has been improved by immunohistological methods.	2.454803311503145
In most cases, they can be distinguished from lymphoma (leucocyte common antigen, B and T markers) and embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma (muscle specific actin, desmin) without problems.	1.9085970300774977

In the past, most scientific or routine studies on heart rate variability (HRV) were done using commercial Holter ECG devices with traditional magnetic tapes.	1.8337830899797958
All methods to calculate parameters of HRV are based on the measurement of time intervals between successive sinus cardiac beats, in practice RR intervals.	2.259476519025194
Hence, results of HRV calculation depend on the quality of primary data acquisition.	2.697891751296907
However, technical standards on accuracy of RR interval acquisition in magnetic tape and digital solid state Holter ECG systems do not exist as yet.	1.9579639367423758
Therefore in a laboratory investigation accuracy of HRV parameter calculation after traditional standard tape with and without real-time analysis and digital solid state data acquisition was compared in three commercial Holter ECG systems [Ela medical (E), Oxford Medilog Excel (O) and Medset Cardiolight (M)].	1.7611141450388543
A computer-based ECG simulator was used to synthesize a test signal consisting of artificial P-QRS complexes of fixed rate, quartz stabilized "sinus rhythms".	1.8936679119571078
Two channel analog tape and digital 24h recordings of the fixed rate test signal were performed simultaneously.	1.9932339455264798
The influence of recording technology on accuracy of RR interval measurement and consequently on time domaine HRV was shown by comparing five standard 24-h time domain parameters.	1.764287270033078
As expected, in the three Holter systems the analog tape recordings showed a higher, technically induced, artificial RR variability.	2.2304644026364424
The SDNN values (E: 9.38ms vs 2.68ms; p<0.001; O: 3.89ms vs 0.97ms; p<0.001; M: 10.47ms vs 2.89ms; p=0.001), SDNN-Index values (E: 8.22ms vs 0.90ms; p<0.001; O: 3.75ms vs 0.90ms; p<0.001; M: 7.81ms vs 1.49ms, p<0.001) and RMSSD-values (E: 10.39ms vs 2.16ms; p<0.001; O: 10.05ms vs 1.88ms, p<0.001; M: 8.62ms vs 1.69ms; p<0.001) were significantly lower if acquisition was done by digital solid devices in all systems, SDANN (M: 9.83ms vs 5.37ms; p<0.001) in the Medset system too.	1.8602043386166356
The used method is a possible way to validate commercial Holter ECG systems for HRV analysis.	2.173975530704968
Clinical significance of artifical HRV seems to be low.	2.705140248018392

Leg venectasia is a common problem.	2.7606062829112616
Although there are a variety of therapeutic modalities, none of them gives satisfactory results.	2.3224510968843455
The effects of sclerotherapy in the treatment of telangiectasia with a small diameter are poor.	2.4327981800843244
Electrocoagulation and argon laser treatment often result in scarring.	2.270678661804997
We studied the effectiveness of the flashlamp pumped pulsed dye laser at a wavelength of 585 nm in the treatment of leg venectasia.	2.2163866798462566
After repeated treatments using this laser system, only 30% of the vessels that looked blue on clinical examination could be removed; we obtained better lightening of smaller red, telangiectatic vessels with a diameter up to 0.4 mm.	1.866114332456188
However, hyperpigmentation frequently developed after treatment.	2.2881892560015213
In post-treatment biopsies, occlusion of the vessels was found.	2.5358635714057836
Based on these results, we recommend a combined therapy for leg venectasia.	2.4752497984781967
Larger diameter vessels should be treated with sclerotherapy, while finer telangiectasia can be treated with the flashlamp pumped pulsed dye laser.	2.307825981127358

Concomitant pathologies (labral lesions, intra-/extra-osseous ganglia and stress bone marrow edema) in adult residual hip dysplasia (RHD) might influence the outcome of conservative hip surgery.	1.9409159486387804

The first 37 consecutive patients with a minimum follow-up of 18 months have been analysed.	2.9250878308780113
All 37 patients presented RHD with the clinical symptomatology of labral lesions and underwent routine preoperative MRA.	2.1020330205768243
According to clinical, radiological and MR arthrographical criteria, these 37 patients were subdivided into four therapeutic subgroups: (1) reorientation of the acetabulum using the Tönnis triple pelvic osteotomy (TPO); (2) intertrochanteric varisation osteotomy (IVO); (3) palliative decompression with only symptomatic partial resection of the torn labrum (PALL); (4) primary total hip replacement (TEP).	2.04805817655597
Based on the preliminary clinical and radiological outcomes of these four subgroups, the following conclusions can be drawn: labral lesions are considered to be a sign of chronic joint instability.	2.2483038250489122
Therefore, acetabular malorientation should be corrected by redirectional osteotomy of the acetabulum (TPO-subgroup) even in low grades of RHD if labral lesions are present.	1.8828316769033073
"Palliative" labral resections without corrective osteotomy (PALL subgroup) in secondary osteoarthritis due to RHD are definitively obsolete, because they rapidly progress to severe osteoarthritis due to surgically accelerated joint instability.	1.7617326599230019
In RHD with highly osteoarthritic hip joints and concomitant lesions, one should not hesitate to perform primary THR even in young patients.	1.9427679250889613

In two of these cases third-degree open total dislocation of the talus had been sustained.	2.5418038706664077

In each case a fulminating infection was the outcome.	2.2738153453387646

After second- and third-look procedures a free flap was grown for soft tissue coverage within the first 10 days.	2.108884109271247

In the third patient a triple arthrodesis was done.	2.2184575965160738

Amniotic fluid is a major factor of the intrauterine environment, and deviation from the normal volume is associated with an increased perinatal morbidity and mortality.	2.2110563115758954
Polyhydramnios occurs in 0.2 to 1.6 % of pregnancies.	2.3301366848461345
It may be due to a number of congenital anomalies, an abnormal karyotype, maternal diabetes, Rh-disease or intrauterine infections potentially requiring non-invasive or invasive measures.	2.1582440080196754
However, the most common indication for prenatal intervention due to polyhydramnios is the Twin-Twin-Transfusion Syndrom (TTTS).	2.0529866491337527
Treatment of polyhydramnios may focus on correction of the causative lesion, or symptomatic relief through drainage of amniotic fluid.	2.065867929357407
Maternal administration of cyclooxygenase inhibitors represents a further, non-invasive therapeutic option.	2.466653556814491
Indomethacin, Sulindac, or Nimesulide reduce the fetal urine output thus decreasing amniotic fluid volume over time without the risks associated with invasive procedures.	1.8508808933717396
However, potentially serious ductal constriction as well as a delay in the onset of amniotic fluid reduction have limited its application.	2.375249605587318
Percutaneous amniotic fluid drainage may provide immediate reduction of intrauterine pressure, but is associated with a complication rate of 1 to 1.5 %.	2.347830348389871
The hemodynamic characteristics of monochorionic pregnancies complicated by TTTS have led to the development of endoscopic laser coagulation of placental vascular anastomoses as a definitive treatment.	2.083968291565456
Treatment is only required in a small minoritiy of pregnancies with polyhydramnios.	2.275770434083115
Mild cases can be managed expectatively.	2.869136886635251
The main goal of prenatal treatment of polyhydramnios is thus the improvement of fetal outcome through prolongation of gestation and/or the alleviation of maternal symptoms.	2.0455134570687905
With the recent developments in computer technology and the improvements in modern neuroimaging, frame-based stereotactic guidance for open microsurgical procedures has been increasingly replaced by neuronavigation, also called frameless stereotaxy.	1.7455166711738195
The different localization techniques employed are articulated position-sensing arms, infrared or ultrasound systems working with the principle of satellite navigation and robotic systems integrated with the operating microscope.	1.787336733168951
In 200 operations performed with different systems (arm-based, robotic and infrared) the method proved to be helpful, enabling fewer invasive procedures to be performed.	2.0477168374157935
With a mean deviation of 2.87 +/- 1.9 mm for intraoperative localization, the accuracy was only slightly worse than in frame-based stereotaxy with deviations below 2 mm.	1.8837329481092266
Neuronavigation was most helpful for operations on deeply seated lesions, skull-base tumors and lesions in brain areas with high functionality.	1.9126371526786845
The major disadvantage is the use of preoperative data for navigation, leading to inaccuracies when anatomical structures are altered during the operation by resection of tumors or shift of intracranial soft tissue.	2.1946070957023442
Intraoperative magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) might be a solution for this problem.	2.3068087799757175
With the method of intraoperative MRI developed in our department it has already been possible to update neuronavigation with images reflecting intraoperative changes in anatomy.	2.1116000483568147
Therefore, neuronavigation is definitely a method with growing importance in operative routine, and it will also spread into other surgical specialties.	1.9591223630846144

Mental performance tests were simple auditory reaction time and choice reaction time.	2.203725540346631
Practice and baseline data were collected within the first week before BMT.	2.549827320530542
Results The intensity and duration of mucositis differed from patient to patient, resulting in different pain intensities and MPQ scores.	2.1655969117615954
Prolongation of the choice reaction time averaged over the period of mucositis treatment correlated significantly with residual pain intensity (Spearman rs = 0.88, p < 0.01) but not with morphine dose (rs = 0.35, p = 0.33).	1.9313523196545737
For the Sternberg memory search test greater correlation coefficients resulted between reaction time and morphine dose (rs = 0.86, p = 0.014) than between reaction time and residual pain intensity (rs = 0.61, p = 0.15).	1.7137529376985912
In turn, pain intensity, unlike morphine dose, was significantly correlated with high scores in the mood parameters for depression, passivity, and tiredness.	1.9820040441329705
Conclusions It is concluded that both pain and morphine can impair cognitive performance, but that these mental stressors seem to differ according to qualitative criteria.	1.9857308024426514
Whereas pain might slow reaction time by distracting a patient's attention, particularly in low mental demand tasks, morphine could interfere with more specific cognitive processes, such as short-term memory operations, that are required in more complex tasks.	2.0141050740438318

The patient died in acute cardiac failure, five weeks after initial presentation.	2.122762617779541
Autopsy revealed another tumor nodule in the right atrium.	2.4615011101736552

Thrombembolic events as paraneoplastic complications in malignant disease account for severe morbidity and mortality in these patients.	2.230531863177213

Thoughtful coagulation studies and a tumor search program is recommended in these cases.	2.426476302652157
Brain-stem gliomas occur mainly in childhood and are localized in the mesencephalon, pons and medulla oblongata.	2.088620851215121
Diagnosis is a domain of MRI, requiring T2, T1 and KM.	2.079421096151092
CT shows hemorrhage and calcification well.	2.4184505427796883
The criteria are the primary site, size, tumor growth, brain-stem enlargement, delineation, intralesional structure, exophytic components and enhancement.	1.942102178871521
In CT glioma are hypodense, in MRI hyperintense in T2 and hypointense in T1.	1.8924310599622618
Enhancement is seen in 25-60% and does not allow differentiation of tumor vs nontumor or gradings.	2.1692460871974117
Factors influencing poor outcome are high grade, a short history, cranial nerve involvement, severe brain-stem enlargement, pontine site, diffuse growth and recurrency.	1.9107443473103352
The 5-year-survival rate is 30% (after radiation: focal tumors 85%, diffuse 20%).	2.2272947305298136
Most frequent are symptoms of brain pressure, cerebellum, cranial nerves and pyramidal tract.	2.076965414493116
There is no agreement on whether biopsy is necessary or not.	2.076685390972369

Results: 15 out of 135 LBP patients met the American College of Rheumatology criteria for fibromyalgia.	1.921882450684907
Patients with FMS showed remarkably higher levels of pain severity and affective distress.	2.057173400026417
After controlling for different levels of pain severity, these pronounced differences disappeared.	2.2544890670864297
Conclusion: Affective distress is not a unique feature of FMS, but seem to be caused entirely by higher levels of pain severity.	2.291763236729365
Methods: Cases of invasive HI-infections were reported in a national active surveillance program.	2.133950450627979
The case definition required the typical clinical picture and a HI positive culture from a physiologically sterile site (or throat swab or tracheal aspirate in case of epiglottitis or pneumonia) in children up to 10 years.	1.9766066578741248
All initial reports were validated with a questionnaire that additionally questioned the vaccination status, type of vaccine, therapy, outcome of the disease and characteristics of the bacteria.	2.401157325978656
The relation between the type of Hib vaccine used on the risk of infection was analysed in a case control study with controls selected at random from a population based sampling frame.	2.2487707559840917
Results: 310 confirmed cases of invasive HI infections were reported during the observation period, 199 of these with meningitis, 56 with epiglottitis.	2.010105046536394
The number of cases declined from 71 in the last six months of 1992, 120 in 1993, and 65 in 1994 to 54 cases in 1995.	2.091651828671602
In 1995 the incidence in up to 5 year old children was 1.1/100 000 for all infection sites and 0.7/100 000 for meningitis.	1.9553273527991357
The reduced rates were mainly due to a decrease in the number of unvaccinated cases, whereas the number of cases in vaccinated children fluctuated between 22 and 36 per year.	2.7160299923518467
Most of these were observed in incompletely vaccinated children, who according to the German recommendations could already have received at least one further vaccination at the time of the infection.	2.3887281303059384
The type of vaccine (HbOC, PRP-D or OMP) was not significantly associated with the risk of infection in vaccinated children.	2.2917470581722545
10 % of the bacteria produced betalactamase.	2.828391802279059
In accordance with the German recommendations third generation cephalosporines were used in almost all cases of meningitis.	2.3895710191838897
One third of these, however, received additional antibiotics.	2.863166799710177
Conclusions: The present incidence of systemic HI infections in Germany is low.	2.356617242827333
A further decrease, however, would be possible with "on time" completion of the vaccination schedule according to the German recommendations in all children.	2.457174951244714

Even today the name of F. D. von Recklinghausen is often mentioned in connection with primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism.	2.128577966045817
He was one of the first physicians and scientists to render outstanding services to the classification of structural changes of bones, and in many aspects his work remains valid today.	2.3636228811226556
He succeeded through precise and comparative studies in making the disease and symptoms of primary hyperparathyroidism known and thus distinguishing it from other known structural bone diseases.	2.0323878247547684
He also described the phenomenon of "bone remodeling" which has become relevant today again.	2.096998549565361
Although his written macroscopic and microscopic observations include meticulously precise differentiations which make it difficult to study them today, they are still of interest in order to follow his basic ideas.	2.0443456909447044
This article does not constitute a comprehensive biography, but it contains a description of F. D. von Recklinghausen's important work on bone pathology against the background of the main stages of his life.	1.973618382742271
Soft-tissue sarcomas (STS) of the extremities are characterized by a high rate of local recurrences.	2.767360506275671
Limb salvage approaches using multimodality therapy protocols have replaced amputation.	2.082804032786343
In order to evaluate isolated hyperthermic limb perfusion (ILP) in a multimodality therapy concept, we reviewed our patients treated using this method.	1.9573565135677649
Between January 1982 and December 1995, 25 ILPs, using cisplatin, melphalan and adriamycin, were performed in 22 patients with STS.	2.0678543664105486
Forty percent were treated for local recurrences; histology was dominated by malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) and synovial sarcoma.	1.9357469852341742
In all, 68 % of the STS were classified as UICC stage IIb or IIIa/b.	2.0705279390453595
Most of the cases (14) underwent wide or radical resection, 4 patients received intraoperative radiotherapy, and 5 were treated with external beam radiation.	2.46127441784481
Complications were recorded in 32 % of the cases.	2.644249094246976
With a median follow-up of 45 months (range 1-143), the 5-year overall survival rate was 81 %.	2.7753403422172154
The median recurrence-free time was 19 months and the 5-year disease-free survival rate 34 %.	2.4071637740635907
There were 13 local failures, and distant metastases developed in 36 % of the patients.	2.2014245185567023
Five of 11 patients with local failures underwent perfusion after they refused amputation, and 7 incompletely resected STS received ILP without reoperation.	1.8865703306789035
All of these demonstrated local recurrence.	2.3971040249721183
This rate of local recurrence proved to be different from patients with tumor-free resection margins (p = 0.0001, log-rank test).	2.26495930147737
The amputation rate after isolated limb perfusion was 27 % (mean 11 months after treatment).	2.0899032213941022
Long-term results of ILP showed a considerable local recurrence rate and a low disease-free survival.	2.322915013643467
Perfusion in patients without tumor-free resection margins does not prevent local recurrence.	2.3571865414476068
We conclude that ILP with cisplatin, melphalan and adriamycin should be considered carefully and is not an additional treatment strategy of first choice.	2.205671490390641

2.25 hours after the onset of circultory arrest, and 1.5 hours after the beginning of thrombolysis, the patient's hemodynamic patterns under high-dosage catecholamines were satisfactory.	2.283363380033257

With the increasing use of cross-sectional echocardiography in patients with overt or suspected pulmonary thromboembolism in the emergency rooms, more and more right atrial thrombi are detected.	2.264792083438094
These are so-called "transitthrombi" from the venous system on their way to the pulmonary arteries and they are a severe presentation of thromboembolic disease.	2.2633584558619604
They appear as an imminent pulmonary embolism and usually coexists with an already massive embolism.	2.1178584418105677

Therapeutic options were thrombectomy, fibrinolysis or anticoagulants.	2.203178790246782
We treated one of our patients with thrombectomy, eleven patients with fibrinolysis and two patients with anticoagulants.	2.3712610597500707
The era of modern anaesthesia in Germany began on January 24th, 1847.	2.0701612394767244
This day, professor in ordinary Johann Ferdinand Heyfelder anaesthetized a patient with sulphuric ether in the clinic of surgery and ophthalmology of the University of Erlangen.	2.2187933832526636
By March 17th, 1847, Heyfelder had performed 121 surgical procedures under ether.	2.0409914574773236
The operations in majority were teeth-extractions, and a few more complex operations such as the treatment of a harelip or of lip cancer or the resection of the shoulder joint.	2.4969470302283607
Heyfelder described in detail 108 of these inhalations in a little book entitled The experiments with sulphuric ether.	2.030745579635151
This monograph published in March, 1847, represents one of the first complete dissertations on sulphuric ether in the German literature.	2.305632353344537
In a special chapter he analyzed the development of various physiological and psychological parameters during etherization.	2.328416511415964
Heyfelder also examined blood and urine of some etherized patients and reported that he did not find any important or specific alterations.	1.9125947052950296
In 1847, Heyfelder was probably the first to apply salt-ether in man.	2.1732450877027927
After 4 administrations he concluded that salt ether acted more quickly but shorter than sulphuric ether.	1.8266365493442225
Advantageous were its application without problems and ease of induction.	2.2920836157523707
Disadvantageous were its high volatility, its price and the difficulty of getting it in a pure form.	1.9756550798506318
From December, 1847, on Heyfelder started to use chloroform.	2.194574155200674
He was now able to perform more major operations, for example the total resection of the hip-joint.	2.546044505246411
In his book The experiments with sulphuric ether, salt ether, and chloroform he describes a great number of anaesthetic administrations using these 3 agents.	1.797498808646561
In his summary Heyfelder concluded, that chloroform was undoubtly superior to sulphuric ether mainly because it was a quicker acting and longer lasting agent and leads to deeper narcosis.	1.7865144840704819
Moreover its application was much easier for it needed no special apparatus.	2.07652339253108
However, because of its great anaesthetic potency, Heyfelder particularly demanded great caution in the application of chloroform.	2.226812025692616
Explicitely he expected an assistant for chloroformizations, whose only duty was to supervise the inhalations and the patient - a forerunner of the modern specialized anaesthesiologist.	1.9303018901357805
Background: To evaluate the publication rate of abstracts presented during the German Anaesthesia Congress (DAK) in MEDLINE-listed journals in comparison to the publication rate of abstracts presented during the meeting of the European Society of Anaesthesiologists (ESA).	1.7859370484609176
In particular, the embryonic brain is suitable for transvaginal ultrasound examination, because the large "cystic" cavities of the brain can easily be imaged.	2.2019088429317057
Sonoembryology not only describes normal embryonic anatomy and normal relations and proportions of organs, but also the development of structural abnormalities.	2.50174628179892
Approximately one-third of all congenital anomalies, originate from the central nervous system (CNS).	2.1187008598472827
Based on normal sonoembryology and on recent experiences with early CNS anomalies, we recognize some sonographic signs of an early CNS anomaly: (1) Apparent dysmorphology of the brain or the head; (2) Altered appearance of the cerebral ventricles with disproportion of the brain compartments, where the amount of fluid is either greater or less than normal; (3) In the early fetal period, choroid plexuses that are too small to fill the ventricle from the medial to the lateral wall; (4) Irregular contour of the spine/back; (5) Extra-CNS anomalies.	2.0633121682096704
In the following survey, normal sonoembryology of the CNS is described, and CNS anomalies of the early pregnancy are discussed.	2.0790433033303692
Telomerase is an enzyme that elongates telomeric repeats, the specialized structures at the ends of chromosomes that provide genomic stability and compensate for the physiologic process of telomere shortening.	1.7948963500706319
It has been implicated in cellular senescence, immortalization, and carcinogenesis.	2.1213962863097304
Over 85% of human tumours, and 95% of non-melanocytic skin cancers, show telomerase activity, in contrast to the corresponding normal tissues.	2.311839129926415
This suggests that telomerase activity may play an important role in carcinogenesis.	2.3043387319552733
Recent evidence shows that telomerase is active not only in embryonal and germ line tissues, but also in some normal tissues.	2.1249853729685877
In the skin, this activity has been traced to the stem-cell-bearing epidermal basal cell layer, possibly reflecting the presence of telomerase-competent stem cells.	2.138212175423169
These findings require a reconsideration of our interpretation of telomerase activity in tumours of the skin and other tissues.	2.231724977095276
As a causal relationship linking telomerase activity and cancer has yet not been demonstrated, some caution is warranted.	1.9145634308899697
The established criteria of auditory brainstem responses (ABR) such as JV latency, JI-V interpeak latency and interaural differences of  latency or amplitude have been found to be sensitive for detecting tumors of the cerebellopontine angle if a response is present.	1.9024421341190774
However, the ABR can be absent in cases of acoustic neuromas because of desynchronization, even though pure-one audiometry indicates that responses should be present.	2.0025378801157636
This retrospective study compared the ABR and pure-tone thresholds in 234 cases with cerebellopontine angle tumors and a control group of 181 cases with sensory hearing losses in order to quantify threshold discrepancies.	2.1147943805521976
The average deficit of the objective ABR threshold (DOABRT) to the subjective pure-tone threshold for those frequencies between 1-6 kHz was 3.6 dB for the control group (ABR and pure tone thresholds very close) and 31.2 dB for the tumor group (ABR threshold much higher than the pure-tone threshold).	1.923737239869161
ABR thresholds 30 dB higher than the high-frequency pure tone thresholds were found in 40.6% of the tumor group and in none of the control group.	2.626695678168785
Thus, deficits of the ABR threshold >30 dB can be considered to be an additional criterion for detecting retrocochlear disease and increases ABR sensitivity for tumor detection even if responses are absent.	2.1146851329873826

Four different combinations have been specified.	2.453209641545605
Most cases are reported from the Japanese literature.	2.4417108341284743

A connectable butt-press plate was recently developed in order to prevent this type of dislocation.	2.420564390372663
We review the results with this fixation technique in 22 elderly patients with an average age of 76 years who presented with highly unstable trochanteric fracture of the A3 type.	2.2736368666285394
Three patients died of diseases unrelated to the trauma or operation before the fractures had healed.	2.1168030752215325

Complaints, leg shortening and changes in the CCD angle were recorded.	2.617698956358316
Furthermore, the mobility score was determined.	2.359715482528433
Although the patients were able to bear full weight after the operation, no lateral dislocation of fragments was observed.	2.4504120168334693
Only 1 patient had a varus dislocation of 5  ° until the fracture had consolidated.	2.2603484989267724
This was due to severe osteopenia and subsequent dislocation of the screw within the femoral head.	2.4805360230498557
Five of the surviving patients had a lower mobility score after fracture healing as compared to the status before the fracture was sustained.	2.4585280028486562
On the basis of this review, we recommend the use of this new connectable buttress plate with sliding hip screws because it provides sifficient fixation of highly unstable fractures of type A3.	2.369729028933095

To date, the hearing loss has been believed to be purely neural.	2.020161113946317

Ninety-six patients with DSM-III-R diagnoses mainly of the formerly neurotic or personality disordered field, of whom 81 % had shown such basic disorders at the time of the index examination and therefore were classified as persons at high risk of developing schizophrenia, were re-examined for schizophrenia.	2.045757963393822

To date, at least 12 types of primary dystonia can be distinguished on a genetic basis.	2.262368547130195
A 3-bp deletion in the DYT1 gene causes early onset, generalized torsion dystonia (TD), and mutations in the GTP cyclohydrolase I and the tyrosine hydroxylase genes result in dopa-responsive dystonia (DYT5).	1.8251355192112733
A missense change in the D2 dopamine receptor in one large family (DYT11) has recently been implicated in myoclonus-dystonia.	2.0157389198741424
Furthermore, seven other loci for dystonia genes have been mapped to chromosomal regions, including a locus for a mixed dystonia phenotype (DYT6), one form of focal dystonia (DYT7), three types of paroxysmal dystonia (DYT8-10), X-linked dystonia-parkinsonism (DYT3), and rapid-onset dystonia-parkinsonism (DYT12).	1.837199646267114
No positive linkage results have yet been obtained for autosomal recessive TD (DYT2) and several other families of different types of dominantly inherited TD (DYT4).	1.8882039009930862
In addition, hereditary secondary dystonia may occur as part of familial diseases of the basal ganglia, metabolic and storage disorders, and various X-linked and other familial neurodegenerative syndromes affecting the basal ganglia.	2.0201653361621856
It may be anticipated that the traditional clinical and etiological classifications of dystonia will increasingly be replaced by a genetic one and that the identification of more dystonia genes may lead to a better understanding of these largely nondegenerative disorders.	2.072737085024232
