Nucleotides are low molecular weight biological compounds that play major roles in almost all-biological processes.	2.03731409360762
Cell nucleic acids and nucleotides are continuously synthesised, degraded and salvaged.	1.952160410291009
The body's pools derive from three potential sources: synthesis de novo, salvage (recycling of preformed bases) and the diet.	1.9334791648319987
It is generally accepted that de novo synthesis of both purines and pyrimidines from amino acid precursors is capable of supporting the cellular needs for nucleic acid synthesis.	1.6990984629144674
When protein intake is decreased or in situations in which there are a high demand of nucleotides synthesis (after gut injury, after surgical trauma, sepsis, rapid growth: pregnancy or newborn infants, etc.)	1.9209028037998348
some tissues with a rapid turnover (gut and immune system) may increase the salvage of exogenous nucleotides coming from the diet.	1.962625866096549
Therefore, nucleotides may become conditionally essential nutrients.	2.1717982435259144
This article discusses the possible beneficial effects of dietary nucleotides on small intestine (maturation and recovery) and gut microflora, lipid and hepatic metabolism and on the immune system.	2.010547327807203
Human milk is the best source of nucleotides for young infants and the nucleotide/nucleoside profile of it shows a substantial predominance for pyrimidines as compared to purines.	2.035322690818252
Moreover, pyrimidine nucleotides seem to be better preserved in breast milk during storage in the breast and during digestion in the small intestine and they are more absorbed and incorporated into tissue RNA, as compared to purine ones.	1.9909586487495305
Additional research should be done to improve the design of nucleotides supplemented infant formulas.	2.5393207732714074
This includes: 1) to investigate in vivo if the incorporation of dietary nucleotides in tissue RNA is enhanced in situations of stress or rapid growth and 2) to study the biological effects of individually administered purine and pyrimidine nucleotides.	1.961557587753651

Anaesthetic delivery was discontinued simultaneously with termination of surgery and recovery times were recorded.	2.236241371008319

In both groups emergence was very rapid.	2.3136820027502125

So far clinical data concerning the safety margin of the shock energy in ICD therapy do not exist.	2.022576317609505
The shock energy tested during long-term follow-up in this study was twice the intraoperatively measured defibrillation threshold (DFT).	2.577767093284252
All patients received a non-thoracotomy lead system (CPI, Endotak 0070, 0090) and a biphasic cardioverter-defibrillator with the ability to store episodes (Cardiac Pacemakers Inc., Ventac TM PRx II, PRx III).	1.869776603665662
The intraoperative defibrillation threshold (DFT) was evaluated in a step-down protocol (15, 10, 8, 5 J) and hat to be <=15 J for inclusion into the study.	2.112854495621644
The DFT+ value was tested immediately after successful implantation, at discharge, and after a follow-up period of one year.	2.4565552166585714
Prior to implantation the patients were randomized into two groups.	2.603325358270898
The energy of the first shock in the study group was programmed at twice DFT+ and in the control group at the maximum energy output (34 J).	2.519801629109477
The efficacy of the first shock and its reproducibility in DFT testings and in spontaneous episodes during long-term follow-up of the study group were compared to those in the control group.	2.6515888384919393
A DFT+ value was found to be <=15 J in 166 of 176 patients (94%).	2.2484170754133355
The DFT+ in the study group was 9.6+/-3.2; in control group 10.1+/-.35 J.	2.079242407807745
The prohability of successful defibrillation at DFT+ level after one year was 84%.	2.04056297489236
The success rate of the first shock meant to terminate induced ventricular fibrillation (VF) was 99.5% in the study group (217 of 218 episodes) and 99% in the control group (201 of 203 episodes).	2.118959220867794
In the control group the first shock was successful in 151/156 (96.8%) spontaneous MVTs and in 30/33 (91%) VF episodes.	2.025610957294784
The efficacy of the first shock was not influenced by clinical data such as the underlying cardiac disease, left ventricular function, ongoing antiarrhythmic therapy with amiodarone, or the number of spontaneous episodes per day or by the DFT itself.	2.37849336616046
Thus, the safety of ICD-therapy is not impaired when programming the shock energy at the 2x DFT+ value.	2.1083043644285557

In recent years, however, a trend towards higher survival rates has been observed.	2.3585411455505123
This had led to reconsideration of the sequelae of ventilatory therapy.	2.1934077488329646

Procalcitonin is the propeptide of calcitonin devoid of hormonal activity.	2.122253350303616
Normally, procalcitonin is produced in the C-cells of the thyroid gland.	1.9368997942315107
In healthy humans procalcitonin levels are undetectable (<0.1 ng/ml).	2.091336942305092
During severe generalized infections (bacterial, parasitic and fungal) with systemic manifestations, procalcitonin levels may rise up to 100 ng/ml.	2.019236914662355
In contrast, severe viral infections or inflammatory reactions of non-infectious origin do not or very moderately increase procalcitonin levels.	2.1649163471784805
The exact site of procalcitonin production is not exactly known but even large amounts of procalcitonin released during infections do not lead to an increase in plasma calcitonin level or activity.	2.018321240041995

Procalcitonin is a propeptide of calcitonin.	2.4682256761229446
It is usually not detectable in healthy volunteers but appears in high concentrations in the serum of patients with severe bacterial, parasitic or fungal infection.	2.352231276517922
In contrast, procalcitonin levels do not or only moderately increase during viral infections or during non-infectious systemic inflammatory states.	2.036611563202304
Because of these properties, procalcitonin has been proposed to serve as a marker of severe infections and sepsis.	2.2627396075030513

Normally, procalcitonin is produced in the C-cells of the thyroid gland.	1.9368997942315107
The origin of the high levels of procalcitonin in septic conditions is not fully understood.	2.492615483889718

More studies are needed to uncover the nature and pathophysiological role of this molecule.	2.343177574151066

Accidental hypothermia (AH) can be defined as an unintentional decrease in core temperature below 35  °C during cold exposure by individuals without intrinsic thermoregulatory dysfunction.	1.9046894550148286
Pathophysiological changes can be attributed both to the severity of hypothermia and to co-morbid factors such as trauma, submersion, intoxication and underlying diseases.	2.1145488317048917
In trauma victims stratified according to the Injury Severity Score, the factor hypothermia is considered to be a poor prognostic sign for survival.	2.3512287459351193
In these patients rewarming therapy should be applied as soon as possible.	2.3500027082772514
In the Utrecht University Hospital, adult patients with AH are managed according to an algorithm based on their presenting hemodynamic conditions.	1.884757940669961
Patients with perfusing cardiac rhythms and systolic pressures over 80 mmHg will receive continuous arteriovenous rewarming (CAVR).	1.7666333422010052
Arrested and hemodynamically instable patients are treated with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).	2.138661656023541
Fourteen patients had a trauma as the cause of hypothermia.	2.9897843845281953
Twenty patients were treated according to the algorithm (CAVR n = 18, CPB n = 2) and two patients were alternatively managed.	2.630716721296114
Mortality in the CAVR group was 28 % and total mortality reached 32 %.	2.1088169002898884
Complications of CAVR are related to placement and removal of vascular catheters and may be severe in these patients with impaired coagulation.	2.3727536062371763
CAVR permits a good access to the (trauma-) patient and rewarming can be continued synchronously with diagnosis and treatment of various injuries.	2.169436179792882
The grading of long-tubular-bone pseudarthrosis depends on the biological reaction or lack of reaction in pseudarthrosis or non-unions.	2.3645889256265185
Hypertrophic and oligotrophic pseudarthrosis belongs to biologically reacting non-unions, whereas non-reacting non-unions are necrotic pseudarthrosis and defective non-unions with partial decline or complete destruction of cortical substance.	1.8171094066800906
Pseudarthrosis is a serious disturbance or disorder within the regulation cycle in fracture healing, which consists of osteoregeneration, osteovascularization and stabilization.	1.9467720619564846
The causes and underlying reasons for disturbance of this regulation cycle are primarily massive destruction of the biological and functional very important unity of periost, cortical substance and medullary space.	1.8966763371313464
This can occur from trauma, but it happens more often from surgical procedures that do not take the biological principles of bone-healing into account.	2.1689210408951745

Results: The drug effect upon osteoblasts was higher than on progenitor cells.	2.119110227226268
The proliferation of in vitro stromal bone marrow cells, compared to untreated cells, was found to be decreased.	2.467482247631014

The synthesis of osteocalcin by osteoblasts increased to 119%.	2.1019383473298663

Preoperatively, 49 patients reported disturbances of sensitivity of the infraorbital nerve.	2.137152461840514
Other symptoms, such as periorbital haematoma and flattening of the zygomatic prominence, were observed in 49 patients and 45 patients, respectively.	2.3022504089853153
All fractures were repositioned well as assessed clinically and radiologically.	2.263485886239898
The aesthetic result was evaluated as symmetric and durable in all cases.	2.2355250313484643
Six months postoperatively 41 patients reported normal sensitivity in the area of the infraorbital nerve.	2.199840494740214
In only five patients (10.2%) was the sensitivity loss persistent throughout the entire follow-up period.	2.160347036523963
Patients with primarily lacking diplopia developed neither eye motility disturbances nor postoperative enophthalmus in the following period.	1.9677123656672153
It can be concluded that the treatment of an isolated zygomatic bone fracture which satisfies aesthetic and functional requirements is possible by reposition and fixation with one miniplate at the lateral orbital rim.	2.1666035365587892
An additional osteosynthesis at the infraorbital rim or at the zygomaticomaxillary crista is not necessary.	2.0552374422623436
A routine revision of the orbital floor is only indicated in cases of preoperative diplopia.	2.5842635391912077

To date, this impact has been evaluated by measurements of the general pain specific impairment of the quality of life.	2.3242534005749795
Headache specific measurements of quality of life or of disability caused by the headache are still missing for the German language.	2.7071925545051903

94 consecutive patients with a primary headache disorder (59 female, 35 male; mean age 40 +/- 12 years) were examined.	2.656101831885562
Cronbach's alpha was a=0.90, the test-retest-reliability after three months was r=0.87.	1.973655116338912
An analysis of subscales for emotional and functional disability showed similar values for the internal consistency and the test-retest-reliability of these subscales.	1.8782893766301683
The scores of the different headache types did not differ significantly.	2.7398121960791704
In post-hoc-analyses, however, cluster headache showed higher disability scores than migraine both in the total scale and in the subscales.	2.3195798009480932
The total score of the IBK was significantly correlated with the number of headache days per month (r=0.41; p<0.0003) but not with the duration of disease or other demographic parameters.	2.1925208312102282
The IBK is the first German headache specific measurement of certain aspects of the quality of life in chronic headache patients.	2.6836877697172126
It can be used in clinical settings to evaluate the current state of the patient or to monitor treatment and it can be used for scientific studies.	3.3200822596586543

For this purpose the entire septal cartilage is removed, and the severely deviated part is divided into straight sections that are reconnected to each other to form a straight and solid plate.	1.9843484710342874
As connecting material we use a polydioxanon (PDS) foil.	2.11148870197402

The PDS and suture material are usually resorbed within 8 months, excluding long-term complications.	2.24096149475868
During the past 2 years this method was used in treating 38 patients.	2.320411268250548
The surgical goal was attained in every case, and no immediate or long-term complications occurred.	2.471149310401733

The following study investigated the effects of this intervention on aortic input impedance.	2.444516853954065

This approach was chosen to minimize additional influence of extended operative procedures on the ascending aorta, like extracorporal circulation, cardioplegia or blood loss.	2.041849270739615
Flow and pressure were recorded before and after the intervention, and following Fourier Transformation, the aortic input impedance was calculated.	2.2214044936959767

Histologically, these structures are immature fibrous bone formed in local overloaded parts of the trabeculae.	2.0551982456394073

Microcallus formations occur frequently in people over 45 years of age.	2.1231344340133775

The number of microcallus formations depends more on the microarchitecture of the cancellous bone than on individual trabecular parameters.	1.8176728843836516

It stabilizes and regenerates the bone tissue.	2.3170284748518855

Osteoporosis is not the result of an inability to form microcallus.	2.687809298418936

For reconstruction of the distal articular surface, covered screw osteosynthesis was done.	2.757693880568448

From January 1993 to February 1994, the reamed AO standard nail was used.	2.0505937894622654
After introduction of the unreamed tibial nail (UTN) all fractures were treated by this implant.	2.416637502787953
Full load on the operated leg was allowed after 8 weeks.	2.3731232425484006
Union of the fracture was assessed by standard radiological and clinical criteria.	2.8741521065774815
Misalignment was defined as more than 5  ° of angular rotation.	2.6607243701540697
Further surgery due to a valgus deformity in the ankle joint had to be done in three cases.	2.8526385469703204
There were no deep infections.	2.4443200554079025
Three patients had a superficial infection in the ankle area, but surgical debridement was not necessary.	2.453460583418228
A leg shortening was found in 4 cases, but it was less than 1 cm in every case.	2.94140006250956
Therefore, surgical correction was not done.	2.4475623267239635

Bone fusion was reached 12.8 weeks (range 9-21) after the operative treatment.	2.2765752767151297
A specific assessment of the ankle symptoms was made using the score of Olerud and Molander (1984).	2.345765951974418
In 29 patients excellent results were recorded.	2.4402073164188716
A satisfactory result was attained with 17 patients and just 3 patients were found to be unsatisfactory.	2.2554057583352023

The major advantages are closed procedure and simplified interlocking techniques.	2.0915991740378854

Lactic Acid Bacteria (LAB) are a group of Gram-positive organism, which have in common a fermentative metabolism with lactic acid as the major end-product.	1.9793675572803433
Except for bifidobacteria, the LAB are phylogenetically closely related.	2.0818718448314875
They are, furthermore, an essential component of the mucosal flora and especially of the intestinal flora.	2.5629873983346445
The genus Streptococcus contains highly pathogenic species which can be clearly differentiated from the useful germs.	2.227697404924085
The intestinal flora contains such species of the genus Lactobacillus that are also important in food fermentation and species which are strongly adapted to the intestines and therefore, can be found exclusively in this ecological niche.	2.00315533622023
A special status characterises bifidobacteria and enterococci.	2.23486409457494
The former are located in a separate phylogenetic branch and also occur virtually exclusively in the intestines.	2.0714991111181353
Enterococci are rather ubiquitous, participate in indigenous food fermentations, are found in the mucosal flora and are counted as opportunistic pathogens.	1.9874054397455352
To influence the intestinal flora and to achieve health promoting effects LAB are isolated from the intestinal flora, grown and employed either as pharmaceutical preparations or additions to food (usually fermented milk).	1.7826678168766548
These bacteria are termed "probiotics".	2.5018222981036753
In this process the traditional experience with the safe nature of the species can serve as an important criterion.	2.2515583232532657
In front of this background, LAB in probiotics can be considered to be especially safe, nevertheless some restrictions have to be made.	2.3535374904476734
Generally, the germs used should not contain genes encoding transmissible resistance to antibiotics.	1.9331977568007368
In addition they should not produce biogenic amines (e.g.	1.968621839375567
histamine, tyrosine or phenylethylamine) and should not degrade mucine.	2.1645485623665173
The assessment may also include the following: absence of a potential for deconjugation of bile salts, induction of platelet aggregation and binding to fibrinogen and fibronectine.	1.8862895678040748
These examinations may be required as certain LAB have been identified in clinical isolates.	2.3315895133311657
The germs were components of the body flora as well as of the environment, organisms deliberately employed in food fermentations or probiotics have never been isolated.	2.3099150896140914

The risk to health posed by a sedentary lifestyle is a problem of our times.	2.027374652758857
In contrast to the previous assumption that only fairly high-intensity sporting exercise undertaken over a minimum period of 20 min produces health-related benefits, recent studies have shown that even everyday activitites (climbing stairs, brisk walking and cycling) can have a benedicial effects on health, particularly in those who take little exercise.	1.7935492958407546
So now the recommendation is: exercise of moderate intensity lasting 30 min at least 5 times a week, corresponding to an energy consumption of about 150 kacl/day or 1000 kcal/week.	1.7431518915837354
The results of experimental studies on sport and arthritis and sport and osteoporosis point to the advisability of taking up or maintaining an active sporting lifestyle.	1.8042404478258935
For one thing, it can be assumed that a moderate amount of movement does not increase the risk of developing arthritis: for another, sporting activity during early and late childhood produces a high maximum bone mass, therby delaying the development of osteoporosis in later life.	2.0773514932002572
The new guidelines on the extent and intensity of health-giving exercise make it easier to advocate exercise and sport for disease prevention and health promotion because they appear to implement.	1.8699399540598374
More difficult, however, is deciding on a suitable method for motivating inactive individuals to increase their level of physical acitivity.	2.124072907411614

Epidurography with contrast medium is used to verify the correct poition of an epidural catheter and to detect malpositioning.	2.2367380426097863
Results of investigations of the anatomy of the spinal canal and epidural space performed with anatomic specimens, epiduroscopy, and conventional and computed tomographic (CT) epidurography are sometimes contradictory.	2.0929593573097898
We have performed CT epidurography in approximately 30 patients to date.	2.1733330869240293
Insights regarding the distribution of contrast medium in the epidural space can help to interpret conventional epidurographies and to explain special features, such as the "rail-road-track phenomenon" or the plica mediana dorsalis.	2.1055724064332613
Patients scheduled for major abdominal operations were studied.	2.3073529875513556
Catheters were introduced into the thoracic epidural space on the day before the operation.	2.380659059756191
Conventional epidurographies were performed routinely after insertion of the catheters with a mobile X-ray apparatus, usually in the recovery room, using 5 ml iopamidol (Solutrast 250 M).	2.00054165950133
Selected patients (good mental state and stable psychic condition), after written consent and with approval of the local ethical committee, were investigated with CT epidurography using the same contrast medium (partly diluted).	1.9184830796263315
From among the CT scans performed until now, five characteristic images are presented and compared to conventional epidurographies.	2.522159786483343
When small volumes (5 mL) of iopamidol were injected slowly, we regularly observed a railroad-track phenomenon in the AP images of conventional epidurographies.	1.8299600498089137
After rapid injection of larger volumes (10 - 15 ml), the spread was more homogeneous and sometimes outline a lighter zone of contrast distribution in the midline.	2.2379014676865716
CT epidurography in these cases (5 out of 30 patients) revealed a plica mediana dorsalis.	2.3250151572686897
In the majority of the CT scans of the thoracic epidural space its anterior (ventral) compartment was unfilled by contrast medium.	2.139014583678752
According to the findings of several investigators, dura mater and ligamentum longitudinale posterius have grown together, so that an epidural space does not exist in ventral thoracic segments of the spinal canal.	1.981915043293092
In lower thoracic and lumbar segments both structures are separate, and a wide anterior epidural space was present and filled with contrast medium.	2.1354795214748847
In other cases the dorsal and dorsolateral epidural space was completely filled, but the contrast medium stopped behind the spinal nerves and surrounding dural sheaths, as if these structures, together with the connective tissue strands between them, formed a membrane that spread in a frontal plane.	1.8891459787032623
According to conventional epidurographies and confirmed by CT scans, this feature is also seen regulary in cases with correct catheter position.	2.191788431294817
Small volumes of iopamidol spread preferentially into the wider parts of the epidural space between the gaps of the vertebral arcs, whereas the dura mater and periosteal layers touch at the inner side of the pedicules and laminae, allowing the existence of only a potential epidural space.	2.048425791523439
This rhythmic widening and narrowing of the epidural space is the explanation of the "railroad track" in AP contrast epidurographies.	2.0599970524247335
CT epidurography is a valuable tool to provide better insight into the morphology of the epidural space when filled with fluid (contrast medium, local anaesthetics), complementing findings using epiduroscopy and anatomic specimens.	1.969947926044336
It stands to reason that this time- and cost-expensive method can never replace conventional epidurographies, but can help to interpret them properly.	2.0641416948909206

A vascular etiology of Parkinson's disease (PD) has been long debated.	2.3079350219906805

There were 16 (27%) subjects with PD who also had symptoms of cerebrovascular disease.	2.079629806148718

These findings suggest that cerebrovascular disease occurs in approximately one fourth of patients with PD, but seldomly is causally related.	2.3399870991761036

A diagnostic scoring system, recently published by Ohmann et al.	2.135350093516781
in this journal, was validated by analyzing the clinicopathological data of a consecutive series of 2,359 patients, admitted for suspicion of acute appendicitis.	2.048983683287524
The results of the scoring system were compared to the results of clinical evaluation by junior (provisional) and senior surgeons (final clinical diagnosis).	2.204746455277368
To assess the diagnostic ability of the score, the accuracy and positive predictive value were defined as the major diagnostic performance parameters; the rate of theoretical negative laparotomies and that of diagnostic errors served as the major procedural performance parameters.	2.25591628272958
Of 2,359 patients admitted for suspected acute appendicitis, 662 were proven to have acute appendicitis by histology, for a prevalence of 28 %.	2.12533233141011
The overall sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, and accuracy of the provisional clinical diagnosis were 0.50, 0.94, 0.77, 0.83, and 0.82; 0.93, for the score 0.63, 0.93, 0.77, 0.86 and 0.84, and for the final clinical diagnosis 0.90, 0.94, 0.85, 0.96, and 0.93, respectively.	1.8640186636545577
Of the main diagnostic performance parameter, the accuracy of the score was signifianctly better than that of provisional clinical diagnosis (P < 0.05, 2 test).	2.276007733756437
The score yielded a rate of negative appendecomies and laparotomies of 14.3 and 12.3 %.	2.0324287895132906
With respect to the rate of overlooked cases of acute apendicitis, the score demonstrated a superior performance, with only 6 cases missed (0.9 %).	2.090386407159096
However, the number of patients with acute appendicitis, including those with perforated disease, who were not identified by the score, was almost four times that of the final clinical diagnosis (245 vs 63).	2.3933877528556824
With regard to the main procedural performance parameter, the score resulted in a significantly smaller number of diagnostic errors than the provisional clinical investigator (P < 0.05, 2 test).	2.1013050876300623
The results of this study indicate that the diagnostic scoring system might be helpful when experienced investigators or additional diagnostic modalities such as ultrasonography are not available.	2.224909014291594

In patients with acute or chronic myocarditis, arrhythmias are a common and often the only clinical symptom in the natural course of the disease.	2.2491962348842365
Factors responsible for the increased incidence of cardiac arrhythmias are structural changes, parameters of ventricular dynamics and vascular changes.	2.2064720071245194
On the one hand, inflammatory processes in the cardiac myocytes and interstitium can lead directly to fluctuations in membrane potential.	1.9987816001326084
Fibrosis and scarring of the myocardial tissue and secondary hypertrophy and atrophy of the myocytes favor the development of ectopic pacemakers, late potentials and reentry as a result of inhomogeneous stimulus conduction.	2.187278231876974
Furthermore, parameters of ventricular dynamics such as increased wall tension, increased myocardial oxygen consumption and diminished coronary reserve in the case of disturbed systolic or diastolic left ventricular function also contribute to the increased incidence of arrhythmias.	2.043866719408876
Lastly, vascular factors can further increase the arrhythmogenicity of the inflamed myocardium through the disturbance of micro- and macrovascular perfusion and the resulting myocardial ischemia.	2.0096989600723325
Non-invasive rhythmological evaluation by 24 h Holter ECG, measurement of ventricular late potentials and heart rate variability can be used for orienting risk stratification of the at-risk patient with myocarditis.	2.237980026218673
Programmed atrial and ventricular electrophysiological stimulation also has a relatively high predictive value for spontaneous ventricular tachyarrhythmias.	2.374951434971493
It should be emphasized that, at the present time, optimal electrophysiological parameters with a high predictive value do not exist.	2.2182690810860217
In a selected patient population, immunosuppressive therapy in addition to conventional antiarrhythmic therapy can lead to the reduction or complete suppression of spontaneous and inducible arrhythmias.	2.280099088527036
Nevertheless, in the interim, further precautionary antiarrhythmic measures such as serial antiarrhythmic treatment, VT ablation and AICD implantation are necessary in patients with malignant cardiac arrhythmias.	2.2102581314733563
Right ventricular myocardial biopsy for demonstration or exclusion of myocarditis is an important additional examination which can improve the differential diagnosis and treatment of patients with cardiac arrhythmias of unclear etiology.	2.5035177780436393

The media had in its axis direction the lowest reparative potential for regenerating the continuity break.	1.8996853679195598

Patients with a prospectively defined clinical endpoint differed significantly from those with an uneventful course with respect to age, left ventricular ejection fraction, mean RR interval from Holter recording ( 753  +/-  153 vs 921  +/-  132 ms), mean RR from short term recording (783  +/-  153 vs 914  +/-  163 ms), and SDNN from the Holter recording (71  +/-  27 vs 97  +/-  29 ms; p < 0.001) However, patients with and without clinical event could not be seperated by means of SDNN measured from short term ECG registrations (35  +/-  22 vs 41  +/-  19 ms; P = NS).	1.9649939478107024

Some of these techniques have been adapted for use in intensive care patients whilst being mechanically ventilated.	2.5614898810169486
However, most measurement setups are bulky, cumbersome to use and their running costs are high.	1.905757943841733
Hence FRC measurement has not become a routine method in intensive care although it offers considerable advantages in the management of ventilated  patients such as the determination of "best PEEP", the detection of progressive alveolar collapse in the course of acute lung injury and during weaning from mechanical ventilation.	2.288794080514871
Up to now most efforts to improve and simplify FRC measurement were made at the expense of accuracy.	1.8974642609770889
An ideal method ought to be accurate, easy to handle and cost-effective.	2.231212100335455
It should supply not only FRC data but also information about intrapulmonary gas distribution and dead space.	1.9544930238432547
These demands can be met using modern data acquisition software.	2.1720472294743147
The pros and cons of all methods available for FRC measurement are discussed in view of their suitability for intensive care patients.	2.3118745697544116

For flow measurement a normal pneumotachograph can be used.	2.7486377497701495

Three strategies are followed in handling the key issue within the field of action of care and services for the elderly: securing the material needs of those requiring care, creating appropriate care structures, and providing an effective counselling back-up to alleviate interface problems.	1.9375279697513774
Thouse latter, process-oriented aids, have been the subject of discussion and further development under the key term of case management for a good decade.	2.2762697058504346
The aim in this context is to prevent the elderly from being unnecessarily moved into residential care, to stop the revolving door syndrome, to ensure that older people can stay in their homes, to support family members acting as care providers, to enhance the quality of services and those to ease the strain on fund providers.	1.825111928310353

Bullous pemphigoid (BP) is a bullous autoimmune disease of the elderly; it is characterized by tense bullae on both erythematous and otherwise apparently normal skin.	2.3544865496566296
Several clinical variants of BP have been described, and we now add our observations of two BP cases mimicking subacute prurigo.	2.0789439598172343
Both patients had suffered from intensely pruritic excoriated papules for several months before presentation.	2.13548996612777
Histology showed changes of chronic dermatitis.	2.507319495503656
In the serum of both patients, indirect immunofluorescence on NaCl-separated human skin revealed the presence of circulating antibodies binding to the roof of the artificial blisters.	2.1658249887106775
Perilesional skin biopsies showed linear IgG or C3 deposits in the basement membran zone.	2.0263058676056223
These cases are described as a basis for discussion of the clinical spectrum of bullous pemphigoid.	2.9036441432742848

The contribution of Rudolf Virchow to dermatology seems to have been forgotten, or present-day dermatologists are not aware of it.	1.933468173859922

Starter's pistols are often bought for self-defense, but can also be used for criminal activities (e.g.	2.235000758003697
assaults, etc.).	2.5323059550717257
When a starter's pistol is loaded with blank cartridges and is fired, a powerful shooting noise results.	1.8442713218706508
The level of the noise produced is high enough to cause acoustic trauma.	2.248035822570203
For legal examinations and giving an expert opinion further information is needed about the power of such noise.	2.03716261942598
We examined how high peak sound pressure levels were of the gunshots of blank cartridges and whether there existed any directional characteristics from the noise emissions.	1.8380342769360278
In all, 15 different models of starter's pistols of 8 different calibres were examined.	1.9430797129555337
In addition to blank cartridges, 8 mm tear gas cartridges were also examined.	1.975630792005689
Four transducers were situated in the horizontal plane around the muzzle: 0 ° (shooting direction), 45 °, 90 °, and 180 ° (towards the firer).	1.8876664412830921
The distances between the transducers and the muzzle were 25 cm, 50 cm, 100 cm, and 200 cm.	1.9626293189332862
At a distance of 1 m and in the 0 ° shooting direction the peak sound pressure levels of nearly all weapons tested exceeded 160 dB.	2.048535199654059
At a shooting distance of 25 cm the peak sound pressure levels reached 181 dB.	2.012572417473741
In addition, we observed a directional characteristic concerning the emission of noise: pistols produced higher peak sound pressure levels to the front than backwards towards the firer.	1.8087620071981225
Owing to their rare incidence, foreign body injuries in the region of the orbit, skull base and skull have up to now mostly been treated in  the literature by means of case reports.	2.5077148988252533
Here we present our experience and treatment regimen for ten patients we have treated during the last 3 years.	2.497525287467343

Treatment of tachycardic atrial fibrillation (AF) is difficult in patients with congestive heart failure because many drugs which exert negative dromotropic effects (beta-blockers, calcium channel antagonists) may depress ventricular contractility and/or decrease arterial blood pressure.	2.127198381342145
We have identified 2 intravascular sites in the superior (SVC) and inferior vena cava (IVC) where parasympathetic nerves, which innervate the atrioventricular node, can be stimulated electrically.	1.926897940202106
In 8 dogs, a 7-F catheter with an expandable electrode basket at its tip was non-fluoroscopically positioned in the SVC and in the proximal IVC (time for positioning: 3-5 minutes).	2.0252075638576996
High-frequency electrical parasympathetic stimulation (PS) with 20 Hz at an impulse duration of 0.1 ms was performed during pacing induced AF.	1.8112500434502419
Results: With increasing stimulus strength, a graded ventricular rate slowing was observed during PS in the SVC and IVC (P<0.01, ANOVA).	1.961791233049899
The negative dromotropic effect started instantaneously after onset of PS and ceased immediately after termination of PS.	2.0354790633500164
During ventricular pacing at a constant rate, no decrease of the arterial blood pressure was observed during PS.	2.5434174151789923
PS in the IVC yielded significantly lower stimulation thresholds than in the SVC.	2.484228480995075
Conclusions: Transvenous parasympathetic stimulation for ventricular rate control during AF can easily be achieved in the SVC and IVC in dogs.	2.108911711864993
This procedure may provide a foundation for investigating the usefulness of PS in humans.	2.1151760004155964
If the results translate to patients, PS may be very beneficial in the treatment of AF in patients with congestive heart failure.	2.4347953563999734

Charcot foot in its original sense is equivalent to stage 4 of hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy (HMSN) which is known as Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease since 1886.	1.8348296491586542
This entity, which can be subdivided into 3 groups including subgroups, predominantly begins during childhood and progresses slowly.	2.125770998651924
The first symptom, often unnoticed by the patient for a long period, is weakness of the intrinsic foot muscles with consecutive hammer-toe formation and mobile pes cavus.	2.1044337761025362
Progredient atrophy of the peroneal, extensor, tibialis posterior and finally triceps surae muscles leads to fixed pes cavus varus excavatus with severe varus deformity of the hindfoot, secondary varus position of the talus at the ankle level and subsequent arthrosis of the medial compartment.	1.9974627554407087
Permanent varus deformity of the ankle almost invariably leads to stress fractures of the malleoli because of repetitive microtrauma (stage 5 of HMSN).	2.2175065586454465
The alveolar adenoma of the lung is a rare benign tumor in which the normal parenchymal architectur is imitated by a proliferation of both the alveolar epithelial cells and the mesenchymal septal cells.	2.3180243870884
The first description, based on six cases, was published in 1986 by Yousem and Hochholzer.	2.094240957495094
From their ultrastructural findings they presumed a type II pneumocytes differentiation of the epithelial cells.	2.2297369046781834
We investigated an alveolar adenoma of the lung immunhistochemical by means of antibodies against apoprotein B and C of human surfactant.	2.31634479002303
The septal connection tissue cells did not react.	2.2487339762853895
These findings confirm the expression of surfactant constituants and, hence, the differentiation into type II pneumocytes of the epithelial cells of the alveolar adenoma.	2.189199437267532

Using the PTB simulator, which emits real signals from patients, we examined the precision of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement with the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard).	1.8736400223716219
For this purpose we simultaneously registered invasive arterial pulsewave, cuff pressure and cuff pressure oscillations of 20 patients from our intensive care unit and stored them in the database of the simulator.	1.8658627052256667
The invasive reference blood pressure values were determined following the recommendations given by the Association for the Advancement of Medical Instrumentation.	2.026267892973248
The invasive system showed a cut-off frequency of 35 Hz; the damping constant was 0.21.	2.0412949564122425
From a total of 49 bio-signals from patients the Dinamap 1846 was able to process 41 signals and the HP M-1008B 47 signals.	2.0089570803234658
The mean error of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement of the systolic, diastolic and mean arterial pressure amounted to -2.50 mmHg, 3.35 mmHg (P<0.05) and 1.51 mmHg with the Dinamap 1846 and to -8.5 mmHg (P<0.001), -5.15 mmHg (P<0.001) and -5.58 mmHg (P<0.001) for the HP M-1008B.	2.03724875590278
The 95% confidence limit for the systolic, diastolic and the mean arterial pressure amounts to 56 mmHg, 30 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the Dinamap 1846 and 50 mmHg, 38 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the HP M-1008B.	1.812936417492305
The differences between that two instruments could be caused by the different algorithms for the calculation of blood pressure values and different artefact detection and elimination techniques.	2.195477915572615
The results of the performance tests we achieved with the PTB simulator correspond to the results of other clinical examinations.	2.294509183164393
The American Association for the Advanecement of Medical Instrumentation recommends a maximum mean error of 5 +/- 8 mmHg.	2.1625924800868885
None of the examined instruments lay within these limits.	2.2135604682673327
Due to the systematic and stochastic errors, we think that the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard) do not achieve performance levels that are adequate for measuring critically ill patients.	1.7501676891692477

3 different types of complex spinal trauma are defined: Type I means a multilevel contiguous or non contiguous unstable injury, type II is described as a spinal injury with concommitant thoracic or abdominal lesion, typ III stands for the coincidence of spinal injury and polytrauma.	1.8917843132171692
Overlapping of different types occurs.	2.8108736652310182
Type I: The incidence amounts according a german multicenter study to about 2,5 %.	2.1674663204947464
Multilevel injuries need to be stabilized for a long distance from posterior.	2.669405000258722
With a thoroughful analysis the segments to be fused are determined.	2.16975727160588
A CT scan of the thorax during the first diagnostic screening is recommended.	2.475268778084578
Early reduction and stabilization from posterior should be aimed at.	2.3402532878409525
During the first two weeks anterior procedures are contraindicated.	2.329918352739722
Abdominal injuries are to be found in 3-4 % of all spinal injuries.	2.944783712429564
All organs could be affected.	2.5897700156862395
A typical constallation is the "seat-belt syndrome" with lesions of the upper abdominal organs and a flexiondistraction injury of the upper lumbar spine.	2.4165100046725136
The main problem is to make the diagnosis of both components initially.	2.684445817500626
The prognosis of this combination is favorable.	2.3604895678417543

From these only one third need surgical care.	2.270112497694723

The risk of missing a spinal injury in polytrauma totals approximately 20 %.	2.032263867069515
Surgical stabilization should be performed in the primary phase (day-1-surgery).	2.8432755100404683

In the early phase of treatment on the C-spine only anterior procedures and on the thoraco-lumbar spine only posterior techniques should be applied.	2.2011934707796774

In the second case only minor injuries of the face were diagnosed initially.	2.3600828116256234

These have not been described before.	2.828490759786309

Proliferation or clonogenic tumor cells most likely is the major mechanism underlying this phenomenon.	2.1905955161575763
Important progress in radiation oncology might therefore be expected from inhibition of proliferation of clonogenic cells during radiation treatment.	1.993366804961139
Possibilities to minimize the time factor are briefly discussed.	2.4784014999329687

Aortic dissection with no entry or false lumen flow was recently identified as intramural hemorrhage of the aortic wall (IMH).	1.9715737905161146
Analysis of the literature revealed 209 cases of in vivo diagnosed IMH reflecting 17% of all dissections, whereas in autoptic studies this condition is found in 4-13%.	2.168250434840443
Transesophageal echocardiography, computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging and aortography (to rule out dissection) have been applied for diagnosing IMH in 57, 49, 43 and 38% of the cases, respectively.	2.218630517765205
However, diagnostic accuracy of each modality is not available to date.	2.3060554633543546
In 34%, IMH involves the ascending aorta (type A).	2.2518138601160227
The average age of patients with IMH ranges between 55 and 65 years; 65% are males.	2.3830239345017694
In 12%, IMH was associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm.	2.4554787240918157
With 87%, arterial hypertension is the predominant risk factor for IMH irrespective of its location.	2.2538365542245296
As suggested by the term "mediastinal apoplexy" IMH may - similar to cerebral apoplexy - result from hypertensive rupture of the vasa vasorum in the aortic media.	1.967643343920822
With 97%, the majority of patients present with acute chest or back pain similar to classic dissection.	2.305932851557103
Mediastinal widening is found in 83%; signs of hemothorax/pleural effusion are present in 38%, acute aortic regurgitation in 26%, pericardial effusion in 23%, acute neurologic deficits in 12%, and pulse deficits in 5%.	1.8817710256588795
In 18%, IMH progresses to dissection and in another 15% to rupture.	2.209974138341102
The 30-day mortality of IMH is 24% (36% with type A and 12% with type B IMH; p<0.05).	2.019392045721739
With surgical repair, mortality of type A IMH is lowered to 18% compared to 60% with medical treatment (p<0.01).	2.17538941485828
In contrast, with 8% mortality associated with medical treatment, prognosis of type B IMH is more favorable without surgical intervention, the latter associated with a 30-day mortality of 33% (p<0.05).	2.2096227133540403
Thus, IMH is a potential precursor of dissection and should be managed like dissection with undelayed surgical intervention in patients with type A IMH and with medical treatment in type B IMH.	2.4210929615383363

Cisatracurium - one of the ten stereoisomers of atracurium - is an intermediate long-acting non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent.	2.0925777894741504
Cardiovascular reactions have been described after administration of cisatracurium or vecuronium in surgical patients.	2.5302698225250957
After approval by our institutional review board, 62 patients (ASA I-II) were randomly assigned to three groups to either receive 3xED95 or 5xED95 of cisatracurium or 3xED90 of vecuronium prior to intubation as a bolus.	1.6714309340334406

Six minutes later 0.1-0.2 mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated.	1.8883524077326603
Heart rate (HR) and blood pressure (BP) were monitored every minute.	1.9833581138331442
Changes of heart rate or blood pressure >20% compared to baseline were defined as clinically significant.	2.1535991991262513
After application of the study drug, median values of blood pressure and heart rate were stable.	2.784067229226347

Both drugs proved to be safe for use during induction of anaesthesia in patients ASA I-II.	2.3502929109479926

Autolyzed, antigen-extracted, allogenic (AAA) bone is an osteoinductive preparation of completely demineralized bone matrix.	1.8384365498012867
It has been clinically applied for years.	2.2626119604981008
In an experimental study in rabbits, we evaluated the influence of cortical bone and periosteum on the amount of bone formation following augmentation with AAA bone.	2.327589117801444
Two implants of standardized size were placed on the femoral bone of rabbits.	2.2702731114235917
A cell-excluding PTFE membrane was wrapped circularly around the femur as well as the anterior implant shielding the implant from the surrounding periosteum.	2.1806516417752055
The posterior implant was exposed directly to the periosteum while being shielded from the cortical bone by the membrane.	1.9971357869114326
Thus, two compartments were created selectively, preventing contact between the periosteum or cortical bone and the implants.	2.03637074183868
For each compartment the area and volume of the induced new bone were evaluated by computerized radiograph analysis and quantitative CT (pQCT) scans.	1.9250410479376567
Implantation of AAA bone led to new bone formation in both compartments.	2.3658341793387514
Contact of the periosteum and the implant led to an almost fourfold increase in bone volume.	2.257307771505377
Although bone formation showed interindividual variations, the difference of both compartments was highly significant using the Student's t-test for paired samples (P < 0.0001).	1.9737653842603637
The data show that periosteum is the primary source of new bone formation in augmentations with osteoinductive materials as it is rich in inducible progenitor cells and is well vascularized.	1.9915833912073617
In osseous augmentations with AAA bone, the periosteum should be preserved in order to achieve a close contact of the osteoinductive implant.	2.3348343542603014
Shielding from the periosteum, e.g., by cell-excluding membranes, leads to significantly less bone formation following implantation of AAA bone and should therefore be avoided.	2.1372217496833277
Computed tomography is a significant source of medical radiation exposure for populations in Europe.	2.1567385907958707
Reduced radiation exposure may be possible with modern CT scanners with an image quality that while less good than before remains acceptable for clinical purposes.	1.8646538019936403
The lung appears particularly well suited to investigation with low-dose CT owing to the high contrast between normal and diseased pulmonary parenchyma.	2.147146811557395
Undernutrition, particularly protein undernutrition, contributes to the occurrence of osteoporotic fracture, by lowering bone mass and altering muscle strength.	2.119965231038185
Furthermore, the rate of medical complications after fracture can also be increased by nutritional deficiency.	2.5885659109747454
The IGF-I system appears to be directly involved in the pathogenetic mechanisms leading to osteoporotic hip fracture in elderly and to its complications.	2.3223285205353945
In the presence of adequate calcium and vitamin D supplies, protein supplements increasing the intakes from low to normal, raises IGF-I levels, improves the clinical outcome after hip fracture, and attenuates the decrease in proximal femur bone mineral density in the year following the fracture.	1.8554075601116113
This underlines the importance of nutritional supports in preventing and healing osteoporotic fractures.	2.293616607756583

Positive staining was obtained in 70% for p53, 57% for Ki67 and 80% for PCNA.	1.9949785308076988
Sixty-two percent of the cases were DNA-diploid and 38% DNA-aneuploid.	2.584030377764205
The DNA-diploid carcinomas were accompanied by enlargement of the cell nuclei, preservation of wide margins of nuclear heterochromatin, enlargements of the nuclear areas and increases in the number of nuclei.	2.1350943383164225
In the aneuploid-polyploid cancers the nuclei had a substantial polymorphism, with large cleaved nuclei showing significant variations in size and having a nuclear envelope.	1.7363512473173457
A frequent finding was euchromatization of chromatin.	2.233656447096039
Dense chromatin appeared in the form of small clumps spread over the whole area of these irregular nuclei.	2.1972526726654533
Enlargement and activation of nucleoli were found.	2.43126156050759
The antipyretic analgesics still comprise the most widely used group of analgesic compounds.	2.1275200252693094
Until twenty years ago, aspirin, phenazone derivatives and acetaminophen had been used as standard remedies for intercurrent harmless pain conditions in connection with infections, trauma, small surgeries, but also for tension headache and other painful conditions.	1.9942215475793663
During the last decades, this group has been supplemented by a variety of 2-arylpropionic acids being primarily developed for the treatment of rheumatic pain and inflammation.	2.432151575015809
Some of them (e.g.	2.1725534397269715
ibuprofen, ketoprofen and naproxen) have been given over-the-counter status in some countries because of their relative safety at low doses.	2.0757437833291985
Nevertheless, pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetic differences among the various substances of this group make them suitable to a different degree for the treatment of pain conditions.	2.1170737132924495
A 38-year-old man presented with an intracranial extra-axial tumour at the base of the left posterior fossa which proved to be a meningeal melanocytoma.	2.3294965127131317
Meningeal melanocytoma is a rare, benign melanotic tumour of the leptomeninges occuring predominantly in the posterior fossa or the upper spinal cord in adults.	2.3273104625325347
It shows characteristic cytologic features with isomorphic epitheloid or spindle-shaped cells, often with prominent nucleoli and a variable content of intracytoplasmic melanin.	1.8875539078470915
It usually lacks signs of malignancy such as high mitotic rate, necroses or infiltrative growth and shows a low labeling index in proliferation marker studies.	1.7928747104813973
Its immunohistological profile with S-100 protein-, vimentin- and HMB-45-positive tumour cells is similar to that of (primary or metastatic) malignant melanoma.	2.068252697435724
This differential diagnosis is crucial because of the totally different therapeutic and prognostic implications.	2.5721009623507034
Therefore, everyone dealing with surgical neuropathology should be familiar with the rare, but clinically important diagnosis of meningeal melanocytoma.	2.0147885600996527
A 54-year old, obese woman suffered from massive symmetrical swelling of the face, especially of the upper and lower eyelids.	2.616907124291793
Initially the swelling occured intermittently, but after 2 years it was permanent and progressive markedly limiting her visual fields.	1.9230114951605846

There was no suggestion of a storage disease.	2.1763922319877484

An 81-year-old patient had prolonged competitive neuromuscular blockade with train-of-four ratios of 0.1 and 0.5, respectively, after two successive anaesthesia procedures (enflurane-N2O/O2; vecuronium-succinylcholine-sequence) for transurethral prostate resection.	1.9053850275755948
Although antagonism with neostigmine was promptly successful after the first, 65-min period of anaesthesia (1.5 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation, 3 mg vecuronium), repetitive and chronologically staggered administration of neostigmine after the second, 30-min period of anaesthesia (1 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation) had hardly any effect, so that the patient had to be ventilated mechanically for a total of 4.5 h. Laboratory analysis revealed homozygous, atypical, plasma cholinesterase (790 U/l; dibucaine number 23; genotype E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|).	1.7240703859943773
This retrospectively confirmed a succinylcholine-induced phase II block in both instances, as had already been suspected following the second anaesthetic procedure.	1.909002065152997
The degree of block transformation, and thus the available time, are decisive in explaining the diverse effects of antagonism here.	2.0239995537405426
It must be assumed that a complete phase II block developed after the first succinylcholine exposure owing to the longer duration of anaesthesia; the purely competitive component (train-of-four ratio 0.1) was easily antagonized by neostigmine.	1.947734432509535
At the time of the attempted antagonism after the second, shorter period of anaesthesia, however, block transformation was still incomplete (train-of-four ratio 0.5).	2.1991873240760706
The administration of neostigmine therefore rather intensified the depolarization segment of the mixed block, so that repeated attempts at antagonism then inhibited any further block transformation.	1.9259702355909505
The Ph1-negative groups of chronic myeloproliferative diseases (CMPD) are described, and histopathological criteria that distinguish them from each other are given.	2.013484837966614

Histological progress in each group is characterized by (1) increasing number and pleomorphy of megakaryocytes, (2) increasing fibrosis, and (3) excess of blasts.	2.4912606357978695
These three features can be observed in diagnostic biopsies before any therapy.	2.469532916622943

Objective: Patients in a surgical intensive care unit (ICU) have a high incidence of nosocomial infections which often lead to septic shock and death.	2.2297664829864883
Since calculated antibiotic treatment is often difficult, it was recommended to obtain routine nose/throat swabs in order to have a better idea of the causative agent when a systemic inflammatory response occurs in a given patient.	2.3969920794816657
Methods: In 1435 patients of our cardio-surgical ICU, routine nose/throat swabs were taken three times a week and tested for micro-organisms and resistance to antibiotics.	1.8405556335609883
Of these 86 patients developed clinical signs of systemic inflammation, and additional blood cultures were obtained.	2.169550498893439
Antibiotic treatment was achieved to cover the microbes from the nose/throat swabs, or a calculated dosage was given to patients whose swabs had tested negative.	1.978390074372869
Results: Of the 86 patients with systemic inflammation, 29 had blood cultures positive for microbes.	2.11381448556504
Of these 29 patients, 18 received a calculated antibiotic coverage based on their positive nose/throat cultures prior to the return of the blood cultures from the lab.	2.1175133188608806
However, in only 11 of the 18 patients were routine swabs and blood cultures positive with the same microbes.	2.1792991874131613
While positive routine swabs are quite specific for sepsis when there is a systemic inflammatory response, routine swabs are not a suitable screening tool due to their low sensitivity.	2.2489275758453897
Conclusions: Routine nose/throat swabs led to earlier specific antibiotic treatment in only 22% of our patients with clinical signs of systemic inflammation.	2.2156363029643744
As a result, we feel that routine swabs are only of limited value in instituting earlier, specific antibiotic treatment in septic patients.	1.8642141941829538

Problem There is a great need to expand current knowledge of the various functional capacity measurements used in the rehabilitation of chronic low back pain (CLBP) patients.	2.5357510581095752
The literature on these patients reports that mobility, endurance, trunk strength and lifting capacity decrease during the process of chronicity.	1.9777600922570595
Chronically disabled patients appear to have lower functional capacity than asymptomatic persons.	2.156702616704274
Methods Our study group consisted of 90 disabled CLBP patients (44 female, 46 male; average age 42 years) who underwent a multidisciplinary 8-week daily treatment program of functional restoration with behavioral support (instruction, endurance training, strength exercises, behavioral and treatment to facilitate return to work therapy).	1.793968661199145
Initially these patients where compared with 107 asymptomatic persons (44 female, 63 male, average age 41 years).	1.9761044579869436
The patients were investigated before and after treatment, and at intervals of 6 and 12 months.	2.8227918236283744
The reliability of the functional measurements was evaluated by interrater comparison.	2.4514264527721625
Physical assessment included a medical examination (mainly diagnosis of radicular or nonradicular pain), changes in the lumbar spine revealed by X-ray studies according to Herron and Turner [50], rating of physical impairment according to Waddell [117], flexibility, length of hamstrings muscles (SLR), test of power and endurance of trunk movement by standardized exercises according to the Swiss group of Spring [102] and isokinetic measurements (LIDO Back), tests of lifting capacity (LIDO Lift), and (in part) of general endurance on a cycle ergometer (CASE 15 Marquette).	1.8173351310304247
Results Physical findings showed that mobility was reduced substantially in patients suffering from back pain due to reduced SLR (shortened hamstrings) and decreased spinal mobility.	2.0310233798265998
Patients also demonstrated significant reductions in their ability to perform lifting tasks in comparison to healthy individuals.	2.3030462823882982
The results of trunk flexion showed no significant differences between patients and the control group, whereas the ability to perform trunk extension was much better in the control group.	2.5147906657342824
In principle we found the same results with isokinetic measurements as in the exercises without machines.	2.3165370232073395
Cardiovascular endurance was also much better in the control group than it was in the back pain patients.	2.3133366727367926
At the end of the treatment program all physical deficits were improved significantly.	2.3658482906851948
In many cases performance was comparable with that of the control group.	2.4588306470478267
With time, however, training effects gradually decreased.	2.811451465251151
The success of treatment (return to work, absence from work, pain reduction, use of medical care) was independent of the functional status of the patients before and after treatment.	2.673982441851594
Conclusion Study results showed that physical capacity in disabled patients with low back pain is substantially reduced in comparison to persons who do not suffer from back pain.	2.4848249798891113
The only exception was in trunk flexor strength and endurance, in which measurements did not differ between the patients and the control group.	2.3744992220292818
However, even CLBP- patients with long-term pain and severe physical illness can successfully improve their physical condition by participating in an active treatment program.	2.049687281824821
Back extensor muscle training has to be included in physical therapy.	2.711474357240178
Because of loss of condition during the time after treatment, regular monitoring of patients and their home training programs is necessary.	2.2480022616372404
Overall, treatment of CLBP has to include physical training and psychosocial treatment to achieve satisfactory results.	2.071231148380729
The dynamic behavior of the ossicular chain is very complex and is frequency-dependent.	2.3245989659811417
To date, this has still not been fully investigated or understood.	2.168145374432082
There remains a lack of measurement procedures to pick up the motion of the ossicles and ear drum simultaneously with sufficient resolution.	2.1740018336906535

Motions not observed were derived using mechanical simulation models on a computer and then evaluating appropriate mathematical equations.	1.909705153435133
Using a sound stimulus, the displacement velocities of the umbo and stapes footplate were measured, and the corresponding transfer functions were derived by Fourier transform.	1.983374026690738
Results were used for verification of the computer models.	2.5680600002825886

Reactive oxygen species (ROS) are probably not only unintended, toxic side-products of oxygen metabolism in mammalian cells, they also have several important physiologic functions including antimicrobial killing, regulation of cellular proliferation and growth, and regulation of vascular tone.	1.7795542877113695
ROS are generated within the vessel wall by several mechanisms, including a vascular type of a NAD(P)H oxidase.	2.1040597122252707
ROS formation can be stimulated by mechanical stress, environmental factors, the peptide angiotensin II, cytokines, native low-density lipoproteins (LDL), and in the presence of catalytic metal ions.	2.367311224809766
Their ability to modify LDL, react with endothelial-derived nitric oxide subsequently forming peroxynitrite, and amplify the expression of various genes important for leukocyte recruitment within the arterial wall are the basis of the oxidant injury theory of atherosclerosis.	1.8361965141151908
In animal studies, antioxidant therapy (probucol, butylated hydroxytoluene, N',N'-diphenylendiamide, vitamin E, superoxide dismutase) have been successfully used to prevent fatty streak formation, and to restore impaired nitric oxide-dependent vasorelaxation.	1.8199077169629578
Case-controlled and prospective clinical studies suggest a relation between baseline antioxidant plasma levels and/or antioxidant supplementation and risk of cardiovascular events.	2.1541319169761075
In one secondary prevention trial (randomized, blinded, placebo-controlled), vitamin E supplementation reduced significantly the risk for non-fatal myocardial infarctions.	2.0702358121198947
Before general recommendations can be made, results of further large-scale trials should be awaited.	2.2686307221168636

Pregnancy causes substantial changes in the cardiovascular system: cardiac output (40%-50%) and blood volume (40%) increase whereas systemic peripheral resistance and arterial pressure decrease.	2.303495211070486

It seem appropriate to reevaluate benefit and efficacy of routine preoperative assessment programs.	2.2059295798371457

As shown by a number of studies, preoperative screening investigations seldom disclose new pathological findings of clinical relevance.	2.310641898917631
Abnormal laboratory results in otherwise healthy patients rarely alter the anaesthetic management of the patient and are not related to perioperative complications.	2.4630636776509083
Extensive use of costly diagnostic procedures considerably increases health care budgets.	2.108491840026688
A more selective approach to order preoperative investigations promises considerable savings.	2.0585399513709484
To achieve costeffective evalulation an efficient organisation of properative assessment must be established to avoid costly delay and on-day-of-surgery-cancellations.	1.9668858920803411
There is no medicolegal obligation to perform routine diagnostic testing.	2.0670987805474126
The anaesthetist must be sufficiently informed in time to assess the perioperative risk of the patient and to alter anaesthetic management as necessary.	2.6244918824050636
According to the presented studies a clinical history and a thorough physical examination represent an effective method of screening for the presence of disease.	2.3410344186186567
Careful medical history evaluation and physical examination can avoid extensive investigations in apparently healthy individuals and the latter should only be ordered if indicated.	1.9810065987701893
The botryoid odontogenic cyst (BOC) is considered a rare multilocular variant of the lateral periodontal cyst.	2.231898340522112
The origin of the BOC can be seen in aberrant odontogenic tissue.	2.4792951109288652
The BOC is found especially in the premolar region of the mandible, as well as in the frontal region of the maxilla of patients aged between 60 and 70 years.	2.7866104588961225
Histopathologically the BOC is marked by multilocular cysts lined by a thin, nonkeratinized epithelium.	1.9601138525839026
Clusters of glycogen-rich epithelial cells may be noted in nodular thickenings of the cyst lining.	2.0658541460440216
For the clinician, the differentiation of the BOC from the keratocyst and ameloblastoma is relevant.	2.1465723822418936
One case of a large BOC (65-year-old male, BOC regio 33-45, diameter 5 cm, radiographically and histologically multilocular) is presented with a review of the literature, including the therapeutic management, and the possible diagnostic criteria are discussed.	2.497308669489442
The immunohistochemically determined expression of cytokeratin (CK) 13 implicates the histogenetic origin of the BOC from the squamous epithelium of the oral cavity and excludes the origin from the small salivary glands.	1.9222833110771125
The expression of CK 19 and the lack of expression of p53, as well as the higher proliferation rate of the basal epithelial cell layer by the BOC, may be useful for distinction between the keratocyst.	2.3745786407119778

The majority were chronically ill patients with a history of frequent and long psychiatric hospitalization.	2.481191215181462

Depending on the indication, 2.5 g Levovist in bolus or 4 g fractionated was injected intravenously in a concentration of 300 or 400 mg/ml.	1.909953203755476

The general vessel topography could be better evaluated in 83% of the cases.	2.201266868877079

Laser-induced thermotherapy is an in situ ablation method for the local treatment of liver tumors.	2.2579975470428453
The basic prerequisite for induction of adequate treatment volumes for clinical use was the development of a thermostable application system.	2.380886227660685
In an ex vivo test series, the specially developed application system (diffuser tip) with 5760 J had a higher thermic loading capacity than the Ringmode applicator with 4200 J, thus enabling the induction of significantly larger lesions with a volume of 7.6 cm3.	1.722710175097718
The results of a further in vivo test series demonstrated that the lesions were subject to a four-phase connective-tissue organization within a 6-month period.	2.116535458665621
Furthermore, the same laser energy (4200 J) was associated with a significantly lower lesion volume of 2.5 cm3 in the in vivo than in the ex vivo test series.	2.172956151355305
The influence of liver perfusion on the inducible lesion volume was examined in a further animal experimental study.	2.1145461566547383
By temporarily interrupting hepatic blood perfusion (Pringle's maneuver) during laser application, the effective volume could be increased to 50.3 cm3 (P < 0.01) using an optical beam splitter.	1.8891799201568353
The results were compared with those yielded by the conventional cell culture technique.	2.212330560767303
Using cell culture a urogenital C. trachomatis infection could be detected in 72 of 222 patients.	2.225828268974126
Referred to the detection rate of the Amplicor test and that of the cell culture, sensitivity was 91.2% for the test sensitivity and 79.1% for the cell culture.	2.2681663228515205
The specificity of both techniques was 100% when the specimens for which neither both nor either one of the tests gave positive results were considered.	2.096661800358474

Incidence and clinical significance of cardiopulmonary complications of acute cerebral lesions are still unclear.	2.34702182617099
Neurogenic pulmonary edema (NPE) is characterized as an acute, protein-rich lung edema occurring shortly after cerebral lesions associated with an acute rise of intracranial pressure.	2.256734367195542
NPE is infrequently diagnosed, usually in association with head trauma.	2.450312110772664
Pathophysiological mechanisms include a rise of the pulmonary vascular hydrostatic pressure either due to sympathetic innervation with pulmonary vasoconstriction or increased left-atrial pressure following systemic arterial hypertension or an increase in pulmonary capillary permeability.	1.991764198785359
In contrast to NPE, cardiac complications are frequently observed, most consistently in patients with subarachoid hemorrhage.	2.3007826807755283
Typical ECG changes are repolarization abnormalities, similar to those observed in coronary heart disease, and cardiac arrhythmias.	2.5193435530232415
The CK-MB may be slightly elevated; echocardiographic findings show a depressed left-ventricular function.	1.9846449536353779
Pathological examination reveals myofibrillar necrosis.	2.4056475322083775
Cardiac complications are explained with overactivity of the sympathetic innervation and high levels of circulating catecholamines.	2.1541322510011245
For adequate treatment, close cardiac monitoring is required in all patients with acute cerebral lesions.	2.854205809503418

Ischemic stroke is defined as a localized lack of cerebral perfusion mainly due to cardioembolic or arterial-embolic occlusion of cerebral arteries or hemodynamic or microangiographic reduction of cerebral blood flow.	2.0008895347930906

The overall functional and esthetic outcome was excellent.	2.271515259879217

SCA7 is a rare disorder.	3.471726225035719
The first case in Germany was described only recently.	2.3791857264392284

The father carries a trinucleotide expansion of 42 CAG repeats, the son 51.	1.9795217160924239
Normal alleles range from 7 to 35 CAG repeats.	2.2106208124526088
Both patients show the typical picture with progressive ataxia and macular degeneration.	2.129651588267488
We found a pronounced anticipation (earlier disease onset in subsequent generations), which is highly characteristic of CAG repeat disorders.	2.065644130620624

The definition of endocrine disrupters is not very sharp.	2.2510800794736125
At present all non-physiologic substances which bind to steroid receptors, are defined as endocrine disrupters of which the best studied are estrogenic in nature.	1.8460741775131242

Here they may cause severe estrogenization of aquatic life.	2.3186486675518103

In patients above the age of 40 years, the ECG is a basic investigation, often providing hints for cardiovascular diseases.	2.2250538644564717

Although the development of a verrucous carcinoma as a complication of interstitial cystitis has not been reported so far, the authors regard the chronic irritation of the bladder to be the most important etiologic factor for the malignant transformation.	2.6026954517414747
After conservative management had failed, a radical cystectomy with supravesical urinary diversion was performed.	1.9777757549523693
The characteristics of interstitial cystitis, verrucous carcinoma and surgical management are discussed.	2.109503235411313
Introduction: Abdominal actinomycosis is an uncommon disease.	2.579262405374552

This review deals with practical aspects of pharmacotherapy, psychotherapy, cognitive resp.	2.03981893969312

Psychotherapy needs to regard the possibilities of the patient.	2.607156263824966
In the context of a stable long-term relationship, the patient is supported in experiencing himself as a subject capable of action.	2.527945980430322
Effectiveness of cognitive treatments to date is limited.	2.4336104649044352
The best results are achieved by social skills training.	2.150423724767495

The effect of a locally applied peppermint oil preparation on tension-type headache was examined in the design of a randomized, placebo-controlled double-blind crossover study for the first time.	2.092524988467085
The preparation was tested against both the reference substance acetaminophen and to the corresponding placebo.	2.321454981029462
The liquid test preparation contained 10 g of peppermint oil and ethanol (90 %) ad 100 (test preparation LI 170, Lichtwer Pharma, Berlin); the placebo was a 90 % ethanol solution to which traces of peppermint oil were added for blinding purposes.	1.6467329676587361
The reference preparation contained 500 mg acetaminophen; the placebo tablet was identical to the verum in size and appearance.	1.938450128385591
The study included the analysis of 164 headache attacks of 41 patients of both sexes ranging between 18 and 65 years of age, suffering from tension-type headache in accordance with the IHS classification.	2.1473712074823337
Four headache episodes per patient were treated in a double-blind, randomized crossover design.	2.2692897348391106
Each headache attack was treated by the application of 2 capsules of the oral medication (1000 mg of acetaminophen or placebo) and the cutaneous application of the oil preparation (peppermint oil or placebo solution).	2.307650323347244
The oil was spread largely across forehead and temples which was repeated after 15 and 30 minutes.	1.9298823552691722
Using a headache diary, the headache parameters were assessed after 15, 30, 45 and 60 minutes.	2.036843556765599
Compared to the application of placebo, a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution significantly reduced the clinical headache intensity already after 15 minutes (p < 0.01).	1.9752161422070653
This significant clinical reduction of the pain intensity continued over the one hour observation period.	2.3970019623870815
Acetaminophen, too, proved to be efficient compared to placebo (p < 0.01).	2.3579336420550443
There was no significant difference between the efficacy of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution.	1.989095502388197
Simultaneous application of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution leads to an additive effect which remains below the significance threshold, however.	1.860597180840594
The patients reported no adverse events.	2.3897756463472666
This controlled study showed for the first time that a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution efficiently alleviates tension-type headache.	2.0484892209707977
Peppermint oil thus proves to be a well-tolerated and cost-effective alternative to usual therapies.	2.7773269382785553

Aspiration of toxic substances, foreign material, bacterially contaminated secretions, or water (near-drowning) either immediately leads to cessation of respiration or to impaired ventilation due to airway obstruction, it causes hypoxia due to surfactant dysfunction, and pulmonary infection might develop.	1.7159178408029094
Respiratory insufficiency is the resulting consequence which needs immediate and appropriate therapy and intervention.	2.054363012682834
The knowledge of risk factors that promote aspiration injury is important for its prevention and limitation.	2.2395425305174514
Mortality varies between 3 and 70% depending on patients studied, and on the nature and amount of aspirated material.	2.254621103981968
The major cause of death is acute respiratory failure.	2.3963525960808547
The onset of injury to the lung after aspiration is very rapid.	2.20858618229026
Therefore, therapeutic interventions like bronchoscopy are often too late.	2.1420291422217246
More importantly, oxygenation should be monitored continuously for timely institution of mechanical ventilation.	2.1514118615137647
Antibiotics should not be given routinely but a calculated regime is neccessary when signs of infection develop.	2.131922688954898
Prognosis in near-drowning considerably depends on early rescue and successful resuscitation.	2.1166344401022927
A rapid onset of cerebral hypothermia during the accident can help to increase the ischemic tolerance of the brain and makes it neccessary to continue advanced life support until rewarming of the near-drowning victim.	2.0063345129565553
Anticipation of individual outcome in unconscious patients is difficult.	2.3917003367426957
One third of them survive with a moderate to severe neurologic damage.	2.155859245498049
The overall mortality of near-drowning is about 11%.	2.2350060118637436
Pathophysiological aspects, diagnostic procedures, pratical management and possible prophylaxis of aspiration injuries will be discussed.	2.1116169571371532

However, no reduction in mortality has been definitively shown to follow the use of any monitoring device in randomized, controlled trials.	2.2870575802084234
Four techniques of oxygen monitoring are discussed and evaluated.	2.43769765415488
Oxygen monitoring during inspiration can be recommended, although its implementation will probably prevent only a few anaesthesia-related deaths.	2.214797969511231

Transcutaneous PO2 is considered mainly for historical reasons.	2.2593862170855417

One of these assumptions is that stents may prevent restenosis.	2.061302398435323

No difficulties were encountered during device deployment, however, immediately following device placement active arterial bleeding occurred.	2.1806563997971233
