Background: An abnormal coronary flow reserve represents an early marker of impaired blood flow regulation in the natural history of coronary atherosclerosis under the impact of risk factors such as hypercholesterolemia.	2.183944261913255
Our clinical investigation was aimed at assessing noninvasively the integrative coronary flow response to dipyridamole stress in 18 consecutive patients with microvascular angina, only moderately elevated LDL-cholesterol levels (168 +/- 33 mg/dl), and reduced vasodilator capacity despite normal (n=9) or slightly abnormal (n=9) coronary arteriograms (minimal disease with luminal irregularities and/or diameter reduction <=30%) before and after 6-month lipid-lowering therapy (simvastatin).	1.9636944311535833
Baseline data (mean +/- SD): 13 males, 5 females; mean age: 56 +/- 8 years; basal coronary flow: 90 +/- 22 ml/minx100 g; after lipid intervention: 93 +/- 18 ml/minx100 g (n.s.).	1.875512583121202
Total cholesterol decreased to 170 +/- 36 mg/dl (p<0.001); mean LDL level: 97 +/- 26 mg/dl (p<0.001).	2.134854932637317
Coronary dilator capacity increased, assessed in terms of minimal coronary resistance: 0.38 +/- 0.08 vs 0.49 +/- 0.09 units at baseline (p<0.01), myocardial blood flow under dipyridamole: 232 +/- 43 vs 186 +/- 37 ml/minx100 g at baseline (p<0.01), and instantaneous flow ratio: 2.6 +/- 0.7 vs 2.2 +/- 0.6 (p=0.06).	1.8414833169743623
Concomitantly, a considerable regression of angina was noticed in the majority of patients.	2.4670580216759794
Consequently, aggressive cholesterol-lowering therapy represents an antiischemic and antianginal approach suggesting, at least in part, functional reversal and probably prevention of further disease progression.	1.8267704691715627
We report the case of a a 60 year-old worker in the pharmaceutical industry who suffered from recurring contact dermatitis.	2.282461382562886
Initially the contact dermatitis was limited to the hands; later on it became generalized.	2.169254252773143
The patient had been working on a drug filling line in a pharmaceutical plant for more than 20 years.	2.051331104551781
Eight years after starting this job he had developed allergic hand dermatitis to 2,6-diaminopyridine (patch test positive); this healed upon cessation of exposure.	1.8220274193820298
Ten years later he again developed hand dermatitis which progressed to generalized dermatitis and conjunctivitis.	1.9980963551848085
Under systemic and local therapy with corticosteroids and cessation of work, it healed nearly completly.	2.0984067685850527
Four months after returning to work, the patient experienced a first episode of severe asthma and generalized dermatitis with conjunctivitis following exposure to hydroxychloroquine the day before.	2.115824553785808
The asthma and dermatitis improved after systemic corticosteroid therapy and stopping work.	2.050830901057404
His condition continued to fluctuate, when though the patient was transferred at work and now wore rubber gloves.	2.073392653370949
Eight months later he again developed a generalized dermatitis.	2.3729732677046544
Patch testing revealed delayed-type sensitizations to hydroxychloroquine (tested in concentrations of 0.1%, 0.5%, 1% and 2%).	1.9707924224636646
Equivalent tests in five healthy volunteers were negative.	2.331782579433836
The patch test reactions were pustular, while a biopsy was interpreted as a multiform contact dermatitis reaction.	2.076887751592722
Bronchial exposure with hydroxychloroquine dust produced a delayed bronchial obstruction over the next 20 hours, which progressed to fever and generalized erythema (hematogenous contact dermatitis).	1.814469420017098
After removing exposure to 2,6-diaminopyridine and hydroxychloroquine, the patient went on to develop a contact dermatitis to latex (patch test positive).	2.128867528864302
However, skin prick tests with latex and patch tests with rubber additiva were negative.	1.9479340905950258
Hydroxychloroquine is well known to cause drug reactions.	2.777411361146251
To our knowledge, contact dermatitis to this substance has not yet been reported.	2.2231917156094316
It is noteworthy that the patch test reactions were pustular and of multiform morphology and that bronchial exposure to the allergen resulted in asthma and a generalized drug reaction.	1.79715906473456
Pathogenetically the asthmatic reaction seems to be on a delayed-type mechanism as is also seen with ampicillin, cobalt and nickel induced asthma.	2.082096331489095

Hyperbaric Oxygen (HBO) therapy is a kind of medical treatment in which a patient breathes 100% of oxygen inside a pressure chamber while the pressure of the chamber is increased to a point higher than sea level pressure.	2.0363310370974106
For the clinical use of HBO therapy, according to international recommendations, there are several commonly accepted indications in which HBO either is the only causative life-saving kind of treatment, or is an essential and oftenly decisive component of a comprehensive interdisciplinary intensive care therapy.	2.0798677976056967
Among potential adverse effects, barotrauma of the lungs and especially oxygen toxicity to the central nervous system have to be mentioned.	2.524571125098907
Clinical use of HBO therefore requires special knowledge of its effects, risks, and adverse effects, a clear and distinct indication, and the ability and skills to keep complications under control by means of intensive care or emergency medical measures.	2.266295494210575
The clinical use of hyperbaric oxygen with its interdisciplinary-like character of emergency medicine or intensive care therapy therefore should be an additional, most interesting field of activity for the anaesthesiologist.	2.0895249132945293
Although arthroscopy of the ankle joint has been well established, there are only very few reports about arthroscopy in ankle fracture treatment.	2.372277149433697
In order to sytematically analyze the intraarticular lesions of ankle fractures, we assessed 196 consecutive ankle fractures immediately before ORIF.	1.9282551824626095
There were more cartilage lesions found than expected, and cartilage lesions were not noted more frequently in type C-fractures than in type B-fractures.	2.1149494454295468
In both fracture types, an increasing amount of cartilage lesions was found from group 1 to 3.	2.244555318641312
In addition, more ligament injuries were found than expected, especially in the B.1- and B.2-fractures.	2.2229261817817796
Successful arthroscopic surgery was performed in 26 cases: internal fixation, 9; loose body removal, 7; ligament reposition, 5; cartilage smoothening, 4; and cartilage fracture repair, 1.	2.091836321028924
In one case, a periostal flap could not be reduced, and in another case, the internal fixation of the medial malleolus was not stable.	2.5473335586478734
In summary, arthroscopy was shown to be a very helpful diagnostic tool in ankle fractures.	2.495491724847558
As long-term results are not yet available, it remains, however, unclear as to whether arthroscopy may improve the success of the following ORIF.	2.920110278509103
Arthroscopy was also shown to be a successful tool for several closed surgical procedures.	2.4927816080249614
Of these, percutaneous internal fixation of the medial malleolus under arthroscopic view may be an excellent indication.	2.4646075626821546

Methods: The instruments were translated and tested for internal consistency (Cronbach's coefficient alpha), test-retest reliability (intraclass correlation coefficient, ICC), construct validity (testing for association with Schober's test, finger floor distance, occiput wall distance, frequency and duration of awakenings at night, and a visual analog scale pain), and responsiveness (standardized response mean, SRM).	1.7586337750754681
Results: The study sample consisted of 72 patients of a randomized, controlled clinical trial receiving either Diclofenac or placebo.	2.1225924511620593
The limited responsiveness to Diclofenac treatment (SRM: 0.46 [BASFI],  0.33 [D-FI]) may be related to the selected study sample.	2.044270970576196
The BASFI was significantly correlated with all tested validation parameters.	2.280856048876122
The  D-FI was only significantly correlated with finger floor distance, occiput wall distance, and duration of awakenings at night.	1.9846899410945857
Conclusion: The transculturally adapted version of both functional indices are valid, reliable, and internally consistent.	1.8962647434298787
Because of psychometric advantages, the BASFI may be preferred in clinical trial settings.	2.149585495325742
The role of radiotherapy of the pelvic lymphatic pathways in patients with node positive prostate cancer remains uncertain.	2.482151577299093
Interpretation of the few prospective studies (RTOG 75-06 and 77-06) is hampered by severe flaws in the study design.	2.0200615412376552
Extension of the radiation to the paraaortal region shows no advantage over radiation of the pelvic lymphatics alone and is not warranted.	2.160383650033234
Data on longterm side-effects are only available from older studies with outdated radiation techniques.	2.1623978096085232
According to more recent studies short term side effects are considerably higher with radiation of the pelvic lymphatics when compared with radiation of the prostate alone.	2.257905108785282
In summary radiation of the lymphatic pathways in lymph node positive prostate cancer cannot currently be considered as standard treatment and should be carried out within clinical studies.	2.3335978942305586
In reconstruction of cartilage defects, autogenous transplantation is known as a reliable and experienced method.	2.2750773559883326
Although a clinical application has not been reported until now, tissue engineering permits in vitro production of autogenous cartilage transplants.	2.1912689450695955
Nevertheless, in both methods the cartilage is exposed to individually varying resorptive mechanisms.	2.1500530673801133
Among other methods for in vivo tissue protection, the encapsulation with a semipermeable polyelectrolytecomplex membrane could guarantee sufficient protection against resorptive influences.	1.9013203361095794
Human septal cartilage was encapsulated (group 1) with polyelectrolytecomplex membranes and subcutaneously implanted on the back of thymusaplastic nude mice.	1.9955354621880397
Cartilage implants without encapsulation (group 2) were used as control.	2.531361502988838
Scanning electron microscopy and histochemical investigations were performed 1, 4, 8, 12 and 16 weeks after implantation.	2.264521250642383
Group 1 showed no signs of resorption and chronic inflammation at all.	2.295561884888327
In contrast, group 2 presented, correlating to the time of implanta-tion, increasing signs of cell death and fibrotic transformation, representing an increased activity of resorption.	2.0193863719510787
In conclusion, tissue encapsulation with a polyelectrolytecomplex membrane could ensure a sufficient protection of human cartilage transplants from resorptive influences.	1.885064355332231
For the plastic-reconstructive surgeon the desired result becomes more calculable.	2.0682574668378773
Subjective time-experience and objective time-estimation were examined in 20 endogenous, 20 neurotic depressives, and 15 healthy volunteers.	2.051979106869367
Subjective experience of past and anticipated future time was more extended in both depressive groups than in healthy controls.	1.906177226967249
Objective time estimation differed between depressives and controls concerning relatively long time spans whereas very short time spans were correctly estimated also by depressives.	1.8110458117096913
There were no significant differences between endogenous and neurotic depressives.	2.1586947125069282
The perception of extended time normalized during treatment.	2.3032259607259022
The depressives' time perception, differences correlated with the extent of depressive psychopathological symptoms and - to a lesser degree - with retardation.	2.2090888514286613
The findings support the hypotheses of anthropological phenomenology concerning disturbed time perception and estimation in depressives.	1.9206600357246204

In a retrospective analysis, the persentage of free PSA was determined in the sera of 35 patients with histologically proven benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and 35 patients with clinically localized CaP.	2.0688420453227927

Sevoflurane degrades in CO2 absorbents to produce compound A, which may have  hepatotoxic potential in humans.	2.206577021693929
Several recent studies in human volunteers have been performed to evaluate this potential.	2.473558814910821

The initial investigation found high excretion of protein, glucose and renal tubular enzymes in the urine of the volunteers receiving sevoflurane.	1.9390839438268568

No significant excretion of protein, glucose or renal enzymes was observed.	2.0428306858884033

Background: The microbial colonization of the intestinal tract in newborns begins during delivery.	2.0754939356671724
Streptococci and Escherichia coli pave the way for the bifidobacterial dominance typical in breast-fed newborns.	1.955338322143007
They provide optimal living conditions for anaerobic bifidobacteria by withdrawal of intraluminal oxygen.	1.9749977643052135
A mixed intestinal flora is established on infant formula feeding in the infant.	2.049518551645053
Bifidobacteria, Bacteroides, Enterobacteriaceae, streptococci and lactobacilli are the main genera of this mixed intestinal flora.	1.988426937106847
This represents an intermediate stage of the microflora in adults.	2.369708584236308
The bifidogenic effect of mothers' milk is based on the active substances it contains, which selectively enhance the growth of bifidobacteria, whereas other active substances suppress the growth of the accompanying flora.	2.134413866432669
Bifidus-enhancing factors in breast-feeding are lactose, oligosaccharides, glycoproteins such as glycomacropeptide and the inoculation with bifidobacteria deriving from the skin surface of the mother.	1.9619002428618353
Factors directed to the suppression of the accompanying microflora are antibodies, lactoferrin, lysozyme, fatty acids and monoglycerides that act as antimicrobial substances and the comparatively low protein and iron content in mothers' milk.	1.780903685627033
A bifidus-inhibiting colonization of the intestinal tract with pathogenic germs is caused by maternal birth-canal infections, which are now known to be the most frequent reason for premature births.	2.336398427018002
An increasing number of surgical deliveries, the separation of the newborn infant from its mother, and the generous use of antibiotics contribute to the delayed colonization of bifidobacteria and to the development of life-threatening nosocomial infections.	2.6616268986515355
Counteractive measures against this disastrous situation are the preferential use of bifidobacteria-preserving antibiotics and the inoculation of lyophilized bifidobacteria.	1.8702210327116113

After the operations, however, 90.2% of the patients reported that this condition had noticeably improved or had completely disappeared.	2.5407973516849776
In fact, 87.5% of all patients reported a lasting improvement in their ability to walk longer distances.	2.1731204307646146

Average fracture healing time was about 9.8 weeks.	2.385105514400617
Fractures of the atlas account for 1-2 % of all vertebral fractures.	2.4303115506103596
We divide atlas fractures into 5 groups: isolated fractures of the anterior arch of the atlas, isolated fractures of the posterior arch, combined fractures of the anterior and posterior arch (so-called Jefferson fractures), isolated fractures of the lateral mass and fractures of the transverse process.	2.5673849389503722
Isolated fractures of the anterior or posterior arch are benign and are treated conservatively with a soft collar until the neck pain has disappeared.	2.3154000924705116
Jefferson fractures are divided into stable and unstable fracture depending on the integrity of the transverse ligament.	2.4393843372735216
Stable Jefferson fractures are treated conservatively with good outcome while unstable Jefferson fractures are probably best treated operatively with a posterior atlanto-axial or occipito-axial stabilization and fusion.	1.937435127284377
The authors preferred treatment modality is the immediate open reduction of the dislocated lateral masses combined with a stabilization in the reduced position using a transarticular screw fixation C1/C2 according to Magerl.	1.9994339533060328
This has the advantage of saving the atlanto-occipital joints and offering an immediate stability which makes immobilization in an halo or Minerva cast superfluous.	1.8259670565349604
In late instabilities C1/2 with incongruency of the lateral masses occurring after primary conservative treatment, an occipito-cervical fusion is indicated.	2.0023335110028606
Isolated fractures of the lateral masses are very rare and may, if the lateral mass is totally destroyed, be a reason for an occipito-cervical fusion.	2.2546862999982182
Fractures of the transverse processes may be the cause for a thrombosis of the vertebral artery.	2.8381073402795045
No treatment is necessary for the fracture itself.	2.7873341791506707

Fractures and dislocations of the elbow are some of the most common injuries in childhood and adolescence.	2.9328307132461484
The majority occur in sport and play activities, e. g., a fall from gymnastics apparatus or a bike, or from popular sports items, such as skateboards or in-line skates.	1.9607869039352417
The injuries can be divided into pure dislocations of the joint and fractures of the distal humerus, proximal radius and ulna, or combinations of both.	2.3882111202961918
In addition, extra- and intraarticular fracture types are defined, with the latter as partial or complete joint lesions.	2.1894394355398816
Dislocations of the elbow joint or the radial head can occur as single injuries or in combination with a fracture.	2.4849410801658243
Supracondylar fractures and avulsion fractures of the medial epicondyle are the most frequent extraarticular lesions of the distal humerus.	3.2639273308052466
Fractures of the lateral condyle prevail is incomplete intraarticular lesions.	2.2719190190629446
In the forearm, radial head and neck fractures are predominant while typical and atypical Monteggia injuries have a special status.	2.1051312705564733
The complex joint construction and the age-dependent appearance of the epiphyseal ossification centers sometimes make a correct radiological diagnosis difficult.	2.126691971633045
The trauma history and an exact, clinical examination help to verify the injury, as do comparative X-ray studies of the uninjured side when necessary (but not routinely).	2.089871174586989
Unlike other anatomical areas, most elbow injuries - even in the growing skeleton - are treated operatively.	2.1272043743738367
Hereby, the growth plates have to be respected using minimal amounts of small implants.	2.4808687739475435
Additional immobilization in a cast for 2 - 4 weeks is necessary in most cases but does not lead to a functional deficit - in contrast to adults.	2.582095664852813
The implants should be removed as early as possible.	2.2011939163718126
Despite all therapeutic efforts, a significant number of late sequelae, such as malunions and functional impairment, can be seen.	2.5688904614374106
The rate of long-term complications increases in cases of untreated displacement of fragments or joint instability.	2.5116183744922758
Corrective measures are performed only in selected cases and after the growth plates are closed.	2.5223688158976487
Our own treatment regime is demonstrated using exemplary clinical cases of the different injuries and the results of a long-term follow-up study on sports injuries of the elbow in children.	2.727615895618867
Errors in diagnosis and therapy, as well as possible complications, are pointed out.	2.8206705567571593
2-adrenergic agonists, mimicking the action of the inhibitory transmitter norepinephrine, cause antinociception due to postsynaptic inhibition of spinothalamic projection neurons, presynaptic inhibition at the central nervous system termination of primary sensory nerves, presynaptic inhibition of brainstem noradrenergic neurons and a generalized decrease in central nervous system sympathetic efferent activity.	1.8022881013210814
There is a mutual potentiation of antinociceptive effects of clonidine and morphine.	2.0537166729072207
Clonidine is used in chronic pain states for treatment of neuropathic, neuralgic and deafferentiating pain.	2.498951362793768
Based on a meta-analysis of the studies published in the years 1996-1996, the therapeutic efficacy of systematically administered clonidine was evaluated in chronic pain states.	2.4490896428720945
Out of 403 screened published studies, only 9 fulfilled the selection criteria.	2.0294563654035893
Although three studies demonstrated statistically significant improvement in pain scores, the improvement in pain relief in these cases was slight.	2.4105474878306388
Long-term treatment was successful in a few responders over a period of 17 months.	2.5129720877825203
Hyperalgesia caused by sympathetically maintained pain was relieved by topical (transdermal) application of clonidine.	1.985528085478354
Based on this evaluation a grade C recommendation is derived, which relates to responders.	1.929231953506119
Successful treatment is expected only in pain states with increased sympathetic nervous system activity.	2.186032441722263
Therefore, in chronic pain, treatment with systemic clonidine is of no significant value.	2.313441219568275

For the maintenance of muscle relaxation vecuronium bromide was used.	2.2704476226320067

No anticholinergic agents were used at the end of operation since they are known to interfere with bowel motility.	2.4296715094096966
In order to determine gastro-intestinal motility, the H2 exhalation test was used.	2.135481978763612
Lactulose is broken down by bacteria once it enters the colon, and H2 is released, taken up by the vascular system and exhaled.	1.8960916776790577
Postoperatively, patients were asked to exhale into a 20-ml syringe every 10 min.	2.1359624948668454

All three groups of patients were comparable in age, height and body weight.	2.560280356738127
Also, the duration of operation was comparable in all three groups.	2.8181875764492803

The present study deals with long-term dimensional changes in cemented Müller-type total hip endoprostheses.	2.2799075804259603
Creep and wear contribute to different extents to the dimensional changes in polyethylene.	2.0760605700574915
The total amount of polyethylene wear is represented by the displacement of the femoral head into the socket.	2.2630914940811633
Within the first postoperative years, the head shifts up to a relatively high rate of about 0.5 mm per year.	2.672105776017278
This rate diminishes after 5 years to an average of about 0.1 mm (ceramics) and 0.2 mm (metal) per year.	2.062991418196723
Values exceeding 0.2 mm per year for the shift of the femoral head are considered to be unfavourable with regard to a probable loosening of the prosthesis.	2.4181815502098565
In this study we determined the orientation of the centre of the prosthetic head in relation to the wire marker of the polyethylene cup, comprising in all 369 total hip prostheses.	1.9286614443358698

Using metal heads (Protasul-2 and Protasul-10) this rate could only be measured in 71 % (n = 109) of the prostheses (61.5 months).	2.232993782492799
The combination ceramics-polyethylene produces half of the total amount of wear produced by metal-polyethylene.	2.1625203303830567
Younger patients should preferably be treated with a ceramic ballhead.	2.612729293567097
The so-called amyopathic dermatomyositis is a rare variant of dermatomyositis which has attracted increasing interest during the last years.	2.483727921979105
Crucial for the diagnosis is the exclusion of myositis by clinical examination, EMG and histology.	2.6318369714125223
Furthermore, longterm supervision of patients is advisable in order not to miss the appearance of early signs of myositis.	2.1556258573633413
The longest reported follow-up of amyopathic dermatomyositis patient is 4 years; however, it cannot be excluded that these cases will eventually culminate in classical dermatomyositis.	2.143738374707746
In this paper we describe two cases and discuss the differential diagnosis and therapy; also, the term "Premyopathic dermatomyositis" is proposed, to indicate that the full picture is to be expected in most cases.	2.2620692297831684

Making a diagnosis based on histology may prove difficult.	2.3852056934739716
Because of hematogenous formation of metastases and bad prognosis in most cases we recommend that the surgical intervention be followed by the well tolerated systemic chemotherapy with Doxorubicin and Ifosfamid.	2.2498449819525748
This study compares the results of the outpatient-based program of the Cochlear Implant Center Ruhr with inpatient-based rehabilitation, which is almost exclusively performed in Germany.	2.1431025096758978
The Department of Otorhinolaryngology at the University of Essen in Germany provided 52 patients with either 22- or 24-channel Nucleus cochlear implants from March 1996 to July 1999.	1.9471809719917097
Almost all patients (n=49) were rehabilitated on an outpatient basis, which is the standard in many cochlear implant centers outside Germany.	2.3656371730807346
Syringe drivers are used in anaesthetics, intensive care and emergency medicine to deliver small volumes of highly potent drugs with continuous, constant and reproducible flow.	1.9533177089885465
For early recognition of interruptions of the drug delivery caused by occlusion of the infusion system, an alarm is triggered as soon as the system pressure exceeds a certain limit.	2.138362914395056
The sensitivity of this alarm depends on the flow rate, type-specific cut-off pressure and the elastic parameters of the infusion system.	2.342258180823199
The sudden release of pressure built up in the system after occlusion occurred can cause delivery of an uncontrolled drug bolus and hence an additional hazard.	1.9278726900924257
Methods: Six syringe drivers that are widely used in clinical practice were tested for alarm delay and bolus delivery in the event of an occlusion in the system.	2.1201874674408145
First, the alarm pressures at flow rates of 10, 50 and 100 ml/h were measured.	2.002373680096745
Then the alarm delay time and bolus volumes post-occlusion were assessed, using a basic infusion system (syringe+single infusion set).	1.9473524381904501
Finally, several alterations to the system like extension, tap battery with germ filters or branching were made and their impact on alarm delay and bolus volume measured.	1.8099195228038731
Results: Because of the great differences in alarm pressures between the devices tested, there were marked differences in the alarm delay at same flow rates.	2.3598319675617616
Predictably, there was an indirect proportional link between alarm delay and flow rate.	2.5181644872901354
Using the basic infusion system, alarm delays between 23 s and 143 min were measured.	1.9618515322362144
In the other devices, release of the pressure in the occluded system caused boli of 0.5-7 ml.	2.1370192515754
Tap batteries, parallel running syringe drivers or trapped air in the system, however, caused marked increase in both alarm delay (107%) and bolus volume (+147%).	2.0282079778046227
Discussion: Unidentified occlusions of the system cause grave malfunctioning of syringe drivers.	2.2443301849929136
While applying highly potent drugs, the discontinuation of drug delivery with subsequent bolus application can cause vital danger to the patient.	1.9329804967289
As a result of the significant time delays in the pressure alarms, the devices tested do not provide sufficient protection against unrecognized system occlusion.	1.923238683779715
Syringe drivers with adjustable alarm pressure can be set close to the actual infusion pressure.	2.154535794129636
A further important point is that one should aim at a reduction in the elastic properties of the infusion set because of the great impact on alarm delay and bolus volume.	2.3281844071375093
Because the overall results of conservative treatment for distal radial fractures have been unsatisfactory, it is rarely used.	2.4862360339396794
However, minimally invasive methods such as stabilization by external fixation and percutaneous K-wire pinning are being increasingly used.	2.11260438088802
A justified indication for the use of K-wire pinning is that it provides an opportunity to achieve good and very good short- and long-term anatomic and functional results.	2.468658949799303
Short-term supplementary immobilization with a minimized plaster cast or protective external fixation is generally considered to be useful.	2.274462717362645

The indications therefore need to be further specified.	2.534884270992938

Classical stable plate osteosynthesis with its anatomical repositioning, absolute stability between fragments and medial support should only be applied to joint fractures and spongy bone.	1.958616754508367
In cortical bone, the anatomical reposition connected with the plate promotes bone necrosis along the fracture and prevents callus formation.	2.0890148061803866
Direct cortical synthesis, a method also known as "primary bone healing", serves the bone's revascularisation and is not necessarily aimed at healing.	2.066438417458658
Along the shaft of long bones, elastic plate osteosynthesis, a biological method, is safer than and superior to the rigid technique.	2.0509208065503897
This even applies to short oblique and transverse fractures insofar as nailing does not appear feasible.	1.9147356942088514
Elasticity is achieved by leaving a flexible stretch of at least 2 - 4 holes, i.e.	2.3459049145239947
as long as possible, without screws over the fracture and by employing a titanium plate.	2.3823314555104305
Thus, there is no punctate fatigue leading to plate breakage.	2.435264637673811
The fitting of third fragments is deliberately left out.	2.1265438542987782
The same applies to all kinds of compression with lag screws, tension devices or DC-gliding holes - and this with the intention of allowing micromovements in the fracture's fissure.	1.7717630377061728
Periost and muscle are not removed and the fracture is not examined.	2.325778527356396
Healing occurs spontaneously via a fixating callus forming within the first 3 - 6 weeks out of the periost-soft tissue combination.	2.2284836394260736
Histomorphological investigation dates the first woven- bone bridges between the fragments to 3 weeks subsequent to the accident.	1.9847313221037544
In Göttingen University trauma centre, 87 fractures have been attended to over 2 years using this technique.	2.029780593930492
Despite considerable soft-tissue damage, no delayed bone healing, pseudoarthrosis or bone infection has been observed.	2.2220363929624876
The risks of elastic plate osteosynthesis lie in unbiological and exaggerated reposition methods, too short a flexible stretch, and insufficient anchorage of the screws.	1.8349814601519396

The pH value of the pus liquid was 6.164  +/-  0.233.	2.2595399541379266
The calculated mean osmotic pressure of the pus liquid was 7910  +/-  1455 mm Hg, whereas the measured physical pressure inside the abscess was 49  +/-  13 mm Hg.	1.9173090322680117
Both pressure types show time-dependent pressure curves.	2.360217392062541
With time, the real pressure inside the abscess cavity increases, whereas the osmotic pressure decreases.	2.2692575859392843
There was no relationship between the two pressure types and the different species of microorganisms responsible for the inflammation.	2.450981169882215
The results of the study reveal that abscesses can be regarded as osmotically active systems, and the mechanism by which the abscess is formed might be as follows.	2.403637614576599

In different joint diseases, it becomes imbalanced and the destruction of the cartilage supersedes the repair.	2.196329245469844

Axillary block is a common anaesthetic technique for operations on the hand and forearm.	2.52813504955132
This implies a small number of blocks for each anaesthetist.	2.495293618774824
The present study was designed to assess whether it is possible to teach this technique and use it with an adequate degree of success under these conditions.	2.1377170004892014
We used a nerve stimulator and studied whether the success of the block under these conditions is independent of anaesthetist's experience in this technique.	1.994489148269571
Furthermore, we examined other factors involved in the success of the block.	2.637698263240352
The study included 112 patients subjected to elective surgery of the upper extremity; all received an axillary block.	2.1611855273718645
We used a nerve stimulator and injected mepivacaine 1% without adrenaline.	1.911178337754205
The following parameters were recorded: the number of blocks to date performed by the anaesthetist; the minimal current required for nerve stimulation; the dose of local anaesthetic; the time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery; the duration of surgery; and the quality of sensory and motor blockade after 10, 20, and 30 min.	2.4449586465296322
Sensory blockade was assessed by the pinprick method (no blockade, analgesia, anaesthesia); motor blockade was judged by comparing the muscle strength of both arms (no blockade, paresis, paralysis).	1.8504366661258342
Data were analyzed using the Mann-Whitney test, with P<0.05 considered statistically significant.	2.0996885332461623
Of the 112 blocks, 95 (85%) were successful; 17 (15%) failed and the patients required general anaesthesia.	2.085559426332509
Eight of the successful blocks showed a decrease in analgesic quality after >=70 min and required additional analgesics or general anaesthesia.	2.0975991235457054
We found no correlation between the experience of the anaesthetist and the success of the block.	2.476280499530794
The dose of mepivacaine was higher in the success group (5.9 vs. 5.3 mg/kg).	2.2301361752153297
Complete sensory blockade was more frequently achieved for the median, ulnar, and radial nerves than for the musculocutaneous and cutaneous brachii medialis (Fig.	1.8339466870960814
The frequency of complete sensory blockade (anaesthesia) had increased by 21.9% between the 20th and 30th min.	1.962124468067248
Complete motor blockade was less often achieved than sensory blockade (Fig.	2.1349231071040777
Using the method of electrostimulation, the axillary block is an appropriate anaesthetic technique that can be applied in a hospital where each anaesthetist only occasionally performs it.	2.3502760812777392
Prior to injection of the local anaesthetic, the current for nerve stimulation should be reduced to <0.5 mA.	2.329050591570513
The time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery should be no less than 30 min because complete sensory blockade can more often be achieved.	2.1653421495104284
Vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) was discovered 10 years ago as a growth factor that can regulate angiogenesis and in addition the permeability of blood vessels.	2.082008721765747
Numerous studies have revealed that it is essential for normal embryonic development and that it plays a major role in physiological and pathological events of angiogenesis in adults.	2.167729604116442
It is unique in that its expression is regulated directly by hypoxia.	2.097194304560485
These properties are now being exploited in attempts aimed at the induction of new blood vessels in pathological situations such as ischemic heart disease.	1.9986380128980457
Five VEGF forms of 121 to 206 amino-acids are produced from a single gene by alternative splicing.	1.915284590871463
Cells expressing VEGF usually express several forms simultaneously.	2.1966487243657395
VEGF121 does not contain exons 6 and 7 of the gene and consequently lacks a heparin binding ability.	2.1432274947064847
However, this form is fully  active as an inducer of angiogenesis, and as a blood vessel permeabilizing agent.	2.0113088933281618
Exon 6 and 7 contain 2 independent heparin binding domains.	2.2521462022595515
The VEGF form containing exon 7 (VEGF165) and the vascular endothelial growth factor form containing exon 6 (VEGF145) display similar biological potencies raising the question of why so many VEGF forms are required.	1.921799621005672
It was found that VEGF121 diffuses better because it does not bind to heparan-sulfate proteoglycans.	1.943014585162389
In contrast, VEGF145 binds to extracellular matrix ad is released from it slowly.	1.8760986055944533
When the receptor binding properties of VEGF121 and VEGF165 were compared it was found that VEGF165 binds to a class of VEGF receptors that is not recognized by VEGF121.	1.8596952824790776
These receptors are encoded by the neuropilin-1 gene, and we have recently found that the related neuropilin-2 gene also encodes a VEGF165 receptor.	1.9706357925546174
We have recently found evidence indicating the neuropilins form complexes with another VEGF receptor, VEGFR-1.	1.8713293780987923
However, the biological function of this complex remains to be elucidated.	2.3401238338939727

The typical clinical features of myasthenia gravis are weakness and excessive fatiguability of striated muscles that increases during the course of the day or after strenous exercise.	2.1087093611113903
Ocular muscle involvement with ptosis (in 50%) and diplopia (in 25%) are the most common initial signs.	2.3069596230393583
The disease can progress to bulbar muscles and to all other striated muscles (generalized myasthenia).	1.9704826545535938
The muscle fatiguability and a fluctuating course can mislead to a diagnosis of neurasthenia.	2.1366585501316084
Since the treatment of myasthenia gravis is directed at the pathogenetic mechanisms of the disease an early diagnosis is of great significance for the course of the disease.	2.798567849348401
Also, a false positive diagnosis of myasthenia has to be avoided because of the potentially hazardous side effects of the therapy.	2.9343547244250665
The mainstay of the diagnosis is the history and a subtle clinical examination with tests of excessive muscle fatiguability.	2.3381991433393376
The injection of edrophonium (Tensilon), the electrodiagnostic testing after repitive stimulation (decrement test) and the testing for serum antibodies against acetylcholin receptors have to be performed to secure the diagnosis of myasthenia.	2.4197583938713008
The edrophonium test and the decrement test can yield false positive results in other neuromuscular diseases.	2.1062166093314088
Antibodies are present in 50% of ocular myasthenia and in 80-90% of the generalized form.	2.305496722613897
The Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome, other neuromuscular diseases, mitochondrial diseases, diseases of the cranial nerves, botulism and the rare congenital myasthenic syndromes have to be considered as differential diagnosis.	2.1306136251547367

Primary vasculitides are of unknown origin while secondary vasculitides may be caused by drugs, malignancy or infection.	2.063716996999036

Immunologically mediated vasculitis secondary to infection may be due to a predisposing reactivity of the patient's immune system.	2.4964931830023596
After successful treatment of the infection, the vasculitis usually subsides.	2.490446080467793
Therefore, all patients with vasculitis should be evaluated for underlying infection.	2.712947791951578

It is most common on the face, especially in the nasolabial folds, and on the neck below the mandibular line.	2.3869534782203177

The lesion persists with no tendency to spontaneous regression.	2.2245531456429277
Histopathologically, it consists of elaborate, epithelialized galleries connected to the skin surface at multiple points.	2.1068400924536

Intralesional corticosteroid injection, cryosurgery and isotretinoin are not always very effective.	2.144212914549386
Sometimes complete excision of the lesion is necessary.	2.97739043092689
The draining sinus is a special form of scar analogous to the pilonidal cyst.	2.0307154573211057

Results: The response rate was 23%.	2.4995148037263646
The data show that 78% of the anaesthesiologists use epidural or intrathecal analgesia in the therapy of chronic pain.	2.1983593773267454
Local anaesthetics are used by 85% of these anaesthesiologists, followed by morphine (72%), clonidine (48%), buprenorphine (34%), baclofen (20%), fentanyl (13%) and sufentanil (10%).	1.96357541155474
For most of the treatments local anaesthetics are used, again followed by opioids und clonidine.	2.3175477039092396
In the 137 answering pain clinics 79.821 epidural and intrathecal analgetic treatments are performed per year.	1.916826718133693
Discussion: Epidural and intrathecal pain therapy is frequently used in Germany and Austria, either as a complementary or alternative treatment to systemic pain therapy.	2.093440389228202
Local anaesthetics followed by opioids are the most commonly used medicaments for this treatment.	2.374196444004596
For some of the applied substances neurotoxicological data are lacking.	2.517131857763692
The use of these substances has to be considered very carefully.	2.850410616529652
Intraartial conduction disturbances (IACD) are the known substrate of re-entrant atrial arrhythmias and their diagnosis is important for the selection of proper therapy.	2.2168065527200858
Signs of IACD can be missed on the standard ECG, and signal averaged (SA) P wave analysis has proved valuable for the evaluation of electrophysiological (EPS) properties of atrial myocardium.	1.9483254491226814
Unfavourable EPS effects of RAA pacing are known to electrophysiologists, but this aspect is rarely considered in normal practice, and RAA based pacing modes remain standard even for pts.	1.9833416218876565
We examined and compared EPS effects of different atrial pacing modes using two diagnostic tools: IEGM obtained from two atrial leads of biatrial pacing system (via telemetry) and time domain analysis of SA P wave in 22 pts.	1.8063026822812385
with BiA pacing system (implanted due to atrial arrhythmias and IACD).	2.1267791898249193
The results showed that different atrial pacing modes influence atrial activation timing parameters differently: RAA pacing aggravates IACD in comparison to sinus rhythm; the effects of CS pacing is less visible.	1.9741039305495025
BiA pacing normalises all atrial activation times.	2.3409979256383666
The normalisation of SA P wave duration, reduction of SA P wave dispersion, increasing of RMS 20 and decreasing of LAS 5 and finally abolition of presence of late atrial potentials in most of pts.	1.873610292562236
indicates beneficial effects of BiA pacing (in pts.	2.45961093153698
with IACD) in comparison to sinus rhythm and RAA pacing.	2.726855885691019
Unfavourable EPS effects of RAA pacing in patients with IACD indicates suitability the need for alternative (resynchronising) atrial pacing modes.	2.3327623131924176
Time domain analysis of SA P wave is a valuable and sensitive diagnostic tool for non-invasive evaluation of EPS effects of different modes of atrial pacing.	2.2840718499977464

Chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis may occur in children, adolescents and adults, but has not been found in newborns or babies either in our series or in the literature.	2.3601729135008815
Symptoms suggesting an acute disease like fever are uncommon, but a primary chronic course with symptomatic and asymptomatic periods is typical.	1.9292533455744503
Pain and swelling are the main symptoms; painless masses are rare.	2.3420486782380654
In children and adolescents the clavicle and metaphyseal regions of long bones are typical sites of chronic abacterial osteomyelitis.	2.12279022667997
In adults the clavicles or the first two ribs are mainly affected with synovitis of the adjacent joints, but the long bones are rarely involved.	2.14873093159504
Laboratory findings are non-specific but important for the differential diagnosis.	2.6660841056263074
The sedimentation rate and c-reactive protein might be elevated.	2.3113107046553103
The X-ray examination shows osteolytic, sclerotic or mixed bony changes and, in case of a diaphyseal involvement, onionskinlike periosteal bone formation may be present, suggesting a malignant process.	2.1583196148152206
In late stages sclerotic bone formations may be seen as a rest.	2.282573993282117
Uni- or multifocal lesions can be detected by bonescan, as can asymptomatic lesions.	2.335209461585799
Magnetic resonance imaging shows gross signal intensity differences both in the bone and perifocal soft tissue and involvement of the synovium with gadolinium DPTA enhancement in T1-weighted images.	2.0017008159930016
In early stages of the disease granulocytes, microabscesses and new bone formations might suggest bacterial osteomyelitis that cannot be differentiated by histology.	2.1654968113828432
In intermediate phases lymphocytic and plasmacellular infiltrates are found, whereas in late phases sclerotic bone formations and fibrosis of the bone marrow are seen histologically.	2.1297674574709324
In chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis, all clinical, radiological and histological findings, as well as negative bacteriological cultures, are mandatory and will allow a definitive diagnosis to be made.	2.20377737027148
The disease may be uni- or multifocal, and new bone lesions may occur over time, as well as skin manifestations, which can be found years before or after bone involvement.	2.4278188296391017
The association with dermatological diseases and/or synovitis led to the acronym SAPHO syndrome (synovitis, acne, pustulosis, hyperostosis, osteomyelitis).	2.1088956413172912
For the treatment non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are effective for pain relief, reduction of swelling and dysfunction.	2.1812660965531525
Antibiotics have been used in several series and are not effective.	2.719776103196986
Major surgery is not recommended even for recurrences, and the prognosis for growth and function is excellent in the long term despite recurrences over several years.	2.451114189335249

50 %) due to chromosomal aberrations.	2.756094602338532
An undefined proportion of the other half may be due to immunological incompliances.	2.471609241159048
The basis for this assumption is the fact that the maternal immune system recognizes paternal antigens and rejects them.	2.129953486172387
The initial hypothesis that such immune reaction is due to a high similarity between the maternal and paternal HLA systems (HLA sharing) is most likely incorrect.	2.0756276979666146

Several placebo-controlled studies have been performed.	3.0679892900976586

Sevoflurane, like all currently used volatile anaesthetics, is degraded by carbon dioxide absorbents.	2.030206442295643
The most significant degradant is a haloalkene known trivially as "compound A".	2.036379285555327
Compound A is nephrotoxic in rats and, at higher doses, in nonhuman primates, causing proximal tubular necrosis.	1.986254527209716
There has been much interest in the potential for compound A toxicity in humans.	2.1567095258987394
Inhaled compound A concentrations are greatest at low flow rates, high sevoflurane concentrations, warmer absorbent, barium hydroxide vs soda lime, and drier absorbent.	1.7968869676905475
Typical inspired compound A concentrations during low-flow and closed-circuit sevoflurane anaesthesia in humans are 8-24 and 20-32 ppm with soda lime and barium hydroxide lime, respectively.	1.8818475960248133
Renal effects of compound A production during sevoflurane anesthesia have been examined in surgical patients and volunteers, using standard (creatinine clearance, serum BUN and creatinine) and experimental (urine excretion of protein, glucose, NAG, GST, AAP) markers of renal function.	1.7505874129527796
Investigations to date in surgical patients show similar renal effects of low-flow sevoflurane, low-flow isoflurane or high-flow sevoflurane.	2.525999744098124
There have been no case reports of compound A-associated renal injury in humans.	2.138198061256662
In volunteers, one study found changes in experimental but not conventional renal markers, while other investigations show no significant changes in either standard or experimental markers.	1.8769250346885784
The mechanism of compound A nephrotoxicity in rats appears to involve metabolism to glutathione and cysteine conjugates, and their subsequent renal uptake and metabolism by pathways that are different in rats and humans.	1.8024378658260856

Patients with decreased IL-12 levels revealed also a thorax trauma and pneumonia but all patients succumbed.	2.0331495774495987

This article reviews the pathogenesis and clinical and imaging findings in shoulder impingement syndrome.	2.0356636629134206
Shoulder impingement is caused by compression of the supraspinatus tendon underneath the coracoacromial arch, mainly in forward flexion of the arm.	2.139169904298353
Different stages of impingement syndrome are described.	2.3323197423971016
Stage I relates to edema and hemorrhage of the supraspinatus tendon.	2.2161205489328264

Trauma scores in emergency medicine quantitatively characterise the severity of trauma victims' injuries and physiologic derangements.	2.34241676808603
They are used to detect and assess patients and have applications in guiding patient care and early therapeutic decisions.	2.1549592853658486
In the pre-clinical setting, an effective trauma index meets the following criteria: - It is highly reliable with regard to identifying high- and low-risk patients.	2.1690552101409555
- It has high face-validity.	2.2653044632135773
- It has high inter- and intra-rater reliability.	2.257456855757628
- It is easy to use and allows rapid, accurate measurements.	2.3266131509676318
The most widely accepted injury severity index is probably the Injury Severity Score (ISS).	2.122732792805054
It is calculated as the sum of the squares of the three most severely injured body regions, and was originally developed as a means to standardise the description of injuries sustained in motor vehicle accidents.	1.942833431842969
The Trauma Score (TS) represents the gold standard of physiologic scoring of injury severity.	2.2234120438366847
It summarises the numerical assessments of the central nervous and cardiopulmonary system functions.	2.278709283115385
The recently developed Mainz Emergency Evaluation Score (MEES) is based upon numerical specification of the vital signs, including a pain scale, and has been designed as a dynamic score.	1.9652040218658113
Nevertheless, limitations of the established trauma score systems have been described.	2.4806753084258317
Mortality and patient outcome do not strictly correlate with injury severity scoring.	2.1466881638868385
In addition, intubated or paralysed patients were excluded from outcome studies since the scoring systems lacked options for evaluation of pathophysiological conditions after therapeutic interventions.	1.827550649302751
Thus, therapeutic efficacy could hardly be assessed, and subsequent scoring during time periods was impossible.	1.9424979048803324
The accurate definition of comprehensive evaluation of a trauma victim is challenging, for example, "pain" as chosen in the MEES must be regarded as a highly desirable piece of information although its rating may prove difficult, especially when classifying unconscious patients.	1.9320034222218176
Further criticisms of the above-mentioned trauma indices could include omission of the trauma victim's age, gender, pre-injury health status, or the influence of alcohol or additional medication.	2.233294660061927
Moreover, questioning the interrater reliability of injury severity scoring, a recent study revealed bias in assigning values to trauma patients: trained raters classified injury severity with significantly higher indices than less experienced researchers.	1.7161306492434123
If trauma indices in pre-hospital emergency medicine were relied upon as the only means of evaluating a trauma patient and guiding therapeutic approaches, significant numbers of trauma victims requiring major interventions would be missed.	1.9339855316673302
Resuscitative treatment regimens must not be based solely upon indices, since, e.g., in states of shock injury scores do not correlate with fluid resuscitative requirements.	2.0350279728645635
Many multiple-trauma patients do benefit from controlled ventilation in clinical experience even though pulse oximetry values are within the physiological range, and the administration of analgesics or even pre-hospital anaesthesia has often proved advantageous for trauma patients in the field.	2.3194464352088486
Providing the opportunity of subsequent patient evaluation and the efficacy of acute care, the MEES has been developed as a dynamic scoring system.	2.402101488827954
This design is extremely desirable and must be regarded as an indispensible criterion for future scoring systems.	2.2207497952687394
In view of the peculiarities of field emergency medicine, pre-hospital indices do have limitations.	2.097249747153431
The parameters "unknown patient", time pressure, unprecise measurements, lack of diagnostic facilities, incomplete evaluation, and limited statistical power cannot be eliminated.	1.8956033265187318
Accurate prediction of outcome within early time-frames is therefore not possible.	2.0796488225650935

Two tumors showed heterogeneous differentiation with small-cell and adenocarcinomatous components, and five had only adenocarcinoma.	2.1337133202319745
The interval between histological evidence of SCLC and adenocarcinoma was 3 months-5 years.	2.0879253996120535
From the specific findings in the respective patients we can offer two possible explanations for changing differentiation in SCLC after chemotherapy: (a) a primarily heterogeneously differentiated tumor with selection of adenocarcinomatous component under chemotherapy, and (b) an independently developed adenocarcinoma after successful chemotherapy of SCLC, as patients with treated SCLC are known to have an increased risk of non-SCLC.	2.0044762114952173
However, therapy-induced alteration of differentiation seems much more unlikely.	2.2359705696905396

The cumulative UVB dose was significantly lower in the balneophototherapy group (0.9 J/cm2) as compared to the UVA/B monotherapy group (2.0 J/cm2).	2.2516482828752564
Balneophototherapy was well tolerated by patients with atopic dermatitis and no side effects were observed.	2.450879363246998
We conclude that balneophototherapy expands the therapeutic options for patients with subacute atopic dermatitis.	2.386400901982249

It is mandatory to differentiate between traumatic and atraumatic instability when treating shoulder instability.	2.1933023970495316
The traumatic instability is characterized by secondary lesions (Bankart lesion, Hill-Sachs lesion, overstretching of the capsule), which are caused at the time of primary dislocation.	2.413350255908356
The quality of the capsule has to be considered in close relationship to the appearance of the Bankart lesion.	2.754485058942161
The stronger the capsule, the greater the external force has to be in order to surmount the resistance caused by the capsule.	2.7470891436741773
The damage to the glenoid rim makes it possible to draw conclusions about the condition of the capsule.	2.429590167433557
In cases of atraumatic instability, secondary lesions are normally absent.	2.059559091208279
These instabilities are often caused by laxity of the capsule.	2.230496803750301
When stabilizing, a shoulder two criteria have to be taken into consideration: stability and function.	2.4216219790966758
Reattachment of the labrum alone will not guarantee stability.	2.3945988021077422
Additionally, the overstretched capsule has to be shortened or shifted.	2.3976307486356796
Both criteria are decisive for the success of the stabilizing operation.	2.524960748975166

Tyrosinemia type I is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase resulting in accumulation of tyrosin and its degradation products (succinylacetoacetone mainly).	1.8301182218596421
There are three main forms of the disease: the acute form with manifestation in newborn infants and the subacute and the chronic form in children older than one year of age.	2.047402359734247
Experimental data and clinical as well as postmortem experiences have indicated that subdural hematomas are less frequent in acceleration injuries in traffic accidents compared to falls or assaults.	2.18285260845157
The present report demonstrates that this does not hold true in the same way for bridging vein ruptures (one of the predominant causes for subdural bleedings).	2.1199343555893346
Ruptures of these vessels without subdural bleeding (SDB) are only seldom mentioned in the literature.	1.9987986429554365
However, if no SDB is present, no one will look for these structures.	2.0751592682874564
In our institute a systematic analysis of the bridging veins in all cases of lethal blunt head injury is made: prior to the careful morphological preparation we investigate these vessels by radiographic imaging after filling with contrast medium.	2.0453320838894324
6 car passengers (age between 4 and 31 years) which suffered a lethal head injury were examined in the last year.	2.303037885363709
In 1 case the base of the skull was broken and in 3 cases no skull fracture was present; no serious focal brain injury had occured in these 4 cases, but 3 victims had signs of diffuse brain injury.	1.9798234100538323
In 5 cases a direct impact of the head against the interior of the car was obvious.	2.2759908009436454
In one case (survival for 3 days) a minor SDB (20 ml) was present and the ruptures had been closed by thrombosis; another victim died at the scene.	1.969721161060727
The other 3 victims survived between 4 and 15 hours without developing SDB and without closing of the ruptures by thrombosis.	1.9136266521266962
This combination is surprising and shows that our knowledge concerning the relationship between bridging vein ruptures and SDB is restrictred.	2.1075497533072256
The frequency of bridging vein lesions in severe head injuries is likely underestimated in the clinical as well as in the postmortem literature.	2.4061553159580686
A rapid increase of intracranial pressure after the accident resulting in a collapse of the cerebral circulation is probably responsible for the absence of the SDB in the presented cases.	2.4482058234175677
Implantable hearing aids can form the basis of new surgical techniques for dealing with hearing problems originating in the inner ear, provided they are fully implantable.	2.067491787969482
Accordingly, a comprehensive, interdisciplinary, combined project was initiated at the ENT clinic of the University of Tübingen which was to conclude with operations to improve hearing via fully implantable hearing aids.	1.9387138482192148
A novel electromechanical transducer for implantable hearing aids based on the piezoelectric principle is described.	2.364176843324615
Unlike the piezoelectric transducers reported so far, this transducer does not rely on the bimorphic principle but on a circle-shaped, heteromorphic combination system consisting of a piezoceramic disc and metal membrane.	1.7814065681859
The transducer can be hermetically sealed and is designed for implantation into the mastoid.	2.0585879296051868
Transfer of mechanical oscillations to an ossicle in the middle ear is effected by a directly fixed coupling rod or via suitable coupling elements.	1.9190598275571615
The transducer is highly tuned with a resonance frequency at the upper end of the spectral transfer range (greater than 10 kHz).	2.047236154683743
At low and middle frequencies of up to 1 kHz, these vibration amplitudes correspond to sound-pressure levels of around 90 dB SPL.	2.0329163051757746
At higher frequencies of up to 10 kHz, the output level increases to about 130 dB SPL.	2.231114680988933
Nonlinear distortions are also very small at the highest levels (less than 0.1%) throughout the whole transfer range.	2.0409661243200476
Electric power consumption at maximum levels is in the range of a few microwatts and is therefore significantly lower than that of electromagnetic systems.	2.2696898868988233
Particularly, this makes it possible to use the transducer in fully implantable hearing aids for rehabilitation of sensorineural hearing loss.	2.1996463241625457

Serum melatonin levels exhibit a circadian rhythm with low levels during the day, rise in the evening and maximum levels at night between 2 and 4 a.m.. The reasons for prescribing opioids were analysed by recording the diagnosis.	2.2681842518988606
The individual treatment period on an outpatient basis during these 6 months was determined, excluding, e. g. days of hospitalization.	2.224823393618641
During the two observation periods only 16.2 % (1988) and 19.5 % (1991) of the practitioners in the region of Hannover prescribed strong opioids to outpatients.	2.0483379755096602
The majority of the practitioners consisted of general practitioners and specialists in internal medicine.	2.1875338298411173
Although these two groups mainly function as family doctors who are responsible for the basic therapeutical needs of their patients, only 22.6-33.8 % of these doctors prescribed opioids to outpatients.	1.9380695854481271
In two-thirds of the patients, cancer pain was the reason for prescribing the drug.	2.469316458103897

Accordingly, the majority of patients with chronic cancer pain had been supplied with opioids only occasionally.	2.585118315548644
Our data indicate a significant undertreatment of outpatients suffering from cancer pain.	2.164994662126276

Comparing the results from the observation period in 1988 with the results from 1991 it becomes obvious that the situation has not changed.	2.3234679359749006

During a 4-month period, all telephone calls were registered and related to day, time, and origin of the call (city or county) and classified as non-urgent or emergency calls, calls appropriate to the dispatching center dialed, emergency calls to be transferred, or unspecific calls.	1.931418561516051
The EMS dispatching center received 31 286 calls, the five GPS-centers 15 256 calls; 1359 emergency calls that were directed to the police or FB needed transfer to the EMS.	1.7936811719422086
During weekdays the EMS and FB received the most calls, with a reduced frequency on Saturdays and Sundays (Table 2).	2.0141243520755325

At the German Cancer Research Center (Deutsches Krebsforschungszentrum) such a program has been developed under the name of "KonRad" (Conformal Radiotherapy).	1.8756432582697233
Although it is an independent application, it is proposed for clinical usage to supplement a planning system that is already present.	2.2607847230374047
So-called inverse planning differs from conventional 3 D planning, as the trial-and-error approach for finding good field parameters is nearly completely avoided.	1.930314895325558
Instead, the radio-oncologist is given the chance directly to specify medically oriented criteria like the prescription dose in the target volume, maximal tolerance dose values for each organ at risk and their weighting factors.	1.8560202050863972
In addition, the so-called DVH optimization allows aimed, partial overdosage, especially in parallelly structured organs in order to obtain better overall planning results.	2.164149957710438

Objective: Elevated levels of interleukin-1 (IL-1) and Interleukin-6 (IL-6) have been reported after cardiac operation, during inflammatory process and cardiac allograft rejection.	2.6006323349177864
Although several groups proved the evidence of a negative inotropic effect, the actual mechanism is not completely understood.	2.2192464236020317
Speaking generally it is possible that low molecular weight proteins are capable of altering myocardial contractility on the level of the contractile apparatus.	2.1463149175980156
Therefore this study analyzes whether IL-1 and/or IL-6 influence myocardial contractility on the level of the contractile apparatus.	2.4612893629731767
Methods: During aorto-coronary bypass operation, human muscle fibers were excised (n=32) and skinned using Triton-X-100.	1.8923919093152082
The experimental skinned fiber model excludes membrane-related factors such as receptor activation and provides direct examination of the contractile apparatus itself.	2.103358067036793
Different concentrations of IL-1 and IL-6 were applied (pIL-1/IL-6 1-2x10-5-10-11M).	2.2441417442806695
Force generation, calcium sensitivity, and velocity of force generation and relaxation were measured.	2.0677284539081544
(Experiments were carried out at optimal length, bath temperature 23 °C, and isometric conditions.)	2.0899977237559018
Results: None of the skinned muscle preparations of the human myocardium showed under the given experimental setup a significant change in contractility and relaxation after exposure to IL-1 and IL-6.	2.0437310823904857
Despite using nonphysiologic concentrations of IL-1 and IL-6 (pIL-1/IL-6 10-5M) no significant effect occurred.	2.179409894431693
Furthermore no difference in calcium-sensitivity of the contractile proteins following addition of IL-1 and IL-6 could be observed.	2.4349707404380303
Conclusions: Thus, there is no experimental evidence for direct modulation of the contractile apparatus by IL-1 or IL-6.	2.5166257592920913
Given these results it is possible to exclude some potentially negative inotropic cascades that are mediated on the level of the contractile apparatus as the molecular mechanism.	2.1393321924004733
These data show that therapies which support myocardial contractility during sepsis by stimulation of the contractile proteins do not seem to be very promising.	2.3010495943398577

However, a cause-effect relationship has not been established to date.	2.413012889796607

Aim of the study and methods: In the present study the correlation between ischemia induced ventricular tachyarrhythmias and a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials was investigated.	2.369576694609023
In 16 patients with significant coronary artery disease and survived sustained ventricular tachyarrhythmia an electrophysiologic study (EPS) was performed.	2.333529720666815
Before EPS (t1), at every stimulation interval and after induction of a ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation (VT/VF) the lactate concentration was measured in arterial blood and in the coronary sinus for calculation of the myocardial lactate extraction.	2.100444286044047
Furthermore, before investigation, after induction of a VT/VF and after a 10 minute recovery phase an analysis of the signal averaged ECG was performed.	2.1560861994334464
Nine patients showed a so-called "lactate reversal", i.e., an increase of the lactate concentration in the coronary sinus over the concentration of the arterial blood as an expression of ischemia development, during inducibility of a VT/VF (group A).	2.3724062959306202
The control group consisted of 7 patients without ischemia related VT/VF (group B).	2.1098543463278467
Results: In group A significant changes of the three late potential criteria were found between t1 and t2 (QRS:115.61 +/- 13.86 vs. 126.06 +/- 16.74, p=0.08; RMS: 25.81 +/- 22.26 vs. 13.11 +/- 10.72, p=0.01; LAS: 37.72 +/- 19.26 vs. 50.06 +/- 10.72, p=0.01).	1.7228600118751944
In group B, no significant changes could be measured.	2.609655409409076
Furthermore, the prevalence of late potentials increased in group A from 66% (t1) to 89% (t2), whereas in group B no increase was detectable.	2.1975406860202646
Conclusions: These data suggest a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials in correlation with the inducibility of ventricular tycharrhythmias due to ischemic circumstances.	2.09814129378864
Therefore the dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials can be an expression of a modification of the arrhythmogenic substrate in arrhythmia endangered patients.	2.090503835883137
Recent studies and reviews continue to report a high mortality associated with the acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), which involves a severe inflammatory reaction within the whole lung that is frequently associated with multiple-organ failure.	2.126333472912585
Important factors contributing to the poor results in severe ARDS are the aggressive procedures required to maintain sufficient arterial oxygenation, such as mechanical ventilation with high inspiratory pressures and high inspired oxygen concentrations (FiO2) which themselves contribute to the progression of the disease.	2.087567440984305
As no specific therapy that reduces or prevents the general inflammatory reaction is known, current therapy is limited to procedures that minimize peak inspiratory pressures and FiO2.	1.941859122429172
Therefore, pressure- and volume-limited ventilation modes with positive end-expiratory pressure, controlled hypercapnia, differential lung ventilation when appropriate, positioning (particularly prone), and aggressive dehydration are used.	1.957496369294022
Should these procedures fail to improve arterial gas exchange, the patients may be additionally treated by veno-venous extracorporeal gas exchange.	2.103059852982678
From April 1989 to August 1993, 89 patients were transferred to our intensive care unit for treatment of severe ARDS; 52 were treated by combining the described conventional methods without artificial gas exchange (survival rate 88%) and 37 additionally underwent artificial gas exchange (survival rate 57%).	1.9346858325385243

Complex mechanisms have evolved in mammalian cells for regulating cellular lifespan.	2.0894722616725185
Normal cells demonstrate a strictly limited growth potential and senescence after a defined number of cell divisions.	1.9627513171365054
In contrast, tumor cells often exhibit an apparently unlimited proliferation potential and are termed immortalized.	1.9603962635228942
It has been proposed that the progressive shortening of the tips of the eukaryotic chromosomes - the telomeres - is an important component of senescence and is involved in the control of cell cycle.	2.309932263797008
The enzyme telomerase adds TTAGGG repeats onto mammalian telomeres, preventing their shortening.	1.9261070508287903
Telomerase is normally inactive in most somatic cells, but detectable in tumor cells.	2.089950849552528
The activation of telomerase in malignant cancers seems to be an important step in tumorigenesis in order to gain the ability of indefinite proliferation and to become immortal.	2.300110872725049
This review describes the present knowledge of telomeres and telomerase and their role in cellular senescence and human aging.	1.98714718857202
It summarizes aspects of telomerase in cancer and its function as a diagnostic and prognostic tumor marker.	2.30932030882189

We live in an epoch that could be designated as the post-Gutenberg-era.	2.141152277889199

These electronic signs developed quickly a life of their own.	2.3026079423889
A totally new class of objects came into being, the class of virtual objects.	1.971958956253313
These are electronically transformed, completed or wholly electronically produced objects.	1.957646052116358

New patterns of socio-cultural understanding develop, that could be described as industrial feudalism.	2.149509305677403

The early complications of the technique are usually minor and late complications are rare.	2.433962058404585

Surgical intervention may be indicated in shoeproblems, for esthetic reasons or, especially in duplication of the metatarsales, because of secondary deviation of the toes and therefore shoeproblems or plantar callosities.	2.035519668750707
Preoperative analysis including x-ray is of great importance to achieve good functional and cosmetic results.	2.416102882142501

Excessive blood drainage resulting in increased transfusions occurs in 29 % of patients.	2.198364624294532

Injections with botulinum toxin type A (BTX) are considered the first-line treatment for spasmodic torticollis (ST), blepharospasm (BL) and hemifacial spasm (HFS).	1.7791800979356232
Because BTX brings only temporary and partial relief, patients frequently try other additional therapies to minimize their symptoms.	1.8493776616620161
The subjective rating of all therapies ever tried by patients with ST, BL and HFS was evaluated by using a simple questionnaire.	2.0383945499534053
Two hundred questionnaires were considered (112 TS, 54 BL, 34 HFS).	1.946376820593121
BTX was rated subjectively the best therapy in all three diagnostic groups (median: 2=good effect).	2.1854423435007373
Despite Citalopram and physiotherapy (median: 3=average effect), all other therapies were rated with a median of >=4 (=minimal effect).	2.119158517434962
Patients with ST tried 7.7, patients with BL 2.4 and patients with HFS 2.6 different types of therapy.	2.300875336116657
In conclusion, BTX is the most effective treatment for patients with ST, BL and HFS, as rated subjectively.	2.219485813938023
Further evaluation of therapies additional to BTX injections is recommended.	2.152296225176128
The perioperative morbidity and mortality is mainly influenced by the type and duration of surgery as well as the patient's preoperative state of health.	2.8257675945421057
Anesthesia per se, however, may also result in severe perioperative (patho)physiological changes, which may be both desired (e.g.	2.205432492228104
analgesia, vasodilation in vascular surgery) or detrimental (e.g.	2.1307582224407793
hypothermia, ventilatory depression) and which may differ depending on the anesthetic technique used (e.g.	2.127265667821682
general anesthesia vs. regional anesthesia).	2.436615501862255
Yet, all anesthestic techniques have in common, that their effects are not limited to the duration of the surgical intervention, but may expand far into the postoperative period.	2.476723568337288
Therefore, many trials have been performed in the past aiming to compare the impact of different anesthetic techniques on the incidence of postoperative techniques, no significant advantage of one or the other technique has been identified up to now with respect to postoperative mortality or severe morbidity.	2.5438414182534537
This finding may be due to at least three factors.	2.7358113893643843
1) Many side-effects related to anesthesia - due to close postoperative monitoring - are detected and treated early in the postoperative phase (e.g.	2.038271196590015
in the recovery room), thereby preventing serious complications.	2.3513190921840117
2) Postoperative mortality related exclusively to anesthesia probably is so low, that huge patient numbers would be required to demonstrate any significant differences between different techniques.	2.02615633273052
3) Besides the factor 'anesthesia', may other factors contribute to the anesthesia related morbidity and mortality (e.g.	2.169092105214079
the factor 'anesthetist') which are hardly quantified.	2.251672944959181
The fact that clear advantages for a single technique have not yet been demonstrated must not, however, result in anesthetic 'nihilism'.	2.1942152899157756
Rather there may be good reasons in the individual patient (e.g.	2.40573459108611
lack of a recovery room), to prefer a certain anesthetic technique or drug over another, in order to lower the individual risk of anesthesia.	2.2842716458062395
Whether the use of a certain technique - e.g.	2.699948621274301
spinal or epidural anesthesia - may contribute to a reduction of specific postoperative surgical complications (e.g.	2.292277002766339
rate of reocclusion subsequent to peripheral vascular surgery) is presently under investigation.	2.1922889334005777

1930 he became professor of surgery at the Charité.	2.2378744838687687

He took over the surgical chair in Istanbul, Turkey.	2.115640814325229
Emigrating in 1939 to the USA, he held surgical positions in hospitals at New York and accepted in 1952 the chair of Surgery at the University of Basel, Switzerland.	1.9185274608936318
Nissen died in Riehen/Basel on 22 January 1981.	2.08850371214217
Nissen was a critical observant clinician, an efficient and popular physician, a teacher and a speaker.	1.9729656485827318

M. Linehan developed "dialectical behavioral therapy" specifically to treat chronically suicidal borderline patients.	1.949103252117196
It rests on a biosocial model that assumes a disorder in the regulation of emotions and in tolerance of stress.	2.0345945738757076
The numerous dysfunctional patterns of behavior such as self-destructive behavior, inability to govern impulses or severe dissociative phenomena are regarded as attempts at problem-solving.	1.7168388467043232
This concept of therapy focuses on the continuing balance between the necessity of accepting maladaptive behavior patterns in both an intrapsychic and an interactional context while still working to change them.	1.9147820385173404
A comprehensive manual outlines the clearly structured therapy and integrates a wide choice of therapeutic strategies.	1.9846991639961609
Parallel to development of the therapy itself, a method also was developed for testing therapist adherence to the manual's guidelines, thus providing a basis for empirical evaluation.	2.1388352166683653
An initial controlled, randomized study demonstrated the significant superiority of this method to methods of unspecific psychotherapy at various levels.	2.1043816980168613
In the current endeavor to develop disorder-specific approaches to the treatment of personality disorders, "dialectical behavioral therapy" is a noteworthy model.	2.370390167326723

This leads to a failure of the corresponding software modul that results in the loss of function which is regulated through this modul.	2.4168122338360662
Especially with changing of afference through manual treatment or through needling, a replacement of the variables can be reached and this leads to normal function.	1.9977085095754181
With this hypothesis all phenomens of dysfunctions can be explained.	2.2661589467016716
Empirical data on costs of care for chronically mentally ill patients in Germany are rare.	2.2253607275110263
There is a lack of cross-sectional studies as well as of any analysis of the long-term course of mental health care costs.	2.7596110952644763
This study combines data from two cost-studies on patients with schizophrenia, conducted in the same catchment area at an interval of 15 years, to draw conclusions about the long-term course of these costs.	2.204438698061935
The direct costs of comprehensive community based mental health care had increased by 77.0% during 15 years, while the costs of a permanents stay in a long-term ward of a psychiatric hospital had increased by 78.5% in the same period.	2.148741040313304
This increase was 27 and 28.5 per cent higher than the general rise in cost of living in Germany during the interval between the two studies.	2.239461911701387
This higher-than-average increase in mental health care costs was accompanied by a much higher cost-effectiveness.	2.182633822915471
Thus, this rise of costs must be seen as a consequence of the great deficits and the resulting basic improvement of care for chronically mentally ill patients in Germany, which was demanded by an expert-commission of the government in the mid-seventies.	2.231587701171061

The CD4/CD8-ratio as a marker for the down-regulation of the cellular immune response was slightly decreased but was still in the normal range.	2.1407405721779655

The in vitro stimulation of the lymphocytes was impaired for 1 to 4 weeks.	2.297134493508161
