Both preclinical and clinical evidence support the usefulness of antidepressants in chronic pain treatment.	2.3773445994953364
Monoamine uptake inhibitors influence the neurotransmissions of noradrenaline (NA) and/or serotonin (5-HT); their effect on nociception is thought to take place predominantly within the spinal cord.	2.2426084343595205
Antidepressant drugs seem to differ in their properties as analgesics and as thymoleptics.	2.173300179912342

The analgesic profile of antidepressants was established by a metaanalysis of clinical trials on the effect of these drugs, given alone or in combination with other analgetics, in chronic pain syndromes.	2.4465156994259543
57 Clinical trials were separated into 5 groups according to their scientific quality: [1] placebo-controlled double-blind studies with high power; [2] placebo-controlled double-blind studies with low power; [3-4] open controlled studies or studies with historical controls; [5] case reports.	1.9283833298889654
A study was positive if the tested antidepressant was more effective than placebo or the compared drug or seemed beneficial with respect to the interval of its previous absence.	2.064782589822626
The most effective antidepressants in chronic pain treatment only included unselective monoamine reuptake inhibitors in the following rank order: amitriptyline > clomipramine >= desipramine >= imipramine >= doxepin.	1.8750916308750833

In this review article data of retrospective studies on the therapeutic effects of oxygen are summarized and possible indications for this therapy suggested.	2.087431223559515
Studies in infants with chronic lung disease (CLD) showed that (i) if SaO2 was kept >= 93 % via generous prescription of home oxygen, rates of sudden death were much lower than in studies where this was less generously prescribed, (ii) weight gain was significantly better with O2 therapy than without it, (iii) increasing SaO2 from 82 to 93 % by providing low-flow oxygen resulted in a 50 % reduction of pulmonary artery pressure, (iv) hypoxia could cause a significant increase in airway resistance, and (v) low-flow oxygen reduced the frequency of intermittent falls in SaO2 to < 85 % even in infants who had values of >= 90 % at rest.	1.8510389744246631
These data suggest that oxygen therapy should be considered in CLD infants if baseline SaO2 is < 93 %.	2.185543322765354
For older infants, particularly with CF, only few data are available.	2.360489831001601
Regarding the practical aspects of home oxygen therapy, provision of liquid oxygen via nasal cannulae appears to be the method of choice.	2.2655598273769764
Side effects include the risk of CO2 retention, which occurs occasionally in children with CF or sleep-related upper airway obstruction, but has not been reported for infants with CLD.	2.3161590463466757
To identify this potential side effect and to determine the exact amount of oxygen required, performance of a sleep recording of SaO2 and CO2 with and without oxygen is suggested.	2.096536221953312
In infants with CLD, home monitoring of oxygenation should also be considered.	2.2470344492516587

The detection of cytokines may elucidate the pathophysiological mechanisms that produce early systemic complications in acute interstitial (i) or necrotizing (n) pancreatitis (AP).	1.8376486015739766
The increase in the level of cytokines in the blood of patients with AP may correlate with the severity of the disease.	3.065966806662141
In a prospective clinical trial from October 1992 to August 1993, 23 patients with AP were recruited and blood samples taken for cytokine detection by commercially available Elisa kits and C-reactive protein (CRP) by laser nephelometry.	1.796466989803953
The peak of cytokine and CRP level in the first 3 days of hospitalization was used for calculation.	2.431868443738209
The IL-6 concentration in the blood reached up to 2600 pg/ml in the 1st few days, depending on the severity of AP, and dropped to almost zero in the next days, independently of the clinical course.	2.210764143140133
The differentiation of i- versus nAP, using a cutoff line of 600 pg/ml, was correct in 20 patients [87 %, sensitivity (SE): 82 %, specificity (SP): 91 %, P < 0.001].	1.9585562460392825
The blood levels of IL-8 reached a maximum of 1381 pg/ml in the 1st few days, depending on the severity of AP, and showed a correlation with the clinical course in the following days.	2.253247941176402
The peak of IL-8 blood levels indicated correctly the severity of AP in 18 out of 23 patients using a cutoff level of 200 pg/ml (accuracy: 78 %, SE: 82 %, SP: 75 %, P < 0.01).	1.9827442301949252
The CRP levels increased up to a maximum of 535 mg/l and indicated the course of AP correctly in 18 out of 22 patients (SE and SP 82 %, P < 0.01).	2.1084884174347085
In the blood samples of five patients with i- or nAP, no TNF- was detectable.	2.123492662321891
The blood levels of IL-6, and to a lesser extent of IL-8 and CRP, can predict the severity and early systemic complications of AP.	2.5202291055328496
The excessive rise in cytokines can be explained by the stimulation of immunological cells (macrophages, lymphocytes and endothelial cells) in the course of AP, inducing early systemic complications.	2.2359407379998064
Therefore, the size of the specific surface area and the distribution of the pore diameters (pores < 1 µm) of bone regeneration materials were analyzed within this study.	2.045659033218359
The analyzed hydroxyapatites were of synthetic, bovine, and phytotroph origin.	2.0292452432395587
The tricalcium phosphates and the bioglasses included only synthetic materials.	2.079419581638345

A medium surface area was found for Algipore old (4.9 m2/g) and Interpore200 (2.64 m2/g).	2.0978458918365646
All other included materials showed only small sizes of the specific surface area (Ceros80 1.8 m2/g, Ceros82 1.31 m2/g, Cerasorb 1.2 m2/g, Biobase 0.7 m2/g, Endobone 0.7 m2/g, Perioglas 0.6 m2/g, Allotropat50 0.23 m2/g, Biogran 0.2 m2/g).	1.8188998117847184

Pore sizes less than 2 nm were not found in relevant numbers.	2.3895468870521688

Both ill-defined environmental and genetic factors contribute to the development of the disease.	2.693310072127897
Allele 4 of ApoE is a genetic risk factor.	2.3946905624824684
Its presence increases the risk of developing AD.	3.012127687949217
However, presence of e4 is neither necessary nor sufficient for the disease to arise.	2.1314861416370006

Of these, mutations in the gene presenilin 1 on chromosome 14 are most frequent.	2.08375571946942

Background: Atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT) is one of the most common forms of supraventricular tachycardia in the pediatric population.	2.1978374281612383
Patients and methods: 41 children with a mean age of 9.6 (3.7-16) years with recurrent atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT) refractory to medical treatment (n=38) and recurrent syncope (n=3) underwent electrophysiologic (EP) study.	1.8559800816565932
In all patients dual AV-nodal physiology could be demonstrated during EP study and typical form of AVNRT (mean heart rate 220/min) could be induced by programmed atrial stimulation.	1.989709099417049
A steerable 7 F ablation catheter was placed at the inferoparaseptal region of the tricupid valve annulus close to the orifice of the coronary sinus with the intention to record a late fractionated local atrial electrogram during sinus rhythm.	2.0036424705781757
Starting at this point radiofrequency current (500 kHz) with a target temperature of 70 °C was delivered with the intention to ablate the slow pathway.	2.114558331343682
If a slowly accelerated junctional rhythm (<120/min) occurred during energy discharge, programmed atrial stimulation was repeated.	2.015656605192071
Otherwise radiofrequency current was delivered step by step up to a septal position next to the tricuspid valve annulus.	2.01354023178872
Slow pathway ablation was defined as lack of evidence of dual AV nodal pathways during repeated atrial stimulation.	2.1373152315825936
Slow pathway modulation was defined as maximal one atrial echoimpulse after ablation.	2.1635422933388866
Results: The number of energy applications ranged from 1-19 (median 6).	2.3339105168993495
In 35/41 patients slow pathway ablation could be achieved; in six patients the slow pathway was modulated.	2.1940875766309484
In none of the patients permanent high grade AV block was observed.	2.8087512487458253
During follow-up (mean 4.1 years) two patients had a recurrent episode of AVNRT after slow pathway modulation.	2.3054014264985945
All other patients are still free of AVNRT without medical treatment.	2.239130162993539
Conclusion: Selective radiofrequency current ablation/modulation of the slow pathway is a safe and curative treatment of AVNRT in young patients.	2.0810873197964144
Since we had the impression that there was an increase in blood loss during mammaplasties after a change in the anesthesiology department responsible, we conducted a study to compare 28 cases from each anesthesiology department.	2.257908714241027
All operations were carried out by the first author in succession using the same operative technique.	2.4398044329933377
The two groups did not differ in age, BMI, operative time, weight of resected tissue or preoperative laboratory.	2.171263158355026
Blood loss was calculated from the perioperative drop in hemoglobin and patient's blood volume.	2.1265638578803214
Blood pressure, heart rate, medication and intravenous fluid supply were obtained from the anesthetic protocols.	2.248965428314344
Results (means and standard deviations): Group I (n = 28) and [Group II (n = 28)]: total resected tissue 1862  +/-  928 g [1912  +/-  791 g]; Hb-preop.	1.819192000133467
13.6  +/-  0.9 g/dl [13.8  +/-  0.8 g/dl]; Hb-postop.	2.306183363795437
After exclusion of surgical or biological causes hemodynamic effects of the anesthetic techniques were suspected as the reason for the significant difference in blood loss.	2.3294135016761794
MAP was elevated only initially, while the heart rate was considerably elevated throughout the procedures in group II.	2.444606415344451
During anesthesia with nitrous oxide and enflurane, the dose of enflurane in group I could be limited to 0.3-0.5 % after initial i. v. administration of 60 to 100 µg sufentanil, while in group II without opioids doses of 0.5-2 % were required.	2.093845082591098
The well-known dose-dependend effect of enflurane on the peripheral vascular tone was not masked by vasoconstrictors at the operative site.	2.003508623088632
Conclusions: Blood loss during mammaplasties can be affected considerably by the anaesthetic technique - even without deliberate hypotension.	1.9852641666252155
Sufentanil can indirectly reduce the blood loss by lowering the necessary dose of enflurane.	2.2570194664161787
Blood transfusions can be avoided at mammaplasties.	2.580523317762615
Continuous epidural infusion of bupivacaine with the opioid fentanyl represents an effective analgesic method in the therapy of strong postoperative pain after major surgery.	2.1978984005983975
Preparation of the required infusion solution in syringes with a volume of 50 ml immediately prior to administration is routinely performed by nursing staff in Germany.	1.8946025072059332
The effort required for the preparation is associated with logistical and pharmaceutical difficulties.	2.429562789079358
The preparation of a mixture of bupivacaine hydrochloride 0.06% and fentanyl 0.0002% in 250 ml infusion bags at the pharmacy of the University Hospital Mainz is described.	1.8346727897846462
To determine the physicochemical stability, the concentration of bupivacaine-HCl and fentanyl was assessed using HPLC over a period of 32 days; in addition the pH values were determined.	2.044137314409994
After 32 days 95% of the bupivacaine hydrochloride and fentanyl baseline values were recorded.	2.107752079745187
The pH baseline value had decreased from 5.48-5.52 to 0.5-0.7 units.	1.917730507287948
The measured values confirm the physicochemical stability of the mixture of bupivacaine hydrochloride 0.06% and fentanyl 0.0002% over a period of 32 days.	2.0327831618940975
The infusion bag can be stored for 4 weeks at room temperature.	2.2438480530631315
The programming of a cochlear implant speech processor used by young children is often difficult, especially when the stimulus level associated with maximum auditory loudness (MAL) needs to be determined.	1.9929685681138698
Excessively high stimulation should be avoided as this can have a traumatic effect.	2.3855081985659683
The aim of this study was to determine if a relationship exists between the intraoperatively determined electrical stapedius reflex threshold (ESRT) and the postoperatively determined MAL and hearing threshold for 27 patients, each having one of three implant types.	1.7809010491064396
The question of whether the ESRT provides a practical technique to simplify, improve and accelerate speech processor programming was investigated.	1.798524551147556
For the monopolar stimulation mode used for the Med-El and Clarion implant systems, the average MAL and threshold was expressed as a percentage of the average ESRT across all electrodes.	1.9272218082267658
For the "common ground" stimulation mode used for the Nucleus implant system, a parabolic transformation was used to relate MAL and ESRT to one another.	1.9925842778180902
These transformations between MAL values calculated from the ESRT and the actual MAL values, determined psychoacoustically, diverged considerably from one another.	1.8762400196855573
Therefore, it was not possible to determine the MAL from the ESRT with certainty.	2.658919872577235
The ESRT does, however, provide a means to estimate an approximate upper boundary for the MAL, apart from its use to control implant function.	2.088194595634541
The determination of the exact MAL will still need to be determined using behavioural techniques.	2.4425302815463428

Spontaneous rupture und false aneurysms of the non-arteriosclerotic aorta are rare.	2.343238098963058
We report on a 53-year-old patient with false aneurysm due to covered rupture of the thoraco abdominal aorta following sarcoidosis initially repaired by semicircumferential aortic end-to-end anastomosis.	2.012807148939221
After 6 months local recurrence occurred and the afflicted aorta was replaced by autologous arterial graft, transferring the right iliac artery as aortic patch.	1.8875878701679696
The iliac reconstruction was performed by PTFE interposition.	2.7539740164553477
There was no specific therapy for sarcoidosis.	2.385532842353553
At 1 year follow-up there was no recurrence and the patient is free of symptoms.	3.185943382614318
In this biomechanical study the implanted Unreamed Humeral Nail (UHN) has been tested concerning bending and torsional stiffnesses.	2.009402331022859
In literature other intramedullary implants have been critisized for insufficient rotatory stability especially in transverse and short oblique fractures of the humeral shaft.	2.018714937930323
This study examined, whether the implanted UHN, as well as the UHN implanted with interfragmentary compression through a specific compression device, is able to augment torsional stiffness significantly.	2.155181457738512
To evaluate bending and torsional stiffnesses, the UHN has been compared biomechanically to the Russell-Taylor humeral nail (RT) in paired mid-shaft osteotomized cadaveric humeri.	1.6725666371098389
Identic paired comparison has been performed with the UHN without and UHN with interfragmentary compression.	2.2056607103691674
In anterior-posterior, as well as medio-lateral direction stiffness under four-point-bending is significantly higher in stabilizing with the RT.	2.1095696955155083
Under torsional loading with moments of 4 Nm, 6 Nm and 8 Nm the UHN reached more than the double torsional stiffness.	1.8282951486370018
The RT, which is only dynamically interlocked, owns a high initial "play" between bolts and nail itself.	2.109126642513824
Through additional interfragmentary compression stiffness of the UHN under four-point-bending in anterior-posterior, as well as medio-lateral direction augments significantly.	1.9513012006149162
Also under torsional loading with moments of 4 Nm, 6 Nm und 8 Nm torsional stiffness increases with interfragmentary compression significantly.	1.757717725496814
In comparison to other biomechanical studies of different autorship it is clear, that this statically interlocked intramedullary nailing of the humeral shaft is superior to non-statically interlocked types of nailing concerning their stabilizing potency in torsion and serves especially for fracture types, which are critically under rotation, as transverse or short oblique humeral shaft fractures.	1.872361893861782
While the different national health systems merge structurally, cost expansion in health care is a global challenge.	1.9810275318076902
Structural reforms have been developed during recent years in the USA which can be summarized as "managed care".	2.608588204874868
They are characterized by the evolution of an economically orientated system, in which units of medical therapy are generally handled like conventional economical goods.	2.1919154058995542
In managed-care models, patients are deliberately directed to the most economic forms of therapy.	2.318582096235265
The spectrum of medical interventions as well as diagnostic or therapeutic patterns are predefined by a system of contracted guidelines, which lead to a standardization of processes.	2.255833917135337
Financing and medical executive responsibilities fuse.	2.417649454727143
The autonomy of medical decisions is clearly reduced to enforce an integrated and economically oriented steering of the health system.	2.028670151936063
Leadership is no longer primarily confined to doctors or scientists.	2.3796443249233636
It is progressively shifting to financing institutions, managing directors or insurance companies.	1.908478369911187
Structural changes currently are expanding rapidly in the U. S. and have meanwhile led to marked regional reductions of medical costs.	1.802645325218628
Historical development, current concepts of US-managed care, its potential influence and general applicability to the German situation are discussed in an overview.	2.203413985291702
On the subject of natriuretic peptides there is a great deal of controversy, and intensive research efforts have been made studying their effects on electrolyte homeostasis.	2.254621155680049
In the early 1980s, a peptide that caused diuresis, natriuresis, and had a relaxant effect on vascular smooth muscle was discovered independently by several groups.	1.84558941420568
This was the breakthrough for the identification of natriuretic peptides, followed by the characterisation of the amino-acid sequences of several species.	2.181656036374456
Synthesis of the peptide, cloning of the encoding gene, identification and characterisation of specific receptors, as well as the development of antibodies and radioimmunoassays were rapidly accomplished.	2.2352082259225017
Research on the immunohistochemistry of cardiodilatin/atrial natriuretic peptide (CDD/ANP) and the regulation of CDD/ANP gene expression led to detection of the peptide in extra-atrial tissues.	2.101149307175574
Later on, two new peptides were discovered brain natriuretic peptide (BNP) and C-type natriuretic peptide (CNP).	2.0021309176769746
These peptides share structural features with CDD/ANP with regard to their 17-amino-acid-exhibiting loop bridged by a disulfide bond.	1.978080532678598
Another recently discovered peptide is urodilatin (URO), a renal-borne new member of A-type natriuretic peptide.	2.041766325252972
URO was isolated from human urine and consists of the same sequence as CDD/ANP, containing the 17-amino-acid residue loop of the circulating hormone with 4 additional amino acids located at the NH2-terminus of the peptide.	1.8790229454551792
Regarding physiological actions, data strongly support a close association between URO and urinary sodium excretion.	1.9395540008314232
The application of URO in animals revealed a stronger diuresis and natriuresis with a lower influence on arterial blood pressure compared to CDD/ANP-99-126.	1.9045991880681945
These results were encouraging for the use of URO in clinical trials as a tool to prevent acute renal failure (ARF) in patients following heart transplantation and for treatment of incipient ARF in patients following liver transplantation.	2.263673926966922
Summarising the results of these two studies, URO represents a new approach for not only prevention, but also for treatment of ARF following organ transplantation.	2.6923248929376533
This opens up new possibilities for the treatment of ARF of other origins in intensive care medicine.	2.372920903142448

Serological and molecular biology methods were used to investigate the evidence for a recent coxsackie-B-virusinfection.	2.453413647207268

It provides a framework for interviewing patients, as well as for physical, laboratory and imaging examinations and for selection of treatment appropriate to the level of primary care.	2.3526647786942725
Situations which call for urgent evaluation and criteria for referral to rheumatologists are described.	2.058923321610051
The appendix contains comments on signs and symptoms to differentiate arthralgia from joint swelling and on the diagnostic value of a history of joint swelling without confirmation by the physician.	2.2323720456132894
Further recommendations for the evaluation of patient history and physical and technical examinations are given in a tabular form.	2.372190472205299
The significance of laboratory and imaging procedures is discussed.	2.285074484956079
Introduction: Bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy occur twice to three times more frequently than after an open procedure.	2.1333952750097525
Four different types of lesions may be differentiated by the Siewert classification: postoperative bile fistulas (type I), late strictures (type II), tangential injuries of the bile duct (type III) and defect lesions (type IV).	2.109936511062481
The diagnostic and therapeutic management is demonstrated in relation to our own experience and the literature.	2.964620799010275
Methods: Eleven patients (median age 43.8  +/-  17.2) with bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy were operatively treated between November 1993 and December 1998.	1.9511351923760072
Nine patients (four type-II lesions, five type-IV lesions) were referred from another hospital; 2 defect lesions out of 410 laparoscopic cholecystectomies (0.5 %) were documented in our own patient group.	1.8614307526457745
Results: Four patients with late strictures were operatively treated with a hepaticocholedochostomy (n = 2) or hepaticojejunostomy (n = 2) after 14.3  +/-  8.4 months and were discharged from hospital after 10.6  +/-  3.8 days.	1.995385376363008
However, a retrocolic Roux-Y end-to-side hepaticojejunostomy was perfomed in all cases with a larger defect (n = 5; hospital stay 14.8  +/-  2.0 days).	2.052109354699289
The two defect lesions in our own group were detected by intraoperative cholangiography and immediately treated after conversion either with hepaticocholedocho-stomy or hepaticojejunostomy (hospital stay 11.2  +/-  0.6 days).	1.8428559916121507
Conclusions: The incidence of bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy might be kept down by anatomic preparation, selective intraoperative cholangiography and early consideration of conversion to open procedure.	1.9538875769914685
The clinical course after biliary tract injury can be positively influenced only by a standard diagnostic and operative procedure and by an early transfer to a specialized center.	1.9356359293210497
In the last years the incidence of renal cell carcinoma diagnosis increased about 15-20 %.	2.5995528181044416
The main aim of this study was to analyse the reason of the increase of incidence.	2.554398568138272

The positive effects are based not only on the compliance-enhancing reduction of extrapyramidal side effects but also due to improved cognitive function and social integration, shorter duration, and overall reduction of hospital treatment.	1.924258309339045
The mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction is still high and according to recently published data amounts to 17 to 42%.	2.0133267213301154
In the seventies introduction of thrombolytic therapy has led to a dramatic reduction in mortality of non-perioperative myocardial infarction.	2.5897578301883994
However, in the perioperative situation thrombolytic therapy remains to be problematic in most cases because of expected severe bleeding complications.	2.250959454990214
In the last 4-6 years acute-PTCA has been established in the therapy of acute myocardial infarction.	2.5330670369923163
Up to date no data are available concerning the effect of acute-PTCA on mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction.	2.3384759810584734
Nevertheless it can be assumed, that acute-PTCA will lead to a considerable reduction in mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction.	2.529938309285783
Therefore, in patients with significant perioperative myocardial infarction immediate coronary angiography and, if indicated, acute-PTCA should be performed.	2.641369239997637
In principle, thrombolytic therapy is considered to be contraindicated in the intra- or postoperative situation.	2.409818148442491
However, if coronary angiography and PTCA are not possible, thrombolysis might be taken into consideration, in particular if the expected bleeding complications are small in relation to the expected benefit of thrombolysis.	2.268691394515549
Since acute-PTCA has been shown to remarkably reduce mortality in patients with cardiogenic shock after acute myocardial infarction, this group of patients should be especially considered.	2.8501113759628884

Such conditions have been noted in the literature designated as chronic lymphoedema or solid persistent facial oedema in acne or rosacea.	2.148216135195437
The characteristic features are a chronic course, a typical clinical picture, lack of specific laboratory and histological findings and refractoriness to therapeutic measures.	2.2836264182108423

The major problems to the anaesthesiologist in these patients are induction of anaesthesia in infants with HLHS and treatment of pulmonary hypertension in the early post-bypass period.	2.657465120147401
Objective: Thirty years ago, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) was primarily developed for otherwise healthy individuals who experienced sudden cardiac arrest.	2.05811392869463
Today, CPR is widely viewed as an emergency procedure that can be attempted on any person who undergoes a cessation of cardiorespiratory function.	2.065588150500894
Therefore, the appropriateness of CPR has been questioned as a matter of the outcome, the patient's preferences, and the cost.	2.6576081970470913
The objective of this article is to analyse ethical issues in prehospital resuscitation.	2.1255202393854677
Arguments: CPR is bound by moral considerations that surround the use of any medical treatment.	2.2888333229193623
According to Beauchamp and Childress, the hierarchy of justification in biomedical ethics consists of ethical theories, principles, rules, and particular judgements and actions.	1.698720443527259
The decision to start CPR is based on the medical judgement that a person is suffering from circulatory arrest.	2.2255977415654953
The decision is justified by the moral rule that the victim of a cardiac arrest has the right to survive and to receive CPR.	1.9894267980458509
Moral rules are more specific to contexts and are based on ethical principles.	2.420647372807731
The principle of beneficence means the provision of benefits for the promotion of welfare.	1.8968144597204806
Talking about beneficence in resuscitation means once again reporting stories of success, as many victims of pre- and in-hospital sudden death have been saved in the past.	2.081538097588251
Nevertheless, resuscitative efforts still remain unsuccessful in the majority of cases, involving the principle of nonmaleficence.	2.46611028059713
There is potential harm in CPR.	2.351978608009044
Survivors may recover cardiac function, but sustain severe hypoxic brain damage, at worst surviving without awakening for months or years.	1.8457053727054453
In particular, post-traumatic CPR is associated with an extremely poor outcome, leading to the issue of futility.	2.5718625418789873
The time frame in CPR requires medical decision-making within seconds, and CPR is usually initiated without the patient's involvement.	1.904121240018326
If the patient's wish's can be ascertained later on, life-sustaining therapies might be withdrawn at that time.	2.005385729650031
Terminally ill but still competent patients should be encouraged to write a no-CPR document, which does not deny patients relief from severe symptoms, but might facilitate withholding resuscitative efforts at the scene.	1.8748416454092802
The decision made for a particular patient might delay or prevent emergency treatment in other patients who could receive greater benefit.	2.001675470788421
Conclusions: The standard of care remains the prompt initiation of CPR.	2.2645718448228624
However, ethical principles such as beneficene, nonmaleficence, autonomy, and justice have to be applied in the unique setting of emergency medicine.	2.1836926445363956
Physicians have to consider the therapeutic efficacy of CPR, the potential risks, and the patient's preferences.	3.081676743019461
Acting within the context of the therapeutic process is often equated with acting-out.	2.476076825899454
Subtile behaviour, too, as a part of the "complex system of sending and receiving unconscious signals" (Sandler) which serve for the patient to induce behavior of the transference object in the analyst or fulfilling his unconscious wishes is seen as acting-out or microacting-out (Treuniet).	1.9934706202404722
However, this delicate acting has no meaning, it is not symbolic or communicative action.	2.244311322178223
It is aimed at inducing effects and interactions.	2.324919956628524
It appears both on the side of the analyst and of the patient and is part of the unconscious communication in the therapeutic process.	2.9651160419036966
Diverse interactive means and ways will be demonstrated, how the analyst is moved to unnoticed acting and to handling the patient in an unnoticed manner in a certain way.	1.8912060155698147
The acting-reactions of the analyst may have the character of interpretations, by which he unintentionally demonstrates, in what a way he understands the patient.	1.8790751502503733

People who suffer a stroke most often experience a major crisis in their lives.	2.0337550401453846
This leads to psychological problems which are likely to influence the patient's life satisfaction, long-term rehabilitation outcome, and quality of life as much as the physical consequences caused by the stroke.	2.4470755371357704
The patient's ability to accept the new reality created by a disability as a part of their future life is therefore essential.	2.1418125689979624
This necessitates an individual coping strategy in the center of which is a mourning process, which unfolds in the same way as other experiences of vital threat, e.g.	2.0409504953021043
confrontation with one's own dying.	2.5437493207792303

The numbers of common melanocytic naevi, of atypical melanocytic naevi and the frequency of actinic lentigines were found by multivariate regression analysis to be the most important independent risk factors for melanoma development.	2.3577366910912727
Additional factors were hair colour, skin type and a history of naevus growth.	2.2610689132848725
A classification of relative risks was established by considering the first three risk factors mentioned, without any clear improvement of classification when further additional significant factors were taken into accout.	1.9285041729543502
For example, in individuals with more than 50 common melanocytic naevi, 5 or more atypical melanocytic naevi and simultaneous presence of actinic lentigines the risk of developing melanoma was found to be 100-fold that in persons with 10 common melanocytic naevi or fewer and without atypical melanocytic naevi or actinic lentigines.	2.0871715317008013
Early recognition of melanomas may be substantially improved if these risk factors are considered.	2.145401242056442

Abstract   Basis of the modern shoulder implants is the Neer II-system, a non constrained total shoulder prosthesis with conforming radii of curvature and improved protection against dislocation.	1.989657099715489
The second generation of shoulder prosthesis is based on the geometric shaft design of the Neer II prosthesis and offers not only a variety of modular head- and shaft-sizes but also through different radii a physiologic rotation-translation-mechanism.	2.000800652948519
The third generation of humeral head prosthesis carries the concept of an anatomic reconstruction one step further and enables the surgeon to adjust the inclination and the eccentric offset of the humeral head to restore the centre of rotation.	1.9817583662977067
The latest development in shoulder arthroplasty are humeral head prosthesis with a fully variable 3-dimensional modularity to independently adjust the prosthestic head position regardless of the individual shaft geometry.	1.9448931504192954
This achieves a 3-dimensional adaptability of the prosthetic head about the stem axis in the coronary and in the sagittal plane.	2.367099437147884
Besides of the humeral shaft prosthesis an alternative concept of shoulder joint replacement is established - the replacement of the humeral head articular surface.	2.3002858122762317
A hemispheric surface prosthesis - cup arthroplasty - is cemented onto the residual humeral head, which eliminates the obligatory humeral head resection and the reaming of the medullary canal.	1.7502120662707854
Bipolar shoulder prosthesis are humeral shaft prosthesis with a bi-rotational head system.	2.10566371103583
Their indication is limited to pre-existing lesions of the rotator cuff and/or the glenoid surface.	2.839213638289787
The inverse total shoulder prosthesis reverses the articular surface morphology of the humeral head and the glenoid.	2.390434650597421
The hemispheric glenoid component serves as the centre of rotation for the concave epiphyseal proximal humerus component.	1.9825720976525187
This implant is especially used in cases of massive rotator cuff deficiences.	2.519535052292379

Today several component design variations of cemented glenoid implants exist.	2.090989831093131
The peg-shaped anchorage system shall guarantee a greater stability against shear-forces.	1.9109578636842715
Cementless glenoid components consist of a polyethylen inlay and a surface treated metal-back with an integrated fixation system.	1.9371213121897988
These fixation systems are object of intensive biomechanical research and range from conventional screw fixation to specialised cone systems and self-cutting cage-screw-systems.	1.8847986665328738

Due to prosthesis-related pressure lesions, the strategy has now been changed.	2.126175702303225

With an average follow-up period of 37 months, 160 fixtures (91%) were clinically osseointegrated.	2.2737508748691284
Both types of restoration provided sufficient oral rehabilitation.	2.1729128203742967
However, only completely implant-supported prostheses avoided soft tissue ulcers.	2.1618359116853667
The overall success rate was about 77% after 7 years in group 1 and about 87% after 9 years in group 2.	2.1864674455897353
With regard to implants placed after strategy change, the 5-year success rate was approximately 86% (group 1) and 94% (group 2).	2.1784337952329373

In a prospective nonrandomized study patients were investigated with a minimum duration of nonunion of 6 months.	2.221358472643858

Following ESWT we found a success rate of 41 % (n = 11).	2.5506956607325075

Over a period of 11 years a total of 140 liver resections for non-colorectal, non-neuroendocrine hepatic metastases were performed in 127 patients (73 women, 54 men; median age 53 years).	2.198034537405411
Primary tumors were: breast cancer (n = 34), leiomyosarcoma (n = 20), pancreatic cancer (n = 16), renal cell carcinoma (n = 13), melanoma (n = 9), gastric cancer (n = 9), lung cancer (n = 6) and adrenal cancer (n = 6) and miscellaneous tumors (n = 14).	2.2236906523615305
Extrahepatic tumor manifestation (including synchronous primary tumors) was found in 69/140 cases (49 %); 61 of 120 patients with a first liver resection had extrahepatic tumor (51 %).	2.1876649688749947
Median survival after first liver resection was 20 months; after R0 resection a median survival of 28 months and after R1/2 resection of 8 months was achieved.	2.075867306097571
The 5-year survival rate was 16 % for the total group, 24 % in patients with R0 resection and 0 % for R1/2 resections.	2.30079207229044
After a second liver resection (n = 14) there was a median survival of 28 months (5-year-survival-rate of 21 %) for all patients and of 41 months (5-year survival rate 38 %) after R0 resection.	2.377539770521865
Morbidity and mortality after the first liver resection were 32.5 % and 5.8 %, respectively.	2.220779869679604
In patients without extrahepatic tumor at the time of the first liver resection a median survival of 32 months (5-year survival rate 25 %) and 7 months was achieved after R0 resection and R1/2 resection, respectively.	2.2365278983661776
In case of extrahepatic tumor the median survival was 24 months (5-year survival rate 23 %) for R0 resection compared to 8 months after R1/2 resection.	2.0602774534236636
These data suggest that not the presence of extrahepatic tumor but rather the possibility of a R0 resection is most decisive for the prognosis after liver resection.	2.3932035601397126
We conclude that patients with liver metastases of non-colorectal, non-neuroendocrine tumors may benefit from liver resection.	2.3773717515302732
Similar to colorectal metastases, a second or third liver resection can be worthwhile in selected cases.	1.9747012794560768
Therefore, the indication for liver resection should be considered carefully in every single case.	2.3636906087446743
Generalizations about the outcomes of psychotherapy are essentially based on research on brief therapies with quite short follow-up.	2.0172482863842083
The present paper is a survey of some of the findings in an effectiveness study of psychoanalysis and long-term psychotherapy, typically psychoanalytically oriented, in private practice.	2.342361617622929
The design was a three-wave panel comprising more than 700 patients.	2.207571081296519
At the end of the third wave, 418 patients in different phases of treatment remained in the sample.	2.073596977892549
Across a reconstructed time scale covering roughly seven years, before, during, and after treatment, the 74 psychoanalysis cases described a very positive development, whereas the development among the 331 psychotherapy cases was moderately positive.	2.0191784631741228
The findings emphasize the importance of extended follow-up.	2.709665089227946
When therapist variables are considered, therapeutic experience had complex or mixed associations with patients outcome.	1.9649355621666746
Especially positive were high age and many years, in private practice, after licensing.	2.230400085928474
Therapeutic ideals and attitudes divided the therapist group in three subgroups, one of which was characterized by purely classical psychoanalytic views on the values of support, friendliness etc.	1.8998976772408651
Therapists in the classically psychoanalytic cluster were found to do poorly with patients in psychotherapy, in contrast to patients in psychoanalysis.	2.287030041552076
It is concluded that psychoanalysis and psychodynamically oriented psychotherapy are qualitatively different.	2.0200901201187773
Experimental studies and open clinical trials have suggested intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) as a potentially effective treatment of multiple sclerosis (MS).	2.17887498642733
The Austrian Immunoglobulin in Multiple Sclerosis (AIMS) study tested this assumption by examining 148 patients with relapsing-remitting MS in a randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled fashion (75 IVIg, 73 placebo).	1.7550898421800976
Monthly administration of IVIg in a dosage of 0.15-0.20 g/kg over a period of 2 years slowed the progression of or even reversed disability as evident in a total of 24% of patients and almost halved the number of relapses in comparison to placebo treatment.	2.301387394410937
Therapeutic efficacy was noted within the first 6 months of treatment and was not correlated to the severity of disability (mild neurological sins without disability to ambulatory with assistance) at study entry.	2.1955567161306844
Overall the magnitude of treatment effects of IVIg was comparable to that reported for beta-interferon and copolymer 1.	2.141909337711237

Education was a more important variable than gender.	2.5351403871280347

This replicative life span, also known as "hayflick limit", is probably defined by a "critical" length of the telomeres.	2.1308887000924557
Telomeres are special DNA-sequences located at the four ends of the chromosomes which are shortened with each cell cycle.	2.0044698439556874

The presence of vascular involvement was depicted by SCT with a sensitivity of 82-100 % and 62-100 % by MRI.	1.9985526551771207
The specificity varied between 85-100 % for SCT and 77-100 % for MRI.	2.134381250762816

All medications mentioned have been studied on small patient samples, so treatment recommendations must be given cautiously.	2.0619023027176895
The application of laser energy to joint capsular tissues resulted in the reduction of the joint capsule.	2.4752366587161387
Primary clinical results of combined laser-assisted capsular shrinkage (LACS) and multiple suture repair (Caspari) for arthroscopic stabilization procedure of anterior shoulder instability are presented.	1.9390911867682086
From July 1997 to October 1998, 18 patients (2 female, 16 male; mean age 27.9 years; range 16-42 years) with anterior instability and recurrent dislocations of the shoulder received a combined arthroscopic stabilization procedure.	2.0701545943384554
The operative technique involved the use of transglenoid sutures to repair the labrum and shift the capsule (Caspari) and LACS.	2.0156954187747664
Laser energy was applied using a Ho: YAG laser (10 W, 1 J, 10 pulses/s, total energy: 1500-2000 J).	1.8065661027804873
From June 1992 to Februrary 1996, arthroscopic suture stabilization without laser shrinkage was performed on 17 patients (2 female, 15 male; age 25.9 years/range 18-37 years).	1.8603544129445346
The average follow-up in this group was 4.5 years (range 2-5.5 years), and we found 41.2% (7/17) recurrent dislocations.	2.5857434993180686
After combined arthroscopic procedure of multiple suture repair (Caspari) and LACS, a significantly (chi-squared test, P = 0.05) lower recurrence rate was obtained.	2.081123412661457
Only in one patient (5.6%, 1/18) did we find this failure.	2.1770010048070403
No complications occurred in either group.	2.316267165215771
Although, no long-term results are available, the method seems to be suitable for associating low recurrence rates with the advantages of arthroscopic surgery.	2.651042900765515
Simple bone cysts are asymptomatic, benign lesions which are usually an incidental finding on a radiograph.	2.081872962185631
Etiology and treatment are controversially discussed.	2.6179411834112547

Several types of treatment for simple bone cysts of the calcaneus have been suggested.	2.311231622795087
The question whether treatment is unconditionally necessary is controversially discussed.	2.0675979484949583
It is the author's opinion, that asymptomatic bone cysts of the calcaneus require no further treatment.	1.9931510610983594
Facial neuromyography is an objective electrophysiologic measurement used to assess prognosis for recovery from facial paralysis.	2.087585409230068
In the present study variability over time of the amplitude ratio in healthy subjects was investigated.	2.383114049399385
Twenty healthy subjects underwent four neuromyographic tests at intervals of one week.	2.1695435248888812
The study group consisted of 12 males and 8 females.	2.2735597209872225
Ages ranged from 23 to 36 years.	2.3330382640655034
The stimulation intensity required for supramaximal stimulation was 14.6 mA on average.	2.0132036255034444
The mean of the intra-individual side-to-side difference of the evoked compound action potential was 32.5%.	2.123112334778352
Results of the four repeated tests ranged from no to 80% side-to-side differences in the same individual.	2.3691744767214944
The hypothesis of symmetrical evoked facial compound potentials was not supported by our data.	2.0264852720313984
As with previous investigators we found significant side-to-side differences in healthy subjects.	2.2771653829448724
Furthermore, we could also show for the first time that the amplitude ratio was not constant in every individual at repeated measurements.	2.1081548537313877
We conclude that there is a physiological variability that must be taken into account in the interpretation of facial nerve neuromyography.	2.3520273770448936
To compare patient dose and image quality of electron-beam-CT vs. spiral-CT by means of phantom measurements.	2.2568521493835676

No differences were seen using 3 mm collimation.	2.305739445231271

In an experimental study, the biomechanical qualities of the combined Kirschner wire osteosynthesis (KWO) in the unstable Colles' fracture were analyzed.	2.1549743850651986
This type of pin fixation is our preferred osteosynthesis in the treatment of unstable Colles' fracture because it allows immediate functional therapy.	2.2024463650978965
It represents a modification of Kapandji's dynamic KWO, compensating for the insufficient volar stability by means of the conventional static KWO.	2.1030471017265477
Clinical experience according to the anatomical and functional results, was very encouraging suggesting that a clinical concept based on the biomechanical principles of combined KWO and its single components should be constituted.	2.414544603163789
Simulation of the unstable Colles' fracture was realized by dorsal wedge osteotomy of the distal end of the radius using cadaveric material.	2.236539313950053
This fracture model was subsequently pinned using the different KWO types and tested by a standardized vector energy testing device regarding its stability in the four main loading directions.	1.8986456171936654
The combined KWO unifies the advantage of volar stability of the conventional KWO with the high dorsal stability of dynamic KWO.	2.243608763387508
The main functional principle of dynamic KWO with regard to its axial stability consists in the repositioning of the dorsal bone fragmentation zone and hence the reconstitution of cortical load transmission.	2.041558969759875
Furthermore, the experiments yielded important information about technical aspects of the surgical procedure, which helps us to avoid anatomical and functional deficiencies.	2.1710207613814916
Based on these experimental findings, the surgical technique of combined KWO was standardized.	2.377587922564878
This is demonstrated by the ongoing improvement and further development of different methods and by the fact that users of these techniques are not always satisfied.	2.4888383340129434

In order to restore function and esthetics in mandibular hypoplasia, transplantation of osteochondral grafts and the distraction osteogenesis technique are used alternatively.	1.954105428898573
In a retrospective study the indication, growth and complication rate of osteochondral graft and distraction osteogenesis cases in mandibular hypoplasia were compared.	2.1306472211328495
In total, 12 patients (4-14 years old; 7 female, 5 male) with different grades of mandibular hypoplasia received osteochondral grafts (7 costochondral, 5 iliac crest; observation period 4-9 years).	2.0261854043927845
In 5 patients (10-12 years old; 1 female, 4 male), distraction osteogenesis was performed (observation period 10 months to 3 1/2 years).	2.100330437921486
In the results, according to the literature, the range of growth after osteochondral grafting varied considerably, approximate normal growth was noticed in only two cases.	2.3708451161868567
On the other hand, all patients treated by distraction osteogenesis showed a stable increase of bone length as expected.	2.2085115486544957
After osteochondral grafts, adequate growth is to be expected in the minority of cases and it does not seem predictable in individual cases.	2.292549473738206
Therefore, the indication for osteochondral grafts should be restricted to severe hypoplasia, where the local amount of bone does not allow the use of a distraction device, and to cases where support of the mandibula at the skull base is necessary.	2.2281140195785314
In all other cases of mandibular hypoplasia in children, distraction osteogenesis should be discussed as the primary option, even if in the long term a second surgical procedure should be necesssary.	2.244050629253901

The treatment of fractures of very atrophic mandibles as well as mandibular defects and comminuted fractures with miniplates and rigid plates is often difficult or only possible to an inadequate extent.	2.140380948622311
Titanium mesh has proved successful for the treatment of such fractures.	2.9210018245640463
Compared with conventional miniplates this mesh is outstanding for its considerably higher stability due to its given geometry.	1.9900228030610783

Myocardial scintigraphy using thallium-201 and positron emission tomography with metabolic imaging of myocardial glucose metabolism, using fluorine-18 fluoro-deoxyglucose, are today the most widely used nuclear methods for the assessment of myocardial viability.	1.9002744199191282
Besides the prediction of reversible regional and global myocardial dysfunction following coronary revascularization, both methods have demonstrated the ability to identify patient subgroups who will benefit most with regard to cardiac prognosis and survival and those patients in whom coronary revascularization has a limited effect with regard to survival and cardiac events.	2.10353694986989

The investigation at the scene led to the conclusion of a sexual murder.	2.598035571487249

In the ankle (talocrural) joint, the lower end of the tibia and fibula embrace the trochlea tali.	2.285118273682299
Thus, an approximately uniaxial joint is formed which permits dorsiflexion and plantarflexion of the foot against the leg.	1.9902135456108951
Due to the geometry of the trochlea tali, conjunct lateral rotation of the fibula against the tibia occurs at the tibiofibular articulations synchronously with active dorsiflexion at the ankle joint.	1.8534971841854642
Movements at the talocrural joints are mainly limited by the opposing muscles as well as by strong collateral ligaments.	2.3676454902715083
Talus and calcaneus form a functional unit connected by posterior and anterior articulations.	2.1132173591539236
The posterior articulation is the subtalar (talocalcaneal) joint; in the anterior articulation, talar facets of the calcaneus together with the posterior surface of the navicular and the superior fibrocartilaginous surface of the plantar calcaneonavicular ligament form a concavity for the talar head.	1.8803765333171665
Thus, the talocalcaneonavicular joint is a compound and - like the subtalar joint - a multiaxial articulation.	2.0332912808384247
On the weight-bearing foot, the distal tarsus and metatarsus are pronated and supinated against the talus in order to maintain plantigrade contact.	2.108721874988457
When the foot is off the ground, these movements are modified to eversion and inversion, also involving the calcaneocuboid joint.	1.8414704590168565
In addition, movements between the calcaneus and cuboid also occur during pronative or supinative changes between the fore- and hindfoot.	1.8591273237033605
Limitation of movements is due to leg muscles as well as strong ligaments.	2.8311146198799553
Finally, the cuneonavicular, cuboideonavicular, intercuneiform and cuneocuboid joints permit some additional alterations of the loaded foot in contact with the ground.	1.8139419583311829

Despite major advances in knowledge and development of efficient techniques for pain control, many patients on surgical wards suffer from modest to severe pain following surgery or trauma.	1.9653713335507597
Therefore, in the University Hospital of Kiel, Germany, an anaesthesiology-based acute pain service (APS) was started in 1985 to improve this situation.	2.0862620096338493
The anaesthesiologist in training who manages the recovery unit serves as an APS for surgical wards and is supervised by a consultant.	1.9509967396919583
The anaesthesists on call are responsible after regular working hours.	2.1015605038404748
The activities of the APS are as follows: 1.	2.363214288247488
Induction of sufficient postoperative analgesia in the recovery unit for all surgical patients.	2.359176472310725
Clinical rounds on all patients receiving epidural analgesia (EA), other forms of regional analgesia, or patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) every morning and throughout the day if necessary.	1.8513886625622256
Additional consultations for postoperative pain management for other patients on request.	2.3310710510986854
Assessment and documentation of the clinical status of the patient, quality of analgesia, and side effects.	3.2730674487569877
Writing orders for further treatment.	2.7684676615571187
Continuing consultations and informal education for ward nurses, physiotherapists, and surgical staff; formal medical training for ward nurses in postoperative pain management.	1.9844597946442903
From 1985 to 1992, 1947 patients on normal wards were treated (EA: 1736, PCA: 183).	1.8241969918105825
Epidural analgesia was performed using a standard protocol with bupivacaine 0.175% - 0.25% infused continuously with top-ups if needed (mean 240 mg/day, range 75 - 600 mg; median duration 7 days, range 1 - 53, Table 1).	1.8050548032448175
Demand for further treatment was proved by day-to-day withdrawal.	2.538653706241937
Since the introduction of an APS, complications of EA such as hypotension (1985/1986: 5.1%; 1987/1992: 0.5%, Table 3) and insufficient analgesia due to dislocation or other technical complications could be reduced significantly (Table 3).	1.9082198453572603
Dermal infections were seen in 2.6% of patients, with a significantly higher incidence in patients with arteriosclerotic diseases (4.1%).	3.0304404629751045
Epidural opioids were used in only 46 selected cases on surgical wards.	2.3053108390694352
Nevertheless, 2 cases of marked respiratory depression occurred.	2.3862439380849323
The overall risk of complications during postoperative EA could be reduced from 1 : 11 cases in the first 2 years to 1 : 20 in the last 6 years since introducing the APS.	2.206249874387695
For other regional procedures (e.g., interpleural analgesia) no complications were recorded.	2.200583804134189
PCA was performed using a standard protocol with tramadol or piritramide without background infusion (Table 6).	2.0228038202206537
The loading dose was titrated in the recovery unit.	2.4455503790819852
The median duration of PCA was 4 days (range 1 - 23); the median dose of piritramide was 45 mg/day (range 3 - 226 mg).	1.96428619182269
Two cases of somnolence and respiratory depression occurred.	2.211191486142738
In this period there were 8 potential life-threatening complications due to postoperative pain therapy; 4 occurred during standard surgical pain management (3 cases of severe respiratory depression after i.m.	2.064221186681614
piritramide (unsuccessfull resuscitation), tramadol, and buprenorphine; 1 small child with multiorgan failure after paracetamol intoxication).	1.8971291862911321
In those cases the APS was not involved.	2.3750486953265004
There are insufficient data for comparison of the incidence of complications following standard management of postoperative pain relief without an APS, i.e., i.m.	2.529919161510523
injections of opioids on request, but severe and sometimes lethal complications have been reported.	2.1787768782666084
Since the majority of patients used EA or PCA for several days, it is again emphasised that these techniques should not be restricted to high-dependency areas such as intensive care or recovery units.	2.2018321429350864
The introduction of an APS is an adequate approach to more efficient and safer pain management on surgical wards.	1.939748323736418
This requires standard protocols (Table 7), standardised monitoring and trained ward nurses.	2.0138049440970898

The alliance concepts are defined as being the description of the dynamic interaction of all cognitive and emotional factors which promote the analytic process.	2.1765185806279157
The historical significance and the development of the three predominant alliance concepts, these being the implicit "standard alliance" of Freud, Zetzel's therapeutic alliance and Greenson's working alliance, are to be described.	2.0642432547654046
All alliance concepts refer to a general, essentially reality-oriented relationship anchored in the personal and the human domain, which forms the background for the therapeutic process and the basis for the analytic interpretation work.	2.0525354354351486
Nonetheless, the dynamic force of the alliances is substantiated by factors of the transference.	2.166431228655852

The reliability of the determination of the blood alcohol level is dependent on the possible minimum and maximum values of this correction factor.	2.2421198101303768
In a comprehensive multicenter study consisting of 833 samples, which can be considered representative of persons involved in offences under the drinking and driving act, an average quotient of 1.16 was found with minimum and maximum values of 1.08 and 1.21 respectively.	1.8302956819256886
In 96% of the cases the quotient was between 1.13 and 1.19 and the deviation of the quotient from the average value was less than 3%.	2.197245772097922

A measurement system was developed that permits objective comparisons of the sound conduction of middle ear implants.	2.048291615883801
The implants are fitted into a mechanical middle ear model which approximates the impedances of the eardrum and the inner ear.	1.9308088237331587
A defined signal within the frequency range of 0-5 kHz is provided by a miniaturized loudspeaker at the input to the model and is  measured by a probe microphone.	1.936395383910171
Displacement of an artificial stapes footplate at the output of the model is measured by a fiberoptic probe with a sensitivity of 5 nm.	2.0606814699031313
The transmission function is calculated as the quotient of the output and the input signal.	2.167242023280605

Intubation and Positive End Expiratory Pressure Ventilation (PEEP) is a well established therapeutic strategy for impaired lung function, particularly following blunt chest trauma.	2.1991395694212623
Complications of this regime are however also well known and pose the question why non-invasive forms of respiratory assistance such as Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) have only gained minor popularity.	1.854228929843169
In a prospective study, 30 patients who had suffered blunt chest trauma were treated with CPAP administered by mask.	2.5426218965698024
The regime consisted of continuous administration of CPAP by a face-mask, with gradually increasing periods of spontaneous breathing.	1.9366660159067526
Initially a FiO2 of 0.33 (range 0,28-0,38) proved necessary.	2.137121211693527
The initial CPAP level was 7 mbar (range 5-8) with an (Assisted Spontaneous Breathing) ASB of 15 mbar (range 13-18).	1.9859757518031445
FiO2 and CPAP/ASB levels were subsequently gradually reduced until no longer necessary.	1.9847483943838422
In all patients intubation and ventilation was avoided by this regimen.	2.1115060798937506
The treatment was well accepted by all patients and common ventilation associated complications such as pneumonia did not occur.	2.102672370466053
In comparison with the former standard method of treatment the average ICU stay was dramatically reduced, principally due to not having to gradually wean patients from ventilation and sedation.	1.908277467996884
Other positive benefits include normal communication and feeding with active early mobilisation leading to faster recovery, both physical and psychological.	1.9072578267341218

In the present study, we investigated the ability of cells from articular cartilage, perichondrium, and costochondral resting zone to form new cartilage when loaded onto biodegradable scaffolds and implanted into calf muscle pouches of nu/nu mice.	1.7999568027446065
Prior in vitro studies showed that platelet derived growth factor-BB (PDGF-BB), but not transforming growth factor beta-1 (TGF-1), basic fibroblast growth factor, or bone morphogenetic protein-2 promoted proliferation and extracellular matrix sulfation of resting zone chondrocytes without causing the cells to exhibit a hypertrophic chondrocyte phenotype.	2.047441831436123

Scaffolds were manufactured from 80 % PLG with a 75:25 lactide:glycolide ratio and 20 % modified PLG with a 50:50 lactide:glycolide ratio (PLG-H scaffolds).	1.7857257359325243

There was no neocartilage found in nude mice with implants loaded with either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells.	1.8035629983771775

The amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells decreased with time, whereas the amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing resting zone chondrocytes pretreated with PDGF-BB was increased.	1.8354671125051012
The results showed that resting zone cells can be successfully incorporated into biodegradable porous PLG scaffolds and can induce new cartilage formation in a non-weight-bearing site.	2.0834865748718125

Frequent causes are intercurrent infections, fluctuations due to the natural history of the disease and insufficient immunosuppressive treatment prior to the crisis.	2.565835940078553
Early referral to an experienced neurologist is essential.	2.3097199814526794
Specific therapy consists of symptomatic treatment with cholinesterase inhibitors, crisis management with plasmapheresis or immunoglobulins and immunosuppression with clucocorticoids.	1.893858103724597
Infections must be treated vigorously.	2.609078273539829
Thymectomy in patients with previously unrecognized myasthenia gravis is never urgently indicated and should be postponed until the patient is stabilized.	2.639935195142843

Adequate nursing care of intubated patients and a set of prophylactic measures are essential to avoid complications adversely affecting prognosis.	2.122151943710744

Coronary angioplasty (PTCA) is performed only in bail out situations.	2.2065604819283466

Data concerning the interval between surgery and radiotherapy were correlated with the locoregional control, incidence of distant metastases and prognosis of breast cancer, lung carcinoma, and head and neck carcinomas.	2.433147761602118

A prick test was done the day before by scarification of the skin in the forearm.	2.3824407587937753

Six minutes after thiopentone, the patients received the relaxant, and after further 6 min 0.1-0.2 mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated.	2.0302318605356158
Heart rate (HR) and blood pressure (BP) were monitored every minute.	1.9833581138331442

Plasma histamine was measured by radioimmunoassay (RIA) with a sensitivity of approximately 10 pg/ml.	2.3267783099158983
Levels for histamine >1000 pg/ml and for tryptase >2 µg/ml were considered significant.	2.2900672670822058
Cutaneous signs of histamine release were documented.	2.443701365035222
Results: Ten patients showed a positive prick-test reaction.	2.6282286858573225

Analysis of the blood samples demonstrated no significant increase in the histamine level in all three groups.	2.7578852241950926

All measurements of serum tryptase were within the physiological limits.	2.3648632927844373

Median radiation dose was 56 Gy (range: 45 to 66 Gy).	2.0731264160693557
Chemotherapy consisted of 4 to 6 courses of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) (420 mg/m2/d) and leucovorin (200 mg/m2/d).	2.3144944259149067
Median follow-up was 37 months.	3.23739664890613

There were no statistically significant differences between patients treated with radiochemotherapy vs radiotherapy in terms of 5-year survival (63% after radiochemotherapy vs 53% after radiotherapy, p = 0.16), relapse-free survival (52% vs 50%) and locoregional control (69% vs 67%).	2.163581576883504
UICC Stage III disease was associated with high failure rates (40% pelvic recurrences and 53% distant metastases).	2.178850478883318

Apnea, bradycardia and oxygen desaturation in infants with very low birth weight are common findings in neonatal intensive care.	2.0564758829654424
The prognostic significance of their intensity and frequency and the principles of treatment, however, are controversial.	2.4755635495603747
The universal aim, in order to prevent traumatization of the lung, is to ventilate infants with very low birth weight for as short a time as possible.	2.18663118898586
Therefore drugs such as theophylline, aminophylline and doxapram and techniques such as nasal CPAP have been studied in our neonatal intensive care unit.	1.978945949989415
In these studies we developed a treatment algorithm.	2.485948203894159
In two clinically controlled studies performed successively we first proved that sodium acetate theophylline given intravenously has the same efficacy as aminophylline.	1.8100493061920326
As aminophylline has more side effects, sodium acetate theophylline is preferable.	2.3131517864566815
Bradycardia, apnea and desaturation were registered from the print-out of the monitoring system's trend analysis and in a polysomnographic study during steady-state conditions.	2.0435010285761592
In a historical study we were able to prove that intravenous injection of aminophylline is superior to oral administration.	2.317839203520814
We demonstrated equal efficacy of doxapram and theophylline; however, doxapram reduced the rate of apnea significantly more during the first 3 days of treatment.	2.25472165055084
In a retrospective study we analyzed the efficacy of nasal CPAP as the third level of treatment.	2.4576323041454935
The rate of bradycardia, apnea and desaturation was significantly reduced during CPAP and respiratory rate and oxygenation improved.	2.0021626587218977
The algorithm developed established theophylline with 5 mg/ kg as bolus infusion over 20 min, followed by 3 mg/kg BID as the first line of treatment.	2.2530711600930515
Only if a quick therapeutic response was desirable was doxapram the first drug of choice (indication >=4 bradycardias below 80/min, 4 desaturations below 80% or 2 apneas of >=20 s over 2 h).	1.8317324024765442
After 48 h an additional second drug was added if we could still observe >=3 apneas, 15 bradycardias or 15 desaturations over this period.	1.7657297641722591
Nasal CPAP was introduced as the third line of treatment.	2.339105699222989
With this treatment algorithm we were able to reduce the time on a respirator of infants with very low birth weight from 4.9 to 3.4 days (P<0.01).	2.0772096625574012
An evaluation of similar treatment algorithms in multi-institutional studies is indicated.	2.053516413689723

previous experience with low back and sleep complaints) characteristics of the guests.	2.368935647717672

Aiming at reduction of channels, leads from different regions of the scalp were analysed visually and with regard to their spectral content.	2.2333702581958454
APC resistance was first discovered in 1993.	2.4891077480764845
It is the most frequent cause of thrombophilia in Europe and North America.	2.4752275675531714
In more than 90% of cases, the underlying cause of APC resistance is a single point mutation in the factor V gene.	2.3631512710540723
Heterozygous patients have a between five- and ten-fold higher risk of developing venous thrombosis, while in homozygous patients the risk is increased up to between 50- and 100-fold.	2.209350384055712
Where there is a previous history of thrombosis, a careful investigation of the coagulation system, in particular a determination of the APC ratio, is recommended prior to surgery.	2.5088428638274145
In patients with APC resistance, a body-weight-specific thrombosis prophylaxis with heparin is recommended.	2.0990903833957204
Heterozygous patients only need anticoagulation when additional risk conditions are present, while homozygous patients with thromboembolic disease should be anticoagulated over a long period of time.	1.9212630164646125
Primary varicosis of the saphenous system should be treated promptly by surgery to minimize the additional risk of thrombotic complications.	2.2388409010762946
Pyomyositis is an acute bacterial infection with abscess formation in the skeletal muscles mostly due to Staphylococcus aureus.	2.1204648678317324
The disease is found more often in males.	2.4233309464424
Since the patients symptoms and the clinical and laboratory findings are relatively unspecific, the clinical diagnosis of pyomyositis can present difficulties.	2.636470187167161
Furthermore, cases of pyomyositis are rare in non-tropical countries and some physicians may not be familiar with it.	2.2800566076698554
If not diagnosed and treated properly, pyomyositis can lead to sepsis and death.	2.256628536005933
Although the pathogenesis of the disease has not yet been clarified, some predisposing factors of forensic interest are well known: (trivial) trauma or vigorous exercise of the affected skeletal muscles, small potentially "septic" foci in other tissues or internal organs and a preexisting immunodeficiency, e. g. in diabetes mellitus, intravenous drug abusers or individuals suffering from HIV.	2.0223524226635363
Three cases of "non-tropical" pyomyositis with fatal outcome are presented and the literature on the subject is reviewed with special reference to epidemiological and etiological factors, taking forensic aspects, histomorphologic findings and the problems of post-mortem diagnosis of pyomyositis into consideration.	2.2061908733038726

Evaluation of invasion was done by conventional H & E staining after paraffin embedding; immunohistochemistry was performed for cytokeratins (MNF 116), involucrin (Sy5), vimentin (V9), collagen type IV (CIV22), laminin (1-chain, 4C7), and Ki-67 (MIB1); and electron microscopy followed.	1.8556979025076012
Results: The OSCC cell lines PE/CA-PJ15, PE/CA-PJ34, PE/CA-PJ41 were invasive exclusively on gels containing fibroblasts with stratification of the multilayerd OSCC cell coat and polarised expression of cytokeratin and involucrin.	1.611704832351224
There was no evidence for BM, either by immunohistochemistry or by electron microscopy, although OSCC are immunohistochemically positive for collagen type IV and laminin in the 2D cell culture.	1.871407955157776
There were no differences in proliferative activity of the gels with and without fibroblasts.	2.2459137825498954
The absence of a BM does not, per se, imply an invasive tumour growth.	2.0716154904755637
Moreover, stratification and terminanl differentiation of epithelial tumour cells occur independently of a structural BM.	1.926399837022729
Interfragmentary movement and size of the fracture gap influence fracture healing.	2.622037160011573
Limited movements promote callus formation and may result in increased mechanical stability.	2.3909352140132065
Although larger movements still promote callus formation, the bony consolidation of the fracture is hampered.	2.3899100123117547
Fracture healing is also hampered if the size of the fracture gap is too large.	2.3760982003039253
A combination of large movement and large gap bears the risk of non-union.	2.761593037494295
Therefore, having in mind a minimally invasive surgical approach, one should strive for good reduction of the fracture ends and flexible yet stable osteosynthesis.	2.174159260736839
Dynamization of the fracture by enabling axial movement will close the fracture gap, stimulate tissue differentiation and possibly accelerate the healing process.	2.063496272861853
External mechanical stimulation, however, has not been shown to effectively enhance the healing process under flexible fixation or in load-bearing patients.	2.5346570616282817
Although ketamine has been in clinical use for 3 decades, the neuropharmacological basis of its analgesic, anaesthetic, sympathomimetic, and psychotomimetic effects is still a subject of controversial discussion and intensive investigational efforts.	1.9660252004723726
In recent years, however, new experimental approaches to its effects on the cellular and molecular level and the availability of pure ketamine enantiomers contributed substantially to the understanding of its complex neuropharmacology.	2.2041550935651597
This article reviews the current knowledge of ketamine effects on ligand-operated and voltage-operated transmembrane ion channels, G-protein-coupled receptors, transmitter uptake, and the NO-cGMP system in neurons.	1.892705605955087
With regard to its potential clinical relevance and supposed relative role among the complex mechanisms involved in pain perception, analgesia, anaesthesia, and psychotomimesis, the contributions of recent experimental and clinical findings to the identification of major target sites of ketamine are summarised.	1.9377753597458258
In contrast to the uncertainty surrounding the potential role of opioid receptors, there is now considerable evidence that NMDA antagonism is a central mechanism that contributes to the amnesic, analgesic, anaesthetic, and psychotomimetic as well as the neuroprotective actions of ketamine.	2.0280930314824848
Moreover, the involvement of non-NMDA glutamate receptors, muscarinic and nicotinic cholinergic transmission, interactions with 5-HT receptors, and L-Type Ca2+ channels may account for some of its anaesthetic and neuroprotective properties.	1.9027216996809635
There is undoubtedly a need for a safe disinfection method of optical instruments used by ENT specialists.	2.1993911337193564
So far, a standard method that sufficiently covers the risk of infection for patients and medical staff alike while serving the need of practicability in daily routine has not been established.	2.301181806274939
Therefore, in the ENT departments of the hospitals of Mannheim, Kaiserslautern, and Tübingen, studies on the disinfection of rigid optical instruments without working channel were performed between February 1999 and May 1999.	1.9192395030284086
Instruments were wiped either with an aldehyde or alcohol (ethanol 80%) and germs were detected by quantitative swab cultures.	1.9042773583207258
As discussed in the article, disinfection with ethanol proved to be at least equally efficient if not better than disinfection with aldehyde.	2.071149116734947
Therefore, it fully serves the requirements of a safe method for disinfection optical instruments without working channels.	2.019366417491744
White piedra is a rare hair infection of man and certain animals, caused by the widespread Trichosporon fungi.	2.516742473381591
The infection is characterized clinically by whitish, soft and easily removable coating of the hair shafts; however, the shafts may be destroyed by the pathogens invading at localized points.	1.8944386290463144
While all body hair may be affected, the pubic hair is most frequently affected.	2.173917587406306
This paper is the first report genital white piedra in a 34-year-old Central European man.	2.322012524508569
Only 2 men, aged 42 and 53 years, do not fall in this range.	2.008028857268721
Recently, a major African study disclosed this disease in women for the first time.	2.1514836098330137
In moderate latitudes, however, this infection appears to occur almost exclusively in young men.	2.363572765315235
In open fractures the rate of infected non-union defects has in recent years decreased due to the increased primary application of external fixation.	2.6232678149208657
In spite of this positive state of affairs the condition is still encountered often enough to warrant specific treatment strategies and techniques.	1.8619769141408629
In the treatment of infected pseudarthroses the general principles of osteitis treatment are applied.	2.345345777384119
This includes radical excision of infected pseudarthrotic bone and of the diseased surrounding soft tissue, provides mechanical stability in the non-union area and requires effective local treatment of the infection in combination with systemic, target-specific and temporary well-defined antibiotic therapy as well as procedures to improve local circulation.	2.35959140562898
The incorporation of autogenous bone transplants in defects appears to depend on close contact between the transplant and the vascularized receiving site and on the quantity of the transplanted osseous material.	2.018073113284091
A promising alternative method of dealing with extensive bone defects is osteogenesis produced by callus distraction; therefore special attention is given to Ilizarov's ring fixation system.	1.8683351314457892
