Lung resection offers the best prospect of long-term survival in patients with nonmetastatic pulmonary neoplasia.	2.7167046930557657
In view of the dismal prognosis of unresected bronchial cancer, surgical resection should be encouraged even in patients with reduced cardiopulmonary function.	2.3674275313367588
Accurate estimation of the postoperative cardiopulmonary function is therefore desirable to avoid (a) refusal of potentially curative treatment and (b) severe postoperative disability.	2.0775672010636104
The origins of postresection morbidity and mortality are multifactorial.	2.597190009598607
Thus, no single pulmonary function test or hemodynamic measurement can accurately and reliably predict postoperative cardiorespiratory complications.	1.8716889303578679
Criteria of functional operability should be based on percent of predicted value, so that patient's age, sex, and height will be taken into consideration.	2.1106130847346654
Exercise testing offers the advantage that both pulmonary and cardiac risk can be evaluated simultaneously.	2.2076639346010527
The high predictive value of maximal oxygen uptake (VO2max) in assessing postoperative morbidity and mortality is established.	2.354775527977507
The calculation of predicted postoperative lung function (ppo) is of importance.	2.1731891206090337
The postoperative values for the forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1-ppo), the transfer factor (TL,CO-ppo), and VO2max-ppo can be predicted by using the same formula.	2.274563136661187
Patients with nearly normal lung function (FEV1, TL,CO > 75 % predicted) and no concomitant cardiac disease can undergo lung resection right up to pneumonectomy without further diagnostic procedures.	1.856808663384343
In the others, FEV1-ppo and TL,CO-ppo should be estimated first by taking into account the number of segments to be resected.	2.0793121458217305
Patients with values < 30 % predicted are usually regarded as being inoperable, whereas values > 40 % predicted qualify for resection without the need for further diagnostics.	1.9711660040364252
VO2max < 10 ml/kg/min or < 40 % predicted are prohibitive for surgery.	2.223210752939574
If VO2max is > 20 ml/kg/min or > 75 % predicted, functional operability without limitation is given.	2.063980586193793
For those cases where diagnostic uncertainty still remains, FEV1-ppo, TL,CO-ppo, and VO2max-ppo can be calculated by means of quantitative lung scans.	2.013178642587615
Patients with either FEV1-ppo and TL,CO-ppo < 30 % predicted or VO2max-ppo < 8 ml/kg/min or < 35 % predicted are deemed inoperable.	1.7985087261943833
The treatment of acute of Achilles tendon rupture experienced a dynamic development in the last ten years.	2.2366999342908422
Decisive for this development was the application of MRI and above all the ultrasonography in the diagnostics of the pathological changes and injuries of tendons.	2.3092051371913023
The question of ruptue morphology as well as different courses of healing could be now evaluated objectively.	2.238248160222375
These advances led consequently to new modalities in treatment concepts and rehabilitation protocols.	2.0943577126806865
The decisive input for improvements of the outcome results and particularly the shortening of the rehabilitation period came with introduction of the early functional treatment in contrast to immobilizing plaster treatment.	2.21400142065461
In a prospective randomized study (1987-1989) at the Trauma Dept.	2.253641953365194
of the Hannover Medical School could show no statistical differences comparing functional non-operative with functional operative therapy with a special therapy boot (Variostabil/Adidas).	1.9416571167230186
The crucial criteria for therapy selection results from the sonografically measured position of the tendon stumps in plantar flexion (20  °).	2.210501977849544
With complete adaptation of the tendons' ends surgical treatment does not achieve better results than non-operative functional treatment in term of tendon healing and functional outcome.	1.9597867923267118
Regarding the current therapeutic standards each method has is advantages and disadvantages.	2.2094296300805785
Both, the operative and non-operative functional treatment enable a stable tendon healing with a low risk of rerupture (1-2 %).	2.487708364372796
Meanwhile there is consensus for early functional aftertreatment of the operated Achilles' tendons.	2.0862291607413184
There seems to be a trend towards non-operative functional treatment in cases of adaquate sonografical findings, or to minimal invasive surgical techniques.	2.5487946636429673
Based on a case report, we offer brief guidelines on the perioperative management of patients with Sleep-Apnea-Syndrome (SAS) who present with a high incidence of a difficult airway and a high risk of respiratory depression during the perioperative period.	2.3624839421423065
A 39 year old male patient with a body mass index of 34,22 kg/m2 and receiving continuous-positive-airway-pressure- (CPAP) therapy for known SAS was scheduled for elective plastic surgery.	2.0040352665689345
After induction of anaesthesia and direct laryngoscopy no adequate airway could be established and the patient became hypoxic, hypercapnic and developed hypotension and bradycardia.	2.1301741399536334
With the use of a laryngeal mask airway the patient was stabilized and did not show neurologic sequale after immediate awakening.	2.6061185095087356
The following fiberoptic intubation of the awake patient, still showing tendency of upper airway obstruction, confirmed the difficult anatomical structures.	1.9834198342369875
The subsequent general anesthesia was uneventful.	2.453237863291151
The patient received CPAP therapy and was monitored during the first postoperative night in the Intensive Care Unit.	2.1824054938722464
He made an uneventful recovery.	2.5391647112880897
He was advised to have regional anaesthesia or planned fiberoptic intubation, where possible, in the case of further anesthetic intervention.	2.270603528508189
SAS has major implications for the anaesthesiologist and whenever patients exhibiting the high risk factors (obesity, male sex, history of intense snoring, impaired daytime performance, nonrefreshing daytime naps) are presented for surgery this condition should be considered.	1.9412591834606971
Elective surgery should be postponed until after adequate examination and treatment when necessary.	2.3197386153245088
Patients with SAS should always be suspected of having cardiopulmonary dysfunctions such as hypertension, cardiac dysrhythmia or cor pulmonale.	1.9088209380774757
It is most important to avoid sedative premedication, to initiate CPAP therapy preoperatively, to encourage regional anaesthesia if possible and to ensure close monitoring over the complete perioperative period.	1.8759667708959717
Planned fiberoptic intubation, preferably with surgical personnel available for an emergency airway, is a safe method for the induction of anaesthesia.	2.4594747411270226
Postoperatively, patients are at high risk from respiratory depression, even in the awake state.	2.8000790203253807
Postoperative opioid analgesia, no matter what route, should only be given under close monitoring.	2.1558828482504144
Independently of regional or general anaesthesia there is an increased risk of respiratory depression in the middle of the first postoperative week, suspected to be caused by the catching up on lost REM-sleep, due to shifts in the normal sleep pattern during the first postoperative days.	2.4867380639072962
Life style measures (weight reduction and control, reduction of total fat calories to <30% of total calories, modification of fat intake to increased monounsaturated vegetable fat, increased intake of dietary fibers, increased physical activity, controlled stress relaxation) are the basis of longterm therapy of coronary heart disease.	1.9501422534759112

Within 7 years 64 patients with necrotizing pancreatitis underwent surgery with a median preoperative APACHE II score of 9.	2.1859844607497725
The indications for surgery were either proven infection or persistence of symptoms.	2.261923759921528
Thirty-six patients were found to have infected necrosis, while 28 patients had sterile necrosis.	2.257367667592727
There was no significant difference between the two groups regarding pre- and postoperative parameters.	2.348344910421349
The surgical technique involved a blunt necrosectomy followed by closed packing with Penrose drains.	1.8975504321613552

The absorption of large volumes of irrigation fluid is a major problem in transurethral prostatic surgery (TUR-P).	2.090028925293297
Various indicators have been tested to monitor fluid absorption with regard to continuous registration and sufficient accuracy.	2.286286604783884
The volumetric fluid balance is not suitable as a routine method because of its inaccuracy.	2.385402944754528
Easily accessible parameters are unspecific because of surgical bleeding (haematocrit [Hct]), or are interfered with by physiological counter-regulatory actions (serum sodium [Na] concentration).	1.7473149851016303
In 1986 Hulten et al.	2.3569711126427944
suggested adding 2% ethanol to the irrigation fluid as a marker and investigated it intermittently in the expired air with an alcohol-test appliance.	1.9474577540065905
In a prospective clinical study of 17 patients undergoing TUR-P under spinal anaesthesia, expiratory concentrations of alcohol that was added to the irrigation fluid (2% ethanol in Purisole, Fresenius, Bad Homburg) were monitored.	1.879685310685558
Gas was continuously sampled from the nasopharynx through a nasal cannula and the ethanol concentration was measured using a modified diverting anaesthetic gas monitor (Normac, Datex, Helsinki) that allows continuous as well as early detection of the absorbed irrigation fluid with reliable accuracy for clinical use.	1.9579225998258643
In addition, at intervals of 10 minutes we measured blood alcohol, endtidal alcohol (Alcotest 7110, Drauml;ger, Lübeck), haematocrit, serum Na concentration, and blood gases.	1.7916545408546662
Sixty-eight measurements were obtained from the 17 patients.	2.438016163656966
As shown in other studies, serum Na (r2 = 0.68) and Hct (r2 = 0.39) correlated poorly with the irrigation fluid as determined by serum alcohol levels.	1.8763797671708768
In contrast, the expiratory alcohol measurements with the alcotest 7110 (r2 = 0.93) and Normac devices (r2 = 0.85) were closely related.	1.7686606206697646
Continuous monitoring of the expiratory alcohol concentration with a Normac monitor closely reflects blood alcohol concentrations, and may hence serve as a useful semiquantitative monitor of irrigation fluid absorption during TUR-P.	1.926190333044069

In order to evaluate the current status of lymph-node mapping and lymph-node dissection in Germany, we performed a mail survey involving 90 hospitals performing operations for lung cancer.	2.193203285210416
Responses were obtained from 61 (67.7 %) hospitals.	2.323466642220759
Currently, the majority of the departments (43 %) use the German staging system (according to the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Thorax-, Herz- und Gefäßchirurgie/Pneumologie), 23 % lymph-node mapping according to Naruke, and 25 % an individual description of the resected lymph nodes.	2.0833679015873576
Mediastinal lymph-node sampling guided by the intraoperative aspect of lymph nodes is performed in 59 % of the departments.	2.499323509101792
A systematic mediastinal "en-bloc" resection is accomplished in 41 %.	2.1259894706486473
The results of this survey represent the current status of lymph-node mapping and lymphadenectomy in lung cancer in Germany and might be useful for the development of a uniform staging system.	2.253361767393123

Certain intra-articular fractures of the knee can be managed by arthroscopically assisted reduction and  fixation.	2.5179238836979776
The known benefits of arthroscopy include better visualization of the entire joint, limited dissection, and thorough irrigation.	2.125830709521766
The purpose of this paper is to present our experience with arthroscopically assisted reduction and fixation of certain intra-articular fractures of the knee.	2.2353927641502462
From May 1995 to November 1997, 34 patients with intra-articular fractures of the knee were treated by arthroscopic reduction and fixation.	2.449137717396269
We treated 11 patients with tibial plateau fracture type I, II and III (according to J. Schatzker classification), 20 patients with avulsion fracture of the tibial insertion of the anterior cruciate ligament (intercondylar eminence) type II, III and IV (according to Meyers, McKeever and Zariczny classification), two patients with completely dislocated osteochondral flake fractures of the femoral condyle, and one patient with a minimally displaced fracture of the patella.	2.2637496641884143
Postoperatively they were all allowed passive motion exercises.	2.2718498575138195
Patients with avulsion fractures of the ACL and the patient with fracture of the patella were allowed immediate weight bearing, while patients with tibial plateau fractures and osteochondral fractures were allowed weight bearing only after 12 weeks.	2.3215020105321367
Results: Of the 11 tibial plateau fractures, 8 were anatomically reduced, and in 2 the dislocation was less than 2 mm.	2.416291786020572
No further dislocation of the fragment followed.	2.82040796035721
All patients but one reported stable knees and they all had a full range of motion at follow-up.	2.0971969433845956
Of the 20 patients with avulsion fracture of the anterior cruciate ligament, 19 were anatomically reduced.	2.422971622808363
Except in one patient, functional results were excellent (KT1000 was 1.3 mm, average loss of flexion was 2.5 °, loss of extension was 1.3 °).	2.0463292128911243
In two cases of osteochondral fractures of the femoral condyle, reduction was anatomical.	2.664046446898229
The fractures healed, the patients were free of pain and had full ROM at the follow-up.	2.5644421686417918
The fracture of the patella healed in 4 weeks with full ROM of the knee.	2.4446035282556178
There was one case of aseptic synovitis and no other major complications.	2.3291370155431736
Conclusions: Arthroscopic reduction and fixation are technically possible in certain types of intra-articular fractures of the knee.	2.349741129250664
Provided indications are good, results of arthroscopic treatment are better than in classical surgical treatment through arthrotomy.	2.140250828582869
There is less postoperative morbidity, and hospitalization and total rehabilitation times are shorter.	2.151129118899454
Some technical hints are presented.	2.5177974096419224
A healthy 38-year-old woman suffered a sudden cardiac arrest 2 days after a vaginal hysterectomy.	2.3443313713182525
Although standard cardiac life support (CPR) was instituted immediately after the event, it was not possible to re-establish a spontaneous circulation for about 40 min.	2.179557259489249
Systemic intravenous thrombolytic therapy with slow injection of 1.5 million IU urokinase was performed as a final life-maintaining measure because of the high probability that the underlying cause was a pulmonary embolus; 10 min later (after 60 min of ongoing CPR) the patient regained a stable circulation.	2.0504095624406338
She survived without neurological deficit in spite of the long duration of CPR.	2.5942445733097133
In 348 patients with an initial diagnosis of rectal carcinoma operated on between 1985 and 1994 we investigated the quality of lymph node dissection, its influence on the perioperative risk and tumor staging.	2.7354228227261723
The same histopathological work-up was carried out in all cases.	2.9545549040589476
Whether resections or extirpations were performed, the number of dissected lymph nodes increased from 5.3 and (1985/1986) to 16.7 and 17.3 (1991/1992) and to 15.8 and 17.3 (1993/1994) respectively.	1.9541650458504536
Neither the type of operation nor the surgeon's experience had a significant influence on the number of lymph nodes dissected.	2.5142984067136185
The increase in the number of lymph nodes dissected had no negative effect on the length of the operation, the amount of blood infused during the operation or the perioperative risk.	2.7432783951631783
We found a significant correlation between the number of lymph nodes dissected and the number of lymph node metastases (P = 0.02) and between an increase in UICC stage III (P = 0.005) and pN2 tumors (P = 0.000) and an increase in the number of lymph nodes dissected.	2.515630114962359
Central lymph node dissection by high ligation of the inferior mesenteric artery did not increase the perioperative risk in spite of the fact that in recent years we have observed more patients with multiple diseases.	2.5925012601203536
With the institution of the Protection against infection Act, case definitions will be officially introduced for the routine transmission of notifiable infectious diseases from local health departments to state and national health institutions in Germany for the first time.	1.7670283009079464
Case definitions link the disease entity with a defined description of the disease.	2.3856599409145964
The abstraction thereby required leads to the creation of nosological entities.	2.203168458001284
The case definitions, which were developed by the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) according to the Protection against infection Act, enable the local health departments to assess and categorise reported cases, deaths and laboratory reports of pathogens according to uniform criteria prior to transmission to the RKI via the state health institutions.The quality of surveillance data will be significantly improved, as each reported case/infection will fulfil defined criteria, thereby enabling unclear cases/diagnoses to be separated from those that are confirmed.	1.7240134578111959
Furthermore, implants offer good chances for prosthetic rehabilitation in the insufficient bone site, if the extremely atrophic jaw is to be reconstructed by grafting procedures with avascular and vascular grafts, by guided bone regeneration, by distraction osteogenesis, by bone substitutes and in the future by osteoinductive proteins in order to prepare the conditions for implant insertion.	2.032991552935488

Thereafter, the patient experienced recurrent perianal fistulas.	2.884465945304062

Histologically, cystic scar tissue was found with a highly differentiated adenocarcinoma which measured 4 cm.	2.1749891752991677
Later on, the patient again experienced perianal fistulas originating from a renewed presacral mass.	2.311517317736763
As a result, an abdominal-perianal rectum extirpation and a partial resection of the sacrum with placement of a descendostomy were done.	2.0542131917407187
One year following her operation, the patient is free from any complaints and relapses.	2.5456440234443947

Positive and negative affect were used as indicator of daily mood.	2.2337802625608054

In the last decades back pain has reached dramatic proportions in industrialized countries.	2.0264437479736856
Disorders of the back are nowadays the leading cause of direct and indirect health care costs.	1.9972791459585293
Accurate prevalence estimates are needed to serve as a basis for health care evaluations.	2.583082409321239
A review of epidemiologic studies in the general population reveals that back pain has reached a prevalence of 40 % for current pain.	2.0615189394564926
7 to 18 % are "frequently", "often", "daily" or "constantly" affected.	2.2089738668706818
75 % of the adult population suffers from back pain during the last year.	2.622689046909092
80 to 90 % of the adult population in industrialized countries experience back pain ever.	2.459381130186901
Gender specific differences are only present in severe, chronic forms which are more often experienced by women.	2.1111750549409516
Back pain has a prevalence maximum at 50 to 64 years.	2.177132156336635
Older persons display lower prevalence estimates.	2.399011857225666
The prevalence maximum in men is one decade earlier than in women.	2.0934070650265992
There are several potential explanations for this prevalence pattern that are discussed in the article.	2.1944236818337273
Back pain can be classified by location, temporal characteristics, pain intensity and pain history.	2.182512054297908
Currently, for none of these dimensions generally accepted, uniformly employed and validated definitions are available.	2.007744311167663
In most of the industrialized countries back pain is one of the most expensive symptoms.	2.611333964289931
75-90 % of the direct and indirect health care costs were caused by those 5-10 % of patients who are disabled.	2.601822960951743
As predictors of back pain a history of back pain and job satisfaction play by far a more important role than the extensively studied mechanical factors.	2.090083047506401
For a first episode of back pain the prognosis is favorable.	2.4049591983455465
If the pain persist for more than three months the prognosis is unfavorable.	2.434489234971936
After six months of absenteeism because of back pain more than half of the afflicted never return to work.	2.2961471439291956
Rarely back pain is present as a single symptom.	2.6578740788558766
In more than 80 % back pain is associated with pain in at least one joint.	2.854170346662194
It remains to be studied if back pain may be viewed as an entity or as part of a more complex pain syndrome.	2.25663448168849
Chronic low back pain can be considered to be one of the most frequently treated and most costly diseases in modern industrial societies.	2.52581863101303
Dysfunctions and imbalances of the spine-supporting muscles increase the risk of low back pain.	2.577522705915008
Consequently preventive treatment and rehabilitation have to aim at preserving and restoring the full capacity of the spine-supporting muscles as well as training coordination and spine-friendly behaviour.	2.1268495855197234
In addition to various measures of pain therapy, physiotherapeutic treatment including neuro-physiotherapy, physical treatment (eg electrotherapy), balneotherapy and supportive behavioural training, medical rehabilitation therapy (MRT) ranks among the most effective ways of treating low back pain.	1.8703267391714542
MRT applies guidelines and methods of exercise methodology within medically indicated programmes of preventive treatment and rehabilitation.	1.9776122842600365
Various objectives of MRT are outlined with special regard to the stages of MRT treatment, emphasizing positive adaptation of the neuro-muscular system in the course of rehabilitation.	2.1647246615917943
Physicians are responsible for MRT diagnosis and control.	2.581837303924851
Taking into account the base disorder and the progress of therapy physiotherapists and the physicians in charge determine MRT objectives and treatment strategies.	2.0226277556292933

Various treatment options are recommended for managing these fractures.	2.4585132495177398
We treated 51 patients with 54 periprosthetic fractures between 1985 and 1995.	2.1113801329226862
Of these, 42 (78 %) fractures were treated with a plate, eight (14 %), with a revision prosthesis, two (4 %), with retrograde nailing, and two (4 %), conservatively due to poor medical condition.	2.307958572141979
The choice of fracture management was dependent on the type and location of the fracture and on the stability of the prosthesis.	2.7855024280625087
A total of 50 fractures healed primarily.	2.3877115566607197

Cases of a loose implant require revision.	2.3300828476913655
Distal fractures are stabilized with a plate or with a retrograde nail.	2.3177182930958335

A total of 938 responded and stated that they are involved in that field.	2.205761104084677

To test the efficacy of sleep deprivation as a tool to provoke somnambulism we investigated ten patients (three women and seven men, mean age 27 +/- 3.4) with somnambulism.	2.111798642209658

Patients with parasomnias and controls did not show significant differences in sleep parameters with the exception of longer arousal duration in controls, which was nonsignificant.	2.327476605497825

Sleep deprivation led to significantly reduced number of arousals, reduced arousal index, significantly prolonged arousal duration and more stage shifts from all sleep stages (nonsignificant).	1.78913659678206
Complex behavior during sleep increased under sleep deprivation, whereas sleepwalking did not increase.	2.188154015857859

Complex behavior in sleep is stereotypical and nonviolent.	2.237206140470498

The hepatorenal syndrome is defined as the development of renal failure in patients with severe liver disease in the absence of any other identifiable cause of renal functional impairment.	2.9075559413052363
The pathogenesis of this obviously functional renal failure is complex and not completely understood.	2.0428938229575877
Of importance seems to be a peripheral and systemic vasodilatation with redistribution of blood volume.	2.459273856203149
Nitric oxide seems to play a major role as a possible primary mediator.	2.478246620132307
As a consequence changes in several different pathophysiological mechanisms (sympathetic nervous system, renin-angiotensin system, vasopressin, endothelin, prostanoids, natriuretic peptides) lead to a functional renal impairment which is characterized by renal cortical vasoconstriction.	1.8899659629920187
Supportive treatment and intensive monitoring of the cardiovascular circulation is the main goal in the care of these patients.	2.6237627694554346
The mortality is still high exceeding 90%.	2.4837282552136357
Renal extracorporeal support should be initiated using a continuous method when recovery of liver function is expected (acute liver failure, waiting for liver transplantation).	1.9263651555522194

After termination of the seizures there was coma without focal neurological signs.	2.141810005047929
CT scan revealed diffuse brain edema.	2.5514873045498825
Electroencephalographic studies showed generalized slowing.	2.5793470270050354
In laboratory tests the only abnormalities were marked hypocalcemia (1.15 mmol/l) and hyperphosphatemia.	2.0675825381168846

The following results were obtained: 1.	2.6009989348776026

We report on a case of paraganglioma of the cauda equina in a 48-year-old man.	2.298020892092955
These slow-growing, mostly benign and encapsulated intradural-extramedullar tumours are clinically characterized by lumbago, paraesthesia and motor deficits as well as occasi-onally by incontinence.	1.9513665833117853
Paragangliomas of the cauda equina show monomorphous (main) cells arranged in a typical cell cluster pattern, demonstrating a lobular architecture and a fine net of connective tissue formed by so-called sustentacular cells; some tumours show focal ganglionic differentiation.	1.7027004104979642
Because of their morphological similarity to the more common ependymomas, paragangliomas of the cauda equina are sometimes misdiagnosed so that their incidence is likely to be higher than previously estimated.	2.005174125246206
Immunohistochemistry findings are positive for neuron-specific enolase, chromogranin and other neuronal markers as well as neuropeptides (main cells) and S-100 protein (sustentacular cells) while widely lacking reactivity for GFAP.	1.9627430737796934
Paragangliomas of the cauda equina represent a rare entity, of which only 80 cases have been described in the literature.	2.320970148255748
Because they only occur sporadically, they are often not included in the differential diagnosis of mass lesions of the region of the cauda equina.	2.57729862442215

This form of treatment is scientifically validated (Grawe 1997).	2.3002308365382436
Its theory of function and dysfunction has been updated via contributions from contemporary psychological theory.	1.8039264967615223

Abdominal compartment syndrome is defined by increased intraabdominal pressure above 20 mmHg with increased pulmonary peak pressure and oliguria.	2.130095079160896
In primary abdominal compartment syndrome the increased intraabdominal pressure is caused directly by peritonitis, ileus or abdominal and pelvic trauma.	1.9503591395261526
Secondary compartment syndrome is a result of forced closure of the abdominal wall after abdominal surgery.	2.743312188664768
The effects are decreased cardiac output, pulmonary atelectasis, oliguria to anuria and hepatic as well as intestinal reduction of perfusion.	2.2075176747428626
Effective monitoring is done by standardised measuring of urinary bladder pressure.	2.2648185434576154
Normal values are between 0 and 7 cm H2O, after elective laparotomies 5-12 cm H20.	2.1637968770523517
Above 25 cm H20 they are definitely pathological.	2.327262454542276
For the prevention and therapy of manifested abdominal compartment syndrome the application of a laparostomy using a resorbable mesh is recommended.	2.4249626464219323
Between 1988 and 1999 we applied a laparostomy to lower the intraabdominal pressure in 377 patients.	1.9499447282828883
In 16 % of the cases it was indicated by primary abdominal compartment syndrome with a bladder pressure of 31  +/-  4 cm H20 preoperatively, which could be lowered to 17  +/-  4 cm H20 by laparostomy.	2.294928116148222
An early reconstruction of the abdominal wall could be performed in 18 % of the cases.	3.085183494543515
Conclusions: The abdominal compartment syndrome is an often underestimated problem in abdominal surgery involving multiple organ systems.	2.137781516294861
The temporary laparostomy lowering intraabdominal pressure rather than a forced closure of the abdominal wall should be used in all circumstances.	2.3615134837301337

Background: It has been suggested that inflammatory processes play a role in the pathogenesis of acute coronary syndromes (ACS).	2.426825631389197
C-reactive protein (CRP) is a classic acute phase protein.	2.3771078605105034
It is yet unclear whether, in addition to established markers as troponin T (TnT), determination of CRP in patients admitted for ACS contributes significantly to the diagnosis and prognosis of ACS.Patients and Methods: We investigated 50 patients with ACS (59.4 SD 13.9 years) in the first hour after admission and 4-24h later with respect to TnT (Elecsys, Roche Diagnostics) and CRP (biokit, modified Quantex CRP plus, analytical sensitivity 0.02mg/dL).	1.9616217108779264
Fifty percent of the patients were classified as having unstable angina retrospectively.	3.2696919302301097
All patients were followed in the 6 weeks post discharge regarding death and recurrent ACS.Results: The cumulative event rate at 6 weeks after discharge was 62.5% for patients being CRP and TnT positive compared to 35.3% in TnT positive and CRP negative patients.	1.800373565804674
In TnT negative patients a positive CRP test predicted 33.3% of events and 28.8% of patients negative for CRP and TnT had events at 42 days post discharge.	1.7696971135367332
Logistic regression analysis regarding the primary endpoint including TnT and CRP (4-24h values), age, gender and diagnosis resulted in independent prediction of ACS or death by TnT (cutoff 0.1µg/L, p=0.048, odds ratio=7.5) and CRP (cutoff 0.862mg/dL, p=0.026, odds ratio=5.3).	1.78767362794682
Sensitivity/specificity for AMI diagnosis were 69.6%/75% for TnT and 12%/72% for CRP in the first hour and 91.3%/68.2% for TnT and 68%/72% for CRP 4-24h later.Conclusions: Besides TnT, high sensitivity CRP determination has no additional value for early AMI diagnosis.	1.7555667244293593
The prognosis of these patients during the first 24 hours is significantly and independently predicted by CRP measurements in addition to troponin T.	2.504231920918701

During the last decade, many investigations were conducted in order to understand the mechanisms involved in the development of acute lung injury (ALI) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).	2.3262216773235393
However, the increasing knowledge, instead of clarification, leads us to realize that these terms may assemble a wide variety of lung pathologies.	1.8127331599273542
Indeed, many circumstances can result in these syndromes and no particular factor has been defined to distinguish ARDS of one etiology from another.	1.985377688558803
We are still ignorant about which factors lead to the extended inflammation from pneumonia to ARDS, while it is not clear whether the timing of events are determined by some mediators.	2.086480294136761
Furthermore, in the clinical arena, there is no clear distinction between pneumonia, severe pneumonia which may lead to ALI and then ARDS.	2.582766371999391
Finally, the results of all these studies should have allowed us to investigate new therapeutical approaches while none seems to emerge.	2.2009594117052624

The present state about new potential treatments directed on mediators is summarized.	1.9666915350443217
The aim of the study was to evaluate if a combined physiologic-therapeutic scoring system (MARIS = Marburger Intensive Score) offers better outcome prediction compared to scoring systems, which are based either only physiologically (APACHE II = Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II) or only therapeutically (TISS = Therapeutic Intervention Scoring System) in medical intensive care medicine.	1.7711304960937169
Main outcome parameters employed were hospital mortality, severity of disease classification and length of hospital stay.	2.194021747716976
During a 12-months period (1993/94), 531 consecutive patients (ICU stay >4 hours) being admitted to a medical ICU of a tertiary care university hospital were prospectively investigated.	1.9230865930587215
The day-1-scores of MARIS, APACHE II, and TISS were determined and the patients were followed until hospital discharge or death.	2.410245789458867
There was no advantage in using the combined scoring system (MARIS) neither in discrimination between survival and non-survival (hospital mortality; areas under the ROC-curve: MARIS = 0.84, APACHE II = 0.86, TISS = 0.78) nor in severity classification (relationship between day-1-scores and hospital mortality: p<0.001 (chi2-Test) in all three systems).	1.7519427619488113
In contrast only for the combined system (MARIS), a dependence of length of hospital stay from day-1-scores in the analysis of survivors only and in the analysis of all patients (survivors and non-survivors) (p<0.001; ANOVA) could be demonstrated.	2.5829123994783703
In conclusion the combined physiologic-therapeutic scoring system (MARIS) did not offer a better outcome prediction concerning hospital mortality and severity classification compared to the established systems in critically ill patients.	1.9782004900283148
Its use may be advantageous in evaluating the relationship between day-1-scores and length of hospital stay, which for economical reasons has become a parameter of growing interest in intensive care medicine.	2.117990160110547

Expression of the HMG-CoA reductase almost paralleled LDL-receptor values.	2.080898447725296

Abstract   Pachyonychia congenita (PC) comprises a heterogeneous group of autosomal dominantly inherited conditions showing characteristic nail thickening and associated signs such as palmoplantar keratoderma, follicular keratoses, and mucosal leukokeratoses.	1.7285467680918623
Less frequently epidermal cysts, hairshaft abnormalities, natal teeth and laryngeal involvement may be seen.	2.0082013419107425
Phenotypically and genetically two major forms of PC are recognized, pachyonychia congenita Jadassohn- Lewandowsky/PC type I (Medelian inheritance in man - MIM - 167200) and pachyonychia congenita Jackson-Lawler/PC type II (MIM 167210).	1.7006397546843108
Both conditions show nail deformities, focal palmoplantar keratoderma, and follicular hyperkeratoses.	2.051733192261606
In contrast individuals affected with PC type II show premature dentition and multiple pilosebaceous cysts predominantely affecting the upper trunk.	1.8546535749780477
The latter closely resemble eruptive vellus hair cysts and steatocystoma multiplex.	1.940655959636881
By mutational analysis keratin K6a and K16 gene mutations have been detected in patients with PC type I, and keratin K6b and K17 gene mutations have been shown to be the underlying genetic defect in patients with PC type II.	2.3737218491672927

or nitroglycerin (NTG; 26 pats.)	2.291358595554549
or a combination thereof (COM; 25 pats.).	2.1997053925670182
Data investigated included the amount of postoperative chest tube bleeding (CTB), frequency of administration of packed red blood cells (RBC) and fresh frozen plasma (FFP), and changes in hemoglobin (Hb), thrombocyte (Th) levels as well as changes in prothrombin- (PT) and partial thromboplastine time (PTT).	2.0111708814525104
There were no significant differences among the three groups with regard to biometrical or operative data.	2.3182929138837527
The amount of CTB as well as the use of RBC and FFP were not significantly different between the groups.	2.664181663694587
Also, there were no significant differences with regard to Hb or Th and PT or PTT, both in the early phase after the operation in ICU as well as after 24 hours in the ICU.	2.613007548175896

This administration during CABG surgery does not increase the risk of postoperative bleeding.	2.5593213077809276

The present study investigated the frequency and influencing factors of petechial bleeding (PET) in the conjunctivae and eyelids in different causes of death except strangulation.	2.1441978662441668
The highest frequencies were found in fire victims (31%), persons who had died after intensive care (24%), cardiac death (22%), drowning and intoxication (16% each).	1.9836001255695779
The frequency of PET decreased with increasing age and increased with the body mass.	2.2651555514689354
At first sight cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) seemed to influence the occurrence of PET, because the rate was 11% without and 19% with CPR (x2: p < 0.05); an aspect which has been mentioned in the literature.	2.0954062907848345
However, further analysis showed that a higher rate of PET could only be observed in causes of death where PET are often fround irrespective of CPR, whereas in the other groups PET (with or without CPR) are uncommon.	2.279530349402388
Furthermore, a case-by-case analysis showed that in several cases with PET after CPR the causes could clearly be attributed to conditions other than CPR.	2.071021446801743
On the other hand, no statistically significant influence of CPR on the rate of PET could be found in this relatively homogeneous group.	2.334365914794651

The present study investigates the "speed"-hypothesis for fluid intelligence at the individual level using Latent Growth Curve Methodology.	1.9239926435575285
Date on 4 measurement points come from the Bonn Longitudinal Study of aging (N=128, mean age 67.2, 53% women).	1.899015378049446
Based on principal factor analysis, markers of mental speed were the WAIS Digit Symbol Test and simple psychomotor task.	1.8417421301857708
As indicators of fluid intelligence the WAIS Object Assembly and Block Design were used.	1.9736851355609988
After separately fitting Latent Growth Curve Models for the trajectory of mental speed and fluid intelligence, a combined model showed no statistically significant improvement of fit for freeing the covariance between the two slope-factors.	1.9062486487211727
Interpreting this result, contrary to the "speed"-hypothesis the intraindividual change of fluid intelligence does not relate to the according change of mental speed.	1.9060163642393915

At present, there is no option for causal therapy.	2.6969384600894255

The principle of this form of therapy is based on the binding of circulating antibodies to sepharose columns, to which polyclonal antibodies against human immunoglobulin are linked.	2.1374892875286937
These results may be interpreted as indicating that autoantibodies play an active role in DCM and that their removal by immunadsorption possibly represents a highly promising future therapeutic concept.	1.8313473001363065

The lightest implant (4 mg, titanium) showed the best results.	2.2951173154840543

These findings show that the CoMEP is able to restore sound transmission to a normal range.	2.3675619248629323

Background: According to literature, 30-60 % of pacemaker patients suffer from paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF).	2.274904468796569
As rapid tracking of PAF may cause severe symptoms in patients with dual chamber pacemakers, refined algorithms providing AV synchronous pacing during periods of sinus rhythm and preventing high ventricular rates during PAF are highly desirable.	1.9663506999272653
Aim and method: This comprehensive paper introduces a new mode switching (MS) algorithm which uses either a fixed (Inos2CLS) or programmable (Logos) number of short intervals out of 8 consecutive atrial intervals to detect PAF.	1.716112875888855
If the MS criterion is fulfilled, a switch from AV synchronous pacing to nontracking mode is automatically performed.	1.890053152837544
The algorithm is described together with a discussion on optimization of the programming of parameters which may indirectly influence the MS sensitivity and specificity.	2.0297219167036817
Results: This MS concept maintains the high sensitivity and fast reactivity towards PAF of the "mode conversion" in Actros and Kairos pacemaker systems, preventing a long time delay between onset of PAF, detection of the arrhythmia, and switch to nontracking mode.	1.8950681041448814
In addition, adequeate sensing and short blanking periods in the new MS concept enable reliable MS.	1.8721715418975102
The occurrence of atrial oversensing should be tested, as it may lead to inappropriate MS. Programmability of the MS algorithm may be advantageous for individual programming with respect to the patients' arrhythmia rate and atrial sensing performance, but the use of very restrictive or very liberal criteria should be avoided as both may lead to mode oscillations.	2.271832002219283

Additional features of prolidase deficiency included mental retardation, short stature, extensive dental caries, and multiple malar teleangiectases.	1.9255805414541098
Hereditary prolidase deficiency is a very rare autosomal recessive disease.	2.498849402484225
It is caused by heterogeneous mutations of the prolidase gene and affects many aspects of protein metabolism.	2.0194407305123296
Ion exchange chromatography and high voltage electrophoresis of urine can prove the suspected diagnosis.	1.9877631926533483
So far, there is no efficient therapy for hereditary prolidase deficiency.	2.5232168711368166
All reported treatment attempts have ended in failure.	2.199765375029264
In this paper the basic features of acute, subacute and chronic types of osteomyelitis, skeletal tuberculosis and some special forms of osteomyelitis are described.	1.9098567542684624
The diagnosis of osteomyelitis is established using clinical signs and symptoms, culture studies, laboratory studies and radiological signs.	2.096676121644312
The common conservative and surgical treatments are discussed.	2.306769516099257
In the treatment of post-traumatic/postoperative osteitis severe problems are encountered as a result of an increasing number of orthopaedic traumatologic surgical techniques using a variety of implants and because of a generally increasing occurrence of multiresistant strains.	2.4622435783849945
Thanks to modern treatment and the increased use of antibiotics, a considerable decrease in morbidity and mortality is observed.	2.3585333471590118
Despite this improved prognosis, an established infection remains one of the most challenging problems for the orthopaedic surgeon.	2.2631753683404665
Besides an exponential growth in possibilities for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention in reproductive medicine and genetics, the synergistic effects of modern health technologies have led to the necessity of fast transfer of knowledge into the public domain in order to develop a common social consensus.	2.1872492105233055
Thus, physicians and scientists have enormous obligations not only for the development of medical technology but also of medical and societal ethics.	2.247145275254122
Very early, i. e. in 1984, the German Medical Association developed professional laws for reproductive medicine.	2.201958695738976
In addition, the German government saw the need in 1990 for an "Embryo Protection Law" (Embryonenschutzgesetz).	1.9018133134666348
Today, in the light of European integration, the medical profession's and state's obligations are challenged in different ways.	2.14725811265658
Whereas the German Medical Association continuously works on professional guidelines for reproductive medicine and genetics - currently the case with preimplantation genetic diagnosis - the government must develop the sociolegal framework for ethically sound reproductive medicine, i. e. , in the areas of inheritance law, adoption law, family law, and law of succession, the latter especially in the case of discrepancies between genetic vs. social paternity in heterologous insemination.	1.816862954090031
In Crohn's disease, some concomitant neurological illnesses such as cerebral ischemia following arterial or venous thrombosis, subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord following malabsorption of vitamin B12 or folic acid, opticus neuropathy, and polyneuropathy have been described.	1.891339639955497
We report on three such cases in three female patients (aged 26, 29, and 61 years).	1.9497744858178252
All patients became symptomatic with a hemiparesis; one complained additionally of a speech disorder, headache, and intermittent loss of orientation.	1.8383055777597679
In CT and MRI scans, multiple lesions were detected; cerebral angiography showed multiple stenoses of middle- and large-sized vessels that were compatible with cerebral vasculitis.	1.9896100501373892
Serologic tests concerning vasculitis were inconspicuous at that time.	2.175364019881098
Under anticoagulation (in two cases) and immunosuppressive therapy, neurologic symptoms disappeared.	2.3761182798235336
In the following 6 to 12 months, no new neurological symptoms appeared.	2.387400202305005
In two cases, Doppler sonographic controls showed stationary and, in one case, progressive intracranial stenoses.	2.30657346686567
The serin protease tryptase (ECNr.	2.3131982277433023
3.4.21.59), which is almost exclusively expressed in mast cells, is released by mast cell degranulation in an enzymatically active form together with other mediators, e.g.	1.940491736439157
histamine, into the extracellular space and the circulation.	2.3678860864777156
Therefore, in the skin, a role of tryptase is suggested not only in mastocytosis and immediate type hypersensitivity reactions, but also in other inflammatory diseases, degenerative or neoplastic conditions as well as in wound healing, where an accumulation and/or activation of mast cells is found.	2.4135647958471336
Extracellular tryptase may be superior to histamine as a parameter for the onset and course of immediate type reactions and as an indicator for the activation of mast cells in other conditions.	2.195747148847405
In addition, tryptase has been shown to be a sensitive and specific marker for the localization of mast cells in tissues.	2.496897416110223

Flexible miniendoscopes can be combined with a laser for the first time, allowing for exact localization of the stenosis and subsequent therapy.	2.4234861382485535
Surgery of tibial plateau fractures with joint involvement (AO classification 41 A1, B1-B3 and C1- C3) makes high demands on traumatological management.	1.8218586220721573
By using modern, minimally invasive operative techniques for juxta-articular fractures, it is possible to prevent soft tissue injuries that might affect the functional result.	2.277285057763181
The aim of this technique is to achieve the exercise stability obtained with standard procedures.	2.2231622325356946
Arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis not only minimizes the surgical soft tissue trauma, but also enables a precise assessment of the articular surfaces under the operation, as well as the simultaneous treatment of concomitant intra-articular injuries, a particular advantage as compared to conventional operative methods.	2.403021434934191
From a total of 54 patients with tibial plateau fractures, arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis was performed in 34 patients at our clinic from September 1994 to January 1998.	2.331647205771604

We suggest that arthroscopically assisted, minimally invasive osteosynthesis can also be used in selected patients for the treatment of AO classification 41 C1-C3 fractures.	2.3890669910806213
Dorsal tension band fixation is a wide-spread technique of finger arthrodesis.	2.331115940470683
When using a resorbable PDS-suture as tension band fixation a costly implant removal is not needed.	1.967780081559302
Aim of this study is the investigation of the primary stability of this technique in combination with the cup-in-cone-procedure.	2.7508207294886833
Freeze-preserved fingers with thread tension band fixation using the PDS-material (series 1), the same fixating method on formaldehyde preserved fingers (series 3), freeze-preserved fingers with a standard tension band fixating (wire loop, series 2) are load in a four-point-bending in the direction of palmarflexion.	1.8954847958034053
From 6 degrees onwards the wire-tension-system requires a higher torque for bending, but in case of higher torque frequently leads to fracture.	2.046155694376525
The examination shows that the thread-tension-band method by PDS-loop for the stabilisation of finger joint arthrodesis has a sufficient initial stability against bending forces.	1.8240902089622757
Modern medicine has succeeded in achieving enormous technical developments.	2.1339832953552618
One recent highlight has been the introduction of postmortem organ transplantation.	2.493507621170444
At the same time, serious objections have been raised concerning the radical changes in the cultural conception of the inviolable body.	2.0220465597600454
One major objection arises from the conflict of considering a brain-dead person as dead.	2.028082519639083
The presence of brain death is a prerequisite for post-mortem organ donation, because only during this phase of dying does the individual quality as dead while the organs, other than the brain, remain viable.	1.9577087522831005
The objection implies scepticism as to the physician's ability to distinguish a dead from a living person.	2.0487553219931023
On the other hand, even the critics must rely on the physician's ability to discriminate, e.g., when to discontinue resuscitation.	1.988242456170577
The medical community has not found reasons to restrict the definition of irreversible coma 25 years after its first formulation.	2.010485096135064
It must be clearly recognised that reasons other than medical ones can be decisive for refusing organ donation.	1.8299488993082675
One ethical problem is the therapeutic benefit of organ transplantation.	2.417303214112762
The beneficiary of the treatment is not the donor, but another person, the recipient.	2.5268490931256946
The concept of human dignity does not allow the use of a person fur purposes other than the ones he/she consents to, as Immanuel Kant stated.	2.0422217039272246
Although the human corpse is not a person in the full sense, even if it is protected by the thought of respect for the former person, the life-interest of the organ recipient had to be considered legitimate.	2.2516545384087228
The resulting conflict between the respect for the donor and the life-interest of the recipient should be balanced by seeking the donor's consent as far as possible.	1.8696487739567278
The proposed information model seems adequate at the moment.	2.314239747006642
A common report of both churches in Germany in 1990 supported postmortem organ transplantation.	2.080973123656627
The report dealt with the medical problems and harmonized them with the Christian value of solidarity.	2.0912963987618176
The ethical alternatives to organ transplantation, however, are not mentioned.	2.597889666006501
Within this limitation, the report seems to adequately express the aim to strengthen individual competence and plead for fair perception of the neighbour's life-interest.	1.8313814189405409

An expert evaluation comes to the conclusion that the most important systems for elderly are: emergency systems, enhanced vision systems and parking aids.	2.1533153712685262
Emergency systems can call rescue teams automatically or at driver's request, and direct them to the emergency location.	2.033130363510099

Parking aids, using cameras or infrared technique are especially helpful for persons with movability problems.	1.9497906931243179

The value and impact of these systems are analysed in the light of risk homeostasis theory.	2.3145520797374877

In 40 patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD), in 5 patients with non-AD dementia and in 36 cognitively normal controls the concentration of protein tau was determined in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).	2.1539012487848592
Of the AD patients, 19 were very mildly demented (MMSE score from 25 to 28).	1.9717251546291297
Even in these patients, CSF tau was significantly more elevated than in controls.	2.3826997213358987
In the non-AD patients protein tau was less increased.	2.4811161511035347
Among the AD patients there was no association between CSF tau and severity of cognitive impairment or deficit in cerebral blood flow, determined by SPECT.	2.1691100098565945
Our findings suggest that CSF tau may be elevated even at the predementia stage of AD and be useful as a biological marker for the early recognition of the disease.	2.0831522341169313
The aim of our review is to summarize relevant data on the perioperative use of anti-ischaemic drugs in patients at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease.	2.094661331044154
The accessible medical literature according to current electronic information sources was explored.	2.0614550744621387
One in every eight general anaesthetics is administered to a patient at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease.	2.011191707566236
Of these patients, it is estimated that 20% - 40% have perioperative myocardial ischaemia (PMI), the majority being nonsymptomatic.	2.591464663508078
This figure correlates with the occurrence of postoperative cardiac complications and myocardial infarction.	2.447297293117507
The anaesthetist therefore has an important role to play in reducing the rate of perioperative cardiac sequelae.	2.569105079232737
This can be achieved with good control of haemodynamic stability and the timely and appropriate use of antiischaemic drugs.	2.0360336768300495
Acting as coronary and systemic vasodilators, they effect an immediate reduction in preload and have been shown to be the drugs of first choice for intraoperative myocardial ischaemia.	2.2475025278553704
Beta-blockers reduce the rate of PMI to a greater extent than nitrates.	2.298308450118989
They are also effective in myocardial ischaemia not accompanied by an increased heart rate.	2.3559726020522307
Single pre-operative administration of beta-blockers has also been shown to be beneficial in reducing theincidence of perioperative tachycardia, hypertension, and PMI.	2.256758760824551
Consequently, such one-time medication can be considered for previously untreated high-risk patients presenting for surgery.	2.3936554586094907
The continuation of oral calcium channel blockers to the morning of surgery also reduces the rate of PMI and myocardial infarction in coronary-bypass patients, and combination with beta-blockers enhances this effect.	2.14623829164148
Intra-operative diltiazem infusions are similarly advantageous in this patient group.	2.185656193683789
In addition to nitrates, calcium antagonists are the drug of choice for coronary vasospasm.	2.206012497730674
Drugs inhibiting platelet aggregation have a particular role in patients with coronary heart disease, however, they also cause increased perioperative bleeding.	2.727625833548725
Consequently, it is recommended that these medications be discontinued 5 - 10 days prior to major surgery, with the exception of high-risk patients.	2.513423161469464
Pilot studies using alpha2-agonists have shown reduced anaesthetic requirements and a reduction in PMI.	2.162539600102373
The perioperative relevance of these drugs is currently being investigated.	2.51619507072903
Beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, nitrates, and possibly alpha2-agonists lead to reduced rates of PMI and other cardiac complications in risk patients.	1.980718936900623
Current anti-anginal medications, with the exception of anti-platelet agents, should be maintained to the day of surgery and continued as soon as possible thereafter.	2.3235901718685166
All of these drugs except anti-platelet agents may also be used intra-operatively, however, possible interactions with anaesthetic agents should be carefully considered.	2.430724878356261
Inflammatory bowel diseases (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) were thought to be psychosomatic disorders.	2.1421234071025026
However, this argument has recently been questioned by many researchers.	2.180391050692462
At the same time, biomedical factors have been described that were claimed to play a role in the aetiology and modulation of the course of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD).	2.398282430837312
In the present paper, the state of research regarding both biomedical and psychosomatic factors of the aetiology and course of IBD is reviewed and critically evaluated from a methodological perspective.	2.014242724658164
Results covering the following topics are presented: epidemiology; sociodemographic variables; genetic factors; dietary factors and cigarette smoking; drugs; permeability of bowel epithelia; immunological factors; microbiological factors; psychiatric disorders, affective symptoms, personality factors; life events and psychosocial stress; quality of life; and coping with the illness.	1.9015112216518222
Among biomedical factors, a genetically based pathological immune reaction is highly probable.	2.155159034579301
However, the findings of immunological disturbances are of a more descriptive nature and seem to explain not the aetiological process of the development of the disease, but rather a kind of disposition.	2.468237285539528
The question of which agents trigger the pathological immune cascade is still under investigation.	2.104505546146589
Interesting findings can possibly be expected of the psycho-neuro-immunological research in this area.	2.0391571301352336
Results of research on psychological pathology (psychiatric disorders, personality factors) are inconclusive.	2.139185406205118
Part of the high rate of psychiatric morbidity might be due to effects of selective sampling of more disturbed subjects.	2.5076419240048744
Research pertaining to the influence of distressing life events has also yielded inconsistent results.	2.3309013309773117
Prospective studies about the association of psychosocial stress and somatic symptomatology mostly demonstrated cross-sectional correlations which did not allow for causal interpretations.	2.0300146958296876
However, coping research has shown interesting results that point to the mediating influence of coping strategies on the course of the disease.	1.9599939497002905
Finally, perspectives for future research are suggested.	2.3559325933131126
Genital infection, particularly bacterial vaginosis (BV), increases the relative risk of prematurity.	2.0703458916749335
Detection of disturbances of vaginal milieu at an early stage and the use of suitable countermeasures such as intervention with antimicrobial substances can reduce the preterm birth rate.	2.149720763552005
Most cases are consistent with a twin pregnancy, with distinct borders between placenta and mole on sonography.	1.9404272480836122
The pregnancy resulted in a diploid female fetus in the 34th week of gestation with marked hypotrophy.	2.162294281539332
The non-molar part of the placenta showed a complex alteration of villous maturity resulting in intrauterine growth retardation but a living fetus.	2.0173905808730286
No malignancy occured post partum.	2.474072446202222
The clinical and pathogenetic aspects of this rare entity are discussed.	2.4820244271455874
So far, necrosis of the lunate bone has been interpreted in the literature as a phenomenon with a traumatic, primarily vascular-arterial or mechanical causation.	2.1195182461266673
These models seem problematic, since neither the patients' histories nor the macroscopic-radiographical or histological appearances can be reconciled with them.	1.945701650063889
In contrast, the model of a primarily venous aetiopathogenesis accepted for idiopathic necrosis of the femoral head is now examined.	2.042981636179888
Evaluation of 125 cases of lunate bone necrosis treated in the Department of Orthopaedics at the University Hospital in Heidelberg between 1958 and 1993 made it possible to reconstruct the spontaneous course of the condition.	2.331515977940852
X-Ray material, core spin tomographic images and material from a prospective study carried out in 49 patients with unexplained painful conditions of the wrist were available.	2.2836325528401096
A stage-by-stage progression emerged, which initially caused alterations only in the MR image, while the X-ray picture remained unremarkable.	2.2889758290520175
It was recognized from the spontaneous course that subsequent changes in the shape of the diseased lunate bones were always the result of the necrotic transformation process and never the cause of it.	2.2966389738128865
This meant that fractures were excluded as a possible cause of necrosis of the lunate bone.	2.3960890539140047
The spontaneous course was used as the basis of a stage-related classification for lunate bone necrosis.	2.417911960707076
In a pressure measurement test, the behaviour of the intraosseous pressure in 16 necrotic lunate bones, 16 healthy lunate bones and 16 healthy capitate bones was tested under various functional conditions.	1.8968397340132401
The pressure fluctuations in the capitate bones were very slight, while in the healthy lunate bones pressure increased significantly during extension of the wrist.	2.0556397130774977
The pressure increases in necrotic lunate bones were significantly in excess of those in healthy ones; in some cases they were far in excess of the systolic blood pressure.	2.0991680708965323
It was also concluded that necrotic lunate bones were mechanically deformed on movement.	1.9875522503897656
The anatomical causes of the pronounced pressure increases were examined experimentally.	2.237856962716113
After staining of both the arteries and the veins, epoxy sheet plastination was used to fix six fresh cadaver arms in the neutral position and six in extension.	1.9389520724837654
Visualization of the vessels showed that capsular-ligamentous structures that were stretched on the palmar side and slackly turned back on themselves on the dorsal side still allowed the blood supply from the arteries, but substantially hindered venous drainage.	1.7867302389810156
The anatomical preparations made it possible to see that venous drainage from the lunate bone was being prevented; this explained the pronounced pressure increases.	1.9646285375684147
The unphysiological position of the base of the radius inclined in the palmar direction relative to the hand axis when it was extended dorsally was the crucial factor in the development of necrosis.	2.2489507511860243
Evaluation of the histories of the patients with necrosis of the lunate bone made it clear that trauma was not significantly involved in the causation, while manual work had an important role.	2.3926505302672423
Most manual activites are performed with the wrist in extension.	2.3870052631977865
Any extension favours triggering of bone necrosis through congestion in the venous trunk.	2.0938872812019707
Thus, our investigations have shown that the beginning of this illness starts with congestion such as occurs with every extension of the wrist, which is initially physiological, before further factors favouring the process cause it to take a pathologic course.	2.1330876440243824
The results of the German National Health Interview and Examination Survey 1998 confirm allergies as widespread diseases in Germany.	2.048736559904155
In total 40 to 43 % of the adult population have or have had an allergic disease.	2.10771601800306
The morbidity was assessed using a self-administered questionnaire and a personal interview performed by a physician.	2.300691852013633
The agreement between questionnaire and interview data is greater than 90 % for allergic rhinitis, food allergy and urticaria and about 80 % for contact dermatitis and asthma.	1.900209048690915
The results of both assessment methods showed remarkable differences between East and West Germany.	1.9705360925796118
Using the interview data 17 % of the West but only 11 % of the East German adults have/had e.g.	1.892893817974655
Comparable differences exist for contact dermatitis.	2.536496857765825
Many people with allergies suffer or have suffered from several allergies.	2.097327408289031
Frequent patterns of combination are food allergy/allergic rhinitis and asthma/allergic rhinitis.	2.004083821238534
In comparison with former studies we observed an increase of 70 % in the prevalence of allergic rhinitis between 1990/92 and 1998.	2.2131435684090377
The relative increase is higher in East than in West.	2.1762281776261307
The time trend in prevalence of asthma could only be calculated for the West German population.	2.1033306439129587
The results show a remarkable increase here, too.	2.1965552241538098

The surgical management of vesicovaginal fistulae (VVF) is a matter of controversy.	2.2653283098503834
This study deals with our experience with transvaginally treated patients suffering from VVF.	2.5321363824608456
Between 1966 and 1996, 64 patients with VVF were treated surgically.	2.4432502203010937
The VVF occurred in the course of hysterectomy in 54 patients, was due to radiotherapy in 7, was a result of obstetric complications in 2 patients, and occurred after colporrhaphy in 1 patient.	2.5064187068111403
In 60 of these 64 patients closure of the fistula was carried out transvaginally.	2.5998547954591738
Fourteen of these 60 patients (23 %) had undergone prior surgical attempts to close the VVF (1 to 3 procedures).	2.0867131596971915
Transvaginal surgery was successful at first attempt in 55 of these 60 patients (92 %).	2.105940497719891
The other 5 patients were successfully treated by a second procedure (again transvaginal: n = 3; transabdominal: n = 2).	2.183438653369402
In conclusion, the transvaginal approach to close VVF is of advantage, avoiding an abdominal incision and reducing postoperative morbidity.	1.8404758049872108
In the vast majority of the cases isolated VVF can be treated successfully by transvaginal repair.	2.705363256682144

The underlying mutation is an expanding trinucleotide CTG repeat in the 3'prime untranslated region of a serine-threonine kinase gene on chromosome 19q.	1.754909212386704
A statistical correlation exists between the CTG copy number and the severity of the disease.	2.252643770629369
Infants with severe congenital myotonic dystrophy have been shown to have on average a greater amplification of the CTG repeat than is seen in the non-congenital myotonic dystrophy population.	2.248291413515409
However, not all patients with many CTG copies develop congenital myotonic dystrophy.	2.2922166899014687

In 300 patients with 339 coronary lesions the percent diameter stenosis (%-DS) was assessed both by visual estimation and by digital quantitative coronary angiography (DQCA) by use of an on-line computer workstation.	1.8581584792839472
The decision for coronary angioplasty in the same setting ("prima vista"-PTCA) was based on history, evidence of ischemia and visual estimation of %-DS.	2.155626063847084
DQCA measurements of the 339 stenoses revealed a normal distribution of lesion severity with a mean of 58.4  +/-  11.3%.	2.28711851772574
In contrast to DQCA visual estimation led to a bimodal distribution with a nadir at ~55% between two peaks at ~45% and ~75% and a mean of 70.5  +/-  19.6%.	1.9573176397542476
Visual estimation underestimated lesions in the range of 30-55% and overestimated the %-DS between 55-99%.	2.2057881252850216
Visual estimation revealed a %-DS >= 60% in 251 stenoses (74.0%) of the 339 lesions, an estimate that led to subsequent "prima vista"-PTCA.	1.9861638864681441
Conversely, DQCA revealed only 184 stenoses (54.3%) with a %-DS >= 60%; thus, 86 stenoses (25.3%) did not meet the morphologic indication criteria for PTCA.	1.9299290223970826
The bimodal distribution of stenosis severity according to visual analysis with an overestimation of borderline stenosis severity reflects a tendency for "self-referral" of patients for PTCA.	1.9339393971312249
DQCA serves as an objective tool in the decision-making process for PTCA and may reduce "cosmetic" interventions or justify to defer PTCA.	2.125288736239433
Especially in the selection process for "prima vista"-PTCA DQCA-quantification of stenosis severity is recommended.	1.9776282188961019

Orthostatic circulatory disorders are frequently the cause of orthostatic intolerance, syncope or dangerous falls.	2.198215327650813
A sufficient therapy should be based on a differential diagnosis by means of an active standing test or a tilt-table test.	2.536489484587749
Three typical pathological reactions of blood pressure and heart rate can be differentiated.	2.4404810200285296
The hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension is characterised by an immediate drop in blood pressure (systolic drop >20 mmHg below base line within 3 min) with or without compensatory tachycardia.	2.1145285382689667
It is caused by peripheral or central sympathetic dysfunction.	2.2988275785189463
Tachycardia (>30 beats per minute above base line within 10 min) without significant blood pressure drop but with a fall of cerebral blood flow indicates a postural tachycardia syndrome.	1.957583338856794
In general, there is no further somatic dysfunction.	2.78248300611278
Increased venous pooling is thought to be the assumed pathomechanism.	2.768961976122132
A reflex mechanism evokes the neurocardiogenic syncope after a certain time of standing: sympathetic inhibition yields a strong blood pressure drop and vagal activation bradycardia.	1.7772891665560333
Proved therapies include use of the mineralocorticoide fludrocortison (hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension), of the a-agonist midodrin (postural tachycardia syndrome) and of b-blockers (neurocardiogenic syncope).	1.9688929318967883

Several different theories exist about the orign of kinetosis and the space adaption syndrome, with individual sensitivities differing significantly.	1.8654061685343657
One explanation involves the hypothesis of a different otolith mass between the right and left statolith organ and especially a difference in the utricles.	2.068245037303459
A difference in mass results in a different sensitivity to acceleration.	2.496472791904793
For this reason we measured interindividual variances in saccular and utricular otolith mass.	1.8349291183802414
Since the anatomy of the vestibular organ in vertebrates is based as similar principles, we selected fish (salmon and trout) as our study model to facilitation preparations.	1.7841854438950495
The maximum difference in mass in the saccule was 17% and was generally smaller in the utricle, although in individual cases was much higher.	1.9886119270210412
We assume that a misbalanced sensitivity of the statolith organs occurs but is totally compensated for by the vestibular system as long as physiological motion patterns take place.	1.9615688459130516
Decompensation leads to kinetosis under non-physiological motion patterns.	2.1661248463298124
When the vestibular system is better balanced and has an equally distributed otolith mass to both sides, the possibility for developing kinetosis or space adaption syndrome is much less likely.	1.8892049741659416

We measured glucocorticoid receptor (GR) number and affinity as a function of the exposure of cells to different amounts of IL-6.	2.1681286678119247
Incubation for 20 h with IL-6 at increasing concentrations up to 2000 pg/ml yielded a significant increase of GR binding sites in both cell lines.	2.1605652668769464
IL-6 was also able to reverse the inhibitory effect of dexamethasone (1 µmol/l) on GR in both cell lines.	2.156281101220634
In MG-63 cells, expressing higher concentrations of GR, IL-6 deprivation via a specific anti-IL-6 antibody (100 ng/ml) significantly decreased GR.	2.1168729695261757
In Saos-2 cells, expressing lower concentrations of GR, a 40 h treatment with human IL-1 (10 ng/ml) significantly increased both IL-6 production and GR.	2.1869775891953993
This latter effect was completely abolished by co-treating the cells with the anti-IL-6 antibody.	2.097618649496921

The simulation of unilateral deafness is very rare.	2.5187715263667143

A patient with alleged deafness on the left-hand side due to commotio cerebri was treated in our hospital.	2.1109458820461624
Pure tone audiometry showed deafness on the left-hand side and normal hearing on the right-hand side.	2.224536990830627
Transiently evoked otoacoustic emissions (TEOAE) and distortion-product otoacoustic emissions (DPOAE) were measured.	2.0024704878654593
The TEOAE had the same reproducibility but a very low response on both sides, such that inner ear function could not be evaluated.	2.239338107987397
In comparison, the DP gram showed clear DP amplitudes over the whole frequency range on both sides.	2.0066227059765382
Nonphysiological DPs could be excluded by assessing the DP growth rate at three different frequencies.	2.258449958549687
By means of brainstem electric response audiometry (BERA), with which the IV/V complex was detectable up to stimulation with 20 dB SPL clicks, and the Stenger test, a neural or central hearing loss could be excluded.	1.9107003053039766
Normal hearing on the left-hand side was thus confirmed.	2.3748048474912644
In cases of simulated deafness it is possible to prove a normal inner ear function by DPOAE.	2.1599854195287023
DPOAE therefore complements the list of potential audiological simulation tests.	2.182354496064429

Radiofrequency catheter ablation is the treatment of choice in atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia.	2.7694621134735664
Electrophysiologic investigations in 623 patients revealed eight mechanisms of tachycardia ablation: Ablation of fast (I) or slow(II), modification of fast (III) or slow AV nodal pathways (IV), modification of both pathways (V), ablation of fast and modification of slow (VI), ablation of slow and modification of fast pathways (VII) and ablation of both pathways (VIII).	1.907643362346329
The criteria of diagnosis of these eight mechanisms of tachycardia ablation are described.	2.1857431422945504
Follow-up showed fewer relapses in patients with ablation (0-2%) in comparison to patients with modification of a single AV nodal pathway (8-12%).	2.5475214439882943
Alteration of both pathways includes an increasing risk of total AV nodal block, which occured in 7 patients (1.1%).	2.1138377254855114
Detailed analysis of the mechanism of catheter ablation is recommended in all patients after radiofrequency current delivery for AV nodal reentrant tachycardia to estimate the risk of relapsing during follow-up or development of total AV block in the particular patient in case of a further ablation procedure.	2.6860889864442523

The sonographic diagnosis of malignant lymphoma in childhood is described.	2.570526948755734
Malignant lymphomas are sonographically relatively uniform: initial enlargement of the lymph nodes and organs involved and disturbance of normal echo texture by mainly hypoechoic lesions can be found.	2.0512305032149207
Generally, four sonographic patterns of infiltration are described: diffuse, small nodular, large nodular and bulky type.	1.8767968679194216
Secondary, tumor-related or inflammatory complications (e. g. dislocation or compression of vessels, thoracic inlet syndrome, venous thrombosis, ileus, urinary retention, abscess and effusion) can be sonographically evaluated.	2.108868793010379
Response to therapy correlates with normalization of size and echo texture and recovery from tumor-related complications.	2.1359394328439714
Differential diagnosis with ultrasound is based on the topographic distribution and echo pattern of infiltration and, with certain restrictions, on the echogenicity of lesions and perfusion feasible with Doppler sonography.	2.122299655233994
The primary diagnosis has to be established histologically.	2.873458480507834

The German social security legislation has recognized only recently the concern of quality assessment in the field of social and medical services.	2.0947941277829356
The legal frame for quality assessment in the field of medical treatment was enacted in the sickness insurance provision (Social Code - Book V) only in 1989.	1.958779585506684
Quality assessment is considered to be a part of the production of medical services and, therefore, is regulated in the context of providing medical services.	2.665938857577138
The legal provisions do not establish standards for quality and quality assessment.	2.190640661169697
Due to the variety of medical services, quality assessment is not regulated in an exhaustive or systematic manner.	2.1766329886697067
According to the law, providers of medical services (doctors, hospitals) are bound to participate in quality assessment.	2.0576558591285927
As internal quality assessment prevails in the definition of the various measures of quality assessment and the control of quality in all fields of medical treatment, external quality assessment is also prescribed for hospitals.	2.4405752634926694
Because the establishment of quality assessment is considered to be a part of the service production organization, consumers (patients) or their representatives are not involved in the definition, establishment, and control of quality assessment.	2.403931665363208
The participation of patients should be provided by law.	2.6601827618546667

on growth), and that marked metabolic imbalances in infancy (e.g.	2.493469943246668
hypoglycaemia, phenylketonuria) have long term effects on child development.	2.2382216422281114
More recent studies indicate that also variations of metabolic conditions within the normal range, which occur during sensitive periods of early human development, may have marked long term effects on later prognosis and disease risks in adulthood.	1.8863505736657493

The historical opinion that the intima layer of a ruptured artery of muscular type could stop bleeding by "rolling in" should be controlled experimentally.	1.8594135159100302

Furthermore a longitudinally split and a partially oblique incised segment were ruptured.	2.00930512889481
As morphological findings a sandclock deformity was observed in the region of rupture.	2.6179617826081936
This phenomenon was induced by adventitia layer, which closed the ends of ruptured media layer like a Chinese finger trap.	1.8948690089942875
In the longitudinally split segment a transverse rupture of the media layer could be observed, while the fibers of adventitia layer were pulled out when the traction was continued.	2.096463762900136
Neither macroscopical nor microscopical signs could be found for "rolling in" of intima or media layer.	1.9559363620422259
